03VBWKFJ8m3EeyHS1Zoh.directions: Pat tofu dry and roll in a clean, absorbent towel with something heavy on top, such as a cast-iron skillet, for 15 minutes.<SEP>While tofu is draining, prepare sauce by adding dry spices to a small bowl and adding enough water to make a pourable sauce. Set aside.<SEP>Prep veggies and warm a large skillet over medium heat. Once hot, add olive oil and the onion and red pepper. <SEP>Season with a pinch each salt and pepper and stir. Cook until softened - about 5 minutes.<SEP>Add kale, season with a bit more salt and pepper, and cover to steam for 2 minutes.<SEP>In the meantime, unwrap tofu and use a fork to crumble into bite-sized pieces.<SEP>Use a spatula to move the veggies to one side of the pan and add tofu. Sauté for 2 minutes, then add sauce, pouring it mostly over the tofu and a little over the veggies. Stir immediately, evenly distributing the sauce. Cook for another 5-7 minutes until tofu is slightly browned.<SEP>Serve immediately with the breakfast potatoes, toast, or fruit. I like to add more flavor with salsa, hot sauce, and/or fresh cilantro. Alternatively, freeze for up to 1 month and reheat on the stovetop or in the microwave.
03VBWKFJ8m3EeyHS1Zoh.name: Southwest Tofu Scramble
03VBWKFJ8m3EeyHS1Zoh.ingredients: 8 ounces extra-firm tofu<SEP>1-2 Tbsp olive oil<SEP>1/4 red onion (thinly sliced)<SEP>1/2 red pepper (thinly sliced)<SEP>2 cups kale (loosely chopped)<SEP><SEP>#Sauce<SEP>1/2 tsp sea salt (reduce amount for less salty sauce)<SEP>1/2 tsp garlic powder<SEP>1/2 tsp ground cumin<SEP>1/4 tsp chili powder<SEP>Water (to thin)<SEP>1/4 tsp turmeric (optional)

045JlopBxNjbnNPN1f31.ingredients: 2 cups flour<SEP>3⁄4 cup sugar<SEP>1 teaspoon baking powder<SEP>1⁄2 teaspoon baking soda<SEP>1⁄2 teaspoon salt<SEP>1 cup cranberries<SEP>1 egg<SEP>3⁄4 cup orange juice<SEP>1⁄4 cup vegetable oil<SEP>1 teaspoon grated orange rind
045JlopBxNjbnNPN1f31.name: Cranberry Orange Muffins
045JlopBxNjbnNPN1f31.directions: Combine dry ingredients.<SEP>Stir in cranberries.<SEP>Beat egg, orange juice, oil and orange rind.<SEP>Add to dry ingredients all at once.<SEP>Stir just to moisten.<SEP>Spoon into greased muffin cups. (fill 3/4 full).<SEP>Sprinkle tops lightly with a bit of sugar.<SEP>Bake 400F 15-20 mins until lightly browned and firm to the touch.

05KIlqUoHKzOpOUcZrCz.directions: Place the glass noodles in a large bowl and add enough hot water to cover. Let sit for 10 minutes, until softened. Drain the noodles and chop into ½-inch (1-cm) pieces.<SEP>In a large bowl, mix together the chopped glass noodles, cabbage, carrots, scallions, onion powder, garlic powder, salt, pepper, soy sauce, and sesame oil. Toss until well combined.<SEP>Place a spring roll wrapper on a clean work surface and add 3 tablespoons of filling to the center. Fold the bottom of the wrapper over the filling, then fold in the sides and roll. Lightly wet the exposed with your fingertip and continue rolling to seal the egg roll. Repeat with the remaining wrappers and filling.<SEP>Fill a deep skillet with ½ inch (1 cm) of vegetable oil and heat over medium-high heat until the oil reaches 325˚F(160˚C). Fry the egg rolls in batches of 1-2 at a time for 2½- 3 minutes on each side, until crispy and golden brown. Remove from oil and drain on a wire rack or plate lined with paper towels to absorb any extra oil.<SEP>Enjoy! Serve with sweet chili sauce (Trader Joe's is good/cheap).
05KIlqUoHKzOpOUcZrCz.name: Veggie Egg Rolls
05KIlqUoHKzOpOUcZrCz.ingredients: 3.5 oz glass noodle, 1 package<SEP>hot water, for soaking<SEP>2 cups shredded cabbage<SEP>1 cup shredded carrot<SEP>½ cup scallions, chopped<SEP>1 teaspoon onion powder<SEP>1 teaspoon garlic powder<SEP>½ teaspoon salt<SEP>1 teaspoon black pepper<SEP>3 tablespoons soy sauce<SEP>1 tablespoon sesame oil<SEP>12 wheat egg roll wrappers<SEP>1 tablespoon water, for sealing<SEP>vegetable oil, for frying

07C7Gt8s9KQHEwcZsVCp.directions: Whisk chicken broth, oyster sauce, soy sauce, fish sauce, white sugar, and brown sugar together in a bowl until well blended.<SEP><SEP>Heat large skillet over high heat. Drizzle in oil. Add chicken and stir fry until it loses its raw color, 2 to 3 minutes. Stir in shallots, garlic, and sliced chilies. Continue cooking on high heat until some of the juices start to caramelize in the bottom of the pan, about 2 or 3 more minutes. Add about a tablespoon of the sauce mixture to the skillet; cook and stir until sauce begins to caramelize, about 1 minute. Add green beans.<SEP><SEP>Pour in the rest of the sauce. Cook and stir until sauce has deglazed the bottom of the pan. Continue to cook until sauce glazes onto the meat, 1 or 2 more minutes. Remove from heat.<SEP><SEP>Stir in basil. Cook and stir until basil is wilted, about 20 seconds. Serve with rice.
07C7Gt8s9KQHEwcZsVCp.ingredients: 1/2 cup and 1 tablespoon chicken broth<SEP>2 tablespoons oyster sauce<SEP>2 tablespoons soy sauce, or as needed<SEP>1 tablespoon and 1 teaspoon fish sauce<SEP>2 teaspoons white sugar<SEP>1 tablespoon brown sugar<SEP>1/4 cup vegetable oil<SEP>2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken thighs, coarsely chopped (or ground chicken)<SEP>1/2 cup sliced shallots<SEP>8 cloves garlic, minced<SEP>1.5 lbs. (?) green beans<SEP>1/4 cup minced Thai chilies, Serrano, or other hot pepper<SEP>2 cups very thinly sliced fresh basil leaves<SEP>4 cups hot cooked rice
07C7Gt8s9KQHEwcZsVCp.name: Thai Basil Chicken

07oTQ23LVVxTlEiDbp6J.ingredients: #Basic Recipe<SEP>1 part Chia seeds<SEP>3 parts milk<SEP>any sweetener<SEP><SEP>#Chocolate version<SEP>1/4 c. cocoa<SEP>5 T. honey or maple syrup<SEP>pinch of sea salt
07oTQ23LVVxTlEiDbp6J.directions: Whisk ingredients together, let sit in fridge for 3-5 hours.
07oTQ23LVVxTlEiDbp6J.name: Chia Pudding

0Kk3fJ0FkvNtAKsASIzn.name: Chickpea Curry
0Kk3fJ0FkvNtAKsASIzn.directions: Cook the basmati rice according to the package instructions<SEP>Heat the oil in a medium skillet over medium-low heat<SEP>Add the onions, season with salt and pepper and cook for a few minutes, until the onions are soft and starting to turn golden.<SEP>Sprinkle in the curry powder and garlic and stir, cooking for another minute or so.<SEP>Pour in the vegetable stock and stir to scrape up all the brown bits in the pan. <SEP>Add the coconut milk, honey and a squirt of sriracha. <SEP>Bring to a boil, add the chickpeas, reduce the heat, and simmer for 10 minutes. <SEP>Taste and adjust the seasoning, adding more salt, honey, or Sriracha (or lime juice, if using.)<SEP>Serve the curry over rice and garnish with cilantro
0Kk3fJ0FkvNtAKsASIzn.ingredients: 2 cups Basmati Rice<SEP>2 tbsp. Vegetable Oil<SEP>1 whole Large Onion, Diced Fine<SEP>Salt And Pepper to taste<SEP>2 tsp. Curry Powder, Any Variety<SEP>2 cloves Garlic, Minced<SEP>1 c. Vegetable Stock<SEP>2 cans Chickpeas, Drained And Rinsed<SEP>1 can (13.5 Ounce) Coconut Milk<SEP>1 tbsp. Honey, More To Taste<SEP>1 tbsp. Sriracha Or Hot Sauce (more to taste)<SEP>Lime Wedges, For Serving (optional)<SEP>Cilantro Leaves for garnish

0SgVqOcAY1L5CCxS3B44.name: Japanese Garlic Fried Rice
0SgVqOcAY1L5CCxS3B44.ingredients: #rice<SEP>2 1/2 cups (450 g) cooked Japanese short grain rice* (make ahead and refrigerate overnight or up to 1 week)<SEP>10 cloves garlic – minced (I used a garlic press)<SEP>4 stalks spring onions – diced<SEP>3 eggs – lightly beaten<SEP>½ tsp salt and black pepper<SEP>Vegetable cooking oil<SEP><SEP>#Sauce<SEP>2 tbsp soy sauce (preferably Kikkoman or other Japanese brand)<SEP>2 tbsp sugar<SEP>2 tbsp mirin (Japanese rice wine)<SEP>1 tbsp oyster sauce<SEP>1 tbsp toasted sesame oil<SEP>2 tsp fish sauce
0SgVqOcAY1L5CCxS3B44.directions: In a heated large wok or pan, add in 2 tbsp veg oil and minced garlic. Fry the garlic at medium low heat until golden brown. Keep an eye on them as they brown quickly in a matter of seconds.<SEP>Separate the oil and garlic and set aside.<SEP>Mix all the ingredients for the sauce and set aside.<SEP>Add another 2 tbsp of oil to the hot wok. Pour the beaten eggs into the wok and swirl it around so it coats the wok.<SEP>Let it sit for a min before using your spatula to cut the egg into small pieces. Push the scrambled eggs to one side of the wok.<SEP>Turn up heat and add in 1 tbsp oil.<SEP>Add in cooked rice and stir fry until they are loose. The wok should remain constantly at high heat.<SEP>Add in salt, few dashes of black pepper and half of the fried garlic. Continue to mix for 1 min.<SEP>Finally, pour the sauce over the rice and stir fry until they are evenly coated.<SEP>Sprinkle remaining garlic and spring onions and give it a final toss.<SEP>Serve immediately.

0cCplYX9W4sQlxFl9V57.directions: Blend all ingredients until completely smooth. <SEP>Feel free to blend in a few coconut milk ice cubes for a super thick and ice-cream-like shake if desired. (To make coconut ice cubes, just freeze canned coconut milk in an ice cube tray. Do not add regular ice cubes, because that would dilute the flavor of the smoothie.) <SEP>Serve cold. The recipe makes about 2 cups.
0cCplYX9W4sQlxFl9V57.ingredients: 1 large avocado<SEP>3 cups cold milk of choice (vanilla ice cream or frozen yogurt works too)<SEP>1 tsp pure vanilla extract<SEP>sweetener of choice, such as 2 tbsp pure maple syrup or stevia to taste. Sweetened condensed milk is another option<SEP>1/4 tsp salt<SEP>scoop of protein powder, optional
0cCplYX9W4sQlxFl9V57.name: Avocado Smoothie

12YHwj9gYksaFxG3hLg0.directions: In a small bowl, stir together all ingredients until smooth.
12YHwj9gYksaFxG3hLg0.name: Fry Sauce
12YHwj9gYksaFxG3hLg0.notes: Makes a LOT. Half the recipe unless you're hosting a party!
12YHwj9gYksaFxG3hLg0.ingredients: 2.25 cups Real Mayonnaise<SEP>1/2 cup Ketchup<SEP>1 tablespoon Franks Red Hot Buffalo Sauce<SEP>1 tablespoon pickle juice from bread and butter pickles<SEP>2 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce<SEP>1/4 teaspoon ancho chili powder<SEP>1/2 teaspoon seasoned salt<SEP>1/4 teaspoon paprika

18JgWTCpxO8XEwljSfGZ.ingredients: 2 tablespoons canola oil<SEP>1 medium onion, finely chopped<SEP>2 garlic cloves, minced<SEP>3 cups cooked white rice<SEP>2 cups cooked black beans, drained and rinsed<SEP>1 teaspoon ground cumin<SEP>1 teaspoon ground coriander<SEP>1/2 teaspoon ground ginger<SEP>2 to 3 tablespoons vegetarian worcestershire sauce (regular can be used as well)<SEP>salt & freshly ground black pepper, to taste<SEP>fresh cilantro (optional)<SEP>sliced green onion (optional)
18JgWTCpxO8XEwljSfGZ.directions: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat.<SEP>Add onion and sauté until it just begins to soften and turns color.<SEP>Add garlic and sauté for about 5 minutes, or until onion is golden.<SEP>Add spices and Worcestershire, and stir into onion and garlic.<SEP>(The first time I made this, I was afraid to add the full 3 Tbsp of Worcestershire, but the addition of the rice balances the flavor out).<SEP>Next, add the beans and then the rice.<SEP>Combine the rice and beans evenly and cook until mixture is heated through.<SEP>Add salt and pepper to taste and serve hot.<SEP>Garnish with some chopped cilantro or green onions if you prefer.<SEP>Vegetarians use only the vegetarian Worcestershire sauce.
18JgWTCpxO8XEwljSfGZ.name: Gallo Pinto (Costa Rican Beans & Rice)

1IIFDw1cHrDLGuSh2PpF.ingredients: 3 Bananas, sliced<SEP>1 1/2 C. Sugar<SEP>2 Eggs<SEP>1/2 C. Butter or margarine<SEP>2 C. Flour<SEP>1 tsp. Salt<SEP>1 tsp. Baking soda<SEP>1 tsp. Baking powder<SEP>1 tsp. Vanilla<SEP>1/2 C. Sour milk (buttermilk or any milk add 1 tsp. vinegar or lemon juice, let stand)<SEP><SEP>Optional: 1/2 C. Dried cranberries, nuts, walnuts, pecans, coconut, chocolate chips.
1IIFDw1cHrDLGuSh2PpF.directions: Heat oven to 350'<SEP>Cream butter, sugar, eggs and bananas<SEP>Mix and sift dry ingredients then add along with buttermilk<SEP>Add optional nuts/chocolate chips if desired<SEP>Bake 30 min for 4 1/2 small bread pans *spray pans<SEP>Bake 45 min for 1 large bread pan *spray pan
1IIFDw1cHrDLGuSh2PpF.notes: The riper the banana the better. Or even just add an extra banana for more flavor. <SEP><SEP>From: Catherine Didier
1IIFDw1cHrDLGuSh2PpF.name: Banana Bread

1WoYrTgQE1RrYV14tmF4.directions: Add all ingredients to slow cooker in order that they are listed except for spinach, garnishes and rice.<SEP>Cook on high for 4 hours, or on low for 8 hours. Meanwhile, cook basmati rice according to package directions in a rice cooker or on the stovetop.<SEP>Once dal is finished cooking, stir in spinach and then plate with rice, garnishing with sesame seeds and cilantro. Enjoy!
1WoYrTgQE1RrYV14tmF4.name: Butternut Squash Dal
1WoYrTgQE1RrYV14tmF4.ingredients: 1 tbsp olive oil<SEP>2 small yellow onions diced<SEP>4 cloves garlic minced<SEP>1 small butternut squash cut into 1/2 inch cubes<SEP>1 1/2 cups dry red lentils<SEP>1 (400mL) can coconut milk<SEP>1 (796mL) can diced tomatoes<SEP>1 tbsp turmeric<SEP>1 tbsp curry powder<SEP>1 tsp chili powder<SEP>1 tsp salt<SEP>1/4 tsp pepper<SEP>2 cups spinach chopped<SEP>Cilantro and sesame seeds for garnish

2FoAkSeYLWlRxdBnOITb.directions: Roast or sautee sweet potato.<SEP>Cook quinoa in water or broth.<SEP>Bring a large stockpot of water to a boil (while the quinoa is cooking in a separate pan).  Add broccoli florets and cook for 1-2 minutes until tender and vibrant green.  Remove with a slotted spoon, and transfer to a separate plate and set aside.  Add shelled edamame to the boiling water and cook for 5 minutes.  Remove with a slotted spoon and transfer to the plate with the broccoli.<SEP>Meanwhile, add the kale to a large mixing bowl along with 2 tablespoons of the vinaigrette.  Use your hands to massage the vinaigrette into the kale for 1-2 minutes, or until the kale is soft and turns a darker green.  Set aside.<SEP>Once your quinoa is cooked, portion it out equally among 4 serving bowls.  Top each with equal portions of the broccoli and edamame, kale, sliced avocado, and almonds.  Then drizzle each equally with the vinaigrette, and sprinkle with sesame seeds or chia seeds for garnish.  Serve warm.
2FoAkSeYLWlRxdBnOITb.name: Superfood Quinoa Bowl
2FoAkSeYLWlRxdBnOITb.notes: Recommend cooking quinoa in broth for extra flavor
2FoAkSeYLWlRxdBnOITb.ingredients: #EASY SUPERFOOD QUINOA BOWL INGREDIENTS:<SEP>6 cups cooked quinoa*<SEP>1 large sweet potato, diced<SEP>1 medium head of broccoli, florets removed and chopped into bite-sized pieces<SEP>2 cups frozen shelled edamame<SEP>4 cups chopped kale<SEP>1 avocado, peeled, pitted and sliced<SEP>1/2 cup Blue Diamond Almonds (I used Blue Diamond Sriracha Almonds)<SEP>1 batch Sesame-Soy Vinaigrette (see below)<SEP>toasted sesame seeds or chia seeds, for garnish<SEP><SEP>#SESAME-SOY VINAIGRETTE INGREDIENTS:<SEP>1/3 cup neutral-flavored cooking oil (i.e. vegetable oil, grapeseed oil, etc.)<SEP>1/4 cup rice wine vinegar<SEP>1 tablespoon honey (or agave, to make this vegan)<SEP>2 teaspoons soy sauce<SEP>1/4 teaspoon sesame oil<SEP>pinch of salt and black pepper

2iLng3jg3luM6B2ROxN7.name: Simple Whole Wheat Bread
2iLng3jg3luM6B2ROxN7.ingredients: 3 cups warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C)<SEP>2 (.25 ounce) packages active dry yeast<SEP>⅓ cup honey<SEP>5 cups bread flour<SEP>3 tablespoons butter, melted  <SEP>⅓ cup honey<SEP>1 tablespoon salt<SEP>3 ½ cups whole wheat flour<SEP>2 tablespoons butter, melted
2iLng3jg3luM6B2ROxN7.directions: In a large bowl, mix warm water, yeast, and 1/3 cup honey. Add 5 cups white bread flour, and stir to combine. Let set for 30 minutes, or until big and bubbly.<SEP>Mix in 3 tablespoons melted butter, 1/3 cup honey, and salt. Stir in 2 cups whole wheat flour. Flour a flat surface and knead with whole wheat flour until not real sticky - just pulling away from the counter, but still sticky to touch. This may take an additional 2 to 4 cups of whole wheat flour. Place in a greased bowl, turning once to coat the surface of the dough. Cover with a dishtowel. Let rise in a warm place until doubled.<SEP>Punch down, and divide into 3 loaves. Place in greased 9 x 5 inch loaf pans, and allow to rise until dough has topped the pans by one inch.<SEP>Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 25 to 30 minutes; do not overbake. Lightly brush the tops of loaves with 2 tablespoons melted butter or margarine when done to prevent crust from getting hard. Cool completely.

2oYDofYL6gSXfDUNjyX5.ingredients: 1 box Devil's Food cake mix<SEP>2 eggs<SEP>3/4 c. shortening
2oYDofYL6gSXfDUNjyX5.directions: Mix thoroughly. Roll into walnut-sized balls. Bake on ungreased cookie sheet at 350 degrees for 7-8 minutes. Will finish baking on pan, so they will seem underbaked when you pull them out.
2oYDofYL6gSXfDUNjyX5.notes: I saw another recipe use 1/3 c. canola oil in place of shortening - worth trying!
2oYDofYL6gSXfDUNjyX5.name: Oreos

2qV7RtwfIoKU6r2SwMDp.name: Gazpacho
2qV7RtwfIoKU6r2SwMDp.directions: Combine tomatoes, pepper, cucumber, onion and garlic in a blender or, if using a hand blender, in a deep bowl. (If necessary, work in batches.) Blend at high speed until very smooth, at least 2 minutes, pausing occasionally to scrape down the sides with a rubber spatula.<SEP>With the motor running, add the vinegar and 2 teaspoons salt. Slowly drizzle in the olive oil. The mixture will turn bright orange or dark pink and become smooth and emulsified, like a salad dressing. If it still seems watery, drizzle in more olive oil until texture is creamy.<SEP>Strain the mixture through a strainer or a food mill, pushing all the liquid through with a spatula or the back of a ladle. Discard the solids. Transfer to a large pitcher (preferably glass) and chill until very cold, at least 6 hours or overnight.<SEP>Before serving, adjust the seasonings with salt and vinegar. If soup is very thick, stir in a few tablespoons ice water. Serve in glasses, over ice if desired, or in a bowl. A few drops of olive oil on top are a nice touch.
2qV7RtwfIoKU6r2SwMDp.ingredients: About 2 pounds ripe red tomatoes, cored and roughly cut into chunks<SEP>1 Italian frying (cubanelle) pepper or another long, light green pepper, such as Anaheim, cored, seeded and roughly cut into chunks<SEP>1 cucumber, about 8 inches long, peeled and roughly cut into chunks<SEP>1 small mild onion (white or red), peeled and roughly cut into chunks<SEP>1 clove garlic<SEP>2 teaspoons sherry vinegar, more to taste<SEP>Salt<SEP>½ cup extra-virgin olive oil, more to taste, plus more for drizzling
2qV7RtwfIoKU6r2SwMDp.notes: Comments say less olive oil, add white bread to the blender.

35GFLnChzC3Mml68HZB6.directions: Slice French bread into 1/2-inch-thick slices. <SEP>Place bread slices in a single layer on broiler pan(s). Using pastry brush, lightly brush olive oil on bread. Broil<SEP>until lightly browned.<SEP>In a bowl, toss together tomatoes, basil, Parmesan cheese, and garlic. Mix in balsamic vinegar, 1 teaspoon olive oil, salt, and pepper. Serve on toasted bread slices.
35GFLnChzC3Mml68HZB6.name: Balsamic Bruschetta
35GFLnChzC3Mml68HZB6.ingredients: 1 loaf French bread<SEP>2 tablespoons plus 1 teaspoon olive oil, divided<SEP>4 Roma tomatoes, diced<SEP>1 1/2 teaspoon dried basil<SEP>2 tablespoons shredded Parmesan cheese<SEP>1 clove garlic, crushed<SEP>1 1/2 teaspoon balsamic vinegar<SEP>1/4 teaspoon salt<SEP>1/4 teaspoon pepper

37UWz99EWTdetkHrnDf6.ingredients: #For The Chicken:<SEP>4 Chicken Breasts (pounded 1/2-inch thin)<SEP>2 tsp. Each of Onion Powder and Garlic Powder<SEP>1 tsp. Fresh Chopped Parsley<SEP>1/2 tsp. Each of Dried Thyme and Dried Rosemary*<SEP>Salt and Pepper, to season<SEP><SEP>#For The Sauce:<SEP>4 Cloves Garlic, minced (or 1 Tbsp. minced garlic)<SEP>1 tsp. Fresh Chopped Parsley<SEP>1/2 tsp. Each of Dried Thyme and Dried Rosemary<SEP>1 C. Milk (or half and half)*<SEP>Salt and Freshly Ground Black Bepper, to taste<SEP>1 tsp. Cornstarch Mixed with 1 tbsp. Water, until smooth
37UWz99EWTdetkHrnDf6.name: Creamy Herb Chicken
37UWz99EWTdetkHrnDf6.notes: Make sure you cook the chicken all the way when it is first in the skillet or else it will cook at the end but it'll cook up all the sauce.<SEP><SEP>Serve with rice and a vegetable
37UWz99EWTdetkHrnDf6.directions: Coat chicken breasts with the onion and garlic powders and herbs<SEP>Season generously with salt and pepper<SEP>Heat 1 tablespoon of oil a large pan or skillet over medium-high heat and cook chicken breasts until opaque and no longer pink inside (about 5 minutes each side, depending on thickness)<SEP>Transfer to a plate; set aside<SEP>To the same pan or skillet, heat another 2 teaspoons of olive oil and sauté garlic, with parsley, thyme and rosemary, for about 1 minute, or until fragrant<SEP>Stir in milk (or cream); season with salt and pepper, to taste<SEP>Bring to a boil; add the cornstarch mixture to the centre of the pan, quickly stirring, until sauce has thickened slightly<SEP>Reduce heat and simmer gently for a further minute to allow the sauce to thicken more<SEP><SEP>Return chicken to the skillet<SEP>Sprinkle with extra herbs if desired<SEP>Serve immediately

3IN7F7gEJI6NoSe5kA2F.name: Meyer Lemon Coffee Cake
3IN7F7gEJI6NoSe5kA2F.ingredients: #Streusel<SEP>1 3/4 cups unbleached all-purpose flour<SEP>3/4 cup packed light-brown sugar<SEP>1 teaspoon kosher salt<SEP>1 1/2 sticks (3/4 cup) cold unsalted butter<SEP>[Marie's note: add slivered almonds]<SEP>#Cake<SEP>5 Meyer lemons, cut into paper-thin slices, ends discarded; plus 3 tablespoons finely grated zest (from 4 to 5 lemons)<SEP>[Marie's note: process or candy a few lemons instead?]<SEP>2 cups unbleached all-purpose flour<SEP>1 teaspoon baking powder<SEP>1 teaspoon baking soda<SEP>1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt<SEP>1 stick (1/2 cup) unsalted butter, room temperature, plus more for pan<SEP>1 cup granulated sugar<SEP>2 large eggs<SEP>1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract<SEP>1 cup sour cream<SEP>#Glaze<SEP>1 cup confectioners' sugar<SEP>3 to 4 tablespoons Meyer lemon juice
3IN7F7gEJI6NoSe5kA2F.directions: #Streusel:<SEP>Mix together flour, brown sugar, and salt. Using a pastry cutter or your fingers, cut butter into the flour mixture until small to medium clumps form. Cover and refrigerate until ready to use, up to 3 days.<SEP>#Cake:<SEP>In a large skillet of simmering water, cook lemon slices 1 minute. Drain and repeat. Arrange lemon slices in a single layer on a parchment-lined baking sheet.<SEP>Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Butter a 9-inch angel-food-cake pan. Sift together flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. In a mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, beat together butter, granulated sugar, and lemon zest on medium speed in a large bowl until light and fluffy, about 2 minutes. Beat in eggs, one at a time, then vanilla. Reduce speed to low. Beat in flour mixture in three additions, alternating with sour cream, beginning and ending with flour mixture and beating until combined after each addition.<SEP>Spoon half of batter evenly into pan. Arrange half of lemon slices in a single layer over batter. Spread remaining batter evenly over top. Cover with remaining lemon slices in a single layer. Sprinkle chilled streusel evenly over batter.<SEP>Bake until cake is golden brown and a tester inserted in center comes out clean, about 55 minutes. Transfer pan to a wire rack set over a baking sheet; let cool in pan 15 minutes. Run a knife around edges of pan and remove outer ring. Let cool on rack 15 minutes more. Run a knife around center tube. Slide two wide spatulas between bottom of cake and pan, and lift cake to remove from center tube. Let cool completely on rack.<SEP>#Glaze: <SEP>Just before serving, stir together confectioners' sugar and lemon juice in a medium bowl. Drizzle over cooled cake, letting excess drip down sides. Let glaze set before slicing, about 5 minutes.
3IN7F7gEJI6NoSe5kA2F.notes: Cake can be stored at room temperature up to 3 days. The lemon flavor will intensify with time.

3N3ZVqpjYqR1dxbhMkCY.name: Hummus
3N3ZVqpjYqR1dxbhMkCY.directions: In a food processor, combine tahini and lemon juice and process for 1 minute, scrape the sides and bottom of the bowl then process for 30 seconds more<SEP>Add the olive oil, minced garlic, cumin, and a 1/2 tsp. of salt to the whipped tahini and lemon juice<SEP>Process for 30 seconds, scrape the sides and bottom of the bowl then process another 30 seconds or until well blended<SEP>Add half of the drained, rinsed chickpeas to the food processor and process for 1 minute. Scrape sides and bottom of the bowl, then add remaining chickpeas and process until thick and quite smooth; 1 to 2 minutes<SEP>Most likely the hummus will be too thick or still have tiny bits of chickpea. To fix this, with the food processor turned on, slowly add 2 to 3 tablespoons of water until you reach the perfect consistency<SEP>Taste for salt and adjust as needed<SEP>Serve hummus with a drizzle of olive oil and dash of paprika<SEP>Store homemade hummus in an airtight container and refrigerate up to one week.
3N3ZVqpjYqR1dxbhMkCY.ingredients: 1 (15-ounce) can chickpeas or 1 1/2 cups (250 grams) cooked chickpeas<SEP>1/4 c. (60 ml) fresh lemon juice (1 large lemon)<SEP>1/4 c. (60 ml) well-stirred tahini<SEP>1 garlic clove, minced<SEP>2 T. extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for serving<SEP>1/2 tsp ground cumin<SEP>Salt to taste<SEP>2 - 3 T. water<SEP>Paprika, for serving

3NvuqUKH0oNwwRUkGBpu.directions: Peel the potatoes and cut into 1/2-inch dice. Place in a medium saucepan and cover with cold water. Set over high heat, cover and bring to a boil. Once boiling, uncover, decrease the heat to maintain a simmer and cook until tender and easily crushed with tongs, approximately 10 to 15 minutes. Place the half-and-half and butter into a microwave-safe container and heat in the microwave until warmed through, about 35 seconds. Drain the potatoes in a colander and then return to the saucepan. Mash the potatoes and then add the half and half, butter, salt and pepper and continue to mash until smooth. Stir in the yolk until well combined.<SEP>Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.<SEP>While the potatoes are cooking, prepare the filling. Place the canola oil into a 12-inch saute pan and set over medium high heat. Once the oil shimmers, add the onion and carrots and saute just until they begin to take on color, approximately 3 to 4 minutes. Add the garlic and stir to combine. Add the lamb, salt and pepper and cook until browned and cooked through, approximately 3 minutes. Sprinkle the meat with the flour and toss to coat, continuing to cook for another minute. Add the tomato paste, chicken broth, Worcestershire, rosemary, thyme, and stir to combine. Bring to a boil, reduce the heat to low, cover and simmer slowly 10 to 12 minutes or until the sauce is thickened slightly.<SEP>Add the corn and peas to the lamb mixture and spread evenly into an 11 by 7-inch glass baking dish. Top with the mashed potatoes, starting around the edges to create a seal to prevent the mixture from bubbling up and smooth with a rubber spatula. Place on a parchment lined half sheet pan on the middle rack of the oven and bake for 25 minutes or just until the potatoes begin to brown. Remove to a cooling rack for at least 15 minutes before serving.
3NvuqUKH0oNwwRUkGBpu.name: Shepherd's Pie
3NvuqUKH0oNwwRUkGBpu.ingredients: #Potatoes<SEP>1 1/2 pounds russet potatoes<SEP>1/4 cup half-and-half<SEP>2 ounces unsalted butter<SEP>3/4 teaspoon kosher salt<SEP>1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper<SEP>1 egg yolk<SEP><SEP>#Meat filling<SEP>2 tablespoons canola oil<SEP>1 cup chopped onion<SEP>2 carrots, peeled and diced small<SEP>2 cloves garlic, minced<SEP>1 1/2 pounds ground lamb<SEP>1 teaspoon kosher salt<SEP>1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper<SEP>2 tablespoons all-purpose flour<SEP>2 teaspoons tomato paste<SEP>1 cup chicken broth<SEP>1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce<SEP>2 teaspoons freshly chopped rosemary leaves<SEP>1 teaspoon freshly chopped thyme leaves<SEP>1/2 cup fresh or frozen corn kernels<SEP>1/2 cup fresh or frozen English peas

3QJhvjI5luXq99ZtuVqO.directions: Bake bacon, then chop.<SEP>Boil eggs, then chop.<SEP>Chop the rest of the ingredients.<SEP>To assemble the salad, place greens in a large bowl; top with arranged rows of each topping.
3QJhvjI5luXq99ZtuVqO.name: Cobb Salad
3QJhvjI5luXq99ZtuVqO.ingredients: 4 slices bacon, diced<SEP>2 large eggs<SEP>6 cups spring mix/chopped romaine lettuce/baby spinach<SEP>1 cups ham, diced<SEP>1 apple, diced<SEP>1 pear, diced<SEP>1 avocado<SEP>1/2 cup Fisher Nuts Pecan Halves<SEP>1/3 cup dried cranberries<SEP>1/3 cup cheddar/colby jack cheese/blue/feta cheese<SEP>Blue cheese, ranch, poppy, or balsamic dressing

3QaNSUhnYg10ACiue8R5.ingredients: 1 pound flank steak<SEP>1/4 cup cornstarch<SEP>1/4 cup canola oil oil<SEP>2 teaspoons fresh ginger minced<SEP>1 tablespoon garlic minced<SEP>1/3 cup lite soy sauce low sodium<SEP>1/3 cup water<SEP>1/2 cup dark brown sugar<SEP>4 stalks scallions green parts only, cut into 2 inch pieces
3QaNSUhnYg10ACiue8R5.name: Mongolian Beef
3QaNSUhnYg10ACiue8R5.directions: Slice the flank steak against the grain (the grain is the length of the steak) the long way 1/4 inch think pieces and add it to a ziploc bag with the cornstarch.<SEP>Press the steak around in the bag making sure each piece is fully coated with cornstarch and leave it to sit.<SEP>Add the canola oil to a large frying pan and heat on medium high heat.<SEP>Add the steak, shaking off any excess corn starch, to the pan in a single layer and cook on each side for 1 minute.<SEP>If you need to cook the steak in batches because your pan isn't big enough do that rather than crowding the pan, you want to get a good sear on the steak and if you crowd the pan your steak with steam instead of sear.<SEP>When the steak is done cooking remove it from the pan.<SEP>Add the ginger and garlic to the pan and sauté for 10-15 seconds.<SEP>Add the soy sauce, water and dark brown sugar to the pan and let it come to a boil.<SEP>Add the steak back in and let the sauce thicken for 20-30 seconds.<SEP>The cornstarch we used on the steak should thicken the sauce, if you find it isn't thickening enough add 1 tablespoon of cornstarch to 1 tablespoon of cold water and stir to dissolve the cornstarch and add it to the pan.<SEP>Add the green onions, stir to combine everything, and cook for a final 20-30 seconds.<SEP>Serve immediately.

3lw26HKVJwfT3Cau3OIc.directions: #Brown Butter<SEP>Simmer 2 cups plus 2 tbsp. butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat until browned bits form, 6–8 minutes. Pour into a 2-cup measuring cup. If needed, add more butter to measure 1 3/4 cups plus 2 Tbsp. (added butter will melt). Allow butter to cool slightly but not solidify.<SEP>#Topping<SEP>Whisk flour, sugar, and salt in a medium bowl. Stir in 3/4 cup plus 2 Tbsp. brown butter (reserve remaining butter for cake); stir until moist clumps form. Stir in ginger. Set aside.<SEP>#Cake<SEP>Preheat oven to 325°. Butter pan generously. Whisk all-purpose flour and next 7 ingredients in a medium bowl. Using an electric mixer, beat remaining 1 cup browned butter and sugar in a large bowl until light and thick, 2–3 minutes. Add egg one at a time, beating to blend between additions. Beat in sour cream, milk, and vanilla. Stir in flour just to blend.<SEP>Spoon half of cake batter into prepared pan; smooth top. Scatter 1 cup of topping over. Spoon remaining batter in dollops over; smooth. Add almonds to remaining topping; squeeze to form 1/2” clumps and scatter evenly over batter in pan.<SEP>Bake until tester inserted into center of cake comes out clean, about 1 hour 20 minutes. Let cool in pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes. Run a knife around edge of pan to release cake. Remove pan sides; let cool completely.
3lw26HKVJwfT3Cau3OIc.notes: DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 day ahead. Store airtight at room temperature.
3lw26HKVJwfT3Cau3OIc.name: Brown Butter & Ginger Coffee Cake
3lw26HKVJwfT3Cau3OIc.ingredients: #Brown Butter<SEP>2 cups plus 2 Tbsp. (4 1/4 sticks; or more) unsalted butter<SEP>#Topping<SEP>1 1/4 cups all-purpose flour<SEP>1 cup (packed) dark brown sugar<SEP>1/4 teaspoon kosher salt<SEP>1/2 cup chopped crystalized ginger<SEP>#Cake<SEP>Unsalted butter (for pan)<SEP>2 cups all-purpose flour<SEP>3/4 cup whole wheat flour<SEP>1 tablespoon baking powder<SEP>1 teaspoon kosher salt<SEP>1 teaspoon ground cinnamon<SEP>1 teaspoon ground ginger<SEP>3/4 teaspoon baking soda<SEP>1/2 teaspoon ground allspice<SEP>1 3/4 cups sugar<SEP>4 large eggs<SEP>1 1/2 cups sour cream<SEP>1/2 cup whole milk<SEP>1 tablespoon vanilla extract<SEP>3/4 cup almonds with skins, coarsely chopped

41hxEqXMVBECysAOBuNt.ingredients: 3 small zucchinis, ends removed, cut in half lengthwise<SEP>3/4 cup Stove Top stuffing mix, uncooked<SEP>1/3 cup canned mushrooms, drained, chopped<SEP>1 tablespoon butter, melted<SEP>3/8 teaspoon salt<SEP>Dash pepper<SEP>6 tablespoons shredded Cheddar cheese
41hxEqXMVBECysAOBuNt.directions: Place a large saucepan of water on the stove; heat to a rolling boil. Add zucchini to boiling water and boil 8 minutes, or until tender when tested with a fork.<SEP>Remove zucchini from the pot and cool under running cold water.<SEP>Using a melon ball tool, remove the center portion of the zucchini. Place the removed center portion in a medium-sized bowl and reserve until later. Place hollowed-out zucchini on a foil-lined sheet pan; set aside.<SEP>In a large mixing bowl, combine stuffing mix, mushrooms, butter, salt and pepper. Chop the reserved zucchini centers and add to stuffing mixture; stir to combine.<SEP>Turn on oven broiler. Fill the hollowed-out zucchini with the stuffing mixture, then top with cheese. Place in oven and broil until the cheese is lightly browned.
41hxEqXMVBECysAOBuNt.name: Stuffed Zucchini

42yhzfVKbwqFNRejriV9.name: Chicken Tikka Masala
42yhzfVKbwqFNRejriV9.directions: Heat ghee in a large skillet over medium heat and cook and stir onion until translucent, about 5 minutes. Stir in garlic; cook and stir just until fragrant, about 1 minute. Stir cumin, 1 teaspoon salt, ginger, cayenne pepper, cinnamon, and turmeric into the onion mixture; fry until fragrant, about 2 minutes.<SEP><SEP>Stir tomato sauce into the onion and spice mixture, bring to a boil, and reduce heat to low. Simmer sauce for 10 minutes, then mix in cream, paprika, and 1 tablespoon sugar. Bring sauce back to a simmer and cook, stirring often, until sauce is thickened, 10 to 15 minutes.<SEP><SEP>Heat vegetable oil in a separate skillet over medium heat. Stir chicken into the hot oil, sprinkle with curry powder, and sear chicken until lightly browned but still pink inside, about 3 minutes; stir often. Transfer chicken and any pan juices into the sauce. Simmer chicken in sauce until no longer pink, about 30 minutes; adjust salt and sugar to taste.
42yhzfVKbwqFNRejriV9.ingredients: 2-3 T. ghee<SEP>1 onion, finely chopped<SEP>4 cloves garlic, minced<SEP>1 T. ground cumin<SEP>1 t. salt<SEP>1 t. ground ginger<SEP>1 t. cayenne pepper<SEP>1/2 t. ground cinnamon<SEP>1/4 t. ground turmeric<SEP><SEP>1 14-oz. can tomato sauce<SEP>1 c. heavy whipping cream<SEP>2 t. paprika<SEP>1 T. white sugar<SEP>1 T. vegetable oil<SEP>4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, cut into bite-size pieces (or chickpeas, for vegetarian version)<SEP>Green pepper, carrots (optional)<SEP>1/2 t. curry powder<SEP>1/2 t. salt<SEP>1 t. sugar

4NtNsIpsynQOglcYUU7e.directions: #To Prepare:<SEP>Remove sausage meat from casing. The easiest way to remove the uncooked sausage from the casings is to slice a vertical cut down the center of each sausage. Then just pick them up and “peel” off the casing – takes seconds and not that messy.<SEP><SEP>Peel and thinly slice onion. Finely chop garlic.<SEP>Clean carrots (peel if necessary) and cut into 1/4" rounds.<SEP>Remove core from cabbage and shred. I used the food processor with the shredding blade inserted. Alternately, you could cut the cabbage into very thin slices.<SEP><SEP>#To Cook:<SEP>Heat a large soup pot over medium heat. Once hot, add crumbled sausage. Cook, stirring occasionally, mostly to break up the sausage with a wooden spoon, for 8 to 10 minutes, or until most of the pink is gone.<SEP>Remove sausage from pot and set aside.<SEP>Keep the pot over medium heat and add olive oil. Once hot, toss in sliced onions along with a pinch of kosher salt and a couple turns of freshly ground pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 8 to 10 minutes, until onions are soft.<SEP>Add in garlic and carrots, stir continuously for 1 minute until garlic is fragrant.<SEP>Raise heat to medium high and add in cabbage along with 2 teaspoons of kosher salt and about 25 turns of freshly ground black pepper. Toss to combine and continue cooking for 5 minutes, stirring frequently, until cabbage begins to wilt and release some moisture. <SEP>Add cooked sausage back in along with diced tomatoes and broth. Bring to a boil.<SEP>Once boiling, cover and reduce heat to a simmer. Simmer for 15 to 20 minutes, remove from heat and adjust seasonings if necessary. Serve with a sprinkle of crushed red pepper flakes and Enjoy!
4NtNsIpsynQOglcYUU7e.name: Italian Sausage and Cabbage Soup
4NtNsIpsynQOglcYUU7e.ingredients: 1 1/2 pounds mild Italian sausage removed from casing and crumbled<SEP>1 1/2 tablespoons olive oil<SEP>2 medium or 1 extra large onion halved and thinly sliced<SEP>5 to 6 medium cloves garlic finely chopped<SEP>4 medium carrots cleaned and cut into 1/4" rounds<SEP>1 head green cabbage about 2 pounds, core removed and shredded<SEP>2 teaspoons kosher salt plus a couple pinches<SEP>freshly ground black pepper<SEP>28 ounce can of diced tomatoes unsalted<SEP>6 cups chicken stock or broth<SEP>Crushed red pepper flakes

4O0X3LRKvLWFwIK3AZDz.directions: #Preparing Dough for Storage:<SEP>Warm the water slightly. It should feel just a little warmer than body temperature. Warm water will rise the dough to the right point for storage in about 2 hours. With cold water it will need 3-4 hours.<SEP>Add the yeast to the water in a 5 quart bowl or, preferably, in a resealable, lidded (not airtight) plastic food container or food-grade bucket. Don't worry about getting it all to dissolve.<SEP>Mix in the flour and salt - kneading is unnecessary. Add all of the flour at once, measuring it in with dry-ingredient measuring cups, by gently scooping up the flour, then sweeping the top level with a knife or spatula. Don't press down into the flour as you scoop or you'll throw off the measurement. Mix with a wooden spoon, a high-capacity food processor (14 cups or larger) fitted with the dough attachment, or a heavy duty stand mixer fitted with the dough hook until the mixture is uniform. If you're hand mixing and it becomes too difficult to incorporate all the flour with the spoon, you can reach into your mixing vessel with very wet hands and press the mixture together. Don't knead, it isn't necessary. You're finished when everything is uniformly moist, without dry patches. It takes a few minutes, and will yield a dough that is wet and loose enough to conform to the shape of its container.<SEP>Allow to rise. Cover with lid (not airtight or it could explode the lid off). Allow the mixture to rise at room temperature until it begins to collapse (or at least flattens on the top), approx 2 hours, depending on room temperature, and initial water temperature Longer rising times, up to 5 hours, won't harm the result.<SEP>You can use a portion of the dough any time after this period. Fully refrigerated dough is less sticky and easier to work with than dough at room temperature.<SEP>#On Baking Day:<SEP>prepare your loaf tin, tray, or whatever you're baking it in/on. Sprinkle the surface of your refrigerated dough with four. Pull up and cut of a grapefruit-size piece of dough (c 1 lb), using a serrated knife.<SEP>Hold the mass of dough in your hands and add a little more flour as needed so it won't stick to your hands. Gently stretch the surface of the dough around to the bottom on all 4 sides, rotating the ball a quarter-turn as you go. Most of the dusting flour will fall off - that's fine, it isn't meant to be incorporated. The bottom of the loaf may appear to be a collection of bunched ends, but it will sort itself out during resting and baking.<SEP>The correctly shaped final product will be smooth and cohesive. The entire process should take no more than 30 - 60 seconds.<SEP>Rest the loaf and let it rise in the form, on the tray/pizza peel, for about 40 minutes Depending on the age of the dough, you may not see much rise during this period. That's fine, more rising will occur during baking.<SEP>Twenty minutes before baking, preheat the oven to 450°F Place an empty broiler tray for holding water on any other shelf that won't interfere with the rising bread.<SEP>Dust and Slash. Dust the top of the loaf liberally with flour, which will allow the slashing knife to pass without sticking. Slash a quarter inch deep cross, diagonal lines, or tic-tac-toe pattern on top using a serrated knife.<SEP>After a 20 min preheat you're ready to bake, even though the oven thermometer won't be at full temperature yet. Put your loaf in the oven. Pour about 1 cup of hot water (from the tap) into the broiler tray and close the oven to trap the steam.<SEP>Bake for about 30 minutes, or until the crust is nicely browned and firm to the touch.<SEP>Store the rest of the dough in the fridge in your lidded (not airtight) container and use it over the next 14 days. The flavour and texture improves, becoming like sourdough. Even 24 hours of storage improves the flavour.
4O0X3LRKvLWFwIK3AZDz.name: 5-Minute Artisan Bread
4O0X3LRKvLWFwIK3AZDz.ingredients: 3 cups lukewarm water<SEP>2 T. granulated yeast or (7 1/4 g) packets granulated yeast<SEP>1 1⁄2 T. kosher salt or 1 1/2 tablespoons other coarse salt<SEP>6 1⁄2 c. unsifted unbleached all-purpose flour (not strong)

4e1GvYABW7cxAwhLZg4n.name: Mandarin Salad
4e1GvYABW7cxAwhLZg4n.directions: Shake first 6 dressing ingredients in a jar and refrigerate.<SEP>Stir almonds and sugar in a small pan over medium heat until sugar melts and starts to caramelize and almonds are very lightly toasted.<SEP>Scrape into metal bowl and cool to room temperature.<SEP>Break up and store covered at room temperature.<SEP>Just before serving, put chopped lettuces in a large bowl.<SEP>Add celery, oranges, onions and almonds.<SEP>Shake dressing well and pour over salad.<SEP>Toss to mix and coat.
4e1GvYABW7cxAwhLZg4n.ingredients: #Dressing <SEP>1/2 cup vegetable oil<SEP>1/4 cup cider vinegar<SEP>1/4 cup sugar<SEP>2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh parsley<SEP>1 teaspoon salt<SEP>1/4 teaspoon hot pepper sauce<SEP><SEP>#TOPPING<SEP>1 cup sliced almonds<SEP>1/3 cup sugar<SEP><SEP>#SALAD<SEP>1 head iceberg lettuce<SEP>1 head romaine lettuce<SEP>2 cups chopped celery<SEP>2 (11 ounce) cans mandarin oranges, drained<SEP>1 cup thinly sliced red onion

4hYlij2oZyr9lNOyZS4Z.ingredients: 2 large eggs<SEP>1 cup milk, half and half, coconut milk, or almond milk<SEP>pinch salt<SEP>1 tablespoon granulated sugar, honey or maple syrup<SEP>1 teaspoon vanilla extract<SEP>1 teaspoon ground cinnamon<SEP>8 slices sandwich bread<SEP>butter
4hYlij2oZyr9lNOyZS4Z.name: French Toast
4hYlij2oZyr9lNOyZS4Z.directions: Whisk together eggs, milk, salt, sugar, vanilla, and cinnamon in a flat-bottomed pie plate or baking dish. Place bread slices, one or two at a time, into the egg mixture and flip to make sure both sides of bread are well-coated.<SEP>Melt butter in a large skillet or on a griddle. Place bread slices in skillet or on griddle and cook on medium heat until golden brown on each side, about 2-3 minutes.<SEP>Serve immediately or keep warm in oven until ready to serve, but no longer than about 30 minutes.

4sYoaloKOAba2tl1xT89.directions: In a large pot melt butter over medium heat. Add onion, fennel, and minced garlic. Cook about 5 minutes. Add chicken broth and apples. Bring to boiling, reduce heat. Simmer, covered, 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Transfer to blender. Blend until smooth. Return to pot. Stir in cream and heat through. Season to taste. Top with fennel fronds.
4sYoaloKOAba2tl1xT89.name: Garlicky Potato Apple Soup
4sYoaloKOAba2tl1xT89.ingredients: 2 T. butter<SEP>1 large russet potato, peeled and chopped<SEP>1 medium onion, chopped<SEP>1 fennel bulb, chopped<SEP>2 cloves garlic, minced<SEP>3 c. chicken broth<SEP>2 apples, peeled and chopped<SEP>1/2 c. cream

5A4TWykvqjz2WgWqc8Ty.name: Koshari
5A4TWykvqjz2WgWqc8Ty.directions: Heat 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Stir in rice; continue stirring until rice is coated with oil, about 3 minutes. Add 3 cups water and 1 teaspoon of salt. Bring to a boil; reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer until the rice is tender and liquid has been absorbed, 20 to 25 minutes.<SEP>Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil over high heat. Stir in the macaroni, and return to a boil. Cook the macaroni uncovered, stirring occasionally, until the it has cooked through, but is still firm to the bite, about 8 minutes. Drain well in a colander. Return macaroni to cooking pot, cover and keep warm.<SEP>Soak lentils for 30 minutes. Drain and rinse; drain again. Bring 2 cups water to a boil in a pot and stir in lentils. Bring to a boil; cover and reduce heat to low. Simmer until lentils are tender 15 or 20 minutes. Stir in 1/2 teaspoon salt.<SEP>Heat 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook the onions in the oil, stirring often, until they begin to brown, 10 to 15 minutes. Onions should be a nice caramelized brown color. Add garlic and cook another minute. Remove from pan, drain on a paper towel-lined plate.<SEP>Place half of the onion mixture into a saucepan. Mix in the vinegar. Add the chopped tomatoes and tomato paste, black pepper, 2 1/2 teaspoons salt, cumin, and cayenne (if using). Bring to a boil then reduce heat to medium-low and simmer about 12 minutes.<SEP>Serve by placing a spoonful of rice, then macaroni, and then the lentils on serving plates. Sprinkle with some of the browned onions, then top with tomato sauce.
5A4TWykvqjz2WgWqc8Ty.ingredients: 1 tablespoon vegetable oil<SEP>2 cups uncooked white rice<SEP>3 cups water<SEP>1 teaspoon salt<SEP>1 (16 ounce) package uncooked elbow macaroni<SEP>1 cup beluga lentils, soaked in water<SEP>1/2 teaspoon salt<SEP>1 tablespoon vegetable oil<SEP>5 onions, minced<SEP>2 cloves garlic, minced<SEP>3 tablespoons distilled white vinegar<SEP>4 ripe tomatoes, diced<SEP>1/2 cup tomato paste<SEP>1 1/2 teaspoons salt<SEP>1 teaspoon ground black pepper<SEP>2 1/2 teaspoons ground cumin<SEP>1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper

5JDmGQtcY1Kouq07zO3U.name: Minestrone Soup
5JDmGQtcY1Kouq07zO3U.ingredients: 4 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, divided<SEP>1 medium yellow onion, chopped<SEP>2 medium carrots, peeled and chopped<SEP>2 medium ribs celery, chopped<SEP>¼ cup tomato paste<SEP>2 cups chopped seasonal vegetables (potatoes, yellow squash, zucchini, butternut squash, green beans or peas all work)<SEP>4 cloves garlic, pressed or minced<SEP>½ teaspoon dried oregano<SEP>½ teaspoon dried thyme<SEP>1 large can (28 ounces) diced tomatoes, with their liquid (or 2 small 15-ounce cans)<SEP>4 cups (32 ounces) vegetable broth<SEP>2 cups water<SEP>1 teaspoon fine sea salt<SEP>2 bay leaves<SEP>Pinch of red pepper flakes<SEP>Freshly ground black pepper<SEP>1 cup whole grain orecchiette, elbow or small shell pasta<SEP>1 can (15 ounces) Great Northern beans or cannellini beans, rinsed and drained, or 1 ½ cups cooked beans<SEP>2 cups baby spinach, chopped kale or chopped collard greens<SEP>2 teaspoons lemon juice
5JDmGQtcY1Kouq07zO3U.directions: Warm 3 tablespoons of the olive oil in a large Dutch oven or stockpot over medium heat. Once the oil is shimmering, add the chopped onion, carrot, celery, tomato paste and a pinch of salt. Cook, stirring often, until the vegetables have softened and the onions are turning translucent, about 7 to 10 minutes.<SEP>Add the seasonal vegetables, garlic, oregano and thyme. Cook until fragrant while stirring frequently, about 2 minutes.<SEP>Pour in the diced tomatoes and their juices, broth and water. Add the salt, bay leaves and red pepper flakes. Season generously with freshly ground black pepper.<SEP>Raise heat to medium-high and bring the mixture to a boil, then partially cover the pot with the lid, leaving about a 1” gap for steam to escape. Reduce heat as necessary to maintain a gentle simmer.<SEP>Cook for 15 minutes, then remove the lid and add the pasta, beans and greens. Continue simmering, uncovered, for 20 minutes or until the the pasta is cooked al dente and the greens are tender.<SEP>Remove the pot from the heat, then remove the bay leaves. Stir in the lemon juice and remaining tablespoon of olive oil. Taste and season with more salt (I usually add about ¼ teaspoon more) and pepper until the flavors really sing.<SEP>Garnish with parmesan, if desired.

5N6KQvp5dgszEXh2fpRf.ingredients: 1 1/2 c. flour, whole wheat<SEP>3/4 c. flaxseed, ground<SEP>3/4 c. oats, dry<SEP>1/2 c. brown sugar<SEP>2 t. baking soda<SEP>1 t. baking powder<SEP>2 t. cinnamon<SEP>2 c. grated carrot<SEP>2 c. grated apple<SEP>3/4 c. milk<SEP>2 large egg<SEP>1 t. vanilla extract<SEP>1 c. cranberries, dried
5N6KQvp5dgszEXh2fpRf.name: Flax Carrot Apple Muffins
5N6KQvp5dgszEXh2fpRf.directions: Make oat flour by grinding oats in blender. Grate or puree carrots (will need two cups.) Grate apples.<SEP>Combine dry ingredients.<SEP>In a separate bowl, mix milk, eggs, vanilla.  Add to dry ingredients just until moistened.<SEP>Stir in cranberries.<SEP>Fill muffin papers.<SEP>Bake at 350 for 10 minutes (mini muffins) or 15 minutes, large muffins.

5Nv2fzxQz8fHwzVUrTPg.ingredients: 1 pound chicken breast (about 2 breasts), cubed<SEP>3 scallions, whites only, thinly sliced on a bias<SEP>2 tablespoons sugar<SEP>1 tablespoon dark sesame oil<SEP>1 tablespoon dry sherry<SEP>1 tablespoon soy sauce<SEP>2 cloves garlic, minced<SEP>1-inch piece peeled fresh ginger, minced<SEP>1 tablespoon, plus 1 teaspoon cornstarch<SEP>Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper<SEP>About 1/3 cup water<SEP>3 tablespoons vegetable oil<SEP>5 to 6 cups broccoli florets and sliced stalks (keep the 2 cuts separate)<SEP>3/4 to 1 teaspoon red chili flakes, optional<SEP>1 tablespoon hoisin sauce<SEP>Toasted sesame seeds, for serving, optional<SEP>Jasmine rice, for serving, optional
5Nv2fzxQz8fHwzVUrTPg.name: Chicken & Broccoli Stir-fry
5Nv2fzxQz8fHwzVUrTPg.directions: In a medium bowl, toss the chicken with the scallion whites, sugar, sesame oil, sherry, soy sauce, about half the garlic, half the ginger, 1 teaspoon of the cornstarch and 1 teaspoon salt. Marinate at room temperature for 15 minutes. Mix the remaining 1 tablespoon cornstarch with 1/3 cup water in a small bowl and reserve.<SEP>Heat a large nonstick skillet over high heat. Add 1 tablespoon of the vegetable oil and heat. Add the broccoli stems and stir-fry for 30 seconds. Add the florets and the remaining garlic and ginger, 2 tablespoons water, 1/4 teaspoon salt and some black pepper. Stir-fry until the broccoli is bright green but still crisp, about 2 minutes. Transfer to a plate.<SEP>Get the skillet good and hot again, and then heat the remaining 2 tablespoons vegetable oil. Add the chicken and red pepper flakes if using. Stir-fry until the chicken loses its raw color and gets a little brown, about 3 minutes. Add the hoisin sauce, return the broccoli to the pan and toss to heat through. Stir in the reserved cornstarch mixture and bring to a boil to thicken. Add more water if need to thin the sauce, if necessary. Taste and season with salt and pepper, if you like. <SEP>Mound the stir-fry on a serving platter or divide among 4 plates and garnish with sesame seeds; serve with rice.

5ZTtWGp0RTXaVQlbahDu.notes: I made this with graham cracker crust, and you can leave out the spice. People seemed to like the texture.
5ZTtWGp0RTXaVQlbahDu.name: Spicy Chocolate Pie
5ZTtWGp0RTXaVQlbahDu.ingredients: #For the crust:<SEP>1 1/2 - 2 cups gingersnap crumbs<SEP>6-8 tablespoons melted butter<SEP>1/8 teaspoon ground ginger<SEP>1/8 teaspoon cinnamon<SEP>1/8 teaspoon cayenne pepper (or to taste)<SEP>#For the chocolate filling:<SEP>7 ounces dark chocolate, chopped<SEP>1 cup heavy cream<SEP>1 egg (at room temperature)<SEP>1/8 teaspoon ground ginger<SEP>1/8 teaspoon cinnamon<SEP>1/8 teaspoon cayenne pepper (or to taste)<SEP>Pinch of salt<SEP>#For the cinnamon whipped cream:<SEP>1 1/2 cups heavy cream<SEP>1/4 cup sugar<SEP>1 teaspoon cinnamon<SEP>Pinch of chili flakes
5ZTtWGp0RTXaVQlbahDu.directions: To prepare crust grind gingersnaps in a food processor until fine (alternatively, you can put them in a bag and use a rolling pin, hammer, or other blunt object to pulverize them). Grease a 9-inch pie pan, pour in crumbs, mix in spices, then add melted butter in stages, mixing after each addition until the crumbs are the texture of wet sand. You may have some butter left over, depending on the kind of gingersnaps.<SEP>Firmly press the crumb mixture into the sides of the pan, and along the bottom, forming an even layer. Chill for at least 30 minutes, to prevent the crust from crumbling when cut.<SEP>While the crust chills, prepare the chocolate filling. Preheat oven to 350°F. Put chocolate in a large glass bowl. In a saucepan, heat the heavy cream until it just comes to the boil. Pour over chocolate, and let stand for 1 minute. Gently whisk the cream and chocolate together until fully combined and glossy. Add egg, whisk to incorporate. Whisk in spices and salt, then pour into chilled pie crust and bake for 25 minutes, or until chocolate filling has puffed up but is still slightly wobbly in the center. Remove from oven and cool completely before topping.<SEP>To prepare whipped cream, pour cream into a large bowl or a stand mixer, add sugar and cinnamon, and whip until soft peaks form. Pile on top of cooled chocolate filling, and finish with a sprinkling of chili flakes.

5l7e7qsgfhyOPCEMaoKE.name: Tuna Okara Salad
5l7e7qsgfhyOPCEMaoKE.directions: Put salt on sliced onion and squeeze<SEP>Remove seeds of cucumber if necessary<SEP>Rinse onions and pat dry<SEP>Open canned tuna and drain<SEP>Add all other ingredients, salt and pepper to taste, and mix.
5l7e7qsgfhyOPCEMaoKE.ingredients: 1 cup okara <SEP>1 can tuna<SEP>1/4 English cucumber<SEP>1/4 onion <SEP>5 Tbsp Mayonnaise<SEP>1/4 cup corn<SEP>1/2 carrot<SEP>Salt & pepper

5oZYREpLuTBJ2KKEe2AN.name: Perfect Boiled Eggs (Instant Pot)
5oZYREpLuTBJ2KKEe2AN.directions: Put metal trivet in instant pot, along with water.<SEP>Gently set eggs on the trivet. Close pressure cooker and seal.<SEP>Manual, high pressure, 5 minutes (3 or 4 for soft boiled eggs).<SEP>Quick release, then put eggs in an ice bath for at least 1 minute.
5oZYREpLuTBJ2KKEe2AN.notes: Bring eggs to room temperature beforehand to avoid cracking.

6HVSxiQmANwfBO80ruId.name: Lemon Poke Cake
6HVSxiQmANwfBO80ruId.directions: Place cake layers, top sides up, in 2 clean 9-inch round pans. Pierce cakes with large fork at 1/2-inch intervals.<SEP>Add boiling water to gelatin mix; stir 2 min. until completely dissolved. Carefully pour over cake layers. Refrigerate 3 hours.<SEP>Beat pudding mix and milk in large bowl with whisk 2 min.; stir in COOL WHIP. Dip 1 cake pan in warm water 10 sec.; unmold onto plate. Spread with about 1 cup pudding mixture. Unmold second cake layer; carefully place on first cake layer. Frost top and side of cake with remaining pudding mixture. Refrigerate 1 hour.
6HVSxiQmANwfBO80ruId.ingredients: 2 round white cake layers (9 inch), cooled<SEP> 2 cups boiling water<SEP> 1 pkg. (6 oz.) JELL-O Lemon Flavor Gelatin<SEP> 1 pkg. (3.4 oz.) JELL-O Lemon Flavor Instant Pudding<SEP> 1 cup cold milk<SEP> 1 tub (8 oz.) COOL WHIP Whipped Topping, thawed

6KBFG6OJoyVFQuJzQ7Pa.ingredients: 1 1/2 cup water warm<SEP>1 tsp sugar<SEP>2 1/4 tsp active dry yeast (1 package)<SEP>4 cups all-purpose flour<SEP>1 tsp salt<SEP>1/3 cup olive oil
6KBFG6OJoyVFQuJzQ7Pa.directions: In a small bowl whisk the water, sugar and yeast together. Let it sit for about 10 minutes. If the yeast is good, it will start to froth up.<SEP>In the bowl of your mixer, add the flour and salt, olive oil and yeast mixture. Mix everything together using the dough hook for about 5 minutes or until the dough is soft and elastic. When it's done it will come clean from the side of the bowl.<SEP>Shape the dough into a ball and place in an oiled bowl, rubbing oil on the dough as well, cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate. If you're not using the dough right away, you can also freeze the dough.<SEP>Bake at the highest temperature your oven goes, which is around 550F for about 8 to 10 minutes.
6KBFG6OJoyVFQuJzQ7Pa.name: Easy Pizza Dough

6M9cGHRSrjrSIZEiP5Nw.ingredients: 1 to 1 1/4 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts<SEP>Salt<SEP>2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil + more for lightly coating chicken<SEP>1 tablespoon butter<SEP>1 cup sliced shallots<SEP>1/2 cup dry white wine (can sub chicken stock)<SEP>1/2 cup water<SEP>4 tablespoons Dijon mustard, smooth, whole grain, or a mixture of both<SEP>1 teaspoon dried thyme<SEP>1/4 cup heavy cream
6M9cGHRSrjrSIZEiP5Nw.directions: Cut chicken breasts and pound thin: Remove chicken breasts from package and sprinkle with salt. Remove the tenderloin from each breast and set aside. Cut each chicken breast into 3 pieces, approximately the same size. Coat with just a little olive oil.<SEP>Place the breast pieces between two pieces of plastic wrap or parchment paper and use a mallet, empty wine bottle, or rolling pin to pound the chicken pieces to an even thinness of about 1/4 inch. Repeat with the tenderloin pieces.<SEP>Lightly brown the chicken cutlets: In a large, heavy-bottomed sauté pan, heat the olive oil on medium high to high heat. Stir in the butter. When the butter is foamy, add the chicken pieces to the pan. Do not crowd the pan, if necessary work in batches.<SEP>Lightly brown chicken on one side, turn over and brown the other side. Do not overcook the chicken. The pieces are thin and they will cook quickly. Remove the chicken pieces from the pan and set aside while you make the sauce.<SEP>Cook the shallots: Add sliced shallots to the pan. Lower the heat to medium. Stir to coat with the remaining fat in the pan. Cook until softened, about 5 to 6 minutes.<SEP>Make the sauce: Add white wine to the pan and increase the heat to high. When most of the wine has evaporated, add the water, the mustard, and the dried thyme. Simmer until reduced by half.<SEP>Add chicken back to pan, drizzle in cream: Reduce the heat to low. Add the chicken back to the pan and coat with the sauce. Remove the pan from heat and drizzle in the cream. Taste and adjust seasonings, adding more salt if necessary.
6M9cGHRSrjrSIZEiP5Nw.name: Creamy Dijon Chicken

6OGNoSEXMmhbl0X3nvHt.directions: Toss brown rice with chopped vegetables and sunflower seeds until evenly mixed. <SEP>Pour vinaigrette ingredients in a bottle or jar, and shake vigorously. <SEP>Drizzle over rice and vegetables, toss gently.
6OGNoSEXMmhbl0X3nvHt.notes: Add quinoa. Less oil in the dressing.
6OGNoSEXMmhbl0X3nvHt.name: Confetti Rice Salad
6OGNoSEXMmhbl0X3nvHt.ingredients: 4 c cooked brown rice<SEP>1 c red pepper, chopped<SEP>1 carrot, grated or chopped<SEP>1 c black beans<SEP>1 c corn<SEP>2 T fresh chives or 1 scallion, finely chopped<SEP>1 c chopped red cabbage<SEP>1 c chopped parsley or 1/2 parsley, 1/2 cilantro<SEP>1/2 c sunflower seeds<SEP><SEP>#Dressing<SEP>4 T unrefined sesame oil<SEP>4 T brown rice vinegar<SEP>2 tsp toasted sesame oil<SEP>1 tsp tamari (or soy sauce)

6htaDHrgDMyKgGJUm6kf.directions: Preheat convection oven to 350°F.<SEP>Combine the flour and dry cranberries in the food processor bowl with the blade attachment and chop the<SEP>cranberries in the flour. (The flour prevents the cranberries from sticking to the food processor blade.) Pour<SEP>the flour-cranberry mixture in a mixing bowl. <SEP>Add baking powder, baking soda, and salt mix thoroughly.<SEP>Cut the shortening into the dry ingredients until the shortening is about the size of unpopped popcorn kernels.<SEP>Combine orange juice, sugar, orange zest, and beaten egg  Add liquid ingredients to the dry ingredients. Stir<SEP>until just combined. DO NOT over mix.<SEP>Fold the chopped nuts into the batter.<SEP>Spoon into paper-lined mini muffin cups and bake for 10 to 12 minutes, or until golden brown.<SEP>Allow muffins to sit in the pan for about 5 minutes before removing them. Serve warm or allow to cool<SEP>completely on a wire cooling rack.
6htaDHrgDMyKgGJUm6kf.ingredients: 1 cup dried cranberries<SEP>2/3 cups flour<SEP>1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder<SEP>1/2 teaspoon baking soda<SEP>1 teaspoon salt<SEP>1/4 cup shortening<SEP>1 cup orange juice<SEP>2/3 cup sugar<SEP>1 tablespoon orange zest<SEP>1 egg, beaten<SEP>1 to 1-1/2 cup chopped walnuts
6htaDHrgDMyKgGJUm6kf.name: Orange Cranberry Nut Muffins

6iZtxPZ0rw97kPkfYCzr.directions: For the dressing, dry roast sesame seeds in a frying pan for about a couple of minutes, gently jiggling the pan. Careful not to burn them.<SEP>With a pestle and a mortar, partially grind the sesame seeds.<SEP>In a large bowl, mix together ground sesame seeds, soy sauce, sugar, and a pinch of salt.<SEP>Cut the green beans if they are too long. Cook the green beans by boiling until desired tenderness is reached. Drain and briefly run them under running water so that the beans stay green.<SEP>While the green beans still warm, toss them in the sesame dressing.<SEP>The dressing looks more like a paste than dressing but that's exactly how you want it to be, otherwise when mixed with the green beans, the dressing gets too runny and the green beans won't taste as nice.
6iZtxPZ0rw97kPkfYCzr.ingredients: 500 g fresh green beans<SEP>3 tablespoons sesame seeds<SEP>3 tablespoons soy sauce<SEP>2 tablespoons yellow sugar<SEP>1 pinch salt
6iZtxPZ0rw97kPkfYCzr.name: Goma-Ae (Sesame) Green Beans

71cyUfV13hKTPl6cbtgp.directions: Heat a large pot over medium heat, and warm olive oil.<SEP>Add chopped yellow onion, minced garlic, and chopped carrots; then cook, stirring as necessary, until tender (about 5 minutes).<SEP>Add chili powder and ground cumin; and cook, stirring constantly, for 60 seconds.<SEP>Add chicken broth, 1 can of kidney beans, frozen whole kernel corn, and freshly ground black pepper; and bring to a boil.<SEP>While soup is heating, place stewed tomatoes and second can of kidney beans in a blender or food processor and puree until smooth; then add to soup.<SEP>Add salt to taste.<SEP>Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for about 15 minutes.<SEP>Let cool a bit before serving.
71cyUfV13hKTPl6cbtgp.name: Kidney Bean Vegetable Soup
71cyUfV13hKTPl6cbtgp.ingredients: 1 tablespoon olive oil<SEP>1 yellow onion, chopped<SEP>1 garlic clove, minced<SEP>2 carrots, chopped<SEP>2 t. sodium-free chili powder<SEP>1 t. ground cumin<SEP>4 c. low-sodium low-fat chicken broth<SEP>2 15-oz. cans low-sodium kidney beans, rinsed and drained<SEP>1 cup frozen whole kernel corn<SEP>1⁄4 t. fresh ground black pepper<SEP>1 14.5-oz. can low-sodium stewed tomatoes<SEP>salt, to taste

79rVmVRfrzk0hym9vwpV.directions: Tomato sauce can be made 4 days ahead. Let cool; cover and chill. Reheat before mixing with pasta.<SEP>Preheat oven to 425°F. Combine tomatoes (crushing them with your hands), garlic, anchovies, butter, and 1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes in a 13x9" baking dish; season with salt and black pepper.<SEP>Roast, tossing halfway through, until garlic is very soft and mixture is jammy, 35–40 minutes. Using a potato masher or fork, mash to break up garlic and tomatoes.<SEP>Meanwhile, cook pasta in a large pot of boiling salted water, stirring occasionally, until al dente. Drain, reserving 1/2 cup pasta cooking liquid.<SEP>Return pasta to pot and add tomato sauce and pasta cooking liquid. Cook over medium-high heat, tossing until sauce coats pasta, about 3 minutes. Serve topped with Parmesan and more red pepper flakes.
79rVmVRfrzk0hym9vwpV.ingredients: 1 (28-ounce) can whole peeled tomatoes<SEP>8 garlic cloves, peeled, crushed<SEP>2 anchovy fillets packed in oil<SEP>1/4 cup (1/2 stick) unsalted butter, cut into small pieces<SEP>1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes plus more for serving<SEP>Kosher salt, freshly ground pepper<SEP>12 ounces bucatini or spaghetti<SEP>Finely grated Parmesan (for serving)
79rVmVRfrzk0hym9vwpV.name: Bucatini with Butter Roasted Tomato Sauce

7CKgk3sNY8EO8BD4bcWV.name: Tahini
7CKgk3sNY8EO8BD4bcWV.directions: #TOAST SESAME SEEDS<SEP>Add sesame seeds to a wide, dry saucepan over medium-low heat and toast, stirring constantly until the seeds become fragrant and very lightly colored (not brown), 3 to 5 minutes. Transfer toasted seeds to a baking sheet or large plate and cool completely. (Careful here, sesame seeds can burn quickly).<SEP><SEP>#MAKE TAHINI<SEP>Add sesame seeds to the bowl of a food processor then process until a crumbly paste forms, about 1 minute. Add 3 tablespoons of the oil then process for 2 to 3 minutes more, stopping to scrape the bottom and sides of the food processor a couple times.<SEP>Check the tahini's consistency. It should be smooth, not gritty and should be pourable. You may need to process for another minute or add the additional tablespoon of oil. Taste the tahini for seasoning then add salt to taste. Process 5 to 10 seconds to mix it in.<SEP>Store tahini covered in the refrigerator for one month. You may notice it separates over time, like a natural peanut butter would. If this happens, give the tahini a good stir before using.
7CKgk3sNY8EO8BD4bcWV.ingredients: 1 cup (5 ounces or 140 grams) hulled sesame seeds<SEP>2 to 4 tablespoons neutral flavored oil such as grape seed, canola or a light olive oil<SEP>Pinch of salt

7HEPiBW7CQtelsAZiYLz.name: Sun-dried Tomato Pesto
7HEPiBW7CQtelsAZiYLz.ingredients: 12 ounces penne pasta<SEP>1 (8.5-ounce) jar sun-dried tomatoes packed in olive oil<SEP>2 garlic cloves<SEP>Salt and freshly ground black pepper<SEP>1 cup (packed) fresh basil leaves<SEP>1/2 cup freshly grated Parmesan
7HEPiBW7CQtelsAZiYLz.directions: Cook the pasta in a large pot of boiling salted water until tender but still firm to the bite, stirring occasionally, about 8 minutes. Drain, reserving 1 cup of the cooking liquid.<SEP>Meanwhile, blend the sun-dried tomatoes and their oil, garlic, salt and pepper, to taste, and basil in a food processor and blend until the tomatoes are finely chopped. Transfer the tomato mixture to a large bowl. Stir in the Parmesan.<SEP>Add the pasta to the pesto and toss to coat, adding enough reserved cooking liquid to moisten. Season the pasta, to taste, with salt and pepper and serve.

7d4ABkSD3fTOopO8uqBE.name: Ginger Softies
7d4ABkSD3fTOopO8uqBE.directions: Mix the sugar and molasses until there are no clumps. <SEP>Add in shortening and eggs.<SEP>Mix all the dry ingredients together, then add them to the sugar/molasses mixture a little at a time.<SEP>Bake at 350 for 8-10 minutes.
7d4ABkSD3fTOopO8uqBE.ingredients: 2 cups sugar<SEP>1/2 cup molasses<SEP>1-1/2 cups shortening<SEP>2 eggs<SEP>4 cups flour<SEP>4 teaspoons baking soda<SEP>2 teaspoons cinnamon<SEP>2 teaspoons ground ginger<SEP>1/2 teaspoon ground cloves<SEP>1/2 teaspoon salt

7fD9V7f3o6qLiylEv0vt.ingredients: 1/2 cup burghul<SEP>4 tablespoons finely chopped scallions and/or 1 large onion, finely chopped<SEP>salt and black pepper<SEP>2-3 cups parsley, finely chopped<SEP>4 tablespoons finely chopped fresh mint or 2 1/2 tablespoons dried crushed mint<SEP>5 tablespoons olive oil, or more<SEP>5 tablespoons lemon juice<SEP>1 cucumber, peeled and diced, salt and drain (scrape out seeds if seeds are large)<SEP>1-2 tomatoes, peeled and diced (don’t add any juice from the cutting)<SEP>cooked vine leaves, raw lettuce or tender cabbage leaves
7fD9V7f3o6qLiylEv0vt.directions: Soak the burghul in water for about 1/2 hour before preparing the salad. It will expand enormously. <SEP>Drain and squeeze out as much moisture as possible with your hands. Spread out to dry further on a cloth.<SEP>Mix the burghul with the chopped onions, squeezing with your hands to crush the onions so that their juices penetrate the burghul. <SEP>Season to taste with salt and pepper. <SEP>Add the cucumber, tomato, parsley, mint, olive oil and lemon juice, and mix well. Taste to see if more salt, pepper or lemon are required. <SEP>Tabbouleh is traditionally served in individual plates lined with boiled vine leaves, or raw lettuce or cabbage leaves. People scoop the salad up with more leaves, served in a separate bowl beside it.
7fD9V7f3o6qLiylEv0vt.name: Tabbouleh

7fM39cTAOcPRCUBFLpf1.name: Applesauce (Instant Pot)
7fM39cTAOcPRCUBFLpf1.ingredients: 4 large Granny Smith apples , peeled, cored and roughly chopped (or Golden Delicious apples )<SEP>4 large Honeycrisp apples , peeled, cored and roughly chopped<SEP>1 cup water<SEP>1 Tablespoon fresh lemon juice (from about 1/2 a lemon)<SEP>1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
7fM39cTAOcPRCUBFLpf1.directions: Peel and core apples. I use a johhny apple peeler to do all three steps at once (peel, spice and core).<SEP>Add water, lemon juice and cinnamon to instant pot and stir to combine. Add apples and toss to mix.<SEP>Secure lid and cook on manual (high pressure) for 8 minutes. Do a controlled quick release or allow the pressure to naturally release.<SEP>Mash the apple mixture a few times with a potato masher, if desired. (If you like a smoother texture you could pulse it in the blender.) <SEP>Transfer contents to a bowl and allow to cool completely. Stir in more cinnamon, if desired, to taste. <SEP>Enjoy warm or cold. Store in the fridge for up to 7-10 days.

7gyVagaHLS2YZZdblEO1.name: Seven Layer Dip
7gyVagaHLS2YZZdblEO1.directions: Spread beans in the bottom of a 10" round or square clear glass dish; set aside. <SEP>Combine sour cream and seasoning mix; spread over beans. <SEP>Make guacamole with avocados, lemon juice, garlic, cilantro, cumin, red onion, salt; layer over sour cream mixture. <SEP>Sprinkle with cheese; top with onions, olives and tomato, corn. Serve with tortilla chips.
7gyVagaHLS2YZZdblEO1.ingredients: 16-oz. can refried beans <SEP>2 cups sour cream <SEP>1-1/4 oz. pkg. taco seasoning mix <SEP>2 avocados, pitted, peeled and mashed <SEP>2 teaspoons lemon juice <SEP>3 cloves garlic, minced <SEP>1/4 cup cilantro, chopped<SEP>1/4 tsp cumin<SEP>Some red onion (optional)<SEP>salt<SEP>2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese <SEP>4 green onions, diced <SEP>1/4 cup black olives, sliced <SEP>2 tomatoes, diced<SEP>corn (optional)<SEP>tortilla chips

7l07wWhpypidXm8vIE29.directions: Blanch green beans in a large stock pot of well salted boiling water until bright green in color and tender crisp, roughly 2 minutes. Drain and shock in a bowl of ice water to stop from cooking.<SEP>Heat a large heavy skillet over medium heat. Add the oil and the butter. Add the garlic and red pepper flakes and saute until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the beans and continue to saute until coated in the butter and heated through, about 5 minutes. Add lemon zest and season with salt and pepper.
7l07wWhpypidXm8vIE29.ingredients: 2 lbs. green beans, end trimmed<SEP>1 T. extra-virgin olive oil<SEP>3 T. butter<SEP>2 large garlic cloves, minced<SEP>1 t. red pepper flakes<SEP>1 T. lime zest<SEP>Salt and freshly ground black pepper
7l07wWhpypidXm8vIE29.name: Lemon & Garlic Green Beans

7lZyNs0DqPcYgyPvyHAc.directions: In a big bowl, whisk flour and Dashi (fish broth) together until smooth. Stir egg and yam to flour mixture. Season it with salt and soy sauce.<SEP>Add chopped cabbage, onions, and ginger to the batter and mix.<SEP>Heat oil in a skillet, pour half of the pancake batter into an 8" circle, and lay 3 pieces of pork slices on it. Fry at medium heat until the bottom becomes golden brown, about 5-7 minutes.<SEP>Flip to fry the other side until the pork becomes crispy, about 5-7 minutes.<SEP>Flip one more time, pork side up, and spread Okonomiyaki sauce and mayo on the pancake.<SEP>Sprinkle dried green seaweed, then dried bonito flakes over the pancake. Serve hot.
7lZyNs0DqPcYgyPvyHAc.name: Okonomiyaki
7lZyNs0DqPcYgyPvyHAc.ingredients: 1 cup all purpose flour<SEP>1 cup Dashi (fish broth)<SEP>1 egg<SEP>3-4 Tbsp Nagaimo (long yam), grated (optional)<SEP>1/4 tsp salt<SEP>1/4 tsp Soy Sauce<SEP>1/4 cabbage (about 12oz), chopped fine<SEP>3-4 green onions, chopped fine<SEP>2-3 Tbsp pickled red ginger Benishoga, chopped fine<SEP>1 Tbsp oil<SEP>6 pieces thinly sliced pork belly<SEP>Okonomiyaki sauce or Tonkatsu sauce<SEP>mayonnaise<SEP>dried bonito flakes<SEP>dried green seaweed (Aonori)

7p8LdqpDkCubibrcJdoT.directions: Put the chickpeas in a large bowl and add enough cold water to cover them by at least 2 inches. Let soak overnight, then drain. Or use canned chickpeas, drained.<SEP>Place the drained, uncooked chickpeas and the onions in the bowl of a food processor fitted with a steel blade. Add the parsley, cilantro, salt, hot pepper, garlic, and cumin. Process until blended but not pureed.<SEP>Sprinkle in the baking powder and 4 tablespoons of the flour, and pulse. You want to add enough bulgur or flour so that the dough forms a small ball and no longer sticks to your hands. Turn into a bowl and refrigerate, covered, for several hours.<SEP>Form the chickpea mixture into balls about the size of walnuts, or use a falafel scoop, available in Middle-Eastern markets.<SEP>Heat 3 inches of oil to 375ºF in a deep pot or wok and fry 1 ball to test. If it falls apart, add a little flour. Then fry about 6 balls at once for a few minutes on each side, or until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Stuff half a pita with falafel balls, chopped tomatoes, onion, green pepper, and pickled turnips. Drizzle with tahina thinned with water.
7p8LdqpDkCubibrcJdoT.ingredients: 1 cup dried chickpeas<SEP>1/2 large onion, roughly chopped (about 1 cup)<SEP>2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh parsley<SEP>2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh cilantro<SEP>1 teaspoon salt<SEP>1/2-1 teaspoon dried hot red pepper<SEP>4 cloves of garlic<SEP>1 teaspoon cumin<SEP>1 teaspoon baking powder<SEP>4-6 tablespoons flour<SEP>Soybean or vegetable oil for frying<SEP>Chopped tomato for garnish<SEP>Diced onion for garnish<SEP>Diced green bell pepper for garnish<SEP>Tahini<SEP>Pita bread
7p8LdqpDkCubibrcJdoT.name: Falafel (need to compare w/ other recipe)
7p8LdqpDkCubibrcJdoT.notes: NOTE: Egyptians omit the cilantro and substitute fava beans for the chickpeas.

7uvr3jdVuN9gSNRPn7mg.ingredients: 8 oz. dried navy beans (soaked for 6 hours)<SEP>2 T. oil<SEP>2 stalks celery, diced<SEP>1 medium onion, diced<SEP>2 Italian turkey sausage links<SEP>36 oz. chicken broth<SEP>1/2 t. pepper<SEP>5 oz. spinach, fresh<SEP>1 T. dried basil<SEP>1 T. dried oregano<SEP>1 t. powdered red pepper<SEP>1 T. garlic powder<SEP>1 c. carrots, diced<SEP>salt to taste<SEP>1 c. black wild rice
7uvr3jdVuN9gSNRPn7mg.name: White Bean & Spinach Soup
7uvr3jdVuN9gSNRPn7mg.directions: Soak beans for 6 hours in water. Heat oil in large pot over medium heat. Remove sausage from skin, brown and crumble. Add diced carrots, celery, and onion. Saute for 5 minutes. Add beans, chicken broth, pepper, rice, and spices. Bring to a boil, then simmer on medium low for 1 hour. Add washed spinach and bring to a back to a boil. Lower heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Serve with French bread.

80OdVxqcfcFCHx2OI8Ur.name: Magic Crust Custard Pie
80OdVxqcfcFCHx2OI8Ur.ingredients: 1/4 c butter<SEP>4 eggs<SEP>3/4 c white sugar<SEP>1 pinch salt<SEP>2 c milk, 2%<SEP>2 tsp vanilla extract<SEP>1/2 c all-purpose flour
80OdVxqcfcFCHx2OI8Ur.directions: Put all ingredients into a blender. Blend for 30 seconds.<SEP>Butter a 9-inch pie plate.<SEP>Pour batter into the pie pan.<SEP>Sprinkle with nutmeg.<SEP>Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes.<SEP>The flour will settle to make its own crust.

83HRF1c3IRJfVXNV2XRR.ingredients: 1 (.25 ounce) package active dry yeast<SEP>1 cup warm water<SEP>¼ cup white sugar  <SEP>3 tablespoons milk<SEP>1 egg, beaten<SEP>2 teaspoons salt<SEP>4 ½ cups bread flour<SEP>2 teaspoons minced garlic (optional)<SEP>¼ cup butter, melted
83HRF1c3IRJfVXNV2XRR.directions: In a large bowl, dissolve yeast in warm water. Let stand about 10 minutes, until frothy. Stir in sugar, milk, egg, salt, and enough flour to make a soft dough. Knead for 6 to 8 minutes on a lightly floured surface, or until smooth. Place dough in a well oiled bowl, cover with a damp cloth, and set aside to rise. Let it rise 1 hour, until the dough has doubled in volume.<SEP><SEP>Punch down dough, and knead in garlic. Pinch off small handfuls of dough about the size of a golf ball. Roll into balls, and place on a tray. Cover with a towel, and allow to rise until doubled in size, about 30 minutes.<SEP><SEP>During the second rising, preheat grill to high heat.<SEP><SEP>[Peraltas adaptation: Bake at 500 degrees.] At grill side, roll one ball of dough out into a thin circle. Lightly oil grill. Place dough on grill, and cook for 2 to 3 minutes, or until puffy and lightly browned. Brush uncooked side with butter, and turn over. Brush cooked side with butter, and cook until browned, another 2 to 4 minutes. Remove from grill, and continue the process until all the naan has been prepared.
83HRF1c3IRJfVXNV2XRR.name: Naan

8LDmiRzZvWoK9PfR2Z4D.directions: Mix and put in glass pan to freeze.
8LDmiRzZvWoK9PfR2Z4D.name: Pink Lemonade Pie
8LDmiRzZvWoK9PfR2Z4D.ingredients: Big can pink lemonade concentrate<SEP>Softened 1/2 gallon vanilla ice cream<SEP>Crushed pecan Sandies for bottom and top crust<SEP>1 8-oz container frozen whipped topping, thawed

8NcOs3HbObCyZo7gcK5N.name: Poppyseed Bundt Cake
8NcOs3HbObCyZo7gcK5N.directions: Heat oven to 350<SEP>Mix well and pour into greased bundt pan<SEP>Bake 40-45 minutes
8NcOs3HbObCyZo7gcK5N.ingredients: 1 Box Yellow Cake Mix<SEP>1 Box Instant Vanilla Pudding<SEP>4 Eggs<SEP>1 C. Oil<SEP>4 tsp. Poppyseeds<SEP>1/2 tsp. Almond Extract

8WRkFjm1WWQesnQr6wFB.name: Roasted Broccoli
8WRkFjm1WWQesnQr6wFB.directions: Roast at 400 degrees for about 25 minutes, turning halfway through.

8jyKbJsNW98BAQybyh4X.ingredients: 3/4 cup uncooked quinoa<SEP>1 1/2 cups water<SEP>1 1/2 cup frozen edamame, thawed<SEP>1 bunch kale, stems removed and very finely diced<SEP>1 cup sliced grape tomatoes<SEP>1/3 cup diced red onion<SEP>1 large mango, pitted and diced<SEP>1 avocado, sliced<SEP><SEP>#For lemon basil vinaigrette:<SEP>1/4 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice<SEP>1/4 cup olive oil<SEP>1 garlic clove, minced<SEP>1 teaspoon dijon mustard<SEP>1 teaspoon honey (or agave nectar)<SEP>4-6 large basil leaves, very finely diced<SEP>Freshly ground salt and black pepper, to taste<SEP><SEP>#To garnish:<SEP>1/4 cup toasted sliced almonds
8jyKbJsNW98BAQybyh4X.directions: First, cook your quinoa: Add quinoa and water to a medium pot and place over high heat; bring to a boil, then cover, reduce heat to low and cook for 15 minutes. After 15 minutes, remove from heat, fluff quinoa with a fork and transfer quinoa to a large bowl to cool down.<SEP>To make dressing: place olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, dijon, honey (or agave), basil, and salt and pepper in blender. Pulse for 10-15 seconds; set aside. You can also whisk in a small bowl if you don't have a blender (just make sure your basil is very finely chopped.)<SEP>In large bowl add your kale and pour half of the dressing over. Use clean hands to massage the kale for about 3 minutes or until it breaks down. This allows the kale to take on the dressing flavors.<SEP>Next add in quinoa, edamame, diced onion, and remaining lemon vinaigrette; toss so that the salad is fully coated.<SEP>Before serving, toss salad again and add tomatoes, mango and avocado. Sprinkle toasted sliced almonds over the top. Serves 4. Great for meal prep, picnics or parties!
8jyKbJsNW98BAQybyh4X.name: Kale, Edamame, and Quinoa Salad
