8spnpSpJDDWPyXIX8Qyv.directions: Heat the oil in a large stock pot over medium-high heat, add the onions, carrot and celery and cook until tender, about 8-10 minutes.<SEP>Add the garlic and thyme and cook until fragrant, about a minute.<SEP>Add the chicken broth or stock, chicken and orzo, bring to a boil, reduce the heat and simmer until the orzo is just tender, about 5 minutes.<SEP>Season with salt and pepper to taste and mix in the, lemon juice, zest, tarragon and parsley.
8spnpSpJDDWPyXIX8Qyv.name: Lemon Orzo Soup
8spnpSpJDDWPyXIX8Qyv.ingredients: 1 tablespoon oil<SEP>1 onion, diced<SEP>2 carrots, diced<SEP>2 stalks celery, diced<SEP>2 cloves garlic, chopped<SEP>1 teaspoon thyme, chopped<SEP>4 cups chicken broth or chicken stock<SEP>2 cups cooked chicken, cut into small pieces<SEP>1 cup orzo (gluten free for gluten free)<SEP>salt and pepper to taste<SEP>1 lemon (zest and juice)<SEP>1 tablespoon tarragon, chopped (optional)<SEP>1 handful parsley, chopped<SEP>Sneak some chopped spinach into this

93Ka7TieIFopaBbdPF56.directions: Heat the oil in a Dutch oven or large heavy pot over medium-high heat. Add the onion, carrots, and jalapeño and sauté, stirring often, until the onion is soft and translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and sauté for 1 minute. Add the bulgur, chili powder, and cumin and stir until well combined.<SEP>Stir in the tomatoes, tomato sauce, and beans. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat, cover, and simmer, stirring occasionally, until the beans are tender, about 1 hour. Season with salt to taste. Serve with a sprinkling of cilantro, if desired.
93Ka7TieIFopaBbdPF56.name: Vegan Chili
93Ka7TieIFopaBbdPF56.ingredients: 1 tablespoon sunflower oil<SEP>1 medium yellow onion, diced<SEP>1 cup shredded carrots<SEP>1 to 2 jalapeño peppers, stemmed, seeded, and minced<SEP>3 garlic cloves, minced<SEP>1/2 cup bulgur, rinsed<SEP>2 tablespoons chili powder<SEP>1 tablespoon ground cumin<SEP>2 cups diced fresh tomatoes (about 2 medium or 6 plum tomatoes)<SEP>1 1/2 cups tomato sauce<SEP>1 (15-ounce) can kidney beans, drained and rinsed<SEP>1 1/2 (15-ounce) cans black beans, drained and rinsed<SEP>1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt, or to taste<SEP>Chopped fresh cilantro

9Bxjb5ynkEqXo3avLSuq.ingredients: 4 ripe tomatoes, cored and quartered<SEP>1 red onion, peeled and quartered<SEP>3 garlic cloves, peeled<SEP>2 jalapenos, stemmed and seeded<SEP>1/3 cup fresh cilantro<SEP>3 tablespoons fresh lime juice<SEP>1 tablespoon ground cumin<SEP>2-3 teaspoons sugar<SEP>1 1/2 teaspoons salt<SEP>1 can (15 oz) crushed San Marzano tomatoes<SEP>1 can (4.5 oz) diced green chiles
9Bxjb5ynkEqXo3avLSuq.name: Salsa
9Bxjb5ynkEqXo3avLSuq.directions: Place the fresh tomatoes, onion, garlic, peppers, cilantro, lime juice, cumin, sugar, and salt in a food processor. Pulse until the contents are fine and well blended.<SEP>Pour in the crushed tomatoes and green chiles. Pulse until desired consistency. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

9SNxP5YpW4iTjTPHEPdq.name: Pizza
9SNxP5YpW4iTjTPHEPdq.directions: #Dough:<SEP>With a large metal spoon, stir together all the ingredients in a stand mixer with dough hook on low speed for 4 minutes, until the flour gathers to form a coarse ball. Let the dough rest for 5 minutes, then mix again on medium-low speed for an additional 2 minutes, or until the dough clears the sides of the bowl and sticks just a little to the bottom. If the dough is too soft and sticky to hold its shape, mix in more flour by the tablespoonful; if it is too stiff or dry, mix in more water by the tablespoonful. The dough should pass the windowpane test.<SEP>Immediately divide the dough into 3 equal pieces (or 4, for thinner crust). Round each piece into a ball and brush or rub each ball with olive oil. Place each ball inside its own freezer bag. Let the balls sit at room temperature for 15 minutes, then put them in the fridge overnight or freeze an pieces you will not be using the next day. (If you are making the pizzas on the same day, let the dough balls sit at room temperature in the bags for 1 hour, remove them from the bags, punch them down, reshape them into balls, return them to the bags, and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.)<SEP>The next day (or later the same day if refrigerated for only 2 hours), remove the balls from the refrigerator 2 hours before you plan to roll them out to take off the chill and to relax the gluten. At this point, you can hold any balls you don't wan tot use right away in the refrigerator for another day, or you can freeze them for up to 3 months.<SEP>#Sauce:<SEP>Saute garlic and onion in olive oil with a bit of crushed red pepper. Add in sauce and diced tomatoes. Season with salt, pepper, oregano, thyme, maybe basil and/or brown sugar. Let simmer for at least 30 minutes.<SEP>#Bake:<SEP>Preheat oven to 500 degrees, using pizza stone. Roll out crust and par-bake for 4 minutes, add sauce, cheese, and toppings and bake for another 5 or so minutes.
9SNxP5YpW4iTjTPHEPdq.ingredients: #Dough:<SEP>5 c. unbleached high-gluten or bread flour<SEP>1 1/2 T. sugar or honey<SEP>2 t. table salt or 3 1/2 t. kosher salt<SEP>1 1/2 t. instant yeast<SEP>3 T. olive oil<SEP>1 3/4 c. room-temperature water<SEP>#Sauce:<SEP>few cloves of garlic<SEP>half an onion<SEP>crushed red pepper<SEP>1 can tomato sauce<SEP>1 can petite diced tomatoes<SEP>salt<SEP>pepper<SEP>oregano<SEP>thyme<SEP>basil (optional)<SEP>brown sugar (optional)<SEP>#Toppings:<SEP>Peppers<SEP>Pepperoni<SEP>Olives<SEP>Red onions<SEP>Tomatoes<SEP>Garlic<SEP>Basil<SEP>Pineapple<SEP>Canadian Bacon<SEP>Grilled chicken<SEP>Pickled jalapenos<SEP>Mozzarella cheese
9SNxP5YpW4iTjTPHEPdq.notes: We use 2/5 white whole wheat flour. If making for a crowd, make 1.5x the recipe.

9T8KKkwaB6x62s9yiFkr.ingredients: 1 1/2 c. flour<SEP>1 1/2 c. quick cooking oats<SEP>1 c. brown sugar<SEP>1/2 t. baking soda<SEP>3/4 c. butter<SEP>1 c. jam
9T8KKkwaB6x62s9yiFkr.name: Filled Oatmeal Bars
9T8KKkwaB6x62s9yiFkr.directions: Stir together flour, oats, brown sugar, and soda. Cut in butter until mixture is crumbly. Pat 1/2 of the crumbs in the bottom of an ungreased 9x9 pan. Spread with jam. Sprinkle with remaining crumbs. Bake at 375 degrees for 25-30 minutes. Cool and cut into bars. Makes 30 bars.

9btwVrF9xdqqPuTr2m70.notes: Need to compare this with the other dinner roll recipe. My handwritten note says "these are very good, but they don't have the chew of the perfect recipe."
9btwVrF9xdqqPuTr2m70.directions: In the bowl of a stand mixer, combine warm milk, yeast, sugar, salt, butter, and eggs.<SEP>Add in 5 1/2 cups of flour. Using a dough hook, turn the mixer on to a low speed. Once the flour starts to incorporate into the dough, increase the speed to a medium range. Slowly add the remaining 1/2 cup of flour until the dough pulls away from the sides of the bowl. The dough mixture should be slightly sticky and soft. Add more or less flour until the dough reaches the desired consistency. The amount of flour you add in bread making is always an approximation and you should go by feel.<SEP>Transfer the dough to a lightly greased mixing bowl. Cover with a towel and let rise 90 minutes.<SEP>Lightly grease a baking sheet. Punch down the dough and form into 24 rolls. Place on the greased baking sheet in six rows of four. Cover and let rise 1 hour.<SEP>Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Bake the rolls for 12 to 14 minutes, until lightly browned.<SEP>Remove rolls from oven and brush with melted butter. Serve the rolls warm, or to cool, let rest on the pan for 15 minutes before transferring to a wire cooling rack. Once cooled completely, store in a plastic bag.
9btwVrF9xdqqPuTr2m70.ingredients: 2 cups warm milk<SEP>2 tablespoons instant dry yeast<SEP>1/4 cup white granulated sugar<SEP>2 teaspoons salt<SEP>6 tablespoons salted butter softened<SEP>2 large eggs<SEP>6 cups all-purpose flour<SEP>1 tablespoon melted butter
9btwVrF9xdqqPuTr2m70.name: Dinner Rolls

9pgZMaWxYfaUnWwGHdYD.name: Dinner Rolls II
9pgZMaWxYfaUnWwGHdYD.notes: Need to compare this with the other dinner roll recipe. My handwritten note says "I think these are the best I've made."
9pgZMaWxYfaUnWwGHdYD.ingredients: 1 tablespoon active dry yeast<SEP>2-1/4 cups warm water (110° to 115°)<SEP>1/3 cup sugar<SEP>1/3 cup shortening<SEP>1/4 cup powdered nondairy creamer<SEP>2-1/4 teaspoons salt<SEP>6 to 7 cups bread flour
9pgZMaWxYfaUnWwGHdYD.directions: In a large bowl, dissolve yeast in warm water. Add the sugar, shortening, creamer, salt and 5 cups flour. Beat until smooth. Stir in enough remaining flour to form a soft dough (dough will be sticky).<SEP>Turn onto a floured surface; knead until smooth and elastic, 6-8 minutes. Place in a bowl coated with cooking spray, turning once to coat the top. Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled, about 1 hour.<SEP>Punch dough down. Turn onto a lightly floured surface; divide into 24 pieces. Shape each into a roll. Place 2 in. apart on baking sheets coated with cooking spray. Cover and let rise until doubled, about 30 minutes.<SEP>Meanwhile, preheat oven to 350°. Bake until lightly browned, 12-15 minutes. Remove from pans to wire racks.

9tpMgNdzrF4JK5eOSVeu.ingredients: 6 Tbsp unsalted butter<SEP> 16 oz mini marshmallows, divided<SEP> 1 tsp pure vanilla extract<SEP> 6 cups rice krispies cereal
9tpMgNdzrF4JK5eOSVeu.name: Rice Krispie Treats
9tpMgNdzrF4JK5eOSVeu.directions: Line a 9-inch square baking dish with parchment paper. Set aside.<SEP>In a large saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Once melted, add in all but 1 cup of the marshmallows. Reduce heat to low and continue stirring until completely melted.<SEP>Remove from heat and stir in the vanilla. Add the cereal and the remaining 1 cup of marshmallows.<SEP>Pour into the prepared baking dish. Press GENTLY with your fingertips just until completely spread out (the harder you pack them in, the harder they are to eat).<SEP>Allow to set, about 1 hour. Cut and enjoy!

AAH20uBgBHwRp0R8DtGk.directions: Place the sugar, butter and milk in a saucepan and heat on medium until it starts to boil. Stir occasionally. Once it starts to boil, boil for 1 minute only and remove from heat. Be very careful as the liquid will be extremely hot. If it is lukewarm you didn't bring it to a boil.<SEP>Stir in peanut butter, saltines and vanilla. Mix well. Pour into a greased 8 x 8 pan and chill. Cut into bite size pieces.
AAH20uBgBHwRp0R8DtGk.ingredients: 1 1/2 c sugar<SEP>2 Tbsp butter<SEP>1/2 c milk<SEP>1 c peanut butter<SEP>1 sleeve saltines, crushed (30 crackers or 4 ounces)<SEP>1 tsp vanilla extract
AAH20uBgBHwRp0R8DtGk.notes: To crush the saltines just stick them in a plastic storage bag and roll a rolling pin over them. The key word here is crushed. You want them fine not in junks.<SEP>You can add choc. chips during the second stage also. Others have tried this recipe using different butters as in almond butter and nutella. Have fun with it. It is a very versatile recipe.
AAH20uBgBHwRp0R8DtGk.name: Easy Peanut Butter Fudge

AOvFrLvvRz6k6dIBSCvf.ingredients: 1 tablespoon olive oil<SEP>1 large onion, chopped<SEP>1 stalk celery, chopped<SEP>2 carrots, chopped<SEP>4 cloves garlic, chopped<SEP>2 tablespoons chili powder<SEP>1 tablespoon ground cumin<SEP>1 pinch black pepper<SEP>4 cups vegetable broth<SEP>4 (15 ounce) cans black beans<SEP>1 (15 ounce) can whole kernel corn<SEP>1 (14.5 ounce) can crushed tomatoes<SEP>Sneak in some chopped spinach, too
AOvFrLvvRz6k6dIBSCvf.name: Black Bean Soup
AOvFrLvvRz6k6dIBSCvf.directions: Heat oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Saute onion, celery, carrots and garlic for 5 minutes. Season with chili powder, cumin, and black pepper; cook for 1 minute. Stir in vegetable broth, 2 cans of beans, and corn. Bring to a boil. <SEP>Meanwhile, in a food processor or blender, process remaining 2 cans beans and tomatoes until smooth. Stir into boiling soup mixture, reduce heat to medium, and simmer for 15 minutes.

Aaytgek0fkuheq46wThF.name: Kheer, Indian Rice Pudding (Instant Pot)
Aaytgek0fkuheq46wThF.ingredients: ¼ cup basmati rice, soaked for 15-30 minutes<SEP>½ cup water<SEP>3 cups whole milk or full-fat coconut milk<SEP>½ cup sugar, adjust to taste<SEP>½ teaspoon ground cardamom, adjust to taste<SEP>Pinch of saffron<SEP>Crushed nuts, (pistachios, almonds, or cashews)<SEP>Golden Raisins
Aaytgek0fkuheq46wThF.directions: Soak the basmati rice in cold water for 15-30 minutes. Drain, rinse and set aside.<SEP>Press the sauté button and add 1⁄2 cup water to the pot. Once the water begins to steam, pour the milk into the pot. (Make sure the water is steaming before adding the milk as this will prevent the milk from burning at the bottom of the pot.) Add the rice, stir.<SEP>Secure the lid, close the pressure valve and cook for 20 minutes at high pressure.<SEP>Naturally release pressure.<SEP>Press sauté. Add the sugar, cardamom and saffron to the pot. Stir until well combined. The kheer will thicken as it cools. If you prefer a thicker pudding, press sauté and stir until desired consistency.<SEP>Serve this dessert hot, warm, cold or at room temperature. Top with nuts and raisins prior to serving.

AlC4bIWtDzoJLFJsLzEG.directions: Marinade beef. Brown in a clean nonstick skillet over medium heat.<SEP>Chop all veggies, then saute each (individually or mixed) with sesame oil. Sprinkle salt.<SEP>In a separate nonstick skillet, heat 1 more teaspoon olive oil over medium-low heat and fry the eggs just on one side until yolks are runny but whites are firm, 2 to 4 minutes each.<SEP>Assemble bowls. Drizzle each with 1 teaspoon of sesame oil, a sprinkle of sesame seeds, and a small amount of sauce.
AlC4bIWtDzoJLFJsLzEG.ingredients: #MEAT:<SEP>1 pound ground beef or thiny sliced flank steak<SEP>2 tablespoons minced green onions<SEP>2 tablespoons reduced-sodium soy sauce<SEP>1 tablespoon packed brown sugar<SEP>1 tablespoons sesame oil<SEP>2 teaspoons minced garlic<SEP>2 teaspoons minced fresh ginger<SEP><SEP>#VEGETABLES:<SEP>1 zucchini diced<SEP>small amount of bean sprouts<SEP>1 red bell pepper, diced<SEP>1 yellow bell pepper, diced<SEP>small amount of snow peas<SEP>1 bunch fresh spinach, cut into thin strips<SEP>1 tablespoon soy sauce<SEP>1 teaspoon olive oil<SEP>2 carrots, cut into matchsticks<SEP>1 clove garlic, minced<SEP>1 pinch red pepper flakes<SEP>1 teaspoon olive oil<SEP>4 large eggs<SEP>4 cups cooked white rice<SEP>4 teaspoons toasted sesame oil, divided<SEP>1 teaspoon sesame seeds<SEP><SEP>#SAUCE (you can just use gochujang):<SEP>2 Tbsp gochujang<SEP>1 Tbsp sesame oil<SEP>1 Tbsp sugar<SEP>1 Tbsp water<SEP>1 tsp apple cider vinegar<SEP>1 tsp minced garlic
AlC4bIWtDzoJLFJsLzEG.name: Bibimbap (Marie)

AzMvjZkv1nKD2sRrOMul.ingredients: 2 pounds boneless skinless chicken breasts cut into bite-size pieces<SEP>1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt divided<SEP>1 tablespoon unsalted butter or coconut oil, ghee, or extra-virgin olive oil...I do think the butter is worth it here!<SEP>1 small yellow onion finely chopped<SEP>3 large cloves garlic minced (about 1 tablespoon)<SEP>1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger<SEP>1 tablespoon  garam masala*<SEP>1 teaspoon ground chili powder<SEP>1 teaspoon ground cumin<SEP>1 teaspoon ground turmeric<SEP>1/4 teaspoon ground cayenne use more if you like the dish spicy<SEP>1 can no salt added tomato sauce (8 ounces)<SEP>1 can light coconut milk (14 ounces)<SEP>3/4 cup frozen peas<SEP>1/2 cup plain nonfat Greek yogurt<SEP>Prepared brown rice or naan, for serving<SEP>Fresh cilantro for serving
AzMvjZkv1nKD2sRrOMul.directions: Season the chicken with 1 teaspoon kosher salt and set aside.<SEP>Add the butter to an Instant Pot and set to SAUTE. Once melted, add the onion, garlic, ginger, garam masala, chili powder, cumin, turmeric, and cayenne. Cook, stirring often, until the onion is soft and the spices are very fragrant, about 5 minutes.<SEP>Add the chicken pieces, stir to coat with the spices and onion, and cook, stirring often,  just until the outsides start to brown, about 4 minutes. Add the tomato sauce and remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt. Stir to combine. Cover and cook on HIGH pressure for 8 minutes. Vent to immediately release the pressure.<SEP>Uncover and stir in the coconut milk. Turn the Instant Pot back to SAUTE. Bring the mixture to a simmer, stirring occasionally, and let it continue to simmer until the sauce thickens slightly, about 10 to 15 minutes. Turn the Instant Pot off, and then stir in the peas. Let cool for 3 to 4 minutes, and then stir in the Greek yogurt (do not stir in the Greek yogurt right away or it may curdle). Enjoy warm with rice or naan and a sprinkle of fresh cilantro.
AzMvjZkv1nKD2sRrOMul.name: Chicken Tikka Masala (Instant Pot)

BVhWBLk5YDyfWE8SKiYr.name: Peanut Butter Granola Bars
BVhWBLk5YDyfWE8SKiYr.directions: Mix sugar, peanut butter, sweetener, butter, and vanilla.<SEP>Add the rest of the ingredients, blend together in a 9x13 cake pan.<SEP>Bake at 350 for 15-20 min.
BVhWBLk5YDyfWE8SKiYr.ingredients: 1 c. brown sugar<SEP>2/3 c. peanut butter<SEP>1/2 c. karo or honey<SEP>1/2 c. melted butter<SEP>2 tsp vanilla<SEP>3 c. quick oats<SEP>1/2 c. coconut<SEP>1/2 c. sunflower seeds<SEP>1/2 c. craisins (orange flavored)<SEP>1/3 c. wheat germ or 9 grain<SEP>1 c. mini chocolate chips

BkEfKnpnhfdRqsaoHxeK.name: Taco Soup (Instant Pot)
BkEfKnpnhfdRqsaoHxeK.ingredients: 1-2 lbs Ground Beef or Ground Turkey (93% lean) use a little oil for browning turkey<SEP>1 packet Taco Seasoning Mix, about 3 Tbsp. (or Taco Seasoning recipe)<SEP>1 tsp Garlic Powder<SEP>1/2 tsp Onion Powder<SEP>1/2 tsp Oregano<SEP>1/2 tsp Salt<SEP>1/2 tsp Pepper<SEP>1 packet Ranch Dressing Mix (optional)<SEP>1 (10 oz) can Rotel<SEP>1 (7 oz) can Diced Green Chiles, With juice<SEP>4 cups Chicken Broth, low sodium<SEP>1 (14 oz) can Black Beans, rinsed & drained<SEP>1 (14 oz) can Garbanzo Beans, rinsed & drained<SEP>1 (14 oz) can Red Kidney or Pinto Beans, rinsed & drained<SEP>1 (14 oz) can Diced Tomatoes, with juice<SEP>4 5" Corn Tortillas, cut in thin strips (optional, but adds a nice masa flavor)<SEP>1 cup Frozen Corn (or 1 can of corn, drained)<SEP><SEP>#Garnishes<SEP>Sour Cream<SEP>Cheddar or Monterey Jack Cheese, shredded<SEP>Tortilla Chips<SEP>Avocado, large dice<SEP>Red Onion, diced<SEP>Jalapeño, sliced
BkEfKnpnhfdRqsaoHxeK.directions: Turn the pressure cooker on to the Sauté setting. Add the meat (add a little oil if using turkey). Cook for a few minutes.<SEP>Add the taco seasoning, garlic powder, onion powder, oregano, salt, and pepper. Continue cooking, stirring occasionally, until meat is cooked.<SEP>Add the Ranch packet, if using, Rotel, green chiles, and chicken broth. Stir, and place a glass lid on the pot to help the broth heat up faster. Once the broth is at a slow simmer, add all of the beans and stir well.<SEP>Add the can of diced tomatoes, but don't stir. Place the lid on the pot and lock in place. Turn the steam release knob to the Sealing position.<SEP>Cancel the Sauté setting and then press the Pressure Cook/Manual button (or dial) and the + or - button (or dial) to choose 8 minutes. The pot will take several minutes to build up the pressure before the timer starts.<SEP>When the cooking cycle has finished, let the pot sit undisturbed for 15 minutes. Then do a controlled Quick Release of the pressure by turning the knob towards the Venting position in short bursts (I use a wooden spoon handle). When you feel confident that no soup will spew out with the steam, open the knob all the way.<SEP>When the pin in the lid drops down, you can open the lid facing away from you. Give the soup a stir, carefully as there could be some hot steam pockets in there.<SEP>Taste and adjust salt, if needed, then add the tortillas and the corn. Stir well and let sit for a few minutes, stirring occasionally to help dissolve some of the tortillas.<SEP>Serve with any of the garnishes you like!

C0O37MUDlSgkfyTipOHz.name: Laundry Stain Remover
C0O37MUDlSgkfyTipOHz.notes: For tougher stains use the spray and baking soda
C0O37MUDlSgkfyTipOHz.ingredients: 1 Part Blue Dawn Dish Soap<SEP>1 Part Hydrogen Peroxide

C712bXYWFgmy5QYxzIAA.ingredients: 6 ounces frozen orange juice concentrate<SEP>1 cup milk, lowfat okay<SEP>1 cup water<SEP>1⁄4 cup sugar<SEP>1 tsp vanilla<SEP>8 ice cubes
C712bXYWFgmy5QYxzIAA.name: Orange Julius
C712bXYWFgmy5QYxzIAA.directions: Combine all ingredients, except ice cubes, in blender.<SEP>Blend 1-2 minutes , adding ice cubes one at a time, until smooth.

COD9Zdx2zwc7Y5B2h13C.notes: I used my own photo for this one :).
COD9Zdx2zwc7Y5B2h13C.name: Cranberry Bundt Cake
COD9Zdx2zwc7Y5B2h13C.directions: Preheat the oven to 350°F and grease a 9" bundt pan thoroughly.<SEP>Combine 2 1/2 cups all-purpose flour with 1 teaspoon baking powder and 3/4 teaspoon kosher salt. Whisk to mix well and set aside.<SEP>Place 12 ounces fresh cranberries (1 bag) in a small bowl and pick through them to weed out any mushy ones. Add 1 tablespoon all-purpose flour and toss gently to coat the cranberries. Set aside until ready to use.<SEP>In a mixing bowl, combine 2 sticks softened butter with 2 cups sugar. Mix on low to combine and then turn up the speed to mid-high and beat for 2 minutes until light and fluffy. Mix in 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. Add eggs to the butter mixture one at a time, mixing after each addition until combined.<SEP>Mix in 1/2 the flour mixture until combined and add 1/2 cup sour cream and mix well. Add in the remaining flour mixture until just combined and scrape down the sides of the bowl to ensure all flour is mixed in.<SEP>Gently fold cranberries into the batter.<SEP>Spoon the batter into the prepared pan and smooth to even out.<SEP>Bake on the center rack of the preheated oven for 50-55 minutes until the top springs back when pressed gently or a cake tester inserted comes out clean. Remove from oven and allow to cool in pan for 15 minutes.<SEP>Carefully run a flat edge, such as a butter knife, around the edge of the pan to loosen and also around the center hole. Place a cooling rack over top of the cake pan and carefully flip the cake pan over so the cake slides out onto the cooling rack. Allow cake to cool completely.<SEP>Prepare the sweet orange glaze by combining 1 cup confecioners' sugar with 1/4 cup orange juice and a pinch of kosher salt. Mix well to combine. Add more sugar to thicken or more orange juice to thin to your desired consistency.<SEP>When cake is cooled, drizzle the glaze over the cake. Let it sit after a couple of layers, then add a little powdered sugar to the glaze and repeat. It adds a little texture and sheen.<SEP>If desired, fill with sparkling cranberries (see other recipe).
COD9Zdx2zwc7Y5B2h13C.ingredients: 2 tablespoons unsalted butter softened (for greasing the pan)<SEP>1 tablespoon of all-purpose flour or more as needed to flour the pan<SEP>2 1/2 cups all-purpose flour<SEP>1 teaspoon baking powder<SEP>3/4 teaspoon kosher salt<SEP>12 ounces fresh cranberries 1 bag<SEP>1 tablespoon all-purpose flour<SEP>2 sticks unsalted butter softened<SEP>2 cups sugar<SEP>1 teaspoon vanilla extract<SEP>4 large eggs at room temperature<SEP>1/2 cup sour cream<SEP>1 cup confectioners' sugar or more as needed<SEP>1/4 cup orange juice or more as needed<SEP>pinch of kosher salt to taste

CfDIMqFMwWM6iQ4PmAJz.directions: In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt. Set aside.<SEP>In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment (or in a large mixing bowl using a handheld mixer), beat the butter, brown sugar, and granulated sugar until smooth. Mix in the egg and then the vanilla, scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed.<SEP>Slowly add the flour mixture to the wet ingredients and mix until just combined. Add the oats, dried cranberries, and white chocolate chips and mix until fully combined.<SEP>Cover the dough and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.<SEP>Preheat oven to 350°F. Line two large baking sheets with parchment paper and set aside.<SEP>Using a 1.5-2 tablespoon cookie scoop, scoop the cookie dough and drop onto the prepared baking sheets. Roll the cookie dough into balls and very gently press down with your hand to flatten each ball of cookie dough slightly (make sure not to flatten them completely, just slightly).<SEP>Bake in separate batches at 350°F for 10-13 minutes. Remove from the oven and allow to cool on the baking sheet for 5-10 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to finish cooling.
CfDIMqFMwWM6iQ4PmAJz.name: White Chocolate Cranberry Oatmeal Cookies
CfDIMqFMwWM6iQ4PmAJz.ingredients: 1 cup (125 grams) all-purpose flour (spooned & leveled)<SEP>1/2 teaspoon baking soda<SEP>1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon<SEP>1/4 teaspoon salt<SEP>1/2 cup (115 grams) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature<SEP>1/2 cup (100 grams) light brown sugar<SEP>1/4 cup (50 grams) granulated sugar<SEP>1 large egg room temperature<SEP>1 teaspoon vanilla extract<SEP>1 and 1/2 cups (150 grams) old-fashioned rolled oats<SEP>3/4 cup (105 grams) sweetened dried cranberries<SEP>3/4 cup (140 grams) white chocolate chips<SEP>(optional) chopped pecans

ClCb4IATpe1DTkaqAroe.name: Banana Muffins
ClCb4IATpe1DTkaqAroe.directions: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees Fahrenheit (165 degrees Celsius). If necessary, grease all 12 cups of your muffin tin with butter or non-stick cooking spray (my pan is non-stick and didn’t require any grease).<SEP>In a large bowl, beat the coconut oil and maple syrup together with a whisk. Add the eggs and beat well. Mix in the mashed bananas and milk, followed by the baking soda, vanilla extract, salt and cinnamon.<SEP>Add the flour and oats to the bowl and mix with a large spoon, just until combined. If you’d like to add any additional mix-ins**, like nuts, chocolate or dried fruit, fold them in now.<SEP>Divide the batter evenly between the muffin cups, filling each cup about two-thirds full. Sprinkle the tops of the muffins with a small amount of walnuts, chocolate chips, oats (about 1 tablespoon in total), followed by a light sprinkling of sugar (about 1 teaspoon in total). Bake muffins for 20 to 23 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into a muffin comes out clean.
ClCb4IATpe1DTkaqAroe.ingredients: ⅓ cup melted coconut oil or extra-virgin olive oil*<SEP>½ cup maple syrup or honey<SEP>2 eggs, preferably at room temperature<SEP>1 cup packed mashed ripe bananas (about 3 bananas)<SEP>¼ cup milk of choice or water (I used almond milk)<SEP>1 teaspoon baking soda<SEP>1 teaspoon vanilla extract<SEP>½ teaspoon salt<SEP>½ teaspoon cinnamon, plus more for sprinkling on top<SEP>1 ¾ cups white whole wheat flour or regular whole wheat flour<SEP>1/2 cup chocolate chips<SEP>1/2 c. walnuts, chopped<SEP>⅓ cup old-fashioned oats (optional), plus more for sprinkling on top<SEP>1 teaspoon turbinado (raw) sugar or other granulated sugar, for sprinkling on top

CnfLxl4Vnqi0J3imBG0K.directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease a baking sheet. <SEP>In small bowl, blend sour cream with egg, vanilla, almond extract, and baking soda. Set aside. <SEP>In a large bowl, mix the flour, sugar, baking powder, cream of tartar, and salt. Cut in cold butter. Add the sour cream mixture; mix until just moistened. <SEP>Gently fold in blueberries. Roll or pat the dough into 1 to 1 1/2 in thick round. Cut dough into 12 even wedges. Place the wedges onto the prepared baking sheet about 2 in apart.<SEP>Bake for 12-15 min, or until the bottoms are browned. Drizzle the top of each warm scone with vanilla glaze. <SEP>Vanilla Glaze: Whisk all ingredients in a bowl, adding additional milk until desired texture is achieved (don’t make it too thin or it won’t stick to the scones).
CnfLxl4Vnqi0J3imBG0K.ingredients: 1 c sour cream<SEP>1 egg, slightly beaten<SEP>1/2 tsp vanilla<SEP>1/2 tsp almond extract<SEP>1 tsp baking soda<SEP>4 c flour<SEP>1 c sugar<SEP>2 1/2 tsp baking powder<SEP>1/4 tsp cream of tartar<SEP>1 tsp salt<SEP>1 c very cold butter (cut into small cubes<SEP>1 c fresh blueberries<SEP><SEP>#Vanilla glaze<SEP>2 c powdered sugar<SEP>1/4 c heavy cream or milk<SEP>1 1/2 tsp almond extract
CnfLxl4Vnqi0J3imBG0K.name: Blueberry Sour Cream Scones

Cq1zNeHWWG3iyfXHajmx.directions: Place lentils in a large saucepan; add enough water to cover by 1 inch. Bring water to a boil and cook until tender, about 10 minutes; drain.<SEP>Heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic, onion, and carrot; cook and stir until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes. Pour in lentils, 1 quart water, oregano, rosemary, and bay leaves. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer for 10 minutes.<SEP>Stir in tomato paste and season with salt and pepper. Cover and simmer until the lentils have softened, 30 to 40 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add additional water if the soup becomes too thick. Drizzle with 1 teaspoon olive oil and red wine vinegar to taste.
Cq1zNeHWWG3iyfXHajmx.ingredients: 8 ounces brown lentils<SEP>1/4 cup olive oil<SEP>1 tablespoon minced garlic<SEP>1 onion, minced<SEP>1 large carrot, chopped<SEP>1 quart water<SEP>1 pinch dried oregano<SEP>1 pinch crushed dried rosemary<SEP>2 bay leaves<SEP>1 tablespoon tomato paste<SEP>salt and ground black pepper to taste<SEP>1 teaspoon olive oil, or to taste<SEP>1 teaspoon red wine vinegar, or to taste (optional)
Cq1zNeHWWG3iyfXHajmx.name: Fakes (Greek lentil soup)

D6BTc3bv0VJ7lqBtxIRx.directions: Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Draw a 9-inch circle on the parchment paper.<SEP>In a large bowl, beat egg whites until stiff but not dry. Gradually add in the sugar, about 1 tablespoon at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat until thick and glossy. Gently fold in vanilla extract, lemon juice, and cornstarch.<SEP>Spoon mixture inside the circle drawn on the parchment paper. Working from the center, spread mixture toward the outside edge, building edge slightly. This should leave a slight depression in the center.<SEP>Bake for 1 hour. Cool on a wire rack.<SEP>In a small bowl, beat heavy cream until stiff peaks form; set aside. Remove the paper, and place meringue on a flat serving plate. Fill the center of the meringue with whipped cream, and top with whatever you like (see notes).
D6BTc3bv0VJ7lqBtxIRx.notes: This goes well with lemon curd, strawberries, kiwis, mandarin oranges, bananas (try banoffee style!)
D6BTc3bv0VJ7lqBtxIRx.ingredients: 4 egg whites  <SEP>1 ¼ cups white sugar  <SEP>1 teaspoon vanilla extract  <SEP>1 teaspoon lemon juice<SEP>2 teaspoons cornstarch<SEP>1 pint heavy cream
D6BTc3bv0VJ7lqBtxIRx.name: Pavlova

Dlvfyo9X2qMUZ4zbthh1.name: Whole Wheat Seed Bread
Dlvfyo9X2qMUZ4zbthh1.ingredients: ½ cup warm water<SEP>⅓ cup unsweetened applesauce<SEP>3 tablespoons active dry yeast<SEP>3 ½ cups warm water<SEP>½ cup honey<SEP>½ cup molasses<SEP>½ cup vegetable oil<SEP>3 tablespoons lemon juice  <SEP>2 eggs, beaten<SEP>9 cups sifted whole wheat flour<SEP>½ cup ground flax seed<SEP>1 cup quick cooking oats<SEP>½ cup sunflower seeds<SEP>¾ cup cracked wheat<SEP>1 tablespoon sea salt
Dlvfyo9X2qMUZ4zbthh1.directions: Stir together the 1/2 cup water and applesauce in a small bowl. Dissolve the yeast in the mixture, let stand until creamy, about 5 minutes. Pour the yeast mixture into a large bowl with 3 1/2 cups of warm water, honey, molasses, vegetable oil, lemon juice, and eggs; stir together to combine well.<SEP><SEP>In a separate bowl, combine the whole wheat flour, flax seed, sunflower seeds, cracked wheat, and salt. Stir the flour mixture into the yeast mixture until a smooth dough forms. Knead on a lightly floured surface until smooth and elastic, about 10 minutes. Place in a lightly oiled bowl and cover; let rise in a warm place until doubled in volume, about 1 hour.<SEP><SEP>Lightly grease four 9x5 inch loaf pans. Punch down dough, shape into loaves, and place in the pans. Allow to rise in pans until doubled in bulk, about 1 hour.<SEP><SEP>Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).<SEP><SEP>Bake 40 to 50 minutes, or until the loaves sound hollow when removed from the pan and tapped on the bottom.

DnVq99s1Asv6RceX6JLx.directions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.  Add butter to a large oven safe pan or skillet, and heat over MED heat.  Add Brussels sprouts, shallots and garlic, seasoning with kosher salt, black pepper and paprika.  Saute, stirring occasionally, about 5-8 minutes. <SEP>Remove pan from heat, pour in heavy cream.  Sprinkle shredded cheddar and gruyere cheese all over the Brussels sprouts.  Top with crumbled bacon and bake about 12 minutes, until cheese is melted and bubbly.  <SEP>Sprinkle with additional black pepper and minced parsley if desired.
DnVq99s1Asv6RceX6JLx.name: Cheesy Brussels Sprouts with Bacon
DnVq99s1Asv6RceX6JLx.ingredients: 3 Tbsp butter<SEP>1/4 cup sliced shallots (this was about 2 shallots for me)<SEP>2 cloves garlic, minced<SEP>32 oz bag of fresh Brussels sprouts, cored and halved (or equivalent amount of smaller containers)<SEP>1/4 tsp kosher salt<SEP>pinch black pepper<SEP>1/4 tsp paprika<SEP>3/4 cup heavy cream (might be labeled as heavy whipping cream)<SEP>3/4 cup shredded sharp white cheddar cheese (freshly grated is best)<SEP>1/2 cup shredded Gruyere cheese (freshly grated is best)<SEP>6 slices cooked bacon, crumbled (or about 1/2 cup bacon bits)<SEP>minced fresh parsley, for garnish

DqIXAfzSL9ggzBE42WB8.directions: In a medium saucepan combine the milk, sugar, salt, and coffee granules. Cook over medium heat stirring occasionally until steaming. Reduce the heat to low.<SEP>Lightly beat the egg yolks in a small bowl. Slowly pour half the hot milk into the eggs while whisking continuously. Return the mixture to the pot and cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until thickened, about 5 minutes.<SEP>Strain the custard through a fine-mesh sieve set over a medium bowl. Cover it with plastic wrap, allowing it to touch the surface of the custard to prevent a skin from forming. Refrigerate until cold.<SEP>When ready to make the ice cream, whisk the cream and vanilla into the custard until smooth. Churn in an ice cream maker according to the manufacturer's instructions. <SEP>Enjoy right away or transfer to a freezer-safe container. The ice cream will keep for up to 2 weeks.
DqIXAfzSL9ggzBE42WB8.ingredients: 2 and 1/2 cups whole milk<SEP>1 and 1/2 cups granulated sugar<SEP>1/8 teaspoon salt<SEP>2 tablespoons instant decaffeinated coffee granules (or Pero)<SEP>6 egg yolks<SEP>2 and 1/4 cups heavy cream<SEP>1 and 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract
DqIXAfzSL9ggzBE42WB8.name: Pero Ice Cream

DsdTUcDpIFw4ZSxbJvT1.name: Magnolia Banana Bread
DsdTUcDpIFw4ZSxbJvT1.directions: Preheat oven to 350 <SEP>Spray an 8 x 8-inch pan with nonstick baking spray or line it with parchment paper<SEP>In a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment (or in a large bowl with a handheld electric mixer), beat together the butter, brown sugar, eggs, and vanilla until well blended<SEP>Add the bananas and mix until combined<SEP>In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and salt<SEP>Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and beat just until combined<SEP>Add the pecans/chocolate chips (if using) and mix until combined<SEP>Pour the batter into the prepared pan and spread it evenly<SEP>Sprinkle the sugar over the top, to your liking<SEP>Bake until a tester inserted in the center comes out clean, 45 to 50 minutes<SEP>Let the bread cool slightly in the pan on a rack<SEP>Slice and serve warm with butter.<SEP>When completely cooled, cover the pan with foil and store at room temperature for up to 2 days
DsdTUcDpIFw4ZSxbJvT1.ingredients: Nonstick Baking Spray, for the pan<SEP>8 Tbsp. (1 stick) salted butter, melted and cooled<SEP>1 C. Packed Light Brown Sugar<SEP>2 Eggs, beaten<SEP>1 ½ tsp. Pure Vanilla Extract<SEP>4 to 5 Very Ripe Bananas, mashed (I like to leave them a little chunky)<SEP>1 ¾ C. Flour<SEP>1 tsp. Baking Soda<SEP>½ tsp. Kosher Salt<SEP>½ cup Chopped Pecans or Chocolate Chips, optional<SEP>1 to 2 Tbsp. Granulated Sugar, as needed

DwYY8XF2hKEeLmiFAapj.ingredients: 1 box frozen chopped spinach, cooked and squeezed dry<SEP>1 package (8 oz) cream cheese, softened<SEP>3/4 c Mayonnaise<SEP>1 package Knorr Vegetable recipe mix<SEP>1 1/2 cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese, cheddar, or Swiss cheese, divided<SEP>1 can (14 oz) artichoke hearts, drained and chopped<SEP>2 cloves garlic, finely chopped<SEP>2 loaves Italian bread (or thicker French bread)<SEP>Extra Mozzarella / Muenster cheese<SEP>Italian basil, parsley, or seasonings for garnish<SEP>Salt/pepper to taste
DwYY8XF2hKEeLmiFAapj.directions: Combine spinach, cream cheese, mayonnaise, Knorr mix, 1 cup cheese, artichoke hearts, and garlic.<SEP>Bake at 350 for 20 minutes.<SEP>Cut the bread into a checker board, without cutting all the way through<SEP>Add mozzarella and muenster cheese slices to the crevices<SEP>Add the dip to the crevices, topped with leftover cheese<SEP>Bake at 350 for 10-15 minutes until cheese is golden brown<SEP>Top with garnishes
DwYY8XF2hKEeLmiFAapj.name: Spinach Artichoke Dip Stuffed Bread
DwYY8XF2hKEeLmiFAapj.notes: You can do Mexican blend cheese instead.<SEP>Can add shredded chicken, bacon bits to the dip as well

E2AuxBaWv6V8X6LKHj6n.name: Chicken Fajitas
E2AuxBaWv6V8X6LKHj6n.directions: In a large bowl, combine 2 tablespoons oil, lemon juice and seasonings; add the chicken. Turn to coat; cover. Refrigerate for 1-4 hours.<SEP>In a large skillet, saute peppers and onions in remaining oil until crisp-tender. Remove and keep warm.<SEP>Drain chicken, discarding marinade. In the same skillet, cook chicken over medium-high heat for 5-6 minutes or until no longer pink. Return pepper mixture to pan; heat through.<SEP>Spoon filling down the center of tortillas; fold in half. Serve with toppings as desired.
E2AuxBaWv6V8X6LKHj6n.ingredients: 4 tablespoons canola oil, divided<SEP>2 tablespoons lemon juice<SEP>1-1/2 teaspoons seasoned salt<SEP>1-1/2 teaspoons dried oregano<SEP>1-1/2 teaspoons ground cumin<SEP>1 teaspoon garlic powder<SEP>1/2 teaspoon chili powder<SEP>1/2 teaspoon paprika<SEP>1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes, optional<SEP>1-1/2 pounds boneless skinless chicken breast, cut into thin strips<SEP>1/2 medium sweet red pepper, julienned<SEP>1/2 medium green pepper, julienned<SEP>4 green onions, thinly sliced<SEP>1/2 cup chopped onion<SEP>6 flour tortillas (8 inches), warmed<SEP>Shredded cheddar cheese, taco sauce, salsa, guacamole and sour cream, optional

EFvWaguhossCKOuR2oLJ.ingredients: 1 tablespoon oil, peanut or sesame<SEP>2 cloves garlic, thinly sliced<SEP>1 pound fresh green beans, trimmed<SEP>1 tablespoon white sugar  <SEP>2 tablespoons oyster sauce<SEP>2 teaspoons soy sauce
EFvWaguhossCKOuR2oLJ.directions: Heat peanut oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat. Stir in the garlic, and cook until the edges begin to brown, about 20 seconds. Add the green beans; cook and stir until the green beans begin to soften, about 5 minutes. Stir in the sugar, oyster sauce, and soy sauce. Continue cooking and stirring for several minutes until the beans have attained the desired degree of tenderness.
EFvWaguhossCKOuR2oLJ.name: Chinese Green Beans

EJsGiFKGUOVcolUKXCru.ingredients: ¾ cup fresh lemon juice<SEP>1 tablespoon grated lemon zest<SEP>¾ cup sugar  <SEP>3 eggs  <SEP>½ cup unsalted butter, cubed
EJsGiFKGUOVcolUKXCru.directions: In a 2 quart saucepan, combine lemon juice, lemon zest, sugar, eggs, and butter. Cook over medium-low heat until thick enough to hold marks from whisk, and first bubble appears on surface, about 6 minutes.
EJsGiFKGUOVcolUKXCru.name: Lemon Curd

ELzGrYvTa9bj6S8A6Fvz.name: Breakfast Strudel
ELzGrYvTa9bj6S8A6Fvz.ingredients: 2 teaspoons orange juice concentrate<SEP>1 tablespoon and 4 teaspoons water, divided<SEP>11 eggs, divided<SEP>2 tablespoons fresh chives, minced<SEP>1/4 teaspoon salt<SEP>1/4 teaspoon pepper<SEP>2 tablespoons unsalted butter<SEP>1 cup frozen cubed hash browns (do not thaw)<SEP>1/2 cup yellow onion, diced<SEP>1 cup green bell pepper, diced (about 1/2 of a large<SEP>pepper)<SEP>1 cup diced ham<SEP>4 ounces cream cheese<SEP>1 box (1 pound) puff pastry dough, thawed according to package directions<SEP>2 tablespoons Parmesan cheese, shredded
ELzGrYvTa9bj6S8A6Fvz.directions: Preheat oven to 375°F. Line a jelly roll pan with parchment paper.<SEP>Combine orange juice concentrate and 4 teaspoons water; stir until well combined. Set aside.<SEP>Whisk 10 eggs, chives, salt, and pepper together. Set aside.<SEP>Melt butter in a large skillet. Add frozen hash browns and sauté 5 minutes. Add onion and bell pepper. Sauté 3 minutes, then add ham.<SEP>Add whisked eggs and spices to the pan and cook, stirring, until just set. Remove from heat. Add cream cheese and orange juice mixture. Stir to combine.<SEP>Unfold the sheets of pastry dough and gently roll each into a 10x12 rectangle. Transfer, laying it crosswise, to prepared jelly roll pan. Note the lengthwise fold marks in the dough. Leaving the center third intact, cut<SEP>each outer third crosswise into 10 thin strips.<SEP>Fill the center section of each puff pastry with half the egg mixture. Fold the strips, first right and then left, over the egg to form a braid.<SEP>Repeat steps 6 and 7 with the second sheet of pastry dough.<SEP>Beat the remaining 1 egg and 1 tablespoon water until well combined to create an egg wash. Lightly brush egg wash on tops of each strudel. Discard unused egg wash. Sprinkle parmesan cheese on top.<SEP>Bake for 30 to 40 minutes, until golden brown. Let cool 5 minutes before slicing.

EROSkKXDDS2E911ZVceC.name: Reed's Pasta and Trees
EROSkKXDDS2E911ZVceC.directions: #Broccoli<SEP>Separate broccoli into small trees<SEP>Steam broccoli<SEP><SEP>#Sauce<SEP>Heat up olive oil and butter<SEP>Saute diced garlic<SEP>Add in broccoli and cooked pasta<SEP>Stir to combine, season with salt and pepper<SEP><SEP>Serve with parmesan cheese and enjoy!<SEP><SEP>
EROSkKXDDS2E911ZVceC.ingredients: 1 pound broccoli  tops <SEP>salt and pepper <SEP>1 pound pasta<SEP>1 Tbsp olive oil <SEP>3 cloves of garlic<SEP>2 Tbsp cut up butter <SEP>1 cup grated parmesan<SEP>1 cup ricotta<SEP>Frozen Peas (optional)<SEP>Diced Ham (optional)

EXIi3frIMdOTvGUGFcFm.ingredients: 1 pound crabmeat, shredded<SEP>1 ½ tablespoons dry bread crumbs<SEP>2 teaspoons chopped fresh parsley<SEP>salt and pepper to taste<SEP>1 egg  <SEP>1 ½ tablespoons mayonnaise<SEP>½ teaspoon ground dry mustard<SEP>1 dash hot pepper sauce
EXIi3frIMdOTvGUGFcFm.directions: Preheat oven broiler.<SEP>Mix together crabmeat, bread crumbs, parsley, salt and pepper.<SEP>Beat together egg, mayonnaise, hot sauce and mustard. Combine with other ingredients and mix well. Form into patties and place on a lightly greased broiler pan or baking sheet.<SEP>Broil for 10 to 15 minutes, until lightly brown.
EXIi3frIMdOTvGUGFcFm.name: Crab Cakes

EXYWZzXcw4VomqkttKcX.ingredients: 4 sweet potatoes<SEP>2 tbsp. butter, softened<SEP>4 oz. cream cheese, softened<SEP>1 tsp. chili powder<SEP>1 tsp. garlic powder<SEP>kosher salt<SEP>Freshly ground black pepper<SEP>2 c. shredded rotisserie chicken<SEP>1/2 c. barbecue sauce<SEP>1 1/2 c. shredded Cheddar<SEP>Green onions, for garnish<SEP>Pickled jalapenos, for topping (optional)
EXYWZzXcw4VomqkttKcX.name: BBQ Chicken Stuffed Sweet Potatoes
EXYWZzXcw4VomqkttKcX.directions: Preheat oven to 375°. Place sweet potatoes on sheet tray and bake until soft, about 1 hour. Remove from oven and let stand until cool enough to handle.<SEP>Split potatoes and remove the flesh; transfer to a medium bowl and leave the skins on the sheet tray. Add butter, cream cheese, chili powder and garlic powder to the sweet potato flesh, then season with salt and pepper. Mash with a fork or rubber spatula until the mixture is evenly combined. Spoon the mixture back into the sweet potato skins.<SEP>In a separate medium bowl, combine chicken and barbecue sauce. Divide chicken mixture between sweet potatoes. Top with cheese and garnish with green onions and jalapenos, if using.<SEP>Bake for 15 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and the sweet potato filling is heated through. Serve warm.

EYEemB7caAriMoKGo08S.name: Fruit Salsa & Cinnamon Chips
EYEemB7caAriMoKGo08S.directions: In a large bowl, gently mix the kiwis, apples, raspberries, strawberries, brown sugar, and marmalade. Cover and chill for 15 minutes.<SEP>Preheat oven to 400°F convection bake.<SEP>Mix cinnamon and sugar in a small bowl.<SEP>Spray one side of each flour tortilla with cooking spray. <SEP>Using pizza cutter, cut each tortilla into 8 wedges and arrange in a single layer on large parchment-lined baking sheets or jelly roll pans. Sprinkle wedges with desired amount of cinnamon sugar. Spray again with cooking spray.<SEP>Bake for 4 to 5 minutes. Cool completely before serving with fruit salsa.
EYEemB7caAriMoKGo08S.ingredients: 2 kiwis, peeled and diced<SEP>2 Golden Delicious apples, cored and diced<SEP>1 cup frozen raspberries<SEP>1 pound strawberries, coarsely chopped<SEP>1 tablespoon brown sugar<SEP>3 tablespoons orange marmalade<SEP>10 medium-sized flour tortillas<SEP>Cooking spray<SEP>1 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon<SEP>2 tablespoons sugar

EgSCG1GbEvcKCrArmTR1.ingredients: 2 pounds sweet potatoes, peeled<SEP>2 tablespoons olive oil<SEP>1 teaspoon garlic powder<SEP>1 teaspoon paprika<SEP>1 teaspoon salt<SEP>½ teaspoon black pepper
EgSCG1GbEvcKCrArmTR1.directions: Heat the oven to 400.<SEP>Cut the sweet potatoes into sticks 1/4 to 1/2 inch wide and 3 inches long, and toss them with the oil.<SEP>Mix the spices, salt and pepper in a small bowl, and toss them with the sweet potatoes. Spread them out on 2 rimmed baking sheets.<SEP>Bake until brown and crisp on the bottom, about 15 minutes, then flip and cook until the other side is crisp, about 10 minutes. Serve hot.
EgSCG1GbEvcKCrArmTR1.name: Sweet Potato Fries

ElJeWbJ1vpRaT4E3g1SH.ingredients: 6 Eggs<SEP>1 C. Flour<SEP>1 C. Milk<SEP>1/4 tsp. Salt<SEP>6 Tbsp. Butter (or 1/4 C... whatever is less)
ElJeWbJ1vpRaT4E3g1SH.directions: Spray 9x13 pan with cooking spray<SEP>Melt butter in pan<SEP>Mix together all ingredients and pour into 9x13 pan<SEP><SEP>Optional: Sprinkle generously with sugar and cinnamon, serve with honey, peanut butter, syrup.
ElJeWbJ1vpRaT4E3g1SH.name: German Pancakes (Hoot Nanny's)

EznyHFevKZx1nGD8ha8V.name: Whole Wheat Oatmeal Chocolate Chip Cookies
EznyHFevKZx1nGD8ha8V.ingredients: 1/2 c. butter, softened<SEP>1/2 c. applesauce, unsweetened<SEP>1 c. packed brown sugar<SEP>1/2 c. sugar<SEP>2 eggs<SEP>2 t. vanilla extract<SEP>1 1/4 c. whole wheat flour<SEP>1/2 t. baking soda<SEP>1 t. salt<SEP>2 1/2 c. quick-cooking oats<SEP>1 c. semi-sweet chocolate chips<SEP>1 c. chopped walnuts...opt.
EznyHFevKZx1nGD8ha8V.directions: Preheat oven 325<SEP>In large bowl, cream together the margarine, apple sauce.brown sugar, & white sugar until smooth.<SEP>Beat eggs one at a time, then stir in vanilla.<SEP>Combine the flour, baking soda, & salt; stir into the creamed mixture until just blended.<SEP>Mix in the quick oats, walnuts, & chocolate chips.<SEP>Drop by spoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 12 minutes, Allow cookies to cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to wire rack.

F7LYJQO0IfozggIr3VuZ.directions: Combine all ingredients. I threw all 3 in a mini food processor and mixed for a minute or two.<SEP>Store in a sealed container.<SEP>Plan on 1-2 tablespoons (to taste) chocolate milk mix to per 8 ounces of milk.<SEP>When making a glass of chocolate milk, stir powder mix into 1 - 2 tablespoon warm water to help dissolve sugar crystals.<SEP>Add milk, stir and enjoy.
F7LYJQO0IfozggIr3VuZ.name: Chocolate Milk Mix
F7LYJQO0IfozggIr3VuZ.ingredients: 2/3 Cup Sugar<SEP>1/3 Cup Cocoa Powder<SEP>Pinch of salt

FQ5RHKLV6Ppl66itvU1f.name: Shakshuka
FQ5RHKLV6Ppl66itvU1f.directions: Heat oil in a 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat. Add chiles and onions and cook, stirring occasionally, until soft and golden brown, about 6 minutes. <SEP>Add garlic, cumin, and paprika, and cook, stirring frequently, until garlic is soft, about 2 more minutes.<SEP>Put tomatoes and their liquid into a medium bowl and crush with your hands.<SEP>Add crushed tomatoes and their liquid to skillet along with 1/2 cup water, reduce heat to medium, and simmer, stirring occasionally, until thickened slightly, about 15 minutes. <SEP>Season sauce with salt.<SEP>Crack eggs over sauce so that eggs are evenly distributed across sauce's surface.<SEP>Cover skillet and cook until yolks are just set, about 5 minutes. Using a spoon, baste the whites of the eggs with tomato mixture, being careful not to disturb the yolk. <SEP>Sprinkle shakshuka with feta and parsley and serve with pitas, for dipping.
FQ5RHKLV6Ppl66itvU1f.ingredients: 1/4 cup olive oil<SEP>5 Anaheim chiles or 3 jalapeños, stemmed, seeded, and finely chopped<SEP>1 small yellow onion, chopped<SEP>5 cloves garlic, crushed then sliced<SEP>1 teaspoon ground cumin<SEP>1 tablespoon paprika<SEP>1 28-ounce can whole peeled tomatoes, undrained<SEP>Kosher salt, to taste<SEP>6 eggs<SEP>1/2 cup feta cheese, crumbled<SEP>1 tablespoon chopped flat-leaf parsley<SEP>Warm pitas, for serving

FUCyQdpPTPH7GUYkCXNu.directions: Boil eggs.<SEP>To create the dressing/marinade, combine sugar, mustard, salt, grated onion, and vinegar. Mix until sugar is dissolved.<SEP>Slowly whisk in oil and beat well.<SEP>Stir in poppy seeds. Add 1 1/2 cups thinly sliced mushrooms to marinate. Cover and chill.<SEP>Just prior to serving, on a large serving platter, make multiple salad layers from spinach, Swiss cheese, bacon, red onion, and cottage cheese.<SEP>Spoon mushrooms, sliced boiled eggs, and small amount of dressing over the top, and serve. NOTE: you will most likely NOT use all of the dressing. You may serve extra dressing on the side in a bowl for those who want additional dressing.
FUCyQdpPTPH7GUYkCXNu.name: Poppy Seed Spinach Salad
FUCyQdpPTPH7GUYkCXNu.ingredients: 1/4 cup sugar<SEP>1/2 teaspoon dry mustard<SEP>1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons vinegar<SEP>3/4 teaspoon salt<SEP>1 teaspoon finely chopped onion (not dry onion)<SEP>3/4 cup Canola oil<SEP>1/2 teaspoon poppy seeds<SEP>1 package fresh spinach, cleaned and broken<SEP>1/2 pound grated Swiss cheese<SEP>1/2 pound bacon, cooked and crumbled<SEP>1/2 medium red onion, thinly sliced<SEP>1 cup (8 oz.) cottage cheese<SEP>4 ounces fresh mushrooms, thinly sliced<SEP>2 boiled eggs (optional)

FXk1RIUHlMgKHqnUEy8h.ingredients: 1 Tbsp olive oil<SEP>1 1/2 cups chopped yellow onion (1 medium)<SEP>1 1/4 cups chopped celery (about 3 ribs)<SEP>1 tsp minced garlic (1 clove)<SEP>4 cups unsalted chicken broth<SEP>2 cups water<SEP>1 (16 oz) bag dried split peas, picked over and rinsed<SEP>2 bay leaves<SEP>1 1/2 tsp chopped fresh thyme, or 1/2 tsp dried<SEP>Salt and freshly ground black pepper<SEP>1 1/2 lb meaty ham bone or diced ham<SEP>1 cup chopped carrots<SEP>Chopped fresh parsley, for garnish (optional)
FXk1RIUHlMgKHqnUEy8h.directions: Press "saute" setting on Instant Pot. Add oil, celery and onion, saute 3 minutes, add garlic and saute 1 minute longer. Press "cancel" on the Instant Pot.<SEP>Pour in broth, 2 cups water (instead of the 4 cups listed), split peas, carrots, thyme, bay leaves and season with salt and pepper to taste. Add ham bone.<SEP>Cover and press "manual" mode then set to 15 minutes.<SEP>Once time is up allow pressure to release naturally for 15 minutes, then quick release any remaining pressure.<SEP>Shred ham from bone into pieces and return to soup.
FXk1RIUHlMgKHqnUEy8h.name: Split Pea Soup

FdT8bnxbzKYQ61gopGzF.notes: Kneading and rising times are approximate and depend on many different variables. The dough must be kneaded until it pulls away from the bowl and is no longer sticky, even if that takes shorter or longer than 10 to 15 minutes. Also, the dough should be allowed to rise in the pans until it is as high as you want your final bread to be.<SEP>White whole wheat flour is 100% whole wheat flour that yields a lighter taste and texture than regular whole wheat flour.
FdT8bnxbzKYQ61gopGzF.directions: 1. In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a dough hook, mix together 3 1/2 cups white whole wheat flour, vital wheat gluten, and quick-rise yeast until well combined.<SEP>2. Add the water and mix for one minute, scraping down bowl halfway through. Cover the bowl with a clean kitchen towel and allow to rest for 10 minutes.<SEP>3. Uncover the bowl and add the salt, oil, honey, and lemon juice. Beat for 1 minute.<SEP>4. Add the remaining 2 1/2 cups of flour, one cup at a time, mixing well between each cup. Knead the dough in the mixer (still using the dough hook) until the dough pulls away from the sides of the bowl and feels smooth rather than sticky. This usually takes 10 to 15 minutes, but if your dough pulls away and loses its stickiness sooner, it could take as little as 5 minutes.<SEP>5. Grease two nonstick bread pans measuring 8 1/2" x 4 1/2" x 2 1/2" to 9" x 5" x 3" each (or grease two regular bread pans and then line them with parchment paper). Preheat the oven to lukewarm by setting it to 350°F and then turning it back off after exactly 1 minute.<SEP>6. Turn the dough onto a greased surface. Evenly divide it into two loaves. Form and place the dough into the prepared bread pans, gently pressing it into the corners.<SEP>7. Place the pans in the warm oven and allow them to rise for 20 to 40 minutes, until the dough is nicely domed above the tops of the pans. Without removing the pans from the oven, turn on the oven to 350°F and set the timer for 30 minutes. The bread is done when the tops are golden brown and the internal temperature reaches 190°F to 200°F on an instant-read thermometer. Once the loaves are baked, immediately remove the hot bread from the pans to cool on a rack.
FdT8bnxbzKYQ61gopGzF.name: The Very Best Homemade Whole Wheat Bread
FdT8bnxbzKYQ61gopGzF.ingredients: #Step 1:<SEP>3 1/2 cups white whole wheat flour<SEP>1/3 cup vital wheat gluten<SEP>4 teaspoons instant dry yeast "quick rise" or "rapid rise"<SEP>#Step 2:<SEP>2 1/2 cups very warm water 120°F to 130°F<SEP>#Step 3:<SEP>1 tablespoon salt<SEP>1/3 cup coconut oil melted and cooled (OR vegetable oil)<SEP>1/3 cup honey<SEP>4 teaspoons lemon juice<SEP>#Step 4:<SEP>2 1/2 cups white whole wheat flour

Fw0CHZEfRiHkWFEIwdmS.name: White Chicken Chili
Fw0CHZEfRiHkWFEIwdmS.ingredients: 1 pound of boneless, skinless chicken breast cut in ½ inch cubes<SEP>1 med. Onion<SEP>1 ½ tsp. garlic powder<SEP>1 Tbsp. vegetable oil<SEP>2 cans of great northern beans, drain and rinse<SEP>1 can (14 ½ oz.) chicken broth<SEP>2 cans of chopped green chilies<SEP>1 tsp. salt<SEP>1 tsp. cumin<SEP>1 tsp. oregano<SEP>½ tsp. pepper<SEP>¼ tsp. cayenne pepper<SEP>1 cup sour cream<SEP>½ cup whipping cream
Fw0CHZEfRiHkWFEIwdmS.directions: In large saucepan, sauté chicken, onion, and garlic powder in oil until chicken is no longer pink.  <SEP>Add beans, broth chilies and seasonings.  Bring to a boil.  Reduce heat and simmer uncovered for 30 minutes.  <SEP>Remove from heat and stir in sour cream and whipping cream.  <SEP>Serve immediately.

GALKC2RjMxOa6fqhoVNN.directions: Prepare a marinade for the chicken. Combine the lemon juice, 1/2 cup olive oil, garlic, salt, pepper, cumin, paprika, turmeric, cinnamon and red pepper flakes in a large bowl, then whisk to combine. Add the chicken and toss well to coat. Cover and store in refrigerator for at least 1 hour and up to 12 hours.<SEP><SEP>When ready to cook, heat oven to 425 degrees. Use the remaining tablespoon of olive oil to grease a rimmed sheet pan. Add the quartered onion to the chicken and marinade, and toss once to combine. Remove the chicken and onion from the marinade, and place on the pan, spreading everything evenly across it.<SEP><SEP>Put the chicken in the oven and roast until it is browned, crisp at the edges and cooked through, about 30 to 40 minutes. Remove from the oven, allow to rest 2 minutes, then slice into bits. (To make the chicken even more crisp, set a large pan over high heat, add a tablespoon of olive oil to the pan, then the sliced chicken, and sauté until everything curls tight in the heat.) Scatter the parsley over the top.<SEP><SEP>#Sumac Pickled Red Onions<SEP>Thinly slice large red onion and place it into a bowl. Pour boiling water over the onions making sure they are covered. Soak the onions for about 10 minutes.<SEP>Drain the onions and pat them with a paper towel. Add 1/4 cup of red wine vinegar to the onions and mix them well. Let the onions marinate for 5 to 10 minutes, making sure to stir them a few times. <SEP>Drain the vinegar leaving about 1 teaspoon in the bowl. Add parsley, sumac, and olive oil, stir to combine. Place the onions in the fridge for about 30 minutes before serving.<SEP><SEP>#Assembly<SEP>Serve with over rice with hummus, tomatoes, cucumbers, spinach, hot sauce, olives, feta, pickled onion, tabbouleh - really anything you desire.
GALKC2RjMxOa6fqhoVNN.ingredients: #For the Chicken<SEP>2 lemons, juiced<SEP>1/2 cup plus 1 tablespoon olive oil<SEP>6 cloves garlic, peeled, smashed and minced<SEP>1 teaspoon kosher salt<SEP>2 teaspoons freshly ground black pepper<SEP>2 teaspoons ground cumin<SEP>2 teaspoons paprika<SEP>1/2 teaspoon turmeric<SEP>A pinch ground cinnamon<SEP>Red pepper flakes, to taste<SEP>2 pounds boneless, skinless chicken thighs<SEP>1 large red onion, peeled and quartered<SEP>2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley<SEP><SEP>#For the Pickled Sumac Onions (optional)<SEP>1 large red onion<SEP>1 T. sumac<SEP>1/4 c. red wine vinegar<SEP><SEP>#For the Bowl<SEP>Rice<SEP>Spinach<SEP>Cherry tomatoes<SEP>English Cucumber<SEP>Feta<SEP>Kalamata olives<SEP>Pickles<SEP>French fries (optional)<SEP>Hummus<SEP>Tabbouleh (see separate recipe)<SEP>Pita Bread (optional, see separate recipe)
GALKC2RjMxOa6fqhoVNN.name: Chicken Shawarma Bowl

GI2Qz9uQKWRwedeWZkFi.ingredients: #dry ingredients<SEP>1 cup (200g) granulated sugar<SEP>1/3 cup (40g) unsweetened cocoa powder sifted<SEP>1/2 cup (64g) all-purpose flour<SEP>1/4 tsp. salt<SEP>1/4 tsp. baking powder<SEP><SEP>#wet ingredients<SEP>1/2 cup (113g) butter melted then cooled<SEP>2 eggs room temperature<SEP>1 tsp. McCormick vanilla
GI2Qz9uQKWRwedeWZkFi.name: Brownie Mix
GI2Qz9uQKWRwedeWZkFi.directions: Sift together all dry ingredients. Place into a jar or airtight container.<SEP>On a gift tag or label write the wet ingredients and quantities and then directions. "Melt butter and set aside to cool slightly. In a medium bowl, beat two eggs with the vanilla. Add in and gently stir dry ingredients. Pour the melted butter into brownie mixture and mix until just incorporated. Spread batter in a prepared 8-inch square pan and bake for 20-22 minutes at 350 degrees."

GVhCGKxvMcM6lVoB6dd8.name: Honey Coconut Blueberry Bran Muffins
GVhCGKxvMcM6lVoB6dd8.directions: Preheat oven to 400°F.  Line a muffin tin with 16 liners.<SEP>Combine the wheat bran, wheat flour, baking soda and baking powder. Stir in nuts and coconut.<SEP>In a separate bowl, blend applesauce, almond milk, honey, coconut oil, vanilla and egg.  Add to dry ingredients and stir just until moistened. Fold in blueberries.<SEP>Spoon into paper-lined muffin cups and bake for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean.
GVhCGKxvMcM6lVoB6dd8.ingredients: 1 cup wheat bran<SEP>1-1/2 cups white whole wheat flour<SEP>1/3 cup sweetened shredded coconut<SEP>1/4 cup chopped walnuts<SEP>1 tsp baking powder<SEP>1 tsp baking soda<SEP>1 cup unsweetened vanilla almond milk (or skim is fine)<SEP>1/2 cup honey<SEP>1 tsp vanilla<SEP>3/4 cup unsweetened applesauce<SEP>2 tbsp coconut oil (or canola)<SEP>2 large eggs, beaten<SEP>12 oz blueberries

GX2hTjwU1vEVNW5YGRMu.directions: In a large, straight-sided sauté pan or Dutch oven, cook bacon over medium-low heat, turning occasionally, until meaty parts are crisp and fatty parts are tender, 8 to 10 minutes. Using tongs, transfer bacon to a cutting board and reserve rendered bacon fat in the pan. Cut bacon crosswise into 3/4-inch pieces; set aside.<SEP>Return pan to stovetop and increase heat to medium-high. Add white and light green spring onion parts, fennel, and water, season with salt and cook, stirring frequently with a rubber spatula, until vegetables just begin to soften, about 5 minutes. Add baking soda, stir to combine, and continue to cook until vegetables are very soft and beginning to break down, about 8 minutes longer.<SEP>Add remaining green parts of spring onions. Cook until well-incorporated with vegetable mixture and just beginning to soften, about 3 minutes. Add cream, bring to a simmer, and cook until mixture is slightly thickened, about 2 minutes.<SEP>Transfer mixture to a blender and blend on high speed until smooth and emulsified, about 1 minute. Season lightly with salt. Wipe out sauté pan and transfer blended sauce back to the pan, passing through a fine-mesh strainer if desired. Warm sauce over low heat, occasionally scraping down the sides of the pan to prevent skin from forming.<SEP>Meanwhile, in a pot of salted boiling water, cook orecchiette until just shy of al dente (about 1 minute less than the package directs). Reserve pasta cooking water.<SEP>Transfer pasta to pan along with 1/2 cup pasta water and bacon, increase heat to high, and cook, stirring rapidly until sauce has thickened slightly and pasta is well-coated, about 1 minute. Remove from heat, season generously with pepper, add Parmigiano, and stir rapidly to combine. Season with salt, if needed. Divide pasta into serving bowls and garnish with reserved fennel fronds. Serve immediately, passing more cheese at the table.
GX2hTjwU1vEVNW5YGRMu.name: Creamy Fennel Bacon Orecchiette
GX2hTjwU1vEVNW5YGRMu.ingredients: 6 slices (about 6 ounces; 170g) thick-cut bacon<SEP>1 pound (450g) spring onions, trimmed, white and green parts divided and thinly sliced (see note)<SEP>1 Large or 2 medium fennel bulb cored and thinly sliced, fronds reserved<SEP>1/4 cup (60ml) water<SEP>Kosher salt<SEP>1/8 teaspoon baking soda<SEP>1 cup (235ml) heavy cream<SEP>1 pound (450g) dried orecchiette pasta or Gemelli<SEP>Freshly ground black pepper<SEP>1 cup (about 3 ounces; 85g) grated Parmigiano-Reggiano, plus extra for serving

GhoOp6y2mfe8tKQOWQAt.ingredients: 1/2 cup brown sugar<SEP>1/2 cup finely chopped walnuts<SEP>2 tablespoons margarine<SEP>3/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon<SEP>3 cups flour<SEP>1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder<SEP>1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda<SEP>3/4 teaspoon salt<SEP>3/4 cup margarine, softened<SEP>1 1/2 cups sugar<SEP>1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla<SEP>3 large eggs<SEP>1 1/2 cups sour cream<SEP>1 cup powdered sugar<SEP>1/2 teaspoon vanilla<SEP>3 to 4 tablespoons milk
GhoOp6y2mfe8tKQOWQAt.name: Sour Cream Coffee Cake
GhoOp6y2mfe8tKQOWQAt.directions: Preheat oven to 325°F.<SEP>Adjust the oven rack so that the center of the cake will be in the center of the oven. Grease and flour one 9x13-inch aluminum cake pan.<SEP>To make filling, combine 1/2 cup brown sugar, 1/2 cup walnuts, 2 tablespoons margarine, and 3/4 teaspoon cinnamon and mix until crumbly. Set aside.<SEP>In a small bowl, combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.<SEP>In the large KitchenAid bowl, cream 3/4 cup margarine, sugar, vanilla, and eggs. Continue to beat on medium<SEP>speed for 2 minutes.<SEP>Add flour mixture and sour cream alternately, one-third at a time, beating on low speed until ingredients are<SEP>just combined.<SEP>Pour one-half of the batter into the prepared cake pan. Sprinkle with one-half of the filling. Repeat to create a second layer. Swirl with a knife.<SEP>Bake 45-50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool in the pan for 10 minutes.<SEP>While the cake is baking, make the glaze by combining powdered sugar, vanilla, and milk. Beat until smooth.<SEP>After cake has cooled for 10 minutes, drizzle glaze over coffee cake.<SEP>The cake may be served warm or cold.

GkH1HfbaHoE74V5UWQbh.ingredients: 3 Tbsp coconut oil (or peanut/canola)<SEP>1/3 cup of high quality popcorn kernels<SEP>1 Tbsp or more (to taste) of butter (optional)<SEP>Salt to taste
GkH1HfbaHoE74V5UWQbh.directions: Heat the oil: Heat the oil in a 3-quart thick-bottomed saucepan on medium high heat. If you are using coconut oil, allow all of the solid oil to melt.<SEP>Put 3 or 4 popcorn kernels into the oil. Wait for the popcorn kernels to pop.<SEP>When the kernels pop, add the rest of the 1/3 cup of popcorn kernels in an even layer.<SEP>Cover the pot, remove from heat and count 30 seconds. (Count out loud! It's fun to do with kids.)<SEP>Return the pan to the heat. The popcorn should begin popping soon, and all at once. Once the popping starts in earnest, gently shake the pan by moving it back and forth over the burner.<SEP>Tip: As the popcorn pops, try to keep the lid slightly ajar to let the steam from the popcorn release (the popcorn will be drier and crisper).<SEP>Once the popping slows to several seconds between pops, remove the pan from the heat, remove the lid, and dump the popcorn immediately into a wide bowl.<SEP>Melt butter in the empty hot pan: If you are adding butter, you can easily melt it by placing the butter in the now empty, but hot pan. If you let the butter get just a little bit brown, it will add an even more intense, buttery flavor to the butter and to your popcorn.<SEP>Sprinkle the popcorn with salt to taste.
GkH1HfbaHoE74V5UWQbh.name: Popcorn

GvjRB1Q7Wij0aQjfE3JL.ingredients: 2 cups dried garbanzo beans (do not use canned)<SEP>Cover with water and 1 teaspoon baking soda. Soak for 24 hours. (The garbanzo beans will expand--cover with lots of water, add more water if needed to keep covered)<SEP>2-4 cloves garlic<SEP>2 teaspoons cumin<SEP>2 teaspoons ground coriander<SEP>1 teaspoon baking soda<SEP>1 small onion, cut into sections<SEP>1 teaspoon salt<SEP>1/2 - 1 teaspoon pepper, to taste<SEP>1/2 - 1 bunch fresh cilantro<SEP>1/2 - 1 bunch fresh parsley<SEP>2-4 tablespoons flour
GvjRB1Q7Wij0aQjfE3JL.name: Falafel
GvjRB1Q7Wij0aQjfE3JL.directions: Drain and rinse garbanzo beans. Place the garbanzo beans in a blender or food processor fitted with the metal blade. <SEP>Add the remaining ingredients. Don't grind too fine (it should not fall apart when made into a ball). (You can do this in 2-3 batches depending on the size of your processor.) Taste and add more spices, if desired. <SEP>Place in a glass bowl and refrigerate, covered, about 20-30 minutes.<SEP>Shape into patties.<SEP>Use a deep fryer and cook until outside is brown.<SEP>OR: Pour oil to a depth of 1/2 inch in a heavy skillet and heat until hot but not smoking. Working in batches, fry the patties turning frequently until browned and crisp, about 3-4 minutes. <SEP>Drain on paper towels. <SEP>For sandwiches: put 2-3 falaafils in pocket (pita) bread, tomato-cucumber salad, shredded lettuce, hummus or tahina, pickles, and french fries!<SEP>For taamiya (Egyptian style): substitute fava beans (white broad beans) for the chickpeas.

H13CJSmlfnsZrLVqeGe8.name: Polska Kielbasa Stir Fry
H13CJSmlfnsZrLVqeGe8.ingredients: 1 Polska Kielbasa Sausage - sliced<SEP>1 cup sliced yellow onion<SEP>2 minced garlic cloves<SEP>1 cup sliced carrots<SEP>1 cup sliced celery<SEP>1 cup sliced bok choy<SEP>½ cup sliced peppers<SEP>1 cup sugar peas<SEP>Any veggies you want, really. Broccoli, cauliflower are great in this dish.<SEP>1 TBS olive oil<SEP>⅓ cup teriyaki sauce
H13CJSmlfnsZrLVqeGe8.directions: Add 1 TBS olive oil to a large saute pan over medium heat<SEP>Stir in the onion and saute until translucent - about 5 minutes<SEP>Add the minced garlic, saute 1 more minute<SEP>Stir in and saute the carrots and celery for a couple of minutes<SEP>Add the rest of the vegetables and kielbasa sausage and saute until al dente<SEP>Finally, add the teriyaki sauce for seasoning and warm<SEP>Serve over cooked rice

H1JPx7KbVw2ohhdMYn7e.directions: Preheat oven to 350° and grease a 9"-x-13" baking dish with cooking spray.<SEP>Add onion mix and beef, make into patties and cook in a skillet<SEP>Place bottom halves of slider buns in prepared baking dish and top with the beef patties, cheese, tomatoes, pickles, and slider bun tops.<SEP>Brush melted butter on top of buns and sprinkle with garlic powder and sesame seeds.<SEP>Bake until cheese is melty and buns are golden, 10 to 12 minutes.
H1JPx7KbVw2ohhdMYn7e.name: Sliders
H1JPx7KbVw2ohhdMYn7e.ingredients: 2 pounds ground beef<SEP>Dried onion soup mix<SEP>Slider buns<SEP>Frozen fries<SEP>Burger toppings: tomato, lettuce, red onion

H9qrJiPJb2PrXlbvDezO.ingredients: 1/2 cup wild rice<SEP>kosher salt & freshly ground black pepper<SEP>1 large sweet potato, diced<SEP>2 tablespoons olive oil<SEP>1 cup lightly packed thinly sliced lacinato kale<SEP>1 apple, diced<SEP>1 medium golden beet, peeled, halved lengthwise, and thinly sliced (we usually omit this)<SEP>1 small fennel bulb, trimmed, halved, cored, and thinly sliced<SEP>6 ounces roasted chicken or 6 ounces poached chicken, shredded<SEP>3 ounces fresh goat cheese, crumbled<SEP>1/2 cup craisins<SEP>1/4 cup toasted almond, coarsely chopped<SEP><SEP>#BALSAMIC VINAIGRETTE<SEP>1/2 cup olive oil<SEP>2 tablespoons high-quality balsamic vinegar<SEP>2 teaspoons Dijon mustard<SEP>kosher salt & freshly ground black pepper
H9qrJiPJb2PrXlbvDezO.notes: This is a copycat version of a Sweetgreen's yummy salad.
H9qrJiPJb2PrXlbvDezO.directions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.<SEP>In a medium pot with a tight-fitting lid, combine wild rice, 1 cup water and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil over high heat, top with lid and reduce to low. Cook 45 minutes. Fluff with a fork, remove from heat and cover. Let steam 5 minutes more. Divide between two serving bowls.<SEP>Meanwhile, place sweet potatoes on a rimmed baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil and season generously with salt and pepper. Roast until pieces are golden on the underside, about 18 minutes. Flip pieces and roast for an additional 5-8 minutes, until golden and slightly crisped on the edges. Add to bowls with rice.<SEP>In a large serving bowl, combine kale, beets, fennel and chicken. Toss with enough balsamic vinaigrette to coat. Divide between bowls and top with goat cheese and almonds. Serve with additional dressing on the side.<SEP><SEP>#For the Balsamic Vinaigrette:<SEP>Combine olive oil, balsamic vinegar and dijon mustard in a small bowl. Whisk until emulsified. Season generously with salt and pepper. Leftovers can be stored in refrigerator for up to two weeks.
H9qrJiPJb2PrXlbvDezO.name: Harvest Bowl

HDtinLyIpTLn0euZp85A.ingredients: 1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil<SEP>1 medium onion, chopped<SEP>1 large carrot, chopped<SEP> <SEP>1 stick celery, chopped (optional)<SEP> Salt to taste<SEP>2 large garlic cloves, minced<SEP>1 14-ounce can chopped tomatoes, with juice<SEP>6 cups water (I did a little less and added vegetable broth)<SEP>1 tablespoon tomato paste<SEP>1 teaspoon oregano<SEP>1 medium Yukon gold potato (about 6 ounces), diced<SEP> A bouquet garni made with a bay leaf, a couple of sprigs each parsley and thyme, and a Parmesan rind (optional – but it does add flavor; use what you have for this)<SEP>½ pound kale, stemmed, washed thoroughly, and chopped or cut in slivers (4 cups chopped)<SEP>1 can white beans, drained and rinsed<SEP> Freshly ground pepper<SEP> Grated Parmesan for serving
HDtinLyIpTLn0euZp85A.directions: #Step 1<SEP>Heat the olive oil over medium heat in a large, heavy soup pot and add the onion, carrot, and celery and a pinch of salt. Cook, stirring often, until the vegetables are tender, about 8 minutes. Add the garlic and cook, stirring, until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Stir in the tomatoes and juice from the can, add another pinch of salt and cook, stirring often, for 5 to 10 minutes, until the tomatoes have cooked down slightly.<SEP><SEP>#Step 2<SEP>Add the water, tomato paste, oregano, potato, and salt to taste. Bring to a boil, add the bouquet garni, cover and simmer 10 to 15 minutes, until the potatoes are just about tender.<SEP><SEP>#Step 3<SEP>Add the kale and simmer another 10 minutes, until the kale and potatoes are tender and the soup is fragrant. Taste, adjust salt, and add pepper. Stir in the beans and heat through for 5 minutes. Serve, sprinkling some Parmesan over each bowl.
HDtinLyIpTLn0euZp85A.name: White Bean and Kale Soup

HFHOSu0E2HKOxpp6XWsy.directions: Process the flour, sugar, and salt in a food processor until combined. Scatter the shortening over the top and process until the mixture has the texture of coarse sand, about 10 seconds. Scatter the butter pieces over the top until it resembles coarse crumbs, about 10 pulses. Transfer to a bowl.<SEP>Sprinkle 6 T. of the ice water over the mixture. Stir and press the dough together, using a stiff rubber spatula until the dough sticks together. If the dough does not come together, stir in the remaining water, 1 T. at a time, until it does.<SEP>Divide the dough into two even pieces and flatten each into a 4-inch disk. Wrap the disks tightly in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1 hour. Let the chilled dough soften slightly at room temperature before rolling it out and fitting it into a pie plate.
HFHOSu0E2HKOxpp6XWsy.notes: I've had great results when I grate the frozen butter and mix with pastry cutter, rather than cutting it into cubes and putting in food processor.<SEP>Make ahead: the dough can be refrigerated, wrapped tightly in plastic wrap, for up to 2 days or frozen for up to 2 months. Let the frozen dough thaw on the countertop until malleable before rolling.
HFHOSu0E2HKOxpp6XWsy.name: Pie crust
HFHOSu0E2HKOxpp6XWsy.ingredients: #For double crust:<SEP>2 1/2 c. all-purpose flour, plus extra for rolling out the dough<SEP>2 T. sugar<SEP>1 t. salt<SEP>8 T. shortening, cut into 1/2-inch pieces and chilled<SEP>12 T. unsalted butter, cut into 1/4-inch pieces and chilled<SEP>6-8 T. ice water

HJbIhp4iJj3468f19zIF.name: Black Bean Burgers
HJbIhp4iJj3468f19zIF.ingredients: 2 (14 ounce) cans black beans, drained, rinsed, and patted dry<SEP>1 Tablespoon extra virgin olive oil<SEP>3/4 cup finely chopped bell pepper (1/2 of a pepper)<SEP>1 cup finely chopped yellow onion (1/2 of a large onion)<SEP>3 garlic cloves, minced (about 1 Tablespoon)<SEP>1 and 1/2 teaspoons ground cumin<SEP>1 teaspoon chili powder<SEP>1/2 teaspoon garlic powder<SEP>1/4 teaspoon smoked paprika<SEP>1/2 cup bread crumbs or oat flour<SEP>1/2 cup feta cheese<SEP>2 large eggs<SEP>1 Tablespoon Worcestershire sauce<SEP>2 Tablespoons ketchup, mayo, or BBQ sauce<SEP>pinch salt + pepper
HJbIhp4iJj3468f19zIF.directions: Preheat oven to 325°F (163°C). Spread beans evenly onto a lined baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes until slightly dried out.<SEP>Meanwhile, sauté olive oil, chopped pepper, onion, and garlic over medium heat until peppers and onions are soft, about 5-6 minutes. Gently blot some of the moisture out. <SEP>Place in a large bowl or in a food processor with the remaining ingredients (cumin, chili powder, garlic powder, smoked paprika, bread crumbs, cheese, eggs, worcestershire, ketchup, salt, and pepper). Stir or pulse everything together, then add the black beans. Mash with a fork or pulse the mixture, leaving some larger chunks of beans.<SEP>Form into patties– about 1/3 cup of mixture in each.<SEP>To bake: Place patties on a parchment paper lined baking sheet and bake at 375°F (191°C) for 10 minutes on each side, 20 minutes total. To grill: Place patties on greased aluminum foil and grill 8 minutes on each side. Heat temperature is personal preference as all grills differ. Generally, black bean burgers should grill on medium-high heat about 350°F (177°C) – 400°F (204°C).<SEP>Serve with your favorite toppings. Store leftovers in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.

HQqsNiJj0Ca5p3yEIYnB.name: Pumpkin Pie
HQqsNiJj0Ca5p3yEIYnB.directions: Mix sugar, salt, cinnamon, ginger, and cloves in a small bowl. <SEP>In a separate large bowl, beat 6 large eggs. Mix with dry ingredients.<SEP>Stir in pumpkin and sugar spice mix, gradually stir in evaporated milk.<SEP>Pour into pie shells and bake at 425 degrees for 15 minutes. <SEP>Reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees and bake 40 - 50 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.<SEP>Cool on wire rack for 2 hours.
HQqsNiJj0Ca5p3yEIYnB.ingredients: 1 1/2 cups granulated sugar<SEP>1 tsp. salt<SEP>2 tsp. cinnamon<SEP>1 rounded tsp. ground ginger<SEP>1/2 tsp. cloves<SEP>6 large eggs<SEP>1 - 29 oz. can 100% pure pumpkin<SEP>3 - 12 oz cans evaporated milk

HgZ1l1sVcrAV0FHJitfc.ingredients: #veggies<SEP>2 eggplants<SEP>6 roma tomatoes<SEP>2 yellow squashes<SEP>2 zucchinis<SEP><SEP>#SAUCE<SEP>2 tablespoons olive oil<SEP>1 onion, diced<SEP>4 cloves garlic, minced<SEP>1 red bell pepper, diced<SEP>1 yellow bell pepper, diced<SEP>salt, to taste<SEP>pepper, to taste<SEP>28 oz can of crushed tomatoes<SEP>2 tablespoons chopped fresh basil, from 8-10 leaves<SEP><SEP>#HERB SEASONING<SEP>2 tablespoons chopped fresh basil, from 8-10 leaves<SEP>1 teaspoon garlic, minced<SEP>2 tablespoons Chopped fresh parsley<SEP>2 teaspoons fresh thyme<SEP>salt, to taste<SEP>pepper, to taste<SEP>4 tablespoons olive oil
HgZ1l1sVcrAV0FHJitfc.directions: Preheat the oven for 375˚F (190˚C).<SEP>Slice the eggplant, tomatoes, squash, and zucchini into approximately ¹⁄₁₆-inch (1-mm) rounds, then set aside.<SEP>Make the sauce: Heat the olive oil in a 12-inch (30-cm) oven-safe pan over medium-high heat. Sauté the onion, garlic, and bell peppers until soft, about 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper, then add the crushed tomatoes. Stir until the ingredients are fully incorporated. Remove from heat, then add the basil. Stir once more, then smooth the surface of the sauce with a spatula.<SEP>Arrange the sliced veggies in alternating patterns, (for example, eggplant, tomato, squash, zucchini) on top of the sauce from the outer edge to the middle of the pan. Season with salt and pepper.<SEP>Make the herb seasoning: In a small bowl, mix together the basil, garlic, parsley, thyme, salt, pepper, and olive oil. Spoon the herb seasoning over the vegetables.<SEP>Cover the pan with foil and bake for 40 minutes. Uncover, then bake for another 20 minutes, until the vegetables are softened.<SEP>Serve while hot as a main dish or side. The ratatouille is also excellent the next day--cover with foil and reheat in a 350˚F (180˚C) oven for 15 minutes, or simply microwave to desired temperature.<SEP>Enjoy!
HgZ1l1sVcrAV0FHJitfc.notes: Makes a lot (8 servings). I like to put bread crumbs and parmesan cheese on top (obviously this makes it not vegan/dairy/gluten-free).<SEP>Serve with garlic bread.
HgZ1l1sVcrAV0FHJitfc.name: Ratatouille

HrftYIEaP2ioehTWgbg7.ingredients: 1 box yellow cake mix<SEP>1 1/4 cups water<SEP>1 tablespoon vegetable oil<SEP>2 teaspoons vanilla<SEP>4 eggs<SEP>1 can (14 oz) sweetened condensed milk (not evaporated)<SEP>1 cup whole milk or evaporated milk<SEP>1 cup heavy whipping cream<SEP>1 container whipped fluffy white frosting
HrftYIEaP2ioehTWgbg7.name: Tres Leches
HrftYIEaP2ioehTWgbg7.directions: Heat oven to 350°F (325°F for dark or nonstick pan). Spray bottom and sides of 13x9-inch pan with cooking spray.<SEP>In large bowl, beat cake mix, water, oil, vanilla and eggs with electric mixer on low speed 30 seconds, then on medium speed 2 minutes, scraping bowl occasionally. Pour into pan.<SEP>Bake as directed on box for 13x9-inch pan. Let stand 5 minutes. Poke top of hot cake every 1/2 inch with long-tined fork, wiping fork occasionally to reduce sticking.<SEP>In large bowl, stir together sweetened condensed milk, whole milk and whipping cream. Carefully pour evenly over top of cake. Cover; refrigerate about 1 hour or until mixture is absorbed into cake. Frost with frosting. Store covered in refrigerator.

HxJkauLK0Y4PJeRi05Nu.name: Focaccia Bread
