HxJkauLK0Y4PJeRi05Nu.directions: Prepare proofing oven and preheat convection oven to 400°F. Grease large plate with shortening. Generously sprinkle a parchment-lined cookie sheet with cornmeal. Set aside.<SEP>Warm and stir flour in microwave in 30-second bursts until warm to the touch. In KitchenAid bowl and with flat paddle, mix 1 cup of bread flour, rosemary, sugar, salt, and yeast. Add 3 tablespoons oil and warm water.<SEP>Beat with electric mixer on medium speed for 3 minutes, scraping bowl frequently. Switch to the dough hook and stir in enough remaining flour until dough is soft.<SEP>Using dough hook, knead 5 to 8 minutes or until dough is smooth and springy. Place dough on prepared plate, turning dough to grease all sides. Cover plate loosely with plastic wrap and let rise in proofing oven about 20 minutes or until dough has almost doubled in size. (Dough is ready if indentations remain when touched.)<SEP>Divide dough in half. Shape each half into a 6- to 8-inch round (about 1-inch thick) and place each piece on the cookie sheet. Cover loosely with plastic wrap lightly sprayed with cooking spray and let rise in proofing oven about 10 minutes or until dough has doubled in size.<SEP>Gently use fingers to make 1/2-inch deep depressions about 2 inches apart in dough. (This adds a decorative surface to the top) Carefully brush with 2 tablespoons oil, then sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown.<SEP>Slice bread and serve with oil and balsamic vinegar in a ramekin next to cut bread.
HxJkauLK0Y4PJeRi05Nu.ingredients: 2 1/2 to 3 cups bread flour<SEP>1 tablespoon dried rosemary leaves, crumbled<SEP>1 tablespoon sugar<SEP>1 teaspoon salt<SEP>2 1/4 teaspoons quick active dry yeast<SEP>5 tablespoons olive oil, divided<SEP>1 cup very warm water (120°F)<SEP>Cornmeal<SEP>1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese<SEP>Olive oil<SEP>Balsamic vinegar<SEP>1-2 tablespoons shortening to grease pans

I3Sb0FDVPBS9oyiG8QLh.ingredients: 10 fluid ounces warm water<SEP>1 tablespoon olive oil<SEP>1⁄3 cup honey<SEP>1 teaspoon salt (we use Real Salt)<SEP>1 cup rolled oats (freshly rolled by DangerBoy at our house)<SEP>3 cups whole wheat flour (freshly ground, if possible)<SEP>2 tablespoons vital wheat gluten<SEP>2 teaspoons instant yeast
I3Sb0FDVPBS9oyiG8QLh.directions: Put ingredients into bread pan in the order suggested by the manufacturer of the bread machine.<SEP>If you're going to use a timer, it is vital to keep the yeast away from both the liquids AND the salt.<SEP>I make this on the white bread cycle and it comes out great, but you may wish to use the whole wheat cycle.<SEP>I never noticed any difference except that the whole wheat cycle took a lot longer.<SEP>Your machine may yield different results, tho.<SEP>If you like crusty bread, just let the finished bread set on a rack to cool.<SEP>If you want a softer crust, slip the hot bread into a plastic bag so that the crust will get steamed and be nice& soft- and good for sandwiches.
I3Sb0FDVPBS9oyiG8QLh.name: Honey Wheat Oatmeal Bread

I5Ssv3FI2bcXT7rNhmHW.name: Quinoa Bowls with Baked Tofu
I5Ssv3FI2bcXT7rNhmHW.ingredients: 1 cup uncooked quinoa<SEP>1 teaspoon ground ginger<SEP>3 teaspoons tamari divided<SEP>1 cup water<SEP>1 1/4 cups Almondmilk coconutmilk blend<SEP>1/4 cup peanut butter<SEP>Juice of 1 lime<SEP>1 teaspoon Asian hot sauce like sriracha<SEP>1 block extra firm tofu cubed<SEP>2 cups shredded cabbage<SEP>2 cups shredded carrots<SEP>1 bunch scallion sliced<SEP>1/4 cup chopped cilantro<SEP>Sesame seeds to garnish optional
I5Ssv3FI2bcXT7rNhmHW.directions: Add quinoa, ginger, 1 teaspoon tamari, water and 1 cup of almondmilk coconutmilk blend into a small saucepan. Bring mixture to a boil, cover and reduce to simmer for 15 minutes. Once liquid has been absorbed, set aside until ready to serve.<SEP>While the quinoa is cooking, preheat the oven to 400ºF. Grease a baking sheet and set aside.<SEP>In a small bowl, whisk together peanut butter, remaining 1/4 cup of almondmilk coconutmilk blend, remaining 2 teaspoons of tamari, lime juice and hot sauce. Continue to whisk until smooth and pourable (add a splash more almondmilk as needed).<SEP>Add tofu to a mixing bowl and toss with half of the peanut dressing. Transfer the tofu to the greased baking sheet and bake for 30 minutes until crispy, flipping halfway through.<SEP>Once tofu is done, assemble your bowls. Divide the quinoa, tofu, cabbage, carrots and scallions evenly among 4 bowls. Drizzle each with the remaining dressing and sprinkle with cilantro and sesame seeds. Enjoy immediately!

IOykot3H5yH2MgfJxS3G.name: Hiyashi Chuka (Rainbow Ramen)
IOykot3H5yH2MgfJxS3G.directions: Combine tare sauce ingredients.<SEP>Cook ramen noodles, drain.<SEP>Mix eggs, sugar, salt. Cook on an oiled frying pan a little at a time to make thin crepe-like omelets. Then stack them and cut into thin strips.<SEP>Cut the rest of the ingredients into thin strips or matchsticks.<SEP>Serve in a bowl with ramen on the bottom, then toppings, then drizzle with tare sauce.
IOykot3H5yH2MgfJxS3G.ingredients: #TARE SAUCE<SEP>6 T soy sauce<SEP>6 T sugar<SEP>6 T white vinegar<SEP>5 T chicken stock (or 5 T water + 2 pkg of seasoning that comes with Ramen)<SEP>2 tsp sesame oil<SEP><SEP>Ramen noodles (top Ramen is fine)<SEP><SEP>#Toppings<SEP>4 eggs<SEP>1 tsp sugar<SEP>1/4 tsp salt<SEP>6 slices Ham<SEP>1 Cucumber<SEP>Lettuce<SEP>1 Carrot<SEP>1 Tomato<SEP>Optional: sesame seeds, kizami nori, bean sprouts, broccoli sprouts, arugula, corn, green onions, shiitake mushrooms, etc.

IPfwPRfquCYySB89EmSd.ingredients: 1 Butternut squash<SEP>2 Carrots<SEP>1 Onion<SEP>2 Celery stalks<SEP>1 Apple<SEP>3 cloves garlic<SEP>2 c. Chicken or vegetable broth<SEP>pinch of nutmeg<SEP>pinch of sage or thyme<SEP>Cream<SEP>Salt<SEP>Pepper<SEP>Pepitas (optional)<SEP>Parsley (optional)
IPfwPRfquCYySB89EmSd.name: Butternut Squash Soup
IPfwPRfquCYySB89EmSd.directions: Optional: Roast butternut squash in oven (brush a little bit of oil, put it face down).<SEP>Chop other ingredients and combine with squash in stockpot. When cooked through, blend until smooth.<SEP>Return to stockpot and add broth. Toward the end, add cream. Garnish with pepitas and parsley.

IUt0N5ZziLy9UePwhkNx.ingredients: Rice<SEP>Rice Vinegar<SEP>Sugar<SEP>Salt<SEP>Salmon<SEP>Cream cheese<SEP>Green onions<SEP>Red pepper<SEP>Avocado<SEP>Seaweed<SEP>Sesame seeds<SEP><SEP>#EGGS<SEP>3 large eggs<SEP>3 T. dashi<SEP>2 t. sugar<SEP>1 t. soy sauce<SEP>1 t. mirin<SEP>2 pinch salt
IUt0N5ZziLy9UePwhkNx.directions: #EGGS<SEP>Gently whisk the eggs in a  bowl. It's best to "cut" the eggs with chopsticks in a zig-zag motion and do not over mix.<SEP>In another bowl, combine the seasonings and mix well.<SEP>Pour the seasonings mixture into the egg mixture and whisk gently.<SEP>Heat the pan over medium hat, add oil.<SEP>When hot, pour a thin layer of egg mixture in the pan, tilting to cover the bottom of the pan.<SEP>Poke the air bubbles to release the air. After the bottom of the egg has set but still soft on top, start rolling into a log shape from one side to the other.<SEP>Move the rolled omelette to the side where you started to roll, and apply oil to the pan with a paper towel, even under the omelette.<SEP>Pour the egg mixture to cover the bottom of the pan again. Make sure to lift the omelette to spread the mixture underneath.<SEP>When the new layer of egg has set and still soft on top, start rolling from one side to the other.<SEP>Repeat the process until you reach the size you want.
IUt0N5ZziLy9UePwhkNx.name: Sushi

Ij8OuOPDwVCSWT1sHbmK.directions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees.<SEP>Cut spaghetti squash in half lengthwise, remove seeds, and drizzle a touch of olive oil on the insides of each half.<SEP>Place spaghetti squash facedown on a large parchment paper or aluminum foil-lined baking sheet. Bake in preheated oven for 40-50 minutes or until fork tender.<SEP>In a large skillet or wok add 2 tablespoons oil, the white parts of the green onions, crushed garlic, and carrots. Cook over medium heat for 2-3 minutes.<SEP>Push the vegetables to the side of the pan and add the whisked eggs. Scramble eggs for 2-3 minutes over medium heat, or until cooked through. Mix the eggs in with the vegetables. Remove eggs and vegetables from the skillet and place onto a plate until ready to use later.<SEP>Toss chicken with the starch and pepper in a gallon-sized zip-top bag. Add 2 tablespoons of oil to the same skillet and cook chicken over medium heat for 6-8 minutes, or until cooked through.<SEP>While chicken is cooking, whisk together coconut aminos, lime juice, coconut sugar, chili garlic paste, and vinegar in a medium-sized bowl.<SEP>Once chicken is done cooking add sauce to the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes.<SEP>When spaghetti squash is done cooking, shred the inside of the halves with a fork. Add equal amounts of the chicken, sauce, veggies, and eggs to each spaghetti squash half.<SEP>You can also remove all of the spaghetti squash and add it to the skillet with the chicken, sauce, veggies and eggs to toss it together.<SEP>Serve spaghetti squash pad Thai with bean sprouts, peanuts, limes and cilantro and enjoy!
Ij8OuOPDwVCSWT1sHbmK.ingredients: 2 spaghetti squash or 1 large<SEP>¼ cup olive oil divided<SEP>6 green onions finely chopped, white and green parts divided<SEP>2 cloves garlic crushed<SEP>1 cup carrots shredded<SEP>4 eggs whisked<SEP>1 lb. chicken breasts thinly sliced<SEP>2 Tbsp. tapioca starch<SEP>¼ tsp. black pepper<SEP><SEP>#Pad Thai Sauce<SEP>⅓ cup coconut aminos or gluten-free soy sauce*<SEP>3 Tbsp. lime juice fresh<SEP>¼ cup coconut sugar<SEP>1-2 Tbsp. chili garlic paste<SEP>1 Tbsp. apple cider vinegar or rice wine vinegar<SEP><SEP>#Toppings<SEP>Cilantro finely chopped<SEP>Limes<SEP>Bean sprouts optional<SEP>Peanuts optional
Ij8OuOPDwVCSWT1sHbmK.name: Spaghetti Squash Chicken Pad Thai
Ij8OuOPDwVCSWT1sHbmK.notes: Prep: 20 minutes<SEP>Cook: 40 minutes<SEP>6 servings<SEP>339 kcal per serving

Ip7bSyOqbvmpMtVFPMqO.ingredients: 1 cup low sodium chicken broth<SEP>3/4 teaspoon seasoning salt<SEP>1/2 teaspoon Italian seasoning<SEP>1/4 teaspoon black pepper<SEP>4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts (or thighs)
Ip7bSyOqbvmpMtVFPMqO.directions: Place broth, seasoning salt, Italian seasoning and pepper into the Instant Pot inner pot. Stir.<SEP>Add the chicken breasts (no trivet necessary!) and put the lid on.<SEP>Turn valve to sealing, and select Manual (or Pressure Cook), high pressure for 10 minutes. <SEP>Once the cook time is over, turn the Instant Pot off and let the pressure release naturally for 10 minutes.<SEP>Release pressure, open the lid and drain about half of the liquid. Shred the chicken breasts with the remaining liquid in the pot, and serve as desired. To freeze, let cool to room temperature before placing in freezer bags.
Ip7bSyOqbvmpMtVFPMqO.name: Shredded Chicken (Instant Pot)

J2PCB6h6iUW98KOf49GB.name: Lemoncello Ice Cream
J2PCB6h6iUW98KOf49GB.directions: Add 1/2 c heavy cream to a medium bowl, with a mesh strainer set on top. Set aside.<SEP>Add milk, remaining 1 cup heavy cream, sugar, and salt to a medium saucepan. Cook, stirring occasionally, over medium-low heat until sugar has dissolved and mixture is steaming.<SEP>In a small bowl, whisk yolks. Continue to whisk yolks while slowly adding 1 cup warm milk mixture to temper it in. Pour egg mixture into saucepan. Continue cooking until mixture coats the back of a wooden spoon or rubber spatula. <SEP>Pour through a mesh strainer into reserved heavy cream. Cook to room temperature, cover and refrigerate until thoroughly chilled, roughly 4-6 hours or overnight.<SEP>Churn according to manufacturer's directions. In the last several minutes of churning, add spoonfuls of lemon curd. Continue churning until fully combined. Transfer to a freezer-safe container. Freeze until firm.<SEP>Top with roasted almonds when serving.
J2PCB6h6iUW98KOf49GB.ingredients: 1 1/2 c heavy cream<SEP>1 1/2 c whole milk<SEP>3/4 c granulated sugar (less if your lemon curd is very sweet)<SEP>1/4 tsp salt<SEP>5 egg yolks<SEP>1 c lemon curd<SEP>Roasted almonds

JX729bMoZnToo9UlYdd1.ingredients: 1 tablespoon olive or coconut oil<SEP>1 small red onion, diced<SEP>2 garlic cloves, minced<SEP>1- inch fresh ginger, peeled and minced<SEP>1 serrano chili pepper, seeded and minced<SEP>1 teaspoon ground cumin<SEP>1 teaspoon garam masala<SEP>¼ teaspoon coriander<SEP>One 15-ounce can diced tomatoes<SEP>1 teaspoon sea salt<SEP>One 15-ounce can unsweetened full fat coconut milk<SEP>1 cup red lentils<SEP>5 ounces baby spinach<SEP>1 avocado (optional)
JX729bMoZnToo9UlYdd1.directions: In a large stock pot or Dutch oven, heat the oil. Saute the onion over medium-high heat until soft, 5 minutes. <SEP>Add the garlic, ginger, serrano, cumin, garam masala, and coriander. Cook until very fragrant, 2 minutes. <SEP>Carefully pour in the tomatoes and add the salt, scraping up any brown bits that formed on the bottom of the pan. <SEP>Cook, stirring occasionally, until the liquid has reduced and the tomato chunks have softened, 5 minutes. <SEP>Add the coconut milk and 1 cup water. Bring to a boil over high heat. <SEP>Stir in the lentils and reduce the heat to medium-low. Cook until the lentils are tender, 25-35 minutes, stirring occasionally.<SEP>Fold in the spinach and cook until wilted, 3 minutes. Top with avocado, serve with rice.
JX729bMoZnToo9UlYdd1.name: Red Lentil and Spinach Masala

K1XwvRTGLgKKOo6EPSb3.ingredients: 1 (18.25 oz.) box cake mix (I used yellow - Super Moist Betty Crocker)<SEP>1 tsp. baking powder<SEP>2 eggs<SEP>1/2 cup vegetable oil<SEP>1 cup semisweet chocolate chips
K1XwvRTGLgKKOo6EPSb3.name: Cake Batter Chocolate Chip Cookies
K1XwvRTGLgKKOo6EPSb3.directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a medium bowl, stir together the cake mix and baking powder. Add eggs and oil, then mix until well blended. Stir in chocolate chips, or your choice of additions. Drop by rounded spoonfuls onto cookie sheets. Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven.  Allow cookies to cool on baking sheets for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

KHCEC2p7kJ3cByY8dHPY.directions: Mix hot water, salt, sugar, shortening, yeast, and 1/2 of the flour. Mix well. Add egg and mix.<SEP>Add remaining flour and mix. Knead in mixer 6-7 minutes.<SEP>Let rest 10-15 minutes. <SEP>Roll out dough to about 1/2 inch thickness. Cut out with biscuit cutter. Pull a little, dip in butter, fold in half so the top is longer than the bottom. <SEP>Raise 15-30 minutes. Bake for 12-15 minutes at 400°-425°F.
KHCEC2p7kJ3cByY8dHPY.ingredients: 1 1/2 c. hot water<SEP>1 tsp. salt<SEP>1/4 c. sugar<SEP>2 T. shortening<SEP>1 T. yeast<SEP>3-3 1/2 c. flour<SEP>1 egg
KHCEC2p7kJ3cByY8dHPY.name: Dinner Rolls

Kb0jMt1taAtofLjz8iCe.name: Peanut Brittle
Kb0jMt1taAtofLjz8iCe.ingredients: 1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda<SEP>1 cup plus 1 teaspoon water, divided<SEP>1 teaspoon vanilla<SEP>1 1/2 cups sugar<SEP>1 cup light corn syrup<SEP>3 tablespoons butter or margarine<SEP>3 cups unsalted raw Spanish peanuts
Kb0jMt1taAtofLjz8iCe.directions: Calibrate thermometer.<SEP>Generously grease a 15 1/2x12-inch jelly roll pan with butter.<SEP>Grease long metal turner with butter; set aside.<SEP>In small bowl, mix baking soda, 1 teaspoon water, and vanilla, and stir until baking soda is dissolved. Set aside.<SEP>In 4-quart saucepan, mix sugar, 1 cup water, and corn syrup.<SEP>Cook over high heat, stirring constantly until mixture boils. Wash down sides of the pan and wash your stirring spoon to cool it down. Turn the heat down to medium-high. Cook, stirring occasionally, until candy thermometer reads 240°F.<SEP>Stir in butter and peanuts. Be careful! This is when the mixture is most likely to burn. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, to 300°F. Immediately remove from heat. Because this syrup is extremely hot and continues to cook itself, you may wish to remove your brittle 5°F sooner than the recipe indicates and watch the thermometer for the right temperature)<SEP>Quickly stir in baking soda mixture until candy mixture is light and foamy.<SEP>Quickly pour the candy mixture around the outside edge of the jelly roll pan, working toward the middle to fill the pan. Use the buttered turner to aid in spreading the brittle. Do not scrape the insides of the cooking pan-this could trigger the candy to crystalize, producing a grainy texture in the brittle. Cool brittle completely. When the mixture is cooled, break into pieces.

Kra7mpWeLzN08eDeRevr.ingredients: 2 (14.5-ounce) cans white beans<SEP>1 tablespoon canola oil<SEP>1 medium jalapeno pepper, minced<SEP>2 medium poblano peppers, chopped<SEP>1 large onion, chopped<SEP>4 garlic cloves, minced<SEP>Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper<SEP>1 tablespoon ground cumin<SEP>1 1/2 teaspoons ground coriander<SEP>1 teaspoon ancho chili powder<SEP>4 cups low-sodium chicken broth<SEP>2 limes, juiced, plus lime wedges, for serving<SEP>1 rotisserie chicken, skin removed and meat shredded<SEP>1/4 cup chopped cilantro leaves<SEP>Sour cream, for topping<SEP>Tortilla chips, coarsely crushed, for topping
Kra7mpWeLzN08eDeRevr.name: White Chicken Chili
Kra7mpWeLzN08eDeRevr.directions: Drain and rinse the canned white beans. In a medium bowl, mash half of the beans with a potato masher until chunky. Reserve the beans until needed.<SEP>Add the canola oil to a large Dutch oven and heat it over medium-high heat. Add the peppers, onions, and garlic and saute until soft and fragrant, about 5 minutes. Season the vegetables with salt, and pepper, to taste. Add the cumin, coriander, and chili powder and continue to saute for 1 more minute to toast the spices. Stir in the chicken stock, and lime juice and bring to a simmer. Add the beans and continue to simmer for 20 more minutes.<SEP>After 20 minutes of simmering, taste for seasoning, and adjust if necessary. Stir in the shredded rotisserie chicken and cilantro and simmer until heated through, about 5 more minutes. Serve the chili in individual bowls topped with a dollop of sour cream, crushed tortilla chips, and lime wedges.

L8swXet0Qq0dw1EVV1Df.ingredients: 1 pre-made chocolate graham cracker crust (the oreo one doesn't taste right)<SEP>1/2 bottle hot fudge sauce<SEP>1 8-oz. pkg cream cheese<SEP>1 c. granulated white sugar<SEP>1 c. peanut butter, creamy<SEP>3 c. cool whip for silk<SEP>2 c. cool whip for top
L8swXet0Qq0dw1EVV1Df.name: Peanut Butter Silk Pie
L8swXet0Qq0dw1EVV1Df.directions: Heat up hot fudge in microwave and then pour a half inch thick layer over the botom of the graham cracker crust<SEP>In a mixing bowl, whip together the sugar, peanut butter, and cream cheese, then carefully stir in the 3 cups of cool whip. this is the peanut butter silk. Pour into pie pan on top of the hot fudge.

LDqrtp8267YCWB7oNozL.notes: fill to the 6 line in the instant pot
LDqrtp8267YCWB7oNozL.name: Yogurt (Instant Pot)
LDqrtp8267YCWB7oNozL.directions: Make sure the vent on top of the unit is turned toward "sealing" and the unit is plugged in.<SEP>With the inner pot in place, pour in 1/2 gallon whole milk.<SEP>Push the Yogurt button, then Adjust.<SEP>The word "More" will light up, and the word "Boil" will appear on the display. <SEP>The unit will then begin heating the milk. It took exactly 26 minutes for the Instant Pot to heat 1/2 gallon of milk to 180Â°F, the target temperature for Phase One. "Yogt" appears on the display when complete.<SEP>Remove the lid from the Instant Pot. Do not let condensation from the lid drip into the milk.<SEP>In order to "hold" the milk at 180Â°F for 5 minutes, press Yogurt and Adjust again. This turns the heat back on. Even though the lid is now off and the milk won't reach a boil, this additional heating time will ultimately create thicker yogurt without the need for milk powders or other thickeners. Hit Keep Warm/Cancel when complete.<SEP>Unplug the unit. Carefully remove the inner pot and place on a wire rack. Cool the milk to 115Â°F, the target temperature for Phase Two. To speed cooling, set the inner pot (only! not the entire Instant Pot!) in a shallow bowl of icy water and stir gently. Test the milk frequently with a thermometer or affix a candy thermometer to the side of the pot. Without the ice bath, the cooling process took 37 minutes. Lift off and discard any milk "skin."<SEP>Place 2 tablespoons active yogurt into a medium bowl. This is your starter.<SEP>Ladle 1/2 cup of the warm milk into the starter. Scrape the milky starter back into the inner pot.<SEP>Return the inner pot to the Instant Pot. Remove the thermometer. Close the lid. Plug in the unit. During this phase, the vent can actually be pointed in either direction.<SEP>Push the Yogurt button. Add time using the (+) key to reach 8 hours. Go about your day (or night).<SEP>In 8 hours, your yogurt will be fully set and "Yogt" will appear on the display. Ladle into clean containers or jars and refrigerate for several hours before enjoying. Yield: 7 cups yogurt
LDqrtp8267YCWB7oNozL.ingredients: 1/2 gallon (8 cups) whole milk<SEP>2 tablespoons active yogurt (yoplait, dannon work well)

LMae79cRzeHEeePt4Hq2.directions: Heat a large pot over medium heat. Once hot, add oil, onion, ginger, and carrots. Season with a pinch each sea salt and black pepper and stir. Cook for 3-5 minutes, stirring frequently, until onions are soft and fragrant.<SEP>Add garlic and potatoes and stir. Cook for 3-4 minutes to brown slightly, and then add curry powder. Stir to coat. Cook 2 minutes more.<SEP>Add lesser amount of vegetable broth (5 cups or 1200 ml as original recipe is written // adjust if altering batch size) and increase heat to medium-high. Once at a low boil, add lentils, stir, and reduce heat to low. Simmer for 20-25 minutes, uncovered, or until lentils and potatoes are tender.<SEP>Taste and adjust seasonings, adding coconut sugar for a little sweetness (optional), more curry powder for intense curry flavor, or sea salt and pepper for more balance. I added more of each.<SEP>If the soup has thickened too much, add remaining vegetable broth (1 cup or 240 ml as original recipe is written // adjust if altering batch size) , stir, and cook until warmed through.<SEP>In the last few minutes of cooking, add the kale and cover to steam until tender but still vibrant green - about 2-3 minutes.<SEP>Serve immediately as is or with cilantro and fresh lemon juice (optional).
LMae79cRzeHEeePt4Hq2.ingredients: 1 Tbsp coconut oil (or sub a neutral oil, such as avocado)<SEP>1 cup diced yellow or white onion<SEP>1 tsp minced fresh ginger<SEP>2 medium whole carrots (peeled and chopped)<SEP>1 pinch sea salt + black pepper (plus more to taste)<SEP>4 cloves garlic, minced (yields ~2 Tbsp as original recipe is written)<SEP>3 cups diced potatoes (I used 1/2 peeled sweet potato, 1/2 unpeeled baby yellow potato)<SEP>1 1/2 Tbsp curry powder<SEP>5-6 cups vegetable broth (or store-bought- I like Imagine brand)<SEP>1 cup green lentils (thoroughly rinsed and drained)<SEP>1 Tbsp coconut sugar (optional // plus more to taste)<SEP>4 cups chopped green or purple kale<SEP>For serving:<SEP>Fresh chopped cilantro<SEP>Lemon juice<SEP>Bread or Flatbread
LMae79cRzeHEeePt4Hq2.name: Curry Soup with Lentils and Potatoes

LWC3JpSCRTodHzLQrZAn.name: Chocolate Peanut Butter Bars
LWC3JpSCRTodHzLQrZAn.ingredients: ¾ cup shortening<SEP>¾ cup margarine<SEP>1 ½ cups sugar<SEP>1 ½ cups brown sugar<SEP>3 eggs<SEP>1 ½ cup peanut butter<SEP>1 ½ tsp. soda<SEP>¾ tsp. salt<SEP>1 tsp. vanilla<SEP>3 cups oatmeal<SEP>3 cups flour<SEP><SEP>½ cup margarine<SEP>4 Tbsp. milk<SEP>3 Tbsp. cocoa
LWC3JpSCRTodHzLQrZAn.notes: For the frosting, do a 1.5 batch.
LWC3JpSCRTodHzLQrZAn.directions: Mix sugars and shortening/butter.  <SEP>Add eggs one at a time, then peanut butter.  <SEP>Next add vanilla, stir, and soda and salt then flour and oatmeal.  Press into two greased jelly roll pans.  <SEP>Bake separately at 350 for 10 to 12 min.  Let cool 10 minutes.  CAREFULLY Spread with a thin layer of peanut butter.  <SEP>Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat only till the butter melts then remove from heat, then add milk and cocoa, beat in 1 tsp. vanilla and enough powdered sugar to make a soft but not soupy frosting. <SEP>Pour over peanut butter bars and spread carefully.

Lc1MGQN4qxByZFhPKsbq.ingredients: 2 cups all-purpose flour, (spooned and leveled)<SEP>1 cup confectioners' sugar<SEP>1 teaspoon coarse salt<SEP>1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon lemon zest<SEP>1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice<SEP>1 cup (2 sticks) unsalted butter, cut into pieces<SEP>2 large egg yolks<SEP>1/4 cup granulated sugar, for rolling
Lc1MGQN4qxByZFhPKsbq.directions: In a food processor, pulse flour, confectioners' sugar, salt, and lemon zest until combined. Add butter and process until sandy. Add egg yolks and lemon juice; pulse until dough comes together. Divide dough in half and form each into a 1 1/2-inch-wide log. Wrap in plastic and freeze until firm, about 2 hours (or up to 1 month).<SEP>Preheat oven to 350 degrees, with racks in upper and lower thirds. Spread granulated sugar on a piece of parchment; roll logs over sugar to coat. Slice logs into 1/4-inch-thick slices and arrange, 1 inch apart, on two parchment-lined baking sheets. Bake until cookies are golden brown around edges, about 15 minutes, rotating sheets halfway through. Transfer cookies to wire racks to cool.
Lc1MGQN4qxByZFhPKsbq.name: Lemon Icebox Cookies

M0WZtT2Nsmsg1eotzBg8.ingredients: 1/4 cup olive or vegetable oil<SEP>6 cups fresh corn kernels , from 8-10 shucked cobs (save some cobs for simmering in the soup)<SEP>1 cup chopped yellow onion<SEP>1/4 teaspoon ancho chili powder<SEP>kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper<SEP>2 large garlic cloves , chopped (about 1 tablespoon)<SEP>4 cups chicken or vegetable broth<SEP>1/2 cup sour cream<SEP>1/2 cup grated dry/aged Cotija cheese , plus additional for garnish (substitute Parmesan or Romano if Cotija is unavailable)<SEP>1 tablespoon fresh lime juice<SEP>1 teaspoon grated lime zest<SEP>2 tablespoons plus 2 teaspoons chopped cilantro , divided
M0WZtT2Nsmsg1eotzBg8.directions: Heat oil in a large, nonstick pot or cast iron Dutch oven until shimmering. Add corn kernels, chopped onion, chili powder, 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, and 1/2 teaspoon black pepper. Cook over medium-high heat, stirring frequently, until onions are soft and corn is lightly charred in spots, about 8-10 minutes.<SEP>Add garlic and cook until fragrant, 1 minute. Remove 1-1/2 cups of corn mixture from the pot and set aside. Stir broth and 6 stripped corn cobs into the pot, scraping up the brown bits on the bottom. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer for 20 minutes.<SEP>Use tongs to remove corn cobs from pot and discard.<SEP>Stir sour cream and Cotija into the soup. Transfer soup to a blender or food processor (in batches, depending on the size of your unit for safety) to puree until smooth.<SEP>Return soup to pot and if needed, gently reheat to desired serving temperature. Stir in half (3/4 cup) of the reserved corn mixture, lime juice, and 2 tablespoons chopped cilantro. Season to taste with salt, pepper, and chili powder.<SEP>Toss remaining 3/4 cup corn with lime zest and 2 teaspoons chopped cilantro. Serve soup, topped with a few spoonfuls of the corn mixture, and an extra sprinkling of Cotija.
M0WZtT2Nsmsg1eotzBg8.name: Elote Soup

M2zRweKrsqnmUXhZffss.ingredients: 1 pound red potatoes (scrubbed clean and dried)<SEP>3-4 Tbsp vegan butter (or olive oil)<SEP>1 tsp sea salt<SEP>1/2 tsp garlic powder<SEP>1/2 tsp ground black pepper
M2zRweKrsqnmUXhZffss.name: Breakfast Potatoes
M2zRweKrsqnmUXhZffss.directions: Heat a skillet to medium heat, or an electric skillet to 350 degrees F (176°C).<SEP>"Bake" your potatoes in the microwave for 4-6 minutes total (flipping once halfway through) until they have a little give when squeezed. Alternatively, bake them in a 400-degree F (204°C) oven placed directly on the rack for roughly 20-35 minutes, depending on their size, until soft to the touch.<SEP>Cut cooked potatoes into bite-sized pieces (I usually quarter mine), and place vegan butter 1 Tbsp at a time onto the hot skillet. Only add enough to accommodate all of your potatoes.<SEP>TIP: Place potatoes, one by one, onto the skillet directly in the melted butter ensuring both exposed cut sides touch the butter and get some cook time in the skillet. This will ensure all sides get crispy brown.<SEP>Once all potatoes are on the skillet, spray the top with avocado or olive oil (optional) and season with half of the seasonings. Spraying them with oil helps the seasonings stick to the skin.<SEP>After about 4 minutes, use a fork or spatula to tip the potato over onto its other side to brown evenly.<SEP>After another 3-4 minutes, flip the potatoes on their backsides (skin side down) and season with remaining salt, pepper and garlic powder. Cook for another 2-4 minutes until crispy and golden brown on all sides.<SEP>Serve with hot sauce or Whiskey BBQ ketchup. These potatoes go great with omelets and Southwest Tofu Scramble.

M4YtD7H1EzcO3hMxEB0k.directions: Heat oven to 350<SEP>Mix eggs, cake mixes and shortening<SEP>Roll into small balls<SEP>Bake 8-10 minutes<SEP>Let cool on cookie sheet
M4YtD7H1EzcO3hMxEB0k.name: Homemade Oreos
M4YtD7H1EzcO3hMxEB0k.ingredients: 2 Devils Food Cake Mixes<SEP>4 Eggs<SEP>1 1/2 C. Short<SEP><SEP>#Filling:<SEP>8 oz. Cream Cheese<SEP>3 C. Powdered Sugar<SEP>1/2 Stick Butter

MEqLqgi4TmUFfNQ5wsgL.name: Health Nut Loaf Bread
MEqLqgi4TmUFfNQ5wsgL.ingredients: 1 tablespoon active dry yeast<SEP>1/2 teaspoon white sugar<SEP>1-3/4 cups warm water<SEP>1-3/4 cups warm water<SEP>2 tablespoons honey<SEP>2 tablespoons molasses<SEP>1/4 cup vegetable oil<SEP>1 egg<SEP>1 tablespoon lemon juice <SEP>3-1/2 cups whole wheat flour<SEP>2 tablespoons flax seed<SEP>2 tablespoons cracked wheat<SEP>2 tablespoons and 1/4 teaspoon sunflower seeds<SEP>2 teaspoons salt<SEP>2 cups bread flour
MEqLqgi4TmUFfNQ5wsgL.directions: In a small bowl, dissolve the yeast and sugar in 1/2 cup warm water. In a large bowl, mix remaining 3 1/2 cups warm water, honey, molasses, oil, eggs and lemon juice. Mix well. Add yeast mixture and stir.<SEP><SEP>Gradually add 5 cups whole wheat flour beating well after each addition. Add the flax, cracked wheat and sunflower seeds, stir well.<SEP><SEP>Let stand for 20 minutes, until mixture is very light. Stir in salt and the rest of the flours until dough pulls away from the sides of the bowl.<SEP><SEP>Knead 10 to 15 minutes until dough is smooth and elastic. Put into a greased bowl and cover, let rise in the oven with light on until doubled, about 1 hour.<SEP><SEP>Punch down and shape into 6 round balls. Cover and let rest for 20 minutes.<SEP><SEP>Form into loaves and let rise covered in oven until doubled. Bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) 25-35 minutes.

MtYn6xW2cU527aiFLGEt.name: Poppyseed Dressing
MtYn6xW2cU527aiFLGEt.directions: Mix all ingredients in a jar, cover and shake well to combine<SEP>Use immediately or store covered in fridge<SEP>Makes approximately 4 servings
MtYn6xW2cU527aiFLGEt.ingredients: 1/2 tsp. Salt<SEP>1 Tbsp. Honey<SEP>2 Tbsp. White Vinegar<SEP>1/4 C. Plain Greek Yogurt<SEP>1 Tbsp. Olive Oil<SEP>1 tsp. Poppy Seeds

N7yb0pYSFMZM5P8OUys7.ingredients: 1 cup warm whole milk (105-110 degrees F)<SEP>1 (1/4-ounce) packet active dry yeast<SEP>4 tablespoons honey, divided<SEP>1/3 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature<SEP>1 large egg, at room temperature<SEP>1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour<SEP>1/2 teaspoon kosher salt<SEP>2 cups whole wheat flour<SEP>2 tablespoons melted unsalted butter
N7yb0pYSFMZM5P8OUys7.name: Honey Whole Wheat Dinner Rolls
N7yb0pYSFMZM5P8OUys7.directions: Combine milk, yeast and 1 tablespoon honey in a small bowl; let stand until foamy, about 5 minutes.<SEP><SEP>In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with paddle attachment, beat butter and remaining 3 tablespoons honey on medium speed until well combined, about 1-2 minutes. Beat in egg until well combined. Beat in yeast mixture, all-purpose flour and salt until a smooth batter forms.<SEP>Using the dough hook, gradually add whole wheat flour, 1/2 cup at a time, until a soft, smooth ball of dough is formed. The dough should feel elastic and slightly tacky to the touch. Increase speed to medium-high and beat for 3 minutes.<SEP>Lightly oil a large bowl or coat with nonstick spray; place dough in bowl, turning to coat. Cover with a clean dishtowel and let stand in a warm spot until dough has doubled in size, about 45 minutes to 1 hour.<SEP>Gently deflate dough by punching down. Roll into a 15-inch rope; cut into 15 1-inch pieces, pressing each piece into a disk, then shaping into a ball.<SEP>Lightly oil a 9×13 baking dish or coat with nonstick spray. Place dough balls into the prepared baking dish; brush tops with butter. Cover with a clean dishtowel and let stand in a warm spot until dough has doubled in size, about 30-45 minutes.<SEP>Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Place into oven and bake until golden brown, about 18-22 minutes.<SEP>Serve warm.

OI6s5BWkSHFsNl0exVQe.ingredients: 1 1/2 c. warm water<SEP>1 Tbsp. sugar<SEP>2 tsp. kosher salt<SEP>1 pkg. active dry yeast<SEP>4 1/2 c. all-purpose flour<SEP>2 oz. unsalted butter, melted<SEP>vegetable oil, for pan<SEP>10 c. water<SEP>2/3 c. baking soda<SEP>1 large egg yolk beaten with 1 tbsp water<SEP>extra kosher or pretzel salt
OI6s5BWkSHFsNl0exVQe.directions: 1. Combine the water, sugar, & kosher salt in the bowl of a stand mixer. Sprinkle yeast on top. Allow to sit for 5 minutes or until the mixture begins to foam. Add the flour and butter.<SEP>2. Using dough hook attachment, mix on low speed until well combined. Knead dough until its smooth and pulls away from sides of bowl. 4-5 minutes. Remove from bowl and place in a metal or glass bowl slightly oiled with vegetable oil. Cover and let sit in a warm place for about an hour or until dough has doubled in size.<SEP>3. Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Line 2 baking sheets with parchament paper and lightly brush with vegetable oil. Set aside.<SEP>4. Bring the 10 cups of water and the baking soda to a roiling boil in a large saucepan.<SEP>5. In the meantime, turn dough out onto a slightly oiled work surface and divide into about 16 twenty-four inch ropes. (if you want to make regular shaped pretzels at this point: make a U shape with the rope, holding ends of rope, cross them over each other and press into the bottom of the U.) Or you can cut the ropes into 2 inch nuggets.<SEP>6. As you work place the nuggets or pretzels on your parchament baking sheet and (for the regular pretzels, place 1 by 1 into the boiling water for about 30 seconds) for the nuggets, I placed about a whole rope's worth in the water at the same time. 30 seconds, remove from water with a large slotted spatula and return to one of your baking sheets.<SEP>7. Brush the top of each pretzel or nugget with your egg wash mixture and sprinkle with salt. (Cinnamon sugar is good too!!) Bake until dark golden brown in color, approximately 12-14 minutes. Let cool on a cooling rack for at least 5 minutes prior to serving.
OI6s5BWkSHFsNl0exVQe.name: Homemade Soft Pretzels

OPwL2CTSW2e37RTQyYAw.ingredients: 6 Egg Yolks<SEP>Juice of Half a Lemon (about 1 1/2-2 Tbsp)<SEP>Zest of Half a Lemon<SEP>1 1/2 Sticks of Butter, melted and mostly cooled<SEP>Pinch of Salt<SEP>Pinch of Cayenne Pepper
OPwL2CTSW2e37RTQyYAw.name: Hollandaise Sauce

OXwh8SNcUW5VdjipV6MY.name: 100% Whole Grain Wheat Bread
OXwh8SNcUW5VdjipV6MY.directions: Place the first five ingredients in the bowl and mix.<SEP>Add: 2 Cups 100% Whole Grain Wheat Flour. (to cool the water and end up with warm dough) Mix then add 2 Tbs of Dry Active Yeast. If your not sure about your yeast proof it in a little warm water first.<SEP>Add: 4 Cups of 100% Whole Grain Wheat Flour.<SEP>Mix until the consistency is some what even. Then continue to slowly add flour 1/2 Cup at a time until the dough quits sticking to the sides of the bowl. It should be tacky to the touch. The trick is to have enough consistency to stand up with the least amount of flour so the bread will be fluffy. It will most likely be 6 1/2 cups but in any case do not exceed 7 1/2 cups of wheat flour. You can trade one cup of wheat flour for one cup of all purpose white if you wish. Don't over mix or the bread will be tough.<SEP>When your dough is finished, leave it in the mixer, cover the bowl and let it rise for about 30-45 minutes. The dough will be larger but it doesn't need to double.<SEP>Grease two bread pans with Crisco. You can also flour the pans to reduce sticking.<SEP>Mix the dough again just enough to knock it down at least close to the original size.<SEP>Drop the dough on a floured surface so you can work the dough and shape it. Shape it with your hands to make a nice ball getting enough flour on it so it isn't sticky. Divide the ball in half and do it again. Shape the loaves by turning the dough under it's self over and over. When the dough is shaped the sides and ends will be sealed and all you will see is a nice oblong shaped loaf with smooth sides and top. Drop the loaves in your bread pans and let them rise until almost doubled. Bake in a preheated oven at 350 for 36 minutes. If you forgot to preheat 41 minutes. (gas oven).<SEP>When done turn the bread out of the pan to a rack to cool. You can eat it right away (a great time for real butter) don't wrap it until completely cooled. (Condensation will make it soggy) Put in tinfoil to store on the counter. If you put it in the refrigerator it will turn into a brick. Enjoy.
OXwh8SNcUW5VdjipV6MY.ingredients: 2 3⁄4 cups hot water<SEP>1⁄3 cup olive oil, any oil is fine<SEP>1⁄3 cup honey<SEP>2 tablespoons molasses<SEP>1 tablespoon salt, Sea Salt is good<SEP>7 1⁄2 cups of 100% whole grain wheat flour<SEP>2 tablespoons dry active yeast

OZvglblibYo2t6T4U2PG.name: カレーライス (Instant Pot)
OZvglblibYo2t6T4U2PG.ingredients: 2-3 onions<SEP>2 carrots<SEP>3 Yukon gold potatoes<SEP>2 cloves garlic<SEP>1 tsp ginger<SEP>1½ lb boneless skinless chicken thighs (1½ lb = 680 g)<SEP>salt (kosher or sea salt; use half if using table salt)<SEP>Freshly ground black pepper<SEP>1 Tbsp neutral flavor oil (vegetable, canola, etc)<SEP>3 cups chicken stock/broth (3 cups = 720 ml)<SEP>1 package Japanese curry roux (1 package = 8.4 oz, 240 g) <SEP>1 Tbsp ketchup<SEP>1 Tbsp soy sauce<SEP>Furkujinzuke (red pickled daikon) (for garnish)
OZvglblibYo2t6T4U2PG.directions: Chop/mince all vegetables/meat<SEP>Season meat with salt/pepper<SEP>Press the “Sauté” button on your Instant Pot and heat 1 Tbsp. vegetable oil.<SEP>When the pot is hot, add the onion, minced garlic and ginger.<SEP>Add the chicken to the pot and coat with oil.<SEP>Add carrot and potato to the pot and mix well.<SEP>Add 3 cups (720 ml) chicken broth and curry roux from one box (8.4 oz, 240 g). I use ½ package mild and ½ package medium spicy. Use spatula to push down some ingredients but keep the curry roux blocks on top (no mixing). <SEP>Cover and lock the lid. Make sure the steam release handle points at “sealing” and not “venting”. Press the “Keep Warm/Cancel” button on the Instant Pot to stop sauté. Press the “meat/Stew” button to switch to the pressure cooking mode. Press “minus” button to change the cooking time to 15 minutes.<SEP>When it is finished cooking, the Instant Pot will switch automatically to a “Keep Warm” mode. Slide the steam release handle to the "Venting" position to let out steam until the float valve drops down, OR let the pressure release naturally (takes about 15 mins).<SEP>Unlock the lid and add 1 Tbsp ketchup and 1 Tbsp soy sauce (if you use homemade curry, add it before ketchup and soy sauce.  Change to saute mode for additional 5 minutes until homemade curry roux blends well). Mix well and make sure all the curry roux has been dissolved. Transfer to a serving dish. Garnish with Fukujinzuke (red daikon pickles).

OceFNJemtaFS6CjtVMRp.directions: Preheat oven to 375 F. Blend the first 4 ingredients together in a food processor, blender, or Vitamix until it looks like flour. Mix with remaining ingredients to form a dough. If too dry, slowly add the third tbsp milk. Using a cookie scoop or your hands, roll or form into balls, and place on a greased cookie sheet. Press down a little to flatten. Cook 6 minutes, then take out when still a bit undercooked. Let sit 10 minutes before handling, and they firm up. Makes a small batch, so feel free to double the recipe!
OceFNJemtaFS6CjtVMRp.name: Gluten-free Chocolate Chip Cookies
OceFNJemtaFS6CjtVMRp.ingredients: 1 1/2 cups rolled oats<SEP>1/2 tsp baking soda<SEP>1/4 tsp salt<SEP>1/2 cup sugar, unrefined if desired<SEP>1/4 cup chocolate chips<SEP>2 tbsp oil or melted buttery spread<SEP>2-3 tbsp milk of choice (start with 2)

P83cV9IzsV6Gao4xwErQ.ingredients: 1 cup butter, room temperature<SEP>1 1/4 cup sugar<SEP>1 egg<SEP>1 1/2 tsp vanilla extract<SEP>3 cups flour<SEP>1 1/2 tsp baking powder<SEP>1/4 tsp salt<SEP>1/4 cup sugar<SEP>1 1/2 tsp cinnamon
P83cV9IzsV6Gao4xwErQ.name: Snickerdoodle Cookies
P83cV9IzsV6Gao4xwErQ.directions: Preheat oven to 350<SEP>Cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy.<SEP>Add in egg and vanilla and mix until combined.<SEP>In a separate bowl combine dry ingredients - flour, baking powder and salt, and mix to combine.<SEP>Slowly add flour mixture to butter mixture, mixing well between each addition.<SEP>The dough should not be sticky and should not be crumbly. If it is sticky, mix in flour one tablespoon at a time until it becomes not sticky. If the mixture is crumbly, mix in water one teaspoon at a time until the dough holds together.<SEP>Mix cinnamon and sugar together and place on a plate.<SEP>Measure dough with a 1/4 cup measure and roll into balls. <SEP>Roll each ball to coat well in the cinnamon sugar mixture and place on a cookie sheet lined with a silpat liner or parchment paper.<SEP>Bake at 350F for 12-15 minutes or until the center is just set.<SEP>Let cool 2 minutes on tray then cool on a wire rack.

PE0hMCYF0ffCC5thF0fo.name: Navajo Tacos
PE0hMCYF0ffCC5thF0fo.directions: #filling<SEP>Heat olive oil in a 12-inch non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Add onions and saute 2 minutes, add garlic and saute 20 seconds. Scoot mixture to the side then crumble beef into skillet. <SEP>Season with salt and pepper and cook stirring occasionally and breaking up beef when stirring, until beef has browned and cooked through. Drain fat from beef and return to skillet. <SEP>Stir in chili powder, cumin, paprika, kidney beans, canned diced tomatoes and green chilis then season mixture with salt and pepper to taste. <SEP>Cover and simmer for 10-15 minutes (if you used the tomato sauce you can add in a few tbsp of water to thin a little if needed). <SEP>Using a slotted spoon, spoon mixture over fry bread, then top with lettuce, cheese, tomatoes and sour cream (and any of the other optional toppings listed). Serve immediately.<SEP><SEP>#frybread<SEP>In a mixing bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, yeast and salt. Whisk melted butter into warm milk and pour milk mixture into dry ingredients.<SEP>Stir until mixture comes together and slightly forms a ball, dough should be fairly sticky (if needed you can add in a little more flour or a little more water to reach a good consistency but try not to overwork the dough).<SEP>Cover dough with plastic wrap and allow to rest 5 - 10 minutes. <SEP>Heat 1 inch of oil in a large cast iron skillet to 350 - 360 degrees over stove top.<SEP>Divide rested dough into 8 equal pieces. <SEP>Working with floured hands and one piece of dough at a time (keep other pieces covered with plastic wrap), pat dough out on a lightly floured surface into a 6-inch circle and gently drop into hot oil, and cook until golden brown, then flip and cook opposite side until golden brown.<SEP>Remove from oil and drain onto a plate or baking sheet lined with paper towels. <SEP>Serve warm with Navajo taco filling or for dessert, spread with honey butter.
PE0hMCYF0ffCC5thF0fo.ingredients: #filling<SEP>1 Tbsp olive oil<SEP>3/4 cup yellow onion, diced<SEP>2 cloves garlic finely minced<SEP>1 lb lean ground beef<SEP>2 tsp chili powder<SEP>1 tsp ground cumin<SEP>1/2 tsp paprika<SEP>1 (15 oz) can dark red kidney beans, drained and rinsed<SEP>1 (14.5 oz) can petite diced tomatoes, drained (or sometimes I used an 8 oz can of tomato sauce instead)<SEP>1 (4 oz) can diced green chilis<SEP>Salt and pepper, to taste<SEP><SEP>#toppings<SEP>Romaine or Iceberg lettuce, chopped<SEP>Shredded cheddar or Monterey Jack cheese<SEP>Roma tomatoes, diced<SEP>Sour cream<SEP>Sliced black olives and chopped cilantro (optional)<SEP><SEP>#frybread<SEP>2 1/4 cups all-purpose flour<SEP>2 tsp baking powder<SEP>1/2 tsp rapid rise or active dry yeast<SEP>1/2 tsp salt<SEP>1 cup warm milk (110 degrees)<SEP>1 Tbsp butter or shortening, melted<SEP>Vegetable oil, for frying

PJquGaDeNpfVmYpj9KBt.directions: To 3 small cups, add 1/4 cup of coolish water to each.  In 1 of the cups add the lipase and stir to combine (it won't dissolve completely).  To another cup add citric acid and stir to combine.  To the final cup, add the animal rennet and stir to combine.<SEP>Pour milk into the pot of the Instant Pot and clip a thermometer on to the side (or have one close by so you can closely watch the milk temperatures).  Press yogurt and adjust until it says “boil”.<SEP>Warm milk to 55°F.<SEP>When milk reaches 55° F, use a whisk and stir while pouring in lipase mixture.  Continue to whisk briskly while pouring in citric acid mixture<SEP>Continue to heat milk until it reaches 88°F; press cancel to turn off the Instant Pot.<SEP>Gently stir in rennet mixture using a slow up and down motion with the whisk, about 30 seconds.  Place a lid on the pot for 5-10 minutes, until there is a clear separation of the whey, otherwise known as a “clean break”.  The whey should be clear and yellow.  If it is still whitish or milky looking, put the lid on and wait another 5 minutes.<SEP>Using a long knife, spatula, or off set icing spatula (basically something long enough to reach to the end of the pot) Cut the curds by making 4 or 5 vertical cuts from the top to the bottom of the pot.  Then repeat this process on the other side to make a checkered pattern on the top.<SEP>Press yogurt, adjust to “boil”, and lightly stir the curds until the temperature reaches 105°F.  The temperature will vary slightly depending on where your thermometer is in the  curds and whey, so just move your thermometer around and take the pot off the heat once it reaches an average of 105°F.  Cover the pot and let sit 1 minute.<SEP>Using a slotted spoon, scoop large curds into a strainer (the Euro Cuisine yogurt strainers work great for this) and press lightly to remove some whey.  Tear 3 pieces of plastic wrap (large enough to wrap 3 balls of your final mozzarella) and set them to the side (don't stack them on to of each other!)<SEP>Transfer curds to a microwave safe pyrex bowl and microwave curds for 1 minute.<SEP>Tip: This next step will need some food safe gloves because the cheese is about to get quite hot!<SEP> Gently fold the the cheese over and over then drain the released whey.  Microwave for another 35 seconds, gently fold cheese over and over, drain released whey.  One last time – microwave for another 35 seconds, drain excess whey, sprinkle with 1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt, and continue to fold and knead until cheese becomes smooth, shiny, and stretches like taffy (this is my favorite part!).<SEP>Working quickly so the cheese doesn't cool and become unstretchable, break cheese into 3 pieces and create a tight, smooth ball shape with each.<SEP>You can eat it hot at this point (so good!) or shape it and chill it for later.  It will store in the fridge for 1-2 weeks.<SEP>Tip:  While the cheese is hot, it will not maintain the shape very well.  I like to wrap it tightly in a piece of plastic wrap and twist the plastic wrap to create a tight ball.  Once the mozzarella cools, it will maintain this round shape.  You can also try dipping the hot mozzarella in  ice water for a 10 seconds, but I feel like the plastic wrap works better.
PJquGaDeNpfVmYpj9KBt.ingredients: 1 gallon whole or 2% milk (see notes about milk brands to use)<SEP>3/4 cup water (divided)<SEP>1/4 teaspoon lipase (optional, see note)<SEP>2 teaspoons citric acid<SEP>1/4 teaspoon single strength liquid animal rennet<SEP>1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt
PJquGaDeNpfVmYpj9KBt.name: Mozzarella Cheese (Instant Pot)
PJquGaDeNpfVmYpj9KBt.notes: The mozzarella is the best when eaten warm right after it's made.  Chilling the mozzarella will change its texture a bit, but it is still delicious!  Cube it up for skewers, slice it up for topping pizza or grilled cheese sandwiches, or partially freeze it, then shred it.  If you have extra, I have frozen the cheese successfully.  In fact, I insist that it melts and oozes better after it has been frozen and thawed!<SEP>As I mentioned above, lipase is optional. I feel like it makes a softer more flavorful cheese, but you can definitely make it without.

PYBhJDxu3sMBOGXbcJqD.directions: In a large mixing bowl, mix all ingredients. Make sure it is mixed well so that you can form the balls easily. Chill the mixture in the fridge for an hour so that balls will bind together. Roll the balls into about a 1inch diameter and keep in freezer for on the go.
PYBhJDxu3sMBOGXbcJqD.ingredients: 1 C. Rolled Oats<SEP>1 C. Steel Cut Oats<SEP>1/3 C. Coconut Flakes<SEP>1 C. Rice Crispy Cereal<SEP>1 C. Nut Butter<SEP>1 C. Ground Flax Seed<SEP>2/3 C. Chocolate Chips (I prefer mini)<SEP>3/4 C. Raw Honey<SEP>2 tsp. Vanilla<SEP>2 Tbsp. Coconut Oil (put inside or rub on hands when rolling nalls<SEP>
PYBhJDxu3sMBOGXbcJqD.name: Protein Balls

PYJVySaWc8AUNLESCp5H.ingredients: 1  cup plain yogurt<SEP>¼  cup water<SEP>¾  tablespoon sugar<SEP>¼  cup fresh or canned mango pulp (see note)<SEP>½  teaspoon ground cardamom seeds (plus a little extra for garnish)<SEP>3  ice cubes
PYJVySaWc8AUNLESCp5H.directions: Place all ingredients in a blender and puree until smooth. Add sugar to taste. Garnish with a pinch of ground cardamom seeds. A few extra ice cubes may be added when serving.
PYJVySaWc8AUNLESCp5H.name: Mango Lassi

PYSUStKSPYoXn73eyPKj.name: Coconut and Honey-Glazed Carrots
PYSUStKSPYoXn73eyPKj.ingredients: 2 pounds medium carrots (about 12 carrots), trimmed and peeled<SEP>2 tablespoons coconut oil<SEP>2 tablespoons honey<SEP>Salt and pepper, to taste
PYSUStKSPYoXn73eyPKj.directions: Place the carrots in a large, deep skillet and add in 1/2” of water. Cover and heat over medium-high heat until the carrots are just barely fork tender (do not overcook), about 10 minutes. Drain carrots, and return them to the skillet.<SEP>Return the skillet to medium heat. Add in the coconut oil and honey and gently toss carrots to coat. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

QE9e0tLVJHjUlq3uTT1Z.ingredients: 1 package (2 1/4 teaspoon) Active dry yeast<SEP>3 tablespoons Warm water 105F- 115 F<SEP>1 can coconut milk 14-15oz divided in half<SEP>4 tablespoons (56.8 grams) unsalted butter<SEP>1 large egg<SEP>¼ cup (30 grams) powdered milk I used full fat milk<SEP>½ cup (100 grams) Sugar<SEP>½-1 teaspoon (2.84 grams) salt<SEP>3 1/2 cups (448 grams) to 3 3/4 cups all purpose flour<SEP>2 -3 tablespoon (28.12 grams to 42.18 grams) raw sugar (optional for the top}
QE9e0tLVJHjUlq3uTT1Z.name: Pani Popo (Samoan Coconut Rolls)
QE9e0tLVJHjUlq3uTT1Z.directions: In a standing mixer combine 3-tablespoon lukewarm water and yeast. Let it sit until dissolve for about 5 minutes.<SEP><SEP>Meanwhile in a microwave safe medium bowl, combine 1 cup coconut milk, with the butter pieces, sugar, salt and microwave for about a minute. Stir until everything is melted. Lightly whisk in the egg and powdered milk to the butter mixture (if the mixture is too hot let it cool to a warm mixture to prevent eggs from curding.)<SEP>Dump everything into the yeast mixture.<SEP>Mix for 2 minutes at medium speed. Add about 3 ½ cups of flour and continue mixing dough.<SEP>Add in enough additional flour (if needed) to make soft dough.<SEP>Turn dough on lightly floured surface and knead for 8 to 12 minutes or more if you want airy bread.<SEP>Place dough in a greased bowl, turning once to coat the dough Cover loosely with a clean cloth and let rise in a warm, draft-free place for 1 to 2 hours or until doubled.<SEP>Punch the dough down.<SEP>At this point the dough maybe shaped into a grease loaf pan, and place seam side down in the pan or divide dough into 12 equal pieces. Shape into balls.<SEP>Place in greased 12 -inch round pan and bake. You may refrigerate before baking for up to 24 hours.<SEP>Preheat the oven to 350 F. Add the remaining coconut milk in the pan. Brush the top of the loaf with coconut milk and sprinkle with sugar. Bake until the crust is deep golden brown and the bottom of the loaf sounds hollow when tapped, 20 to 25 minutes.<SEP>Remove from the baking pan and let it cool. I like to eat mine when it is still warm.

Qe443EzkhIh1dGGrYYZI.directions: #Crumb Topping<SEP>Whisk flour, sugar, and salt in a medium bowl. Stir in nuts. Add butter; using your fingertips, work butter into dry ingredients until large, moist crumbs begin to form. Set topping aside. DO AHEAD: Can be made 5 days ahead. Cover and chill.<SEP>#Cake<SEP>Preheat oven to 350°. Coat pan with nonstick spray. Line bottom with parchment paper; set aside. Whisk flour, cornmeal, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a medium bowl; set aside.<SEP>Using an electric mixer on medium speed, beat 3/4 cup sugar and butter in a medium bowl until light and fluffy, 3–4 minutes. Beat in vanilla. Add eggs one at a time, beating to blend between additions and occasionally scraping down sides of bowl, until mixture is pale and fluffy, 3–4 minutes longer.<SEP>With mixer on low speed, add dry ingredients to bowl in 3 additions, alternating with buttermilk in 2 additions, beginning and ending with dry ingredients. Pour half of batter into prepared pan and smooth top. Whisk remaining 3 Tbsp. sugar and cinnamon in a small bowl; sprinkle evenly over batter in pan. Spoon remaining batter over; smooth top.<SEP>Toss blueberries with panko in a small bowl; scatter evenly over batter. Sprinkle crumb topping over blueberries.<SEP>Bake cake until top is golden brown and a tester inserted into the center comes out clean, 55–65 minutes. Let cool completely in pan.
Qe443EzkhIh1dGGrYYZI.notes: DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 day ahead. Store airtight at room temperature.
Qe443EzkhIh1dGGrYYZI.ingredients: #Crumb topping<SEP>1/2 cup all-purpose flour<SEP>1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons (packed) dark brown sugar<SEP>1/2 teaspoon kosher salt<SEP>1/4 cup pecans, toasted, chopped<SEP>3 tablespoons chilled unsalted butter, cut into 1/4-inch cubes<SEP>#Cake<SEP>Nonstick vegetable oil spray<SEP>1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour<SEP>1 tablespoon cornmeal<SEP>1/2 teaspoon baking powder<SEP>1/2 teaspoon baking soda<SEP>1/4 teaspoon kosher salt<SEP>3/4 cup plus 3 tablespoons sugar, divided<SEP>6 tablespoons (3/4 stick) unsalted butter, room temperature<SEP>1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract<SEP>2 large eggs<SEP>1 cup buttermilk<SEP>1 tablespoon ground cinnamon<SEP>2 cups fresh (or frozen, thawed) blueberries (about 10 ounces)<SEP>1 tablespoon panko (Japanese breadcrumbs)
Qe443EzkhIh1dGGrYYZI.name: Old-fashioned Blueberry Coffee Cake

QtluQOp6ZfYhDKzvYg87.directions: Adjust an oven rack to the middle position and heat the oven to 375 degrees. Generously coat a 12-cup muffin tin with vegetable oil spray.<SEP>Whisk the flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt together in a large bowl. In a separate bowl, whisk the sugar, eggs, melted butter, and vanilla until smooth. Gently fold the egg mixture into the flour mixture with a rubber spatula until just combined. Fold the carrots, pineapple, coconut, raising, and nuts into the batter. Do not overmix.<SEP>Use a large ice-cream scoop or measuring cup to divide the batter evenly among the muffin cups. Bake until golden and a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out with just a few crumbs attached, 25 to 30 minutes.<SEP>Let the muffins cool in the pan for 5 minutes, then flip out onto a wire rack and let cool for 10 minutes before serving.
QtluQOp6ZfYhDKzvYg87.ingredients: 2 1/4 c. all-purpose flour<SEP>2 t. baking soda<SEP>1 t. cinnamon<SEP>1/2 t. salt<SEP>1 1/4 c. sugar (can be reduced)<SEP>3 large eggs<SEP>8 T. unsalted butter, melted and cooled<SEP>1 t. vanilla extract<SEP>4 carrots, peeled and grated (2 cups)<SEP>1 8-oz. can crushed pineapple, drained and pressed with paper towels<SEP>1/2 c. sweetened shredded coconut<SEP>1/2 c. raisins (I use craisins)<SEP>1/2 c. walnuts or pecans, toasted and coarsely chopped
QtluQOp6ZfYhDKzvYg87.name: Morning Glory Muffins

RBie1FcSnChDsYryvmiK.notes: These sink in the middle - try to gather the batter in the middle before baking.<SEP>Make Ahead & Freezing Instructions: Blondies remain fresh up to 2 weeks stored covered at room temperature or in the refrigerator. Blondies freeze well, up to 3 months. Thaw overnight in the refrigerator.<SEP>Tip: The blondies will look like they are not fully done because the center will be quite gooey, but that’s what you want! After about 30 minutes of cooling, they will be easy to cut using a serrated knife.<SEP>Sprinkles: Do not use black sprinkles swirled into the blondies. It will turn the batter black before baking.
RBie1FcSnChDsYryvmiK.ingredients: 1 box yellow or vanilla cake mix<SEP>1/4 cup vegetable or canola oil<SEP>1 large egg<SEP>1/3 – 1/2 cup milk (less is better)<SEP>1/2 cup sprinkles<SEP>1/2 cup white chocolate chips
RBie1FcSnChDsYryvmiK.directions: Preheat oven to 350°F (177°C). Spray 11×7 baking pan with nonstick spray.<SEP>Combine first four ingredients in a large bowl. Add the milk slowly. You want to cake batter to be as dense & thick as possible. Mix in the sprinkles and white chocolate chips. Pour into prepared baking pan, sprinkle a few more sprinkles on top, and bake for 25-30 minutes until edges are just turning brown.<SEP>Allow to cool for at least 30 minutes so the center sets, before cutting into squares.
RBie1FcSnChDsYryvmiK.name: Cake Batter Blondies

RUnFxiGxkJpEkGqHOp78.directions: In a small bowl, mix together dressing ingredients.<SEP>Add to veggies in bowl and toss. Refrigerate overnight or for a few hours to enhance flavor. <SEP>Just before serving, add avocados.
RUnFxiGxkJpEkGqHOp78.name: Cowboy Caviar
RUnFxiGxkJpEkGqHOp78.ingredients: 2 cans black beans (15 oz), drained and rinsed<SEP>2 cans black eyed peas (15 oz), drained and rinsed<SEP>2 cups frozen corn (or 2 cans corn, drained)<SEP>6-8 roma tomatoes, diced<SEP>1 large red onion, chopped<SEP>2 jalapeños, chopped fine<SEP>3 cloves garlic, minced<SEP>3-4 avocados, diced (add just before serving)<SEP><SEP>#Dressing<SEP>2 tablespoons red wine vinegar<SEP>4 tablespoons lime juice<SEP>1 tsp salt<SEP>3/4 tsp pepper<SEP>1 tsp cumin
RUnFxiGxkJpEkGqHOp78.notes: I like more flavor. Double the dressing.

RhVv9Cr6p2ImgmD2tWPR.directions: In a mortar and pestle, pound garlic and chilies to a paste. Add palm sugar and pound until dissolved. Add cilantro roots and pound to a paste. Add fish sauce and lime juice, stir to mix. Store in the fridge in a tightly sealed container.
RhVv9Cr6p2ImgmD2tWPR.name: Nam Jim Seafood (Thai Seafood Sauce)
RhVv9Cr6p2ImgmD2tWPR.ingredients: 2-5 Thai chilies<SEP>4 cloves garlic<SEP>5-6 cilantro stems, chopped<SEP>2 T. fish sauce<SEP>3 T. lime juice<SEP>2 t. finely chopped palm sugar

S0B0UMCovkOyvlhSlOZU.directions: In a stand mixer bowl, combine 1 ¾ cup bread flour, ¼ cup cake flour, 3 Tbsp granulated sugar, 1 tsp kosher salt, and 1 ¼ tsp instant dry yeast. Whisk all together.<SEP>Set your mixer with a dough hook attachment.<SEP>Add 1 large beaten egg and 3 ½ Tbsp milk and 3 ½ Tbsp water, both which have been kept at 86°F, to the bowl with dry ingredients.<SEP>Start kneading on low speed (speed 2). Use a silicon spatula to scrape the sides and bottom of the bowl a couple of times.<SEP>Continue to knead until it clings to the hook and cleans the sides of the bowl.<SEP>Once dough starts to come together, add the butter and continue to mix on low speed until butter has been incorporated. Then increase speed to medium and knead until dough is silky, smooth and elastic.<SEP>When the dough gets silky and smooth, pull the end of your dough with your thumb and fingers. Keep spreading the dough with your fingers, stretching the dough into thin translucent membrane. This test is called Windowpane Test to see if the dough's gluten has been developed enough. If the dough tears, the gluten isn’t quite ready yet. Knead the dough for another 2 minutes and test again.<SEP>Shape the dough into a ball by pulling all sides of the ball to the bottom and pinching them together. Place the dough in a bowl (the seam on the bottom).<SEP>Cover the bowl with a plastic wrap and let the dough rise in a warm place until the dough has doubled in size, about 1-2 hours. I use a Proof setting (100°F / 38C) in my oven.<SEP>Now for the biscuit dough...<SEP>In a clean stand mixer bowl, add about 4 Tbsp unsalted butter and ½ cup granulated sugar.<SEP>Mix until well blended and smooth.<SEP>Slowly add very small amount of 1 large beaten egg into the bowl and blend well together before you add another small amount of the egg. Continue until all the egg is well blended.<SEP>Sift 1 ½ cup + 2 Tbsp cake flour and ½ tsp baking powder to the mixture.<SEP>Mix until it’s incorporated and the dough is not floury. Then take out the dough and form into a ball.<SEP>Roughly cut the dough into 10 pieces.<SEP>Roll the 10 pieces of biscuit dough into 10 balls. Place them on a baking sheet lined with silicone baking mat or baking sheet. Cover with plastic wrap and rest in the refrigerator for 10 minutes until it hardens a bit.<SEP>Now back to the main dough!<SEP>Once the dough has doubled in size, dust your index finger with flour and put it in the center of the dough. If the hole doesn’t close, then the dough is ready for next step.<SEP>Remove the dough with silicone dough scraper and transfer to a lightly floured work surface. Press the dough with your hands to release gas in the dough and deflate.<SEP>Fold the dough in thirds and then fold in thirds again. Flip to keep the seam side on the bottom. Shape the dough into a ball. To close the seam line, rotate the dough (clockwise) with both hands while the seam line is touching the work surface.<SEP>Using a dough scraper, roughly cut the dough into 10 equal pieces.<SEP>Shape each dough piece into a nice round ball, pulling from all the sides and tuck into the bottom. Place the dough on your left (right) palm, and rotate it with your right (left) hand, keeping the seam side on the bottom.<SEP>Put the dough on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or silicone baking mat. Cover the dough with plastic wrap (I use a cupcake holder lid) to prevent from drying. Rest the dough for 15 minutes at room temperature.<SEP>Put the Biscuit Dough on the lightly floured work surface and flatten the dough with your hand.<SEP>Using a rolling pin, roll out into 4 inch (10-12 cm) flat rounds. Continue the rest until the main dough is ready.<SEP>After 15 minute of resting, flatten the main dough with your hand and fold in thirds.<SEP>Then fold in thirds one more time and pinch both ends to shape the dough into a ball.<SEP>Pull the dough from all sides towards the seam on the bottom. Place the dough on your left (right) palm, and rotate it with your right (left) hand a few times, keeping the seam side on the bottom.<SEP>Place the Biscuit Dough on your palm and put the Main Dough in the middle, seam side facing up.<SEP>Then flip to show the Biscuit Dough on top. Gently pull all sides of the Biscuit Dough wrapping around the Main Dough.<SEP>Coat the Biscuit Dough with granulated sugar (2 Tbsp) and remove the excess sugar. Then using a dough scraper or knife, gently score the Biscuit Dough into crisscross pattern (I score 3 lines each side).<SEP>Place the dough on the baking sheet, seam side on the bottom. Cover the dough with plastic wrap to prevent from drying.<SEP>Let the dough rise in a warm place until the dough rises one and a half (1.5 x) in size, about 50 minutes (I used the Proof setting (100F / 38C) in my oven).<SEP>When the dough has risen half way, preheat the oven to 350F (180C). Note: If you are using the oven for proof, you have to transfer the dough to a warmer place so you can preheat the oven.<SEP>Bake at for 13-15 minutes. Toward the end of baking if you see the bread is not being browning evenly, rotate the bread once so that the bread gets even color.<SEP>Once bread is baked, transfer to a wire rack and let it cool. Keep in an airtight container or bag after it’s been cooled. Enjoy!
S0B0UMCovkOyvlhSlOZU.ingredients: Main Dough:<SEP>1 ¾ cup bread flour<SEP>Scant ¼ cup cake flour<SEP>1 tsp kosher/sea salt (use half for table salt)<SEP>3 Tbsp sugar<SEP>1 ¼ tsp instant dry yeast<SEP>1 large egg (beaten)<SEP>3 ½ Tbsp whole milk (keep at 86°F)<SEP>3 ½ Tbsp water (keep at 86°F)<SEP>2 ½ Tbsp unsalted butter (cut into small cubes and at room temp)<SEP>Biscuit Dough:<SEP>4 Tbsp (room temp)<SEP>½ cup sugar<SEP>1 large egg (beaten)<SEP>1 ½ cup + 2 Tbsp cake flour <SEP>½ tsp baking powder<SEP>Sugar for sprinkling
S0B0UMCovkOyvlhSlOZU.name: Melon Pan メロンパン

STDUD7uBsOSZd2iPPcIa.ingredients: 16 Boston Bibb or butter lettuce leaves<SEP>1 pound lean ground beef<SEP>1 tablespoon cooking oil<SEP>1 large onion, chopped<SEP>1/4 cup hoisin sauce<SEP>2 cloves fresh garlic, minced<SEP>1 tablespoon soy sauce<SEP>1 tablespoon rice wine vinegar<SEP>2 teaspoons minced pickled ginger<SEP>1 dash Asian chile pepper sauce, or to taste (optional)<SEP>1 (8 ounce) can water chestnuts, drained and finely chopped<SEP>1 bunch green onions, chopped<SEP>2 teaspoons Asian (dark) sesame oil
STDUD7uBsOSZd2iPPcIa.name: Beef Lettuce Wraps
STDUD7uBsOSZd2iPPcIa.directions: Rinse whole lettuce leaves and pat dry, being careful not tear them. Set aside.<SEP>Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir beef and cooking oil in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain and discard grease; transfer beef to a bowl. <SEP>Cook and stir onion in the same skillet used for beef until slightly tender, 5 to 10 minutes. Stir hoisin sauce, garlic, soy sauce, vinegar, ginger, and chile pepper sauce into onions. Add water chestnuts, green onions, sesame oil, and cooked beef; cook and stir until the onions just begin to wilt, about 2 minutes.<SEP>Arrange lettuce leaves around the outer edge of a large serving platter and pile meat mixture in the center.

Sk5zP0DU8wQJYCoNuUak.name: Mexican Chicken Corn Chowder
Sk5zP0DU8wQJYCoNuUak.directions: In a Dutch oven, brown chicken and onion in butter until chicken is no longer pink. Add garlic; cook 1 minute longer. Add the water, bouillon and cumin; bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 5 minutes.<SEP>Stir in the cream, cheese, corn, chiles and hot pepper sauce. Cook and stir over low heat until cheese is melted; add tomato. If desired, top with cilantro and tortilla strips.
Sk5zP0DU8wQJYCoNuUak.ingredients: 1-1/2 pounds boneless skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch pieces, or canned chicken<SEP>1/2 cup chopped onion<SEP>3 tablespoons butter<SEP>2 garlic cloves, minced<SEP>1 cup hot water<SEP>2 teaspoons chicken bouillon granules<SEP>1/2 to 1 teaspoon ground cumin<SEP>2 cups half-and-half cream<SEP>2 cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese<SEP>1 can (14-3/4 ounces) cream-style corn<SEP>1 can (4 ounces) chopped green chiles, undrained<SEP>1/4 to 1 teaspoon hot pepper sauce<SEP>1 medium tomato, chopped<SEP>Optional: Minced fresh cilantro and fried tortilla strips

T9hGyyGTXKQeydHacEut.ingredients: 2.5 C. of diced rotisserie chicken or any other cooked chicken}<SEP>3 C. broccoli florets broken down into bite-sized pieces<SEP>1 can cream of chicken soup can use low-sodium or Healthy Request<SEP>1.5-2 C. cooked rice<SEP>1 1/2 C. shredded cheese<SEP>1 C. mayonnaise <SEP>3/4-1 C crushed corn flakes<SEP>3 Tbsp. butter melted
T9hGyyGTXKQeydHacEut.directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine all ingredients into a greased 9x13 baking dish. I use a 9x13 because we like extra room for our corn flakes {more crunch!} but the original recipe will fit into an 8x8 or 9x9 baking dish.<SEP>Mix up all the ingredients except corn flakes and butter right in the baking dish.<SEP>Sprinkle the crushed corn flakes over the top of the casserole.<SEP>Drizzle melted butter over the top.<SEP>Bake for 30-35 minutes or until casserole is heated through.
T9hGyyGTXKQeydHacEut.name: Broccoli Chicken Casserole
T9hGyyGTXKQeydHacEut.notes: Try doing half mayo half greek yogurt. <SEP>Original recipe says 2 C of each broccoli, chicken and rice. We wanted to change up the quantities.

TDh7cwIEgFmLBoOf0Xnw.ingredients: #CHICKEN<SEP>4 skinless chicken breast halves<SEP>olive oil<SEP>1 lemon, juiced<SEP>2 t. crushed garlic<SEP>1 t. salt<SEP>1 1/2 t. black pepper<SEP>1/2 t. paprika<SEP>1/2 t. oregano<SEP>1/2 t. thyme<SEP><SEP>#SALAD<SEP>1 head romaine lettuce- rinsed, dried and chopped<SEP>1 red onion, thinly sliced<SEP>1 (6 ounce) can kalamata olives<SEP>1 green bell pepper, chopped<SEP>1 red bell pepper, chopped<SEP>2 large tomatoes, chopped<SEP>1 cucumber, sliced<SEP>1 cup crumbled feta cheese<SEP><SEP>#DRESSING<SEP>6 tablespoons olive oil<SEP>1 large garlic clove, minced<SEP>1 teaspoon dried oregano<SEP>1 lemon, juiced<SEP>1/2 teaspoon salt<SEP>ground black pepper to taste
TDh7cwIEgFmLBoOf0Xnw.name: Greek Chicken Salad
TDh7cwIEgFmLBoOf0Xnw.directions: Marinate chicken. Pan fry, then cut into strips.<SEP>In a large salad bowl, combine the Romaine, onion, olives, bell peppers, tomatoes, cucumber and cheese.<SEP>Whisk together the olive oil, oregano, lemon juice and black pepper.
TDh7cwIEgFmLBoOf0Xnw.notes: Hugh prefers this with chicken, but Marie prefers salmon.

TIMEKbD6k4ps866S8mBL.ingredients: 1/3 cup fresh lime juice<SEP>1/2 cup olive oil<SEP>1 clove garlic, minced<SEP>1 teaspoon salt<SEP>1/8 teaspoon ground cayenne pepper<SEP>2 (15 ounce) cans black beans, rinsed and drained<SEP>1 can corn kernels<SEP>1 avocado - peeled, pitted and diced<SEP>1 red bell pepper, chopped<SEP>2 tomatoes, chopped, or fire roasted canned tomatoes<SEP>6 green onions, thinly sliced<SEP>1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro (optional)
TIMEKbD6k4ps866S8mBL.name: Black Bean and Corn Salad
TIMEKbD6k4ps866S8mBL.directions: Place lime juice, olive oil, garlic, salt, and cayenne pepper in a small jar. Cover with lid, and shake until ingredients are well mixed.<SEP>In a salad bowl, combine beans, corn, avocado, bell pepper, tomatoes, green onions, and cilantro. Shake lime dressing, and pour it over the salad. Stir salad to coat vegetables and beans with dressing, and serve.

TS0RIGFU9M6wvvRpYPBb.name: Black Bean and Couscous Salad
TS0RIGFU9M6wvvRpYPBb.ingredients: 1 cup uncooked couscous<SEP>1 ¼ cups chicken broth<SEP>3 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil<SEP>2 tablespoons fresh lime juice<SEP>1 teaspoon red wine vinegar<SEP>½ teaspoon ground cumin<SEP>8 medium (4-1/8" long)s green onions, chopped<SEP>1 red bell pepper, seeded and chopped<SEP>¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro<SEP>1 cup frozen corn kernels, thawed <SEP>2 (15 ounce) cans black beans, drained<SEP>Salt and pepper to taste
TS0RIGFU9M6wvvRpYPBb.notes: 30 mins<SEP>8-10 servings<SEP>253 calories per serving [full nutrition info on website]
TS0RIGFU9M6wvvRpYPBb.directions: Bring chicken broth to a boil in a 2 quart or larger sauce pan and stir in the couscous. <SEP>Cover the pot and remove from heat. <SEP>Let stand for 5 minutes.<SEP><SEP>In a large bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lime juice, vinegar and cumin. <SEP>Add green onions, red pepper, cilantro, corn and beans and toss to coat.<SEP><SEP>Fluff the couscous well, breaking up any chunks. <SEP>Add to the bowl with the vegetables and mix well. <SEP>Season with salt and pepper to taste and serve at once or refrigerate until ready to serve.

TjI7la7FRujboh8G0ovD.directions: Wash, peel, and cube potatoes. Place in 2-quart saucepan and add enough water to just cover potatoes.<SEP>Heat to boiling, then reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 20 to 30 minutes, or until potatoes are tender when pierced with a fork. Drain.<SEP>Slide the pan back and forth with potatoes over low heat to dry, making potatoes fluffier.<SEP>Mash potatoes in the pan with potato masher or hand mixer.<SEP>Add milk in small amounts, mashing after each addition, until potatoes reach desired consistency. Add margarine and ranch dressing mix.
TjI7la7FRujboh8G0ovD.name: Herbed Mashed Potatoes
TjI7la7FRujboh8G0ovD.ingredients: 8 medium potatoes (about 3 Ibs.)<SEP>1/2 to 3/4 cup milk<SEP>5 tablespoons margarine, softened<SEP>1 package ranch dressing mix

TrETqJa2GDtlnhTkaov2.directions: #Dough <SEP>Put all ingredients in mixer, but start with just 2 cups of flour<SEP>Add the rest of the flour in mixer until it becomes a soft dough (about 6 to 7 cups)<SEP>Dough should all combine in the center of the bowl<SEP>Remove dough from mixer and place in separate bowl<SEP>Let rise for at least 1 hour over a hot surface with a hot towel on top<SEP><SEP>#Pretzels <SEP>Shape dough<SEP>Dip dough in hot water and baking soda (about 3 cups water, ½ cup baking soda)<SEP>Bake on cooking sheet at 350 degrees for about 15 minutes, or until the pretzel becomes golden brown<SEP>After baking, dip in coating (cinnamon and sugar, butter and salt, etc.)
TrETqJa2GDtlnhTkaov2.name: Simple Homemade Pretzels
TrETqJa2GDtlnhTkaov2.ingredients: 4.5 cups water<SEP>⅔ cups sugar<SEP>½ cup vegetable oil<SEP>4 teaspoons salt<SEP>9 teaspoons yeast<SEP>~8 cups flour

UZgjI1BLotfkjWvk0DRZ.directions: In large pot saute; the onions, garlic, and ginger in a little olive oil for about 5 minutes.<SEP>Add the water, lentils, chick peas, white kidney beans, diced tomatoes, carrots, celery, garam masala, cardamom, cayenne pepper and cumin. Bring to a boil for a few minutes then simmer for 1 to 1 1/2 hours or longer, until the lentils are soft.<SEP>Puree half the soup in a food processor or blender. Return the pureed soup to the pot, stir and enjoy!
UZgjI1BLotfkjWvk0DRZ.name: Moroccan Lentil Soup
UZgjI1BLotfkjWvk0DRZ.ingredients: 2 onions, chopped<SEP>2 cloves garlic, minced<SEP>1 t. grated fresh ginger<SEP>6 c. water<SEP>1 c. red lentils<SEP>1 15-oz. can garbanzo beans, drained<SEP>1 19-oz. can cannellini beans<SEP>1 14.5-oz. can diced tomatoes<SEP>1/2 c. diced carrots<SEP>1/2 c. chopped celery<SEP>1 t. garam masala<SEP>1 1/2 t. ground cardamom<SEP>1/2 t. ground cayenne pepper<SEP>1/2 t. ground cumin<SEP>1 T. olive oil

Ue2yk0cSSmcicCzFUFVk.ingredients: 2 cups cranberries, picked over<SEP>2 cups water<SEP>2 cups sugar, plus more for coating<SEP>More sugar for coating.
Ue2yk0cSSmcicCzFUFVk.notes: Snack on these by themselves, or use to fill/garnish a cranberry bundt cake.
Ue2yk0cSSmcicCzFUFVk.directions: Place the cranberries in a medium glass bowl and set aside.<SEP>Make a simple syrup by bringing the water and sugar just to a simmer in a medium saucepan. Let the syrup cool for a couple minutes and then pour it over the cranberries. If the syrup is too hot the cranberries will burst, so be careful. Cover and refrigerate overnight.<SEP>The next day, drain the cranberries and toss them with larger grained sugar until they are well coated. I only use a scoop of sugar at a time, and small batches of cranberries, so the sugar doesn't get too damp. Place the coated cranberries on a baking sheet to dry for a few hours.<SEP>Do a second toss with the regular granulated sugar, this typically takes care of any sticky spots on the cranberries. Let dry another hour or so.
Ue2yk0cSSmcicCzFUFVk.name: Sparkling Cranberries

VGRPoEwTj4c9WvEjM8Qj.ingredients: 2 pounds boneless skinless chicken breast<SEP>1 tablespoon smoked paprika<SEP>1/2 teaspoon onion powder<SEP>Salt and Pepper<SEP>2 cloves of garlic<SEP>1/2 cup white wine<SEP>1/2 cup chopped onion<SEP>1/4 cup chopped Chiles<SEP>1/4 cup chopped red bell pepper<SEP>1 dried Guajillo Chile<SEP>1 cup chicken stock<SEP>1/2 cup heavy cream<SEP>3 tablespoons unsalted butter
VGRPoEwTj4c9WvEjM8Qj.notes: This photo is terrible, but the recipe is yummy.
VGRPoEwTj4c9WvEjM8Qj.directions: Salt and pepper the chicken breast and rub all over with paprika.<SEP>Repeat on the other side.<SEP>Heat olive oil until very hot in a large, heavy pan.<SEP>Add chicken breasts in to the pan, just 2 at a time - don't crowd.<SEP>When the chicken is golden turn and brown on the other side.<SEP>Remove from pan to a greased baking dish.<SEP>Repeat until all of the chicken is browned.<SEP>Add a little more oil to the pan if needed.<SEP>Saute the onions, garlic and peppers, except guajillo, until just softened.<SEP>Remove from the pan and spoon over the chicken.<SEP>Add the wine carefully to the hot pan and scrape up any bits of chicken or vegetables that may be clinging to the bottom.<SEP>Add the chicken stock, cream, and guajillo chile.<SEP>Simmer until the sauce is reduced by at least half and has thickened, about 10 minutes.<SEP>Remove the guajillo and discard.<SEP>Taste sauce for flavor and adjust seasoning.<SEP>Pour over the chicken and bake at 375F for 15 to 20 minutes or until an instant read thermometer registers 160F when inserted in the chicken.<SEP>Let stand 5 minutes before serving.
VGRPoEwTj4c9WvEjM8Qj.name: Creamy Guajillo Chicken

VHifWm1kEWSog71tk318.directions: Add 1 c raw lentils, water, bay leaf to a pot. Bring the pot to a boil, reduce heat to a very low simmer, cover the pot with a lid and cook for 20-30 minutes or until tender but not mushy. Drain.<SEP>Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium-high. Add onion; sauté 4 minutes. Add zucchini and garlic; cook 3 minutes. Add tomato, curry powder, and ketchup; cook 1 minute, stirring constantly.<SEP>Combine stock and flour in a small bowl. Add stock mixture to pan; bring to a boil.<SEP>Stir in salt and lentils; cook 3 minutes. <SEP>Remove pan from heat; stir in lime juice. <SEP>Garnish with yogurt and cilantro.
VHifWm1kEWSog71tk318.ingredients: 2 teaspoons olive oil <SEP>1 (8-oz.) pkg. chopped yellow onion <SEP>2 cups chopped zucchini <SEP>2 garlic cloves, thinly sliced <SEP>1 cup chopped seeded tomato <SEP>2 tablespoons curry powder <SEP>2 tablespoons unsalted ketchup <SEP>2 cups unsalted vegetable stock <SEP>2 tablespoons all-purpose flour <SEP>1/2 teaspoon kosher salt <SEP>1 (17.6-oz.) pkg. steamed cooked lentils (about 2 1/2 cups) <SEP>2 tablespoons fresh lime juice <SEP>2 tablespoons plain whole-milk yogurt (not Greek-style) <SEP>1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro
VHifWm1kEWSog71tk318.name: Curried Lentil and Vegetable Stew

VJ5TwjR3mGwyITRQfoan.name: Whole Wheat Empanadas
VJ5TwjR3mGwyITRQfoan.directions: #FILLING<SEP>Place flank steak in a saucepan. Cover with water to 1 inch above steak; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low; cover and simmer 1 hour or until steak is very tender and pulls apart easily. Transfer steak to a plate, reserving 1 cup cooking liquid. Cool steak completely; slice crosswise into thirds. Shred each piece; set aside. (If using ground beef, brown it.)<SEP>Heat oil and annatto, if desired, in a small saucepan over medium heat 1 minute or until oil begins to bubble. Remove from heat; steep 10 minutes. Strain into a medium Dutch oven over medium-high heat; discard seeds. Add onion and bell pepper; cook 2 minutes or until softened. Add tomato, cumin, salt, black pepper, and garlic; cook 2 minutes or until mixture begins to thicken. Add steak (or ground beef), reserved cooking liquid, olives, and carrot, stirring to combine. <SEP>Bring mixture to a boil; cover, reduce heat to low, and simmer for 10 minutes or until carrot is tender.
