Uncover, increase heat to medium, and cook 15 minutes or until almost all of liquid evaporates. Remove from heat; cool completely. Cover and chill 2 hours or, preferably, overnight.<SEP><SEP>#DOUGH<SEP>Combine flours and salt in a large bowl, stirring with a whisk. Make a well in center of flour mixture. Combine wine and oil in well, stirring with a fork until moist. When dough begins to form, use fingers to continue to mix until a ball forms. Turn dough and any remaining flour in bowl out onto a work surface; knead 2 minutes or until dough is smooth. Wrap dough tightly in plastic wrap, and let stand at room temperature for 1 hour.<SEP>Roll dough out to 1/8-inch thickness on a very lightly floured surface; cut as many 5-inch circles as possible using a round cutter or knife (use a saucer as a template). Cover circles with a kitchen towel. Gather scraps, cover with plastic wrap, and let rest 20 minutes; repeat procedure with remaining dough for a total of 15 circles. Stack circles between single layers of parchment paper. Use dough disks as directed in empanada recipes, or store, wrapped and chilled, for up to 24 hours. (Disks can also be frozen for up to 1 month. Thaw overnight in the refrigerator. Lightly dust with flour before using.)<SEP><SEP>#ASSEMBLY<SEP>Combine 1 teaspoon water and egg in a small bowl. Divide cold filling into 15 equal portions (about 3 generous tablespoons each). Keep filling chilled while making empanadas. Moisten edges of 1 dough disk with egg mixture; place 1 portion of filling in center. Fold dough over filling to form a half-moon shape. Gently press edges between thumb and index finger to form a border; crimp border using fork tines to seal. Place empanada on prepared pan. Repeat procedure with remaining dough and filling.<SEP>Lightly brush tops of empanadas with egg mixture. Bake at 400° for 23 minutes (or fry) until tops are golden brown, rotating pans in oven halfway through baking. Serve with hot sauce, if desired.
VJ5TwjR3mGwyITRQfoan.ingredients: #FILLING<SEP>1 lb. flank steak (or ground beef)<SEP>2 T. extra-virgin olive oil<SEP>1 t. annatto seeds (optional)<SEP>1/2 c. minced yellow onion<SEP>1/2 c. minced red bell pepper<SEP>1 c. minced seeded plum tomato<SEP>1 t. ground cumin<SEP>1/2 t. sea salt<SEP>1/2 t. freshly ground black pepper<SEP>1 large garlic clove, minced<SEP>3/4 c. sliced pitted manzanilla olives<SEP>1/2 c. minced carrot<SEP>1/2 c. spinach, chopped<SEP>1 t. water<SEP>1 large egg, lightly beaten<SEP><SEP>#DOUGH<SEP>1 1/2 c. all-purpose flour<SEP>1 1/3 c. + 4 t. whole wheat flour<SEP>1 t. sea salt<SEP>3/4 c. white wine (or water)<SEP>1/3 c. + 1 T. extra-virgin olive oil<SEP><SEP>hot sauce and/or sweet chili sauce, for serving

VSRSmkteN4hZQZpREFzk.name: Sweet Potato & Green Rice Burrito Bowls
VSRSmkteN4hZQZpREFzk.directions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit. Line one large, rimmed baking sheet and one smaller sheet with parchment paper. Place the spinach, cilantro, jalapeño, shallot, garlic, salt and 1/2 cup of the vegetable broth in a food processor or blender. Blend until smooth.<SEP>Heat the oil in a heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat until shimmering. Add the rice and stir to coat. Spread the rice in an even layer on the bottom of the pot and let the rice lightly brown. This happens quickly! When the rice starts to brown, stir it and spread it out in an even layer again so that more of the rice browns.<SEP>When most of the rice has lightly browned, scrape the green purée into the rice. Stir until the rice is evenly coated with green purée and continue to cook, stirring constantly, for a minute. Add the rest of the vegetable broth to the pot. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to a low simmer and cover the pot. Cook the rice on a very low simmer until tender, 35 to 40 minutes.<SEP>While the rice cooks, toss the sweet potatoes in the olive oil, smoked paprika and salt until the sweet potatoes are evenly coated in oil. Arrange in a single layer on your prepared baking sheet. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes, tossing halfway, until the sweet potatoes are tender and caramelizing at the edges.<SEP>Meanwhile, transfer the beans and their cooking liquid (don’t drain the beans) to a medium pot. Stir in the cumin and chili powder and warm over medium heat. Once the beans are simmering, cover the beans and reduce heat to maintain a very gentle simmer until you’re ready to serve.<SEP>Once the rice is done cooking, remove the pot from heat. Uncover the pot and place a clean tea towel over the pot, then recover. The towel will help absorb excess liquid as the rice continues to cook in its own steam. (If you don’t have a clean towel, you can skip this step, just cover normally.) Let sit for 10 minutes.<SEP>Once the sweet potatoes are done cooking, toss the pepitas with 1/4 teaspoon olive oil and a sprinkle of salt on the small baking sheet. Toast the seeds in the oven for 4 to 5 minutes, until they’re turning lightly golden and making little popping noises. Set aside to cool.<SEP>Fluff the rice with a fork and season with salt if necessary. Remove beans from heat, stir in the vinegar and season to taste with salt and pepper.<SEP>Assemble your bowls: First add green rice, then use a slotted spoon or fork to transfer beans to the bowls. Top with sweet potatoes and add a few slices of avocado to each bowl. Sprinkle with toasted pepitas and cilantro and optional feta. Serve with salsa verde on the side.
VSRSmkteN4hZQZpREFzk.ingredients: #GREEN RICE<SEP>3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil<SEP>1 1/2 cups long grain brown rice<SEP>3 cups vegetable broth<SEP>1 1/2 cup baby spinach, lightly packed<SEP>1/2 cup cilantro (mostly leaves, stems are ok), lightly packed<SEP>1 jalapeño or serrano pepper, seeded, membranes removed and roughly chopped<SEP>1 medium shallot, peeled and roughly chopped<SEP>1 garlic clove, peeled, roughly chopped<SEP>1/4 teaspoon salt, more to taste<SEP><SEP>#SWEET POTATOES<SEP>2 pounds sweet potatoes (3 to 4 medium sweet potatoes), peeled and sliced into 1-inch chunks<SEP>2 tablespoons olive oil<SEP>1/2 teaspoon smoked paprika<SEP>1/4 teaspoon sea salt<SEP><SEP>#SEASONED BLACK BEANS<SEP>2 cans (14 ounces each) black beans or 3 cups cooked black beans, with their cooking liquid<SEP>2 teaspoons ground cumin<SEP>1/2 teaspoon chili powder<SEP>1 teaspoon sherry vinegar or lime juice<SEP>Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste<SEP><SEP>#ADDITIONAL GARNISHES<SEP>1/4 cup pepitas<SEP>1/4 teaspoon olive oil<SEP>1 avocado, pitted and sliced<SEP>Jarred mild salsa verde<SEP>Chopped cilantro<SEP>Crumbled feta

VewvuuzjCykFlwQIT0bw.name: Duke Pancakes
VewvuuzjCykFlwQIT0bw.directions: Combine first 4 ingredients and mix with dry ingredients.
VewvuuzjCykFlwQIT0bw.ingredients: 2 C. Milk<SEP>2 Tbs. Apple Cider Vinegar<SEP>2 Eggs<SEP>2 Tbs. Brown Sugar<SEP><SEP>2 C. Flour<SEP>3 tsp. Baking Powder<SEP>1 tsp. Salt - Kosher<SEP>1 Tbsp. Cinnamon<SEP>1 tsp. Ginger<SEP>Dash Nutmeg<SEP>Optional: Blueberries & Bananas

Vq5yn4lugPveLYKdGtM3.name: Ranch Potatoes
Vq5yn4lugPveLYKdGtM3.directions: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F.<SEP>	Place potatoes in a 1-gallon-size Glad(R) Zipper Bag and add oil; seal bag. Toss to coat.<SEP>	Add Hidden Valley(R) Original Ranch(R) Salad Dressing and Seasoning Mix and cheese and toss again until coated. Bake in ungreased baking pan for 30 to 35 minutes or until potatoes are brown and crisp. Top with fresh parsley.<SEP><SEP>
Vq5yn4lugPveLYKdGtM3.ingredients: 2 pounds small red potatoes, quartered<SEP>	1/4 cup vegetable oil<SEP>	2 teaspoons Hidden Valley(R) Original Ranch(R) Salad Dressing & Seasoning Mix<SEP>	Parsley<SEP>	Parmesan cheese

Vw9hF3B7SYHKI3ucrdzA.name: Savory Italian Frittata
Vw9hF3B7SYHKI3ucrdzA.ingredients: 1 medium Roma tomato, sliced into 1/4-inch rounds<SEP>1/2 cup yellow crooked-neck summer squash, chopped (about half of a medium squash)<SEP>1/2 cup green bell pepper, thinly sliced (about 1/2 of a<SEP>large pepper)<SEP>1/4 cup onion, finely chopped (about 1/3 small onion)<SEP>3 tablespoons water, divided<SEP>1/2 cup (4 oz) turkey sausage<SEP>1/2 teaspoon dried basil<SEP>1/4 teaspoon dried mint<SEP>1/4 teaspoon dried sage<SEP>1/8 teaspoon pepper<SEP>8 large eggs<SEP>1/2 teaspoon salt<SEP>1/2 cup (2 oz) shredded sharp cheddar<SEP>1 tablespoon freshly shredded Parmesan cheese
Vw9hF3B7SYHKI3ucrdzA.directions: Preheat oven to 325°F.<SEP>Coat a 10-inch oval white ceramic baking dish with nonstick spray.<SEP>Slice tomato slices into wagon wheels (to later use as a garnish).<SEP>Combine squash, green pepper, onion, and 1 tablespoon water and cook in the microwave for 2 to 5 minutes or until crisp and tender. Stir at 1-minute intervals, testing for doneness. Drain and blot dry.<SEP>Cook sausage in a skillet with basil, mint, sage, and pepper. When sausage is cooked through, remove to a plate and use paper towels to blot off any excess grease.<SEP>Arrange sausage and cooked vegetables in baking dish in a decorative pattern.<SEP>Beat eggs with salt and 2 tablespoons water until foamy. Immediately pour eggs over ingredients in baking dish.<SEP>Bake uncovered for 20 to 30 minutes. Gently jiggle frittata dish to check for firmness. Remove from oven and place tomato slices on top and sprinkle with cheddar and Parmesan cheese.<SEP>Broil until cheese melts and is slightly brown in places. Serve warm.

VzGX0ZHVheOAHWPfReXs.name: Lemon Bars
VzGX0ZHVheOAHWPfReXs.directions: Preheat the oven to 325°F (163°C). Line the bottom and sides of a 9×13 baking pan* with parchment paper, leaving an overhang on the sides to lift the finished bars out (makes cutting easier!). Set aside.<SEP>Make the crust: Mix the melted butter, sugar, vanilla extract, and salt together in a medium bowl. Add the flour and stir to completely combine. The dough will be thick. Press firmly into prepared pan, making sure the layer of crust is nice and even. Bake for 18-20 minutes or until the edges are very lightly browned. Remove from the oven and set aside.<SEP>Make the filling: Sift the sugar and flour together in a large bowl. Add the eggs and lemon juice and whisk until completely combined.<SEP>Pour filling over warm crust. Bake the bars for 22-26 minutes or until the center is relatively set and no longer jiggles. (Give the pan a light tap with an oven mitt to test.) Remove bars from the oven and cool completely at room temperature. I usually cool them for about 2 hours at room temperature, then stick in the refrigerator for 1-2 more hours until chilled. <SEP>Once cool, lift the parchment paper out of the pan using the overhang on the sides. Dust with confectioners’ sugar and cut into squares before serving. For neat squares, wipe the knife clean between each cut. Cover and store leftover lemon bars in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.<SEP>Freezing Instructions: Lemon bars can be frozen for up to 3-4 months. Cut the cooled bars (without confectioners’ sugar topping) into squares, then place onto a baking sheet. Freeze for 1 hour. Individually wrap each bar in aluminum foil or plastic wrap and place into a large bag or freezer container to freeze. Thaw in the refrigerator, then dust with confectioners’ sugar before serving.
VzGX0ZHVheOAHWPfReXs.ingredients: #shortbread crust<SEP>1 cup (2 sticks) unsalted butter, melted<SEP>1/2 cup granulated sugar<SEP>2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract<SEP>1/2 teaspoon salt<SEP>2 cups + 2 Tablespoons all-purpose flour<SEP><SEP>#filling<SEP>2 cups (400g) granulated sugar<SEP>6 Tablespoons (48g) all-purpose flour<SEP>6 large eggs<SEP>1 cup (240ml) lemon juice (about 4 lemons)<SEP>optional: confectioners’ sugar for dusting

WbZG5Bm1id9ydAu1Z5eO.ingredients: 1 3/4 cups all-purpose flour<SEP>3/4 teaspoon baking soda<SEP>1/4 teaspoon salt<SEP>3/4 cup granulated sugar<SEP>1/2 cup (1 stick) butter, softened<SEP>1 large egg<SEP>8 fun-size Butterfinger candy bars, chopped
WbZG5Bm1id9ydAu1Z5eO.name: Chewy Butterfinger Cookies
WbZG5Bm1id9ydAu1Z5eO.directions: Preheat oven to 375F degrees.<SEP>Cream together the sugar and butter. Beat in the egg.<SEP>Add in the flour, baking soda, and salt. Stir in butterfinger pieces by hand.<SEP>Drop by rounded tablespoons onto baking sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned.

We2mhm2dsCevhCJy82wt.name: Raspberry Butter
We2mhm2dsCevhCJy82wt.directions: Using KitchenAid with wire whisk attachment, beat butter on high speed until fluffy up to 10 minutes. Scrape the bowl occasionally. Gradually add sugar.<SEP>Add raspberries, a few at a time.<SEP>Continue to beat, scraping bowl occasionally with a rubber scraper, until well mixed (up to 10 additional minutes).
We2mhm2dsCevhCJy82wt.ingredients: 1/2 cup soft butter (if hard, microwave for 10 seconds) DO NOT MELT<SEP>2 tablespoons sugar<SEP>1/2 cup raspberries, thawed and crushed

Wt1Hj0KXZfScGGXajfCX.ingredients: 1 cup flour (white whole wheat works well)<SEP>1 teaspoon baking powder<SEP>½ teaspoon salt<SEP>4 tablespoons olive oil, divided<SEP>½ cup warm water<SEP>1 onion, diced<SEP>2 carrots, diced<SEP>2 cloves garlic, minced<SEP>1 teaspoon dried dill<SEP>½ teaspoon dried sage<SEP>½ teaspoon dried thyme<SEP>½ teaspoon pepper<SEP>2 cups potato, diced<SEP>6 cups vegetable broth<SEP>2 leaves bay leaf<SEP>fresh parsley, chopped, to serve
Wt1Hj0KXZfScGGXajfCX.directions: In a small mixing bowl, combine flour, baking powder, and salt with a spatula. Form a well in the middle of the dry mixture and add 2 tablespoons olive oil and warm water. Mix until dough forms in to a sticky ball. Cover with a dish towel and set aside.<SEP>In large pot or Dutch oven, add the olive oil over medium heat. Once the oil begins to shimmer, add the onion and carrot and cook for about 4-5 minutes, or until the onions are semi-translucent.<SEP>Add in the garlic, dill, sage, thyme, and pepper, and cook for 2-3 more minutes until herbs are fragrant.<SEP>Stir in potatoes, vegetable broth, and bay leaves, and bring to a boil. 5. Reduce heat to medium-high and simmer about 8 minutes or until potatoes are about 75 percent cooked through.<SEP>Carefully drop in dollops of the dumpling dough, about 1 inch (2-cm) in diameter.<SEP>Let dumplings simmer for about 10 minutes, or until chewy and cooked through.<SEP>To serve, garnish with lots of fresh parsley.
Wt1Hj0KXZfScGGXajfCX.name: Vegetable Dumpling Soup

XXA5OKiC5vVmayCncudT.directions: Mix graham cracker crumbs, sugar, melted butter or margarine, and ginger until well blended . Press mixture into a 9 inch pie plate. Cool in refrigerator.<SEP>In a sauce pan, boil an unopened can of sweetened condensed milk for 3 hours. Monitor the water closely, to make sure there is always water in the pan. Remove can from heat and let cool for 10 to 15 minutes.<SEP>Open can and pour toffee into pie crust. Allow to cool.<SEP>Slice bananas over toffee.<SEP>Whip 2 cups of cream and spoon it on top of bananas. Refrigerate before serving.
XXA5OKiC5vVmayCncudT.name: Banoffee
XXA5OKiC5vVmayCncudT.ingredients: 1 ½ cups graham cracker crumbs<SEP>1/2 cup butter  <SEP>½ cup white sugar  <SEP>2 teaspoon ground ginger<SEP>1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk<SEP>2 bananas, sliced<SEP>1 1/2 cups heavy whipping cream
XXA5OKiC5vVmayCncudT.notes: Put bananas over AND under toffee.

XiRVzDEVOkqy8esFnRwP.directions: Heat oven to 350<SEP>Prepare the quiche filling. Add spinach, onion, tomatoes and cooked bacon to a pre-baked pie crust<SEP>In a medium bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, salt and pepper until completely smooth<SEP>Pour egg custard mixture into the pie crust over the veggies/bacon<SEP>Place quiche on a baking sheet (to prevent any spills) and for 40-50 minutes or until the entire quiche is set but the center is slightly wobbly (it will continue to set as it cools)<SEP>Allow the quiche to cool at least 15-20 minutes before slicing
XiRVzDEVOkqy8esFnRwP.name: BLT Quiche
XiRVzDEVOkqy8esFnRwP.notes: Can be dairy and gluten free
XiRVzDEVOkqy8esFnRwP.ingredients: 1 (9") Pie Crust<SEP>2 C. Spinach<SEP>1/4 C. Finely Minced Onion or Shallot<SEP>1 C. Large Diced Tomatoes<SEP>8 oz. Bacon, crisped and crumbled<SEP>8 Eggs<SEP>1 C. Milk<SEP>1/2 tsp. Salt<SEP>1/2 tsp. Pepper<SEP>Optional: 2 Tbsp. Fresh Herbs for garnish, such as cilantro, basil or parsley

Xspkg9z9fhjjczeMUmUT.ingredients: 3 c flour<SEP>1/2 tsp yeast<SEP>1 tsp salt<SEP>1 1/2 c warm water<SEP>Fresh rosemary or any seasoning you like on top
Xspkg9z9fhjjczeMUmUT.name: No-Knead Bread (Dutch Oven)
Xspkg9z9fhjjczeMUmUT.directions: In a bowl, combine flour, yeast, salt, water. Stir until blended. Dough will be sticky<SEP>Cover bowl with towel, let it rest at room temperature for minimum 12 hours<SEP>Dough is ready when its surface is dotted with bubbles. Lightly flour work surface<SEP>Place dough on it and sprinkle with a little flour and fold it over on itself once or twice, it will be sticky<SEP>Put a 6-8 qt dutch oven in the oven as it preheats to 450. Pot should be in the oven for 30 minutes<SEP>Carefully place dough in the pot with the lid on. Bake for 30 minutes.<SEP>Remove lid and bake another 10 minutes<SEP>Cool, then slice

Y0DUlYOGDnmgwhH8jso2.ingredients: 1/2 cup low sodium soy sauce (or Tamari if gluten free)<SEP>1/2 cup chicken stock (or vegetable broth if vegan)<SEP>1 tablespoon corn starch (or arrow root)<SEP>1 tablespoon honey (or agave nectar if vegan)<SEP>1 teaspoon sesame seed oil<SEP>1 teaspoon rice vinegar<SEP>2 inch piece of ginger, peeled and grated or finely minced (or 1 tablespoon ginger paste in a squeeze tube, and other readers have had success with 1 tablespoon ground powdered ginger)<SEP>2 garlic cloves, grated or finely minced<SEP>Vegetables and meat of your choosing for the stir fry
Y0DUlYOGDnmgwhH8jso2.directions: Whisk all ingredients together. Adjust the amount of sauce you add according to how much stir fry you’re making. When adding to your stir fry, allow to cook for 3 full minutes to allow the corn starch to thicken the sauce.<SEP>Makes 1-1/4 cups. Will keep refrigerated in an airtight container for 1 week.
Y0DUlYOGDnmgwhH8jso2.name: Stir Fry Sauce

YBnPv8cB7C8P6ECLzMo8.directions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.<SEP>Using a warmed sharp knife, or unflavored dental floss (See Cook's Note 1) cut the wheel of brie in half horizontally and separate the top half of the wheel from the bottom half. Sprinkle the bottom half of the brie with the dried cherries, toasted almonds, and brown sugar. Replace the top half of the brie and apply pressure to secure the stuffing. Working on a well-floured surface, roll out the puff pastry so that it will fully cover the brie. Place the brie in the middle of the puff pastry and fold the excess pastry around the wheel. Put the wheel aside. Roll out another piece of puff pastry and cut out a circle the same circumference as the top of the brie. Save the trimmings for decorations. Using a pastry brush, brush the egg on top of the brie in the puff pastry and place the circle on top. Brush the top of the circle with egg. Cut out decorations using cookie cutters or a small knife on top of the brie. Brush the entire top side of the brie with the egg and place the brie on a sheet pan lined with parchment paper. Bake for 20 to 30 minutes or until the pastry begins to turn golden brown, then turn the temperature down to 325 degrees F and bake for another 20 minutes. Serve on a pretty platter. See Cook's Note 2.<SEP>Cook's Note 1: Instead of using a knife to cut the brie, use a piece of unflavored dental floss. Make an initial cut half way down, along the outer side of the brie with a pairing knife. Then, take a long piece of dental floss and wrap it around both hands. Starting at the front of the wheel at the initial cut, work through the wheel with the floss, separating the top half of the wheel from the bottom.<SEP>Cook's Note 2: The brie can be made, wrapped securely and stored in the freezer up to a month ahead of time.
YBnPv8cB7C8P6ECLzMo8.name: Baked Brie
YBnPv8cB7C8P6ECLzMo8.ingredients: 1 (7 to 8-inch) wheel brie cheese<SEP>1/4 cup dried cherries<SEP>1/4 cup sliced toasted almonds<SEP>3 tablespoons brown sugar<SEP>2 sheets (12 by 18-inch) puff pastry<SEP>2 eggs, beaten

YLl36MTTfVmJuVrvwUhV.ingredients: 3/4 c. water, room temperature<SEP>1 t. active dry yeast<SEP>2 t. brown sugar<SEP>1/2 t. salt<SEP>1 1/3 c. whole wheat flour<SEP>3/4 c. bread flour<SEP>2 T. cornmeal
YLl36MTTfVmJuVrvwUhV.notes: Spraying rolls with water while they bake will produce a crispy crust. Brush rolls with egg white before baking to produce a shiny crust, brush with milk to produce a dark, shiny crust, and brush rolls with butter immediately after baking to produce a soft crust.
YLl36MTTfVmJuVrvwUhV.directions: In a medium bowl, mix water and yeast. Add brown sugar, salt, and whole wheat flour. Mix well. Slowly add in remaining bread flour, enough to make a dough that follows the spoon around the bowl.<SEP><SEP>Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for 4 minutes, adding more flour as needed until the dough is soft and smooth to the touch.<SEP><SEP>Place dough in a medium-sized greased bowl. Turn dough over in a bowl so that the top is also lightly greased.<SEP><SEP>Cover dough with a clean cloth and let rise in warm, draft-free place for 1 hour or until doubled in size.<SEP><SEP>Grease and sprinkle cornmeal over a baking sheet. Punch down dough. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured board and knead for 4 minutes or until the bubbles are out of the bread.<SEP><SEP>Roll out dough into a long rectangle, about 15 inches in length. Roll up dough along the long side. Pinch seams and tuck under ends. Place loaf on a prepared baking sheet.<SEP><SEP>Cover and let rise in warm, draft-free place for 45 minutes or until doubled in size.​<SEP><SEP>Use a sharp knife to cut 4 or 5 slashes across the top. Bake bread at 375 F for 25 minutes or until golden brown. Remove bread from the sheet and let cool on a rack.
YLl36MTTfVmJuVrvwUhV.name: Whole Wheat French Bread

YQRmh6kRiU0YbcIBpnCd.name: Peanut Blossom Cookies
YQRmh6kRiU0YbcIBpnCd.ingredients: 1/2 cup sugar<SEP>1/2 cup firmly packed brown sugar<SEP>1/2 cup butter, softened<SEP>1/2 cup peanut butter<SEP>1 large egg<SEP>1 teaspoon vanilla extract<SEP>1/4 teaspoon salt<SEP>1 3/4 cups all-purpose flour<SEP>1 teaspoon baking soda<SEP>1/4 cup sugar<SEP>48 milk chocolate candy kisses, unwrapped
YQRmh6kRiU0YbcIBpnCd.directions: Combine 1/2 cup sugar, brown sugar, butter and peanut butter in bowl. Beat at medium speed until light and fluffy. Add egg, vanilla and salt; continue beating until well mixed. Add flour and baking soda; beat at low speed, scraping bowl often, until well mixed. Cover with plastic food wrap; refrigerate 30 minutes.<SEP>Heat oven to 375°F.<SEP>Shape dough into 1 1/4-inch balls. Roll balls in 1/4 cup sugar. Place 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets.<SEP>Bake 8-10 minutes or until very lightly golden brown. Immediately press 1 chocolate kiss in center of each cookie. Remove to cooling racks.

YRGOZrkAodwNTllsBL1p.notes: Try with baby corn, broccoli, cabbage, bok choy, water chestnuts, chicken, tofu, or shrimp.
YRGOZrkAodwNTllsBL1p.name: Cauliflower Fried Rice
YRGOZrkAodwNTllsBL1p.directions: In a large pan, saute garlic and onions in olive oil on medium/high heat, until onions become soft and transparent (about 2-3 minutes).<SEP>Next add in peas and carrots, and cook until carrots begin to soften and peas are heated through, about 3-4 minutes.<SEP>Stir in scrambled eggs, cauliflower and soy sauce. Cook stirring frequently for about 5-7 more minutes.
YRGOZrkAodwNTllsBL1p.ingredients: 3 c. raw grated cauliflower (use a cheese grater or food processor)<SEP>1/2 c. frozen peas<SEP>1/2 c. carrots, diced small<SEP>3-4 garlic cloves, minced<SEP>1/2 c. onion, diced<SEP>1/2 T. olive oil<SEP>2 eggs (or 4 egg white), scrambled<SEP>3 T. soy sauce

YYAtcGgfvSb22kTYyzMR.ingredients: 1 pound green beans, trimmed<SEP>7 tablespoons vegetable oil, divided<SEP>2 1/4 teaspoons kosher salt, divided<SEP>1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, divided<SEP>1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons cornstarch<SEP>2 pounds boneless, skinless chicken thighs, breasts, or a mix, patted dry, cut into 1" chunks<SEP>1/4 cup plus 1 tablespoon honey<SEP>1/4 cup low-sodium soy sauce<SEP>1 large garlic clove, finely grated<SEP>3 tablespoons unseasoned rice vinegar<SEP>1 tablespoon Sriracha<SEP>1 tablespoon tomato paste<SEP>1 teaspoon finely grated ginger<SEP>6 (or more) dried whole red chiles, such as chiles de árbol<SEP>1 scallion, thinly sliced<SEP>Cooked rice (for serving)
YYAtcGgfvSb22kTYyzMR.name: General Tso's Chicken
YYAtcGgfvSb22kTYyzMR.directions: Preheat oven to 425°F. Toss green beans with 1 Tbsp. oil, 1/2 tsp. salt, and 1/4 tsp. pepper on a rimmed baking sheet. Roast, tossing once halfway through, until crisp-tender and blackened in spots, 12-15 minutes.<SEP>Whisk cornstarch, 1 1/2 tsp. salt, and 1/2 tsp. pepper in a large bowl. Heat 3 Tbsp. oil in a large skillet over high. Add chicken to cornstarch mixture and toss to coat. Cook half of chicken, turning occasionally, until chicken is cooked through and a light brown crust forms, 5–7 minutes.<SEP>Meanwhile, mix honey, soy sauce, garlic, vinegar, Sriracha, tomato paste, ginger, 3 Tbsp. water, and remaining 1/4 tsp. salt and 1/4 tsp. pepper in a medium bowl.<SEP>Transfer chicken to a plate. Heat remaining 3 Tbsp. oil in skillet over high. Cook remaining chicken 5 minutes, then add chiles (you can add a few more depending on your heat preference) and cook, stirring and making sure chiles make contact with bottom of pan, until chicken is cooked through and chiles have toasted and puffed, about 1 minute more. Stir in honey mixture. Return first batch of chicken to skillet, toss to coat, and cook until sauce is reduced and thickened, about 2 minutes.<SEP>Divide chicken and green beans among plates. Top with scallions. Serve with rice alongside.

YeRFPNWEH4wVRsXhU5t0.name: Buckeyes
YeRFPNWEH4wVRsXhU5t0.directions: In the KitchenAid mixer bowl, cream butter, peanut butter, and vanilla, adding powdered sugar gradually until dough is stiff enough to form into a ball and keep its shape, but not dry and crumbly.<SEP>Use a small cookie scoop to portion candy. Roll candy into balls and place on a wax paper-lined jelly roll pan and freeze.<SEP>In your smallest pan, melt chocolate chips and shortening together over low heat. Chocolate should be no warmer than body temperature. Stir the chocolate often to keep it melted. DO NOT OVERHEAT.<SEP>Dip each peanut butter ball in the chocolate, leaving a dime-sized un-dipped portion on the top of each candy.<SEP>Place all candies in refrigerator to set.
YeRFPNWEH4wVRsXhU5t0.ingredients: 1/4 cup butter, softened<SEP>3/4 cup creamy peanut butter<SEP>1/2 teaspoon vanilla<SEP>1 1/2 to 2 cups powdered sugar<SEP>1 1/2 cups semisweet chocolate chips<SEP>1 1/2 teaspoon vegetable shortening

YodJpZib6WU78wxF1ERY.name: Apple Pancakes
YodJpZib6WU78wxF1ERY.directions: Batter:<SEP>Mix all ingredients in a bowl.<SEP><SEP>Syrup:<SEP>Mix cornstarch & apple cider first then add in sugar, lemon juice, butter, nutmeg & cinnamon<SEP>Continue stirring and let boil until it thickens
YodJpZib6WU78wxF1ERY.ingredients: 2 C. Bisquick<SEP>1 Egg<SEP>1 2/3 C. Milk<SEP>2 Granny Smith Apples, peeled & grated<SEP>1/2 tsp. Cinnamon<SEP><SEP>#Syrup:<SEP>1 C. Sugar<SEP>2 C. Apple Cider or Juice<SEP>2 Tbsp. Lemon Juice<SEP>2 Tbsp. Butter<SEP>1/4 tsp. Nutmeg<SEP>1/2 tsp. Cinnamon<SEP>2 1/2 Tbsp. Cornstarch

Z2uXG638e8b102ZGhaXC.ingredients: ½ cup milliliters cold whole milk<SEP>⅓ cup grams whole milk Greek-style yogurt (preferably 5% milk fat)<SEP>2 level cups grams all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting<SEP>1 tablespoon baking powder<SEP>¼ teaspoon baking soda<SEP>1 teaspoon kosher salt<SEP>1 cup unsalted butter, frozen (2 sticks; you will not use all of it)
Z2uXG638e8b102ZGhaXC.name: Flaky Folded Biscuits
Z2uXG638e8b102ZGhaXC.directions: Adjust an oven rack to the center position and heat oven to 425 degrees. In a small bowl, whisk together milk and yogurt; place in refrigerator until ready to use.<SEP>In a large bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt; set aside.<SEP>Place a large plate or small rimmed baking sheet on top of a kitchen scale and zero the scale. Remove the butter from the freezer and unwrap it. Using a flat, open hand, position the butter lengthwise against the large holes of a box grater. Grate as much butter as you can without grating your fingers or hand until you have a total of 5 ounces/140 grams grated frozen butter.<SEP>Immediately transfer the grated butter to the large bowl with the flour mixture and toss gently with your fingertips until the butter is thoroughly coated in the flour mixture and no clumps of butter remain.<SEP>Add the refrigerated milk-yogurt mixture to the large bowl and fold the mixture until it forms a very rough, shaggy ball. Dump the mixture out onto a generously floured countertop and, dusting with more flour as needed to prevent sticking, knead four to five times until dough just holds together. Flatten into a rough 4-inch square with your hands.<SEP>Using a rolling pin, roll the mixture out into a rough 12-inch square, flouring generously as needed to prevent the dough from sticking to the counter or the rolling pin. Using a bench scraper, fold the sides of the square across the center in thirds like a business letter. Flatten gently with your hand, then fold the top and bottom thirds into the center to form a rough 4-inch square. Flatten the square out with your hands.<SEP>Roll the square out into a 12-inch square again. Starting at the bottom edge, roll the dough up like a jelly roll into a tight log. Lay the log seam-side down, then press into a rough 3-by-12-inch rectangle. Cut the rectangle crosswise into four 3-by-3-inch squares, then cut each square across the diagonal to form 2 triangles (for a total of 8 triangles). Transfer the triangles to a parchment-lined baking sheet, spacing them out evenly.<SEP>Melt 3 tablespoons of the remaining butter and brush it over the tops of the biscuits. Bake until golden brown and puffed, 16 to 20 minutes. Remove biscuits from oven and brush the tops with a little more melted butter. Allow to cool slightly, then serve.

ZCm8C4LDrhsETTrSMe9k.name: Chocolate Mint Squares Recipe
ZCm8C4LDrhsETTrSMe9k.directions: #Chocolate Mint Squares: <SEP>Butter, or spray with a non stick cooking spray, a 9 inch (23 cm) square baking pan. Line the pan with parchment paper, wax paper, or aluminum foil.<SEP><SEP>#Crumb Base: <SEP>In a saucepan, over low heat, melt the butter. Stir in the sugar and cocoa powder. Take the saucepan off the heat and gradually whisk in the beaten egg. Return the saucepan to the heat, and cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens (1 - 2 minutes). Remove from heat and stir in the vanilla extract, graham cracker crumbs, coconut, and chopped nuts. Press the mixture evenly into the prepared pan. Cover and refrigerate until firm (about an hour).<SEP><SEP>#Mint Buttercream: <SEP>In your electric stand mixer, fitted with the paddle attachment (or with a hand mixer), beat the butter until smooth. Beat in the remaining ingredients. If desired, add a little green food coloring and beat until the filling is uniform in color. If the mixture is too thick to spread, add a little more milk. Spread the filling over the bottom layer, cover, and refrigerate until firm (about 30 minutes).<SEP><SEP>#Chocolate Topping: <SEP>In a heatproof bowl, placed over a saucepan of simmering water, melt the chocolate and butter. Let cool to lukewarm, and then spread over the filling and refrigerate just until the chocolate has set (5-10 minutes).<SEP><SEP>#To Serve: <SEP>To prevent the chocolate from cracking bring the squares to room temperature and then, using a sharp knife, cut into pieces.<SEP><SEP>#Yield: <SEP>Makes about 36 squares
ZCm8C4LDrhsETTrSMe9k.ingredients: #Crumb Base:<SEP>1/2 cup (113 grams) butter, at room temperature<SEP>1/4 cup (50 grams) granulated white sugar<SEP>1/3 cup (30 grams) unsweetened cocoa powder (regular or Dutch-processed)<SEP>1 large egg, beaten<SEP>1 teaspoon (4 grams) pure vanilla extract<SEP>2 cups (200 grams) graham cracker crumbs or crushed Digestive Biscuits<SEP>1 cup (65 grams) dried coconut (either sweetened or unsweetened, shredded or flaked)<SEP>1/2 cup (50 grams) finely chopped walnuts or pecans<SEP><SEP>#Mint Buttercream:<SEP>1/4 cup (55 grams) butter, at room temperature<SEP>3 - 4 tablespoons milk or light cream<SEP>1/2 teaspoon (2 grams) pure peppermint extract or 1/4 teaspoon (1 gram) peppermint oil<SEP>2 cups (230 grams) powdered sugar (confectioners or icing sugar), sifted<SEP><SEP>#Chocolate Topping:<SEP>6 ounces (170 grams) semisweet or bittersweet chocolate, chopped<SEP>1/2 tablespoon (6 grams) butter or vegetable shortening

ZFXHqYygnnPZqe7VqrA8.name: NYT No-Knead Bread
ZFXHqYygnnPZqe7VqrA8.ingredients: 3 ⅓ c./430 g. all-purpose or bread flour, plus more for dusting<SEP>¼ t. instant yeast<SEP>2 t. kosher salt<SEP>Cornmeal or wheat bran, as needed
ZFXHqYygnnPZqe7VqrA8.directions: In a large bowl combine flour, yeast and salt. Add 1 1/2 cups plus 2 tablespoons/390 milliliters water, and stir until blended; dough will be shaggy and sticky. Cover bowl with plastic wrap. Let dough rest at least 12 hours, preferably about 18, at warm room temperature, about 70 degrees.<SEP>Dough is ready when its surface is dotted with bubbles. Lightly flour a work surface and place dough on it; sprinkle it with a little more flour and fold it over on itself once or twice. Cover loosely with plastic wrap and let rest about 15 minutes.<SEP>Using just enough flour to keep dough from sticking to work surface or to your fingers, gently and quickly shape dough into a ball. Generously coat a cotton towel (not terry cloth) with flour, wheat bran or cornmeal; put dough seam side down on towel and dust with more flour, bran or cornmeal. Cover with another cotton towel and let rise for about 2 hours. When it is ready, dough will be more than double in size and will not readily spring back when poked with a finger.<SEP>At least a half-hour before dough is ready, heat oven to 450 degrees. Put a 6- to 8-quart heavy covered pot (cast iron, enamel, Pyrex or ceramic) in oven as it heats. When dough is ready, carefully remove pot from oven. Slide your hand under towel and turn dough over into pot, seam side up; it may look like a mess, but that is O.K. Shake pan once or twice if dough is unevenly distributed; it will straighten out as it bakes. Cover with lid and bake 30 minutes, then remove lid and bake another 15 to 30 minutes, until loaf is beautifully browned. Cool on a rack.

ZUksWQuqvkfjiFSSdATN.name: Granola
ZUksWQuqvkfjiFSSdATN.directions: Preheat oven to 300 degrees<SEP>Mix dry ingredients (grain, nuts, seeds, salt, and spices) in a large bowl<SEP>Mix in oil thoroughly<SEP>Add sweetener<SEP>Add egg white (beat lightly until foamy)<SEP>Stir, stir, stir<SEP>Line a large rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper<SEP>Spread the mixture onto the sheet, bake at 300 for 30-45 min, stirring after about 20 min<SEP>Stop when the granola looks toasty brown and smells incredible<SEP>Let the granola cool completely in the pan, mix in any dried fruit<SEP>Store in an airtight container
ZUksWQuqvkfjiFSSdATN.ingredients: 3 c. rolled oats (old-fashioned, not instant or quick oats)<SEP>1-2 T. wheat germ<SEP>1-2 T. uncooked quinoa<SEP>1 - 1 1/2 c. chopped raw nuts (pecan, almond, pistachio, hazelnut, walnut)<SEP>1/2  - 3/4 c. sweetener (maple syrup, honey, agave, or brown rice syrup)<SEP>1/4 - 1/2 c. oil (canola, grapeseed, extra virgin olive oil, melted coconut oil)<SEP>1 tsp kosher salt (or 3/4 tsp regular table salt)<SEP>1-2 c. seeds (pumpkin, sunflower, flax, millet, sesame)<SEP>1 c. coconut<SEP>1 c. dried fruit (raisins, craisins, dried blueberries, cherries, mango, apples, pineapple, etc)<SEP>1 tsp. spices (cinnamon, cardamom [1/2 tsp], nutmeg, ginger)<SEP>Optional: 1/4 c. cocoa and/or 1 c. chocolate chips<SEP>1 egg white

ZVkKBSmTEEK78BD7rhVN.directions:
Place the cocoa powder along with 1 cup of the half-and-half into a medium saucepan over medium heat and whisk to combine. 
Add the remaining half-and-half and the heavy cream. 
Bring the mixture just to a simmer, stirring occasionally, and remove from the heat.
In a medium mixing bowl whisk the egg yolks until they lighten in color. 
Gradually add the sugar and whisk to combine. 
Temper the cream mixture into the eggs and sugar by gradually adding small amounts, until about 1/3 of the cream mixture has been added. Pour in the remainder and return the entire mixture to the saucepan and place over low heat. 
Continue to cook, stirring frequently, until the mixture thickens slightly and coats the back of a spoon and reaches 170 to 175 degrees F.
Pour the mixture into a container and allow to sit at room temperature for 30 minutes. 
Stir in the vanilla extract. Place the mixture into the refrigerator and once it is cool enough not to form condensation on the lid, cover and store for 4 to 8 hours or until the temperature reaches 40 degrees F or below.
Pour into an ice cream maker and process according to the manufacturer's directions. This should take approximately 25 to 35 minutes. Serve as is for soft serve or freeze for another 3 to 4 hours to allow the ice cream to harden.
ZVkKBSmTEEK78BD7rhVN.ingredients:
1 1/2 ounces unsweetened cocoa powder, approximately 1/2 cup
3 cups half-and-half
1 cup heavy cream
8 large egg yolks
1 1/8 cup sugar
2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract
ZVkKBSmTEEK78BD7rhVN.name: Chocolate Ice Cream

ZbZQx58vB1zFeZuJEtpH.directions: Prepare vegetables.<SEP>Place in saucepan. Add clams with juice, pour over vegetables. <SEP>Add enough water to barely cover. Simmer, covered, over medium heat until potatoes are tender, about 20 minutes.<SEP>Melt butter; add flour, and blend.<SEP>Cook 2 minutes. Add cream and cook, stirring until smooth and thickened, using wire whisk to blend.<SEP>Add undrained vegetables and clams and heat through. Season with salt, pepper, and sugar (or vinegar). Serves 8
ZbZQx58vB1zFeZuJEtpH.name: Clam Chowder
ZbZQx58vB1zFeZuJEtpH.ingredients: 1 c. finely chopped onion<SEP>1 c. finely diced celery<SEP>2 c. finely diced potatoes<SEP>2 or more cans minced clams<SEP>3/4 c. butter or margarine<SEP>3/4 c. flour<SEP>1 qt (4 c.) half & half or whole milk<SEP>1 1/2 tsp. salt<SEP>Dash of pepper<SEP>1/2 tsp. sugar (or 1 T red wine vinegar)

Zfx91jqUhBHdf73B0dGz.ingredients: #Meat<SEP>100g / 3.5 ounces beef mince (or other cuts)<SEP>1 Tbsp soy sauce<SEP>1 Tbsp sesame oil<SEP>1 tsp sugar – I used brown sugar<SEP>1/4 tsp minced garlic<SEP><SEP>#VEGGIES/OTHER<SEP>250g (0.6 pounds) mildly seasoned spinach<SEP>350g (0.8 pounds) mildly seasoned bean sprouts – (You don’t have to use them up if you think it’s too much but I love having lots of vegetables on my Bibimbap!)<SEP>100g (3.5 ounces) shiitake mushroom<SEP>120g (4.2 ounces) carrots (1 small)<SEP>1/2 tsp fine sea salt (1/4 tsp each will be used when cooking shiitake mushroom and carrots)<SEP>3 to 4 serving portions of steamed rice<SEP>3 or 4 eggs (depending on the serving portion)<SEP>Some cooking oil to cook the meat, mushroom, carrots and eggs – I used rice bran oil.<SEP>Korean seasoned seaweed, shredded (long thin cut)<SEP><SEP>#BIBIMBAP SAUCE<SEP>2 Tbsp gochujang<SEP>1 Tbsp sesame oil<SEP>1 Tbsp sugar – I used raw sugar<SEP>1 Tbsp water<SEP>1 Tbsp roasted sesame seeds<SEP>1 tsp vinegar – I used apple vinegar<SEP>1 tsp minced garlic
Zfx91jqUhBHdf73B0dGz.name: Bibimbap
Zfx91jqUhBHdf73B0dGz.directions: For meat, mix the beef mince with the meat sauce listed above. Marinate the meat for about 30 mins while you are working on other ingredients to enhance the flavour. Add some cooking oil into a wok and cook the meat on medium high to high heat. It takes about 3 to 5 mins to thoroughly cook it.<SEP>Mix the Bibimbap sauce ingredients in a bowl.<SEP> Spinach and bean sprouts per linked recipe.<SEP>Rinse, peel and julienne the carrots. Add some cooking oil and 1/4 tsp of fine sea salt in a wok and cook the carrots on medium high to high heat for 2 to 3 mins.<SEP>Clean/rinse the shiitake mushrooms and thinly slice them. Add some cooking oil and 1/4 tsp of fine sea salt in a wok and cook the mushrooms on medium high to high heat until they are all cooked. (It takes 2 to 3 mins.)<SEP>Fry eggs<SEP>Put the rice into a bowl and add the meat, assorted vegetables, seasoned seaweed, Bibimbap sauce and the egg on top of the rice. Serve it.

ZkW1PWntIxjtd0oYoXNp.ingredients: #Peppermint Whoopie Pies:<SEP>1 3/4 cups (230 grams) all purpose flour<SEP>3/4 cup (75 grams) unsweetened cocoa powder, preferably Dutch processed<SEP>1 teaspoon (5 grams) baking powder<SEP>1/4 teaspoon (1 gram) baking soda<SEP>1/2 teaspoon (2 grams) salt<SEP>3/4 cup (170 grams) unsalted butter, at room temperature<SEP>3/4 cup (150 grams) granulated white sugar<SEP>1 large egg, at room temperature<SEP>1 teaspoon (5 grams) pure vanilla extract<SEP>1/4 cup (60 ml) buttermilk, at room temperature<SEP>1/2 cup (120 ml) coffee or water, at room temperature<SEP><SEP>#Vanilla Filling:<SEP>1/4 cup (55 grams) vegetable shortening<SEP><SEP>1/4 cup (55 grams) butter, at room temperature<SEP><SEP>1 cup (120 grams) confectioners (powdered or icing) sugar, sifted<SEP>1 1/2 teaspoons (7 grams) pure vanilla extract<SEP>1/3 cup (80 ml) (175 grams) light corn syrup (or golden syrup)<SEP>pink or red food coloring<SEP>crushed candy canes or peppermint crunch baking chips
ZkW1PWntIxjtd0oYoXNp.directions: <SEP>#Peppermint Whoopie Pies: <SEP>Preheat your oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) and place your oven rack in the center of the oven. Line two baking sheets with parchment paper.<SEP><SEP>In a large bowl sift or whisk together the flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.<SEP><SEP>In the bowl of your electric mixer, fitted with the paddle attachment (can also use a hand mixer), beat the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the egg and beat to combine. Beat in the vanilla extract. Scrape down the sides and bottom of your mixing bowl as needed. In a small measuring cup, mix the buttermilk with the coffee (or water). With the mixer on low speed, alternately add the flour mixture (in three additions) and buttermilk/coffee mixture (in two additions), beginning and ending with the flour. Drop heaping tablespoons (can also use a small ice cream scoop) of the batter onto your prepared baking sheets, spacing about 2 inches (5 cm) apart. With moistened fingers or with the back of a spoon, smooth the tops of the cookies.<SEP><SEP>Bake for about 8 - 10 minutes or until the tops of the cookies, when lightly pressed, spring back. Remove from oven and transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.<SEP><SEP>#Filling: <SEP>Beat the shortening and butter until soft and creamy. With the mixer on low speed, gradually beat in the powdered sugar. Increase the speed to high, and beat until light and fluffy, about 2-3 minutes. Then, with the mixer on low speed, beat in the vanilla extract and slowly drizzle in the corn syrup. Continue to beat until the filling is soft and fluffy. If desired, color the filling with pink or red food color (I use the gel paste food coloring that is available at cake decorating stores and party stores).<SEP><SEP>#To Assemble: <SEP>Take one cookie and spread a heaping tablespoon of the filling on the flat side of the cookie. Top with another cookie. Dip the edges of the filling into the crushed candy canes.<SEP><SEP>The assembled cookies can be stored, covered, in the refrigerator for several days. Bring to room temperature before serving.<SEP><SEP>Makes about 16 sandwich cookies.
ZkW1PWntIxjtd0oYoXNp.name: Peppermint Whoopie Pies

ZoCKgL0ACwZXngocs7mQ.directions: In a medium stockpot, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion, bell pepper, and chili; cook, stirring, until softened, about 5 minutes.<SEP>Add the garlic and cook, stirring constantly, 1 minute.<SEP>Add the broth, chickpeas, tomatoes, curry powder, salt, and black pepper; bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat and simmer gently, uncovered, stirring occasionally, about 10 minutes. <SEP>Add the remaining ingredients and cook, stirring occasionally, until heated through, about 5 minutes. Serve warm.
ZoCKgL0ACwZXngocs7mQ.name: African Chickpea Soup
ZoCKgL0ACwZXngocs7mQ.ingredients: 2 tablespoons canola oil<SEP>1 medium onion (about 6 ounces), chopped<SEP>1 medium red bell pepper (about 6 ounces), chopped<SEP>1 jalapeño chili, seeded and finely chopped<SEP>2 large cloves garlic, finely chopped<SEP>2 cups low-sodium vegetable broth<SEP>1 (15-ounce) can chickpeas, rinsed and drained<SEP>1 cup chopped tomatoes, seeded and peeled, fresh or canned (see Cook's Tip)<SEP>1 teaspoon mild curry powder<SEP>1/2 teaspoon salt, or to taste<SEP>Freshly ground black pepper, to taste<SEP>1 (14-ounce) can light coconut milk<SEP>3/4 cup cooked white or brown rice<SEP>2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro or parsley

ZtNaatc06Z6qw60M79y0.name: Whole Wheat Cornbread
ZtNaatc06Z6qw60M79y0.ingredients: 2 c. whole wheat flour<SEP>2 c. cornmeal<SEP>4 t. baking powder<SEP>1 1/2 t. salt<SEP>1/2 c. honey<SEP>1/4 c. oil<SEP>2 c. milk<SEP>2 eggs
ZtNaatc06Z6qw60M79y0.directions: Combine the cornmeal, flour, baking powder, and salt.<SEP>Add the honey, oil, milk, and eggs.<SEP>Mix just enough to moisten the batter.<SEP>Pour the batter into an oiled 9x13 baking pan.<SEP>Bake at 375 degree oven for 20-35 minutes or until golden brown.

ZyXngezOprYGDtkCHhIh.directions: Peel the potatoes and cut into 1/2-inch dice. Place in a medium saucepan and cover with cold water. Set over high heat, cover and bring to a boil. Once boiling, uncover, decrease the heat to maintain a simmer and cook until tender and easily crushed with tongs, approximately 10 to 15 minutes. <SEP>Place the half-and-half and butter into a microwave-safe container and heat in the microwave until warmed through, about 35 seconds. Drain the potatoes in a colander and then return to the saucepan. Mash the potatoes and then add the half and half, butter, salt and pepper and continue to mash until smooth. Stir in the yolk until well combined.<SEP>Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.<SEP>While the potatoes are cooking, prepare the filling. Place the canola oil into a 12-inch saute pan and set over medium high heat. Once the oil shimmers, add the onion and carrots and saute just until they begin to take on color, approximately 3 to 4 minutes. Add the garlic and stir to combine. <SEP>Add the lamb, salt and pepper and cook until browned and cooked through, approximately 3 minutes. Sprinkle the meat with the flour and toss to coat, continuing to cook for another minute. Add the tomato paste, chicken broth, Worcestershire, rosemary, thyme, and stir to combine. Bring to a boil, reduce the heat to low, cover and simmer slowly 10 to 12 minutes or until the sauce is thickened slightly.<SEP>Add the corn and peas to the lamb mixture and spread evenly into an 11 by 7-inch glass baking dish. Top with the mashed potatoes, starting around the edges to create a seal to prevent the mixture from bubbling up and smooth with a rubber spatula. Place on a parchment lined half sheet pan on the middle rack of the oven and bake for 25 minutes or just until the potatoes begin to brown. Remove to a cooling rack for at least 15 minutes before serving.
ZyXngezOprYGDtkCHhIh.ingredients: #potato topping<SEP>1 1/2 pounds russet potatoes<SEP>1/4 cup half-and-half<SEP>2 ounces unsalted butter<SEP>3/4 teaspoon kosher salt<SEP>1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper<SEP>1 egg yolk<SEP><SEP>#Meat filling<SEP>2 tablespoons canola oil<SEP>1 cup chopped onion<SEP>2 carrots, peeled and diced small<SEP>2 cloves garlic, minced<SEP>1 1/2 pounds ground lamb (or beef)<SEP>1 teaspoon kosher salt<SEP>1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper<SEP>2 tablespoons all-purpose flour<SEP>2 teaspoons tomato paste<SEP>1 cup chicken broth<SEP>1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce<SEP>2 teaspoons freshly chopped rosemary leaves<SEP>1 teaspoon freshly chopped thyme leaves<SEP>1/2 cup fresh or frozen corn kernels<SEP>1/2 cup fresh or frozen English peas
ZyXngezOprYGDtkCHhIh.name: Shepherd's Pie

a13sFMCNDnUeEufrQr7G.name: Put the Lime in the Coconut Cake
a13sFMCNDnUeEufrQr7G.ingredients: #Cake:<SEP>1 cup butter<SEP>2 cups sugar<SEP>1 teaspoon coconut oil<SEP>4 eggs<SEP>2 1/2 cup all-purpose flour<SEP>1/2 teaspoon salt<SEP>1 teaspoon baking soda<SEP>1/2 teaspoon baking powder<SEP>1 cup coconut milk<SEP>#Glaze:<SEP>1 cup sour cream or yogurt<SEP>1 cup sugar<SEP>2 limes, zested and juiced<SEP>1/4 cup coconut milk<SEP>1 cup shredded coconut<SEP>#Frosting:<SEP>1/2 cup butter<SEP>1/2 cup shortening<SEP>4 ounces cream cheese<SEP>1 pound box plus 1 cup powdered sugar<SEP>1/4 cup coconut milk<SEP>1 teaspoon vanilla<SEP>2 cups shredded coconut
a13sFMCNDnUeEufrQr7G.directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F and grease and flour 2 (9-inch) cake pans.<SEP>In an electric mixer or using a hand beater, cream butter and sugar until fluffy. Add coconut oil and eggs 1 at a time. In a mixing bowl or on a sheet of parchment paper, combine flour, salt, baking soda and powder. To mixer add coconut milk and flour to creamed mixture alternately, beginning and ending with flour. Pour batter into prepared pans and bake for 25 to 28 minutes. Allow to cool 10 minutes then unmold onto rack(s) over a sheet pan and allow to cool completely.<SEP>For Glaze: In a medium bowl combine sour cream or yogurt, sugar, lime zest and juice, coconut milk, shredded coconut.<SEP>With a bamboo skewer, poke holes in cake and spread glaze on both sides of both cakes. Cover with plastic wrap, chill until ready to frost cake.<SEP>In an electric mixer or using a hand mixer beat together the butter, shortening, and cream cheese until well blended and fluffy. Add the powdered sugar gradually at low speed. Beat in coconut milk and vanilla. Frost cake. Coat top and sides with shredded coconut.

a5E4NcNFPrcvfstzghkY.name: Crunchies
a5E4NcNFPrcvfstzghkY.ingredients: 12 C. Crispex<SEP>4 C. Golden Grahams<SEP>1/2 C. Coconut<SEP>1/2 C. Pecans<SEP>3/4 C. Butter<SEP>1 C. Sugar<SEP>1 C. Karo Syrup
a5E4NcNFPrcvfstzghkY.directions: Boil wet ingredients for 1 minute 45 seconds<SEP>Pour over dry mixture

aOUDG6h4Zba2cf2qIr8H.ingredients: 3 c. milk<SEP>1/2 c. honey or sugar<SEP>1/2 c - 2 T. shortening<SEP>2 T. butter<SEP>3/4 c. water with a sprinkle of sugar<SEP>2 T. yeast<SEP>3 eggs<SEP>scant tablespoon salt<SEP>9 3/4 c. flour
aOUDG6h4Zba2cf2qIr8H.name: Grandma Magleby's Rolls
aOUDG6h4Zba2cf2qIr8H.notes: Melinda says she uses less flour.
aOUDG6h4Zba2cf2qIr8H.directions: Sprinkle yeast in warm water. Scald milk, add honey, shortening, and butter. Mix 5 cups of flour to milk mixture. Beat well. Add yeast, mix well, and add eggs until well blended. Add two more cups of flour then add the salt. Continue adding flour until dough is no longer sticky to the tough. Knead for 5 minutes. Let rise. Punch down and shape as desired. Put on greased pans and brush with melted butter. Rise until doubled. Bake at 400 degrees for 8 minutes or until done.

afDWnAwPPaeXf11DjO2J.name: Coleslaw
afDWnAwPPaeXf11DjO2J.directions: Add the mayonnaise, sugar, lemon juice, white vinegar, salt and pepper to a large mixing bowl and whisk together until fully combined.<SEP>Add in the coleslaw mix and stir well to combine.<SEP>Refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.
afDWnAwPPaeXf11DjO2J.ingredients: 14 ounce coleslaw mix with red cabbage and carrots<SEP>1/2 cup mayonnaise<SEP>2 tablespoons white sugar<SEP>1 1/2 tablespoons lemon juice<SEP>1 tablespoon white vinegar<SEP>1/4 teaspoon kosher salt<SEP>1/2 teaspoon coarse ground black pepper

agL8gz3b7SFHeOvM2MWo.directions: Heat oil in heavy large pot over medium-high heat. Add onions; sauté until brown, about 6 minutes. Add jalapeños and garlic; sauté 1 minute. Add beef; sauté until brown, breaking up with back of fork, about 5 minutes. Add chili powder, cumin, and paprika, then mix in tomatoes with juices, beans, and broth; bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer until chili thickens and flavors blend, stirring occasionally, about 45 minutes. Skim any fat from surface of chili. (Can be made 2 days ahead. Cool slightly. Refrigerate uncovered until cold, then cover and keep refrigerated. Bring to simmer before continuing, stirring occasionally.)<SEP>Ladle chili into bowls. Serve, passing bowls of sour cream, grated cheese, green onions, and cilantro separately.
agL8gz3b7SFHeOvM2MWo.ingredients: 1 tablespoon olive oil<SEP>2 large red onions, chopped<SEP>5 tablespoons chopped jalapeño chilies with seeds<SEP>8 garlic cloves, chopped<SEP>2 1/3 pounds ground beef (15% fat)<SEP>1/4 cup chili powder<SEP>2 tablespoons ground cumin<SEP>1 teaspoon sweet paprika<SEP>1 28-ounce can diced tomatoes in juice<SEP>2 15 1/4-ounce cans kidney beans, drained<SEP>1 14-ounce can beef broth<SEP>Sour cream<SEP>Grated cheddar cheese<SEP>Chopped green onions<SEP>Chopped fresh cilantro
agL8gz3b7SFHeOvM2MWo.name: Beef and Bean Chili

anNcvTATVfUFejWflRaZ.ingredients: 2 cups chicken stock<SEP>1 cup quinoa<SEP>1⁄2 cup red pepper, diced<SEP>1⁄2 cup green pepper, diced<SEP>1⁄2 cup cucumber, diced<SEP>1⁄4 cup green onion, diced<SEP>1⁄4 cup black olives<SEP>1⁄4 cup red onion, diced<SEP>3 ounces reduced-fat feta cheese<SEP><SEP>1⁄4 cup lemon juice<SEP>2 tablespoons olive oil<SEP>1 teaspoon minced garlic<SEP>1⁄2 teaspoon basil<SEP>1⁄2 teaspoon oregano<SEP>pepper
anNcvTATVfUFejWflRaZ.directions: In a saucepan, bring stock to a boil.<SEP>Stir in quinoa.<SEP>Reduce heat to med low and cover.<SEP>Cook 15 minutes, until liquid is absorbed.<SEP>Transfer to a large bowl and cool.<SEP>Stir veggies and cheese into cooled quinoa.<SEP>Whisk together dressing ingredients.<SEP>Pour over quinoa mixture and toss.
anNcvTATVfUFejWflRaZ.name: Quinoa Greek Salad

b3hPEaDl5qSg1Q3Pkt6w.ingredients: #Cauliflower:<SEP>Vegetable oil cooking spray<SEP>1 medium head cauliflower, trimmed and cut into 1/2 to 1-inch pieces<SEP>1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil<SEP>Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper<SEP><SEP>#Salad:<SEP>2 cups low-sodium chicken broth<SEP>1 1/2 tablespoons mild curry powder (recommended: Spice Islands)<SEP>1/2 teaspoon salt<SEP>1 (10-ounce box) couscous<SEP>3/4 cup dried cranberries<SEP>1/2 cup coarsely chopped, roasted and lightly salted cashews<SEP>1 (4-inch) piece cucumber, peeled, seeded and chopped into 1/2-inch pieces<SEP>1/3 cup chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley<SEP>1 large lemon, zested<SEP><SEP>#Dressing:<SEP>1/3 cup Greek yogurt<SEP>1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil<SEP>1 1/2 teaspoons mild curry powder (recommended: Spice Islands)<SEP>2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice<SEP>Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
b3hPEaDl5qSg1Q3Pkt6w.name: Curried Couscous Salad
b3hPEaDl5qSg1Q3Pkt6w.directions: #Cauliflower:<SEP>Put an oven rack in the center of the oven. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Spray a baking sheet liberally with vegetable oil cooking spray. Set aside.<SEP>In a medium bowl, toss the cauliflower and olive oil together until coated. Put in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet and season with salt and pepper, to taste. Roast until golden and tender, about 25 to 30 minutes. Set aside to cool for 10 minutes.<SEP>#Salad:<SEP>In a medium saucepan, bring the chicken broth, curry powder and salt to a boil over medium-high heat. Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the couscous. Cover the pot and allow the couscous to absorb the liquid, about 5 to 7 minutes. Fluff the couscous with a fork and transfer it to a large serving bowl. Stir in the cooked cauliflower, cranberries, cashews, cucumber, parsley, and lemon zest. Refrigerate until ready to serve.<SEP>#Dressing:<SEP>In a small bowl, whisk together the yogurt, olive oil and curry powder until smooth. Whisk in the lemon juice and season with salt and pepper, to taste.<SEP>Just before serving, add the dressing to the salad and toss well to coat.

bCCjeZPoMihQTtm470y3.name: Chicken enchiladas
bCCjeZPoMihQTtm470y3.ingredients: #RED SAUCE<SEP>2 tablespoons vegetable oil, or any other neutral oil<SEP>2 tablespoons all-purpose flour<SEP>4 tablespoons chili powder<SEP>1/2 teaspoon garlic powder<SEP>1/2 teaspoon salt<SEP>1/4 teaspoon ground cumin<SEP>1/4 teaspoon dried oregano<SEP>2 cups chicken or vegetable stock<SEP><SEP>#ENCHILADAS<SEP>4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves<SEP>1 onion, chopped<SEP>1/2 pint sour cream<SEP>1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese<SEP>1 tablespoon dried parsley<SEP>1/2 teaspoon dried oregano<SEP>1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper<SEP>1/2 teaspoon salt (optional)<SEP>1 (15 ounce) can tomato sauce<SEP>1/2 cup water<SEP>1 tablespoon chili powder<SEP>1 chopped green bell pepper<SEP>1 red pepper<SEP>Spinach<SEP>1 clove garlic, minced<SEP>8 (10 inch) flour tortillas<SEP>3/4 cup shredded Cheddar cheese<SEP>Avocadoes<SEP>Cilantro
bCCjeZPoMihQTtm470y3.directions: #SAUCE<SEP>Heat oil in a small saucepan over medium-high heat. Add flour and whisk together over the heat for one minute. Stir in the remaining seasonings (chili powder through oregano). Then gradually add in the stock, whisking constantly to remove lumps. Reduce heat and simmer 10-15 minutes until slightly thickened.<SEP><SEP>#ENCHILADAS:<SEP>Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).<SEP>In a medium, non-stick skillet over medium heat, cook chicken until no longer pink and juices run clear. Drain excess fat. Cube the chicken and return it to the skillet. Add the onion, sour cream, Cheddar cheese, parsley, oregano and ground black pepper. Heat until cheese melts. Stir in salt, tomato sauce, water, chili powder, green pepper and garlic.<SEP>Roll even amounts of the mixture in the tortillas. Arrange in a 9x13 inch baking dish. Cover with sauce and cheddar cheese. Bake uncovered in the preheated oven 20 minutes. Cool 10 minutes before serving.

bDNeR5jRReNZUPcGmIu9.directions: Place the chocolate into a medium bowl. Heat the cream in a small sauce pan over medium heat. Bring just to a boil, watching very carefully because if it boils for a few seconds, it will boil out of the pot. When the cream has come to a boil, pour over the chopped chocolate, and whisk until smooth. Stir in the rum if desired.<SEP>Allow the ganache to cool slightly before pouring over a cake. Start at the center of the cake and work outward. For a fluffy frosting or chocolate filling, allow it to cool until thick, then whip with a whisk until light and fluffy.
bDNeR5jRReNZUPcGmIu9.name: Chocolate Ganache
bDNeR5jRReNZUPcGmIu9.ingredients: 9 ounces bittersweet chocolate, chopped<SEP>1 cup heavy cream<SEP>1 tablespoon dark rum

bXpiXE5KgyIE3m9GRJqP.directions: Shake all ingredients together and store in the fridge for up to a week<SEP>Makes 4 servings
bXpiXE5KgyIE3m9GRJqP.name: Homemade Gatorade
bXpiXE5KgyIE3m9GRJqP.ingredients: #Lemon Lime Flavor:<SEP>1/4 C. Freshly Squeezed Lime Juice<SEP>14 C. Freshly Squeezed Lemon Juice<SEP>2 C. Fresh Water<SEP>1/8 tsp. Sea Salt<SEP>2 Tbsp. Cane Sugar<SEP><SEP>#Orange Flavor:<SEP>1/4 C. Freshly Squeezed Lemon Juice<SEP>1/4 C. Freshly Squeezed Orange Juice<SEP>2 C. Fresh Water<SEP>1/8 tsp. Sea Salt<SEP>2 Tbsp. Cane Sugar

bdWZPj3FEcts3AjsfVgH.name: Thai Cabbage Salad
bdWZPj3FEcts3AjsfVgH.ingredients: 1/2 head ea. Red & Green cabbage (sliced thinly)<SEP>3 carrots grated<SEP>1 cucumber diced small<SEP>1 lg. Red pepper (diced small)<SEP>1 bunch Green Onions (slice 1/2 pcs)<SEP>1 bunch cilantro (chop)<SEP>1 cup Peanuts chopped<SEP><SEP>#Dressing<SEP>1/2 c. white vinegar<SEP>1/2 c. vegetable oil<SEP>Few dashes of sesame oil<SEP>1/4 soy sauce<SEP>1 T. garlic chili paste<SEP>2 Serrano chilies, minced<SEP>2 T. sugar
bdWZPj3FEcts3AjsfVgH.directions: Toss all salad ingredients together.<SEP><SEP>Mix dressing ingredients together.<SEP><SEP>Serve immediately once the salad is dressed.

boLW6hHUDbGD3LSCtYAC.name: Candied Walnuts
boLW6hHUDbGD3LSCtYAC.ingredients: 1/4 cup packed brown sugar<SEP>1 teaspoon fine sea salt<SEP>1 teaspoon ground cinnamon<SEP>1/4 teaspoon ground cayenne<SEP>1 egg white<SEP>1 teaspoon vanilla extract<SEP>4 cups (12 ounces) raw walnut halves
boLW6hHUDbGD3LSCtYAC.directions: Heat oven to 300°F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper; set aside.<SEP>In a small mixing bowl, whisk together the brown sugar, sea salt, cinnamon and cayenne until combined.<SEP>In a large mixing bowl, whisk together egg white and vanilla until combined. Add the walnuts and toss until they are evenly coated with the egg white mixture. Add the brown sugar mixture and toss until the walnuts are evenly coated.<SEP>Spread the pecans out in an even layer on the baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove baking sheet from the oven, and give the walnuts a brief stir. Return to the oven and bake for 20 more minutes. Remove and transfer to a wire rack to cool for 10 minutes.<SEP>Serve immediately, or store in a sealed container for up to 2 weeks.

bxQxXeo4LfVqhjWQXTTC.directions: Preheat the convection oven to 375°F. Line two 12-count muffin tins with paper liners.<SEP>Create the streusel topping by combining pecans, brown sugar, and 1/2 cup flour in a small bowl. Add 1/4 melted butter, and stir until the mixture resembles crumbs. Set aside.<SEP>Combine 3 cups flour, sugar, and baking powder in a large bowl.<SEP>Combine milk, 1 cup butter, and eggs in a small bowl.<SEP>Pour milk mixture into flour mixture, and stir just enough to combine.<SEP>Spoon half of the batter into the muffin cups, filling each cup about 1/4 full. Then place 4 raspberries in each cup. Spoon the rest of the batter over the raspberries, leaving enough room for streusel topping.<SEP>Sprinkle topping onto batter.<SEP>Bake 25 to 30 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean.<SEP>Remove from pan and cool on a rack.
bxQxXeo4LfVqhjWQXTTC.ingredients: 1/2 cup chopped pecans<SEP>1/2 cup packed brown sugar<SEP>3 1/2 cups flour, divided<SEP>1 1/4 cups butter, melted, divided<SEP>1 cup sugar<SEP>4 teaspoons baking powder<SEP>1 cup milk<SEP>2 eggs, beaten<SEP>2 cups fresh or individually frozen raspberries
bxQxXeo4LfVqhjWQXTTC.name: Raspberry Streusel Muffins
bxQxXeo4LfVqhjWQXTTC.notes: Makes a lot (24 regular-sized muffins)! Half the recipe unless you're feeding a large group.

c56K1KiW0rjxGpX2mPAo.name: Whole Wheat Pita Bread
c56K1KiW0rjxGpX2mPAo.ingredients: 4 c. whole wheat flour (or 2 cups whole wheat flour and 2 cups all-purpose flour)<SEP>1 T. dry yeast<SEP>1 1⁄4 c. warm water (120-130F degrees)<SEP>1⁄2 t. salt (optional)
c56K1KiW0rjxGpX2mPAo.directions: Preheat oven to 500°F.<SEP>Sift together 2 cups of flour and the yeast.<SEP>Add water and salt and mix well.<SEP>Gradually add in the remaining flour just until the dough begins to clean the sides of the bowl. Once this happens, stop adding flour (so, you might not use all the flour the recipe calls for.).<SEP>Knead the dough for about 4 or 5 minutes, or until dough is smooth and elastic. (While you're kneading, you can get creative and add in some herbs or spices, but only if you want to do that). Be careful not to over-knead the dough.<SEP>Form dough into 10 balls.<SEP>On a floured surface, roll each ball into a 5-6 inch circle, about 1/4 inch thick. (Be sure to sprinkle a little flour on both sides to prevent sticking).<SEP>Place on a non-stick baking sheet and allow to rise 30 minutes, or until slightly raised.<SEP>Just before you place the pan in the oven, flip each pita over on its other side.<SEP>Bake on the bottom rack of the oven for 5 minutes. (The instant hot heat will help them puff up).<SEP>When the pitas come out of the oven they will be hard, but they will soften as the cool.<SEP>Store them, while they're still warm, in plastic baggies or an airtight container.<SEP>Cut the pitas in half crosswise and stuff with your favorite fillings (beans and rice, taco fixings, thick stews, curries - anything goes).
c56K1KiW0rjxGpX2mPAo.notes: Pitas can be reheated in a 350°F oven or in the microwave.

c5xrPn51BfhO0MiWo5BL.ingredients: #Pork Seasoning<SEP>1 tablespoon cumin<SEP>1 tablespoon regular or smoked paprika<SEP>1 tablespoon onion powder<SEP>1 tablespoon chili powder<SEP> 1 tablespoon garlic powder<SEP> 2 teaspoons salt (I use coarse, kosher salt)<SEP> 1/2 teaspoon black pepper (I use coarsely ground)<SEP><SEP>#Sweet Pork<SEP> 3-5 pounds boneless sirloin pork roast or pork shoulder roast<SEP> 1 cup root beer or cola soda<SEP> 1 cup green salsa or enchilada sauce<SEP><SEP>#Pork Sauce<SEP> 2 cups red enchilada sauce (see note for homemade version)<SEP> 1/2 cup light or dark brown sugar<SEP> 8 ounces chopped green chiles (blend for smoother texture, if desired)<SEP> 1 cup green salsa or enchilada sauce<SEP><SEP>#Dressing<SEP>1 (1 ounce) package Hidden Valley Ranch Dressing mix<SEP>2 cups sour cream<SEP>1 large or 2 small tomatillos (they are green and by the tomatoes)<SEP>2 cloves garlic, minced<SEP>1/2 bunch cilantro, chopped<SEP>1/2 teaspoon lime juice<SEP>1/2 to 1 small jalapeno<SEP><SEP>#Salad Ingredients<SEP>Romaine Lettuce<SEP>Tomatoes<SEP>Shredded Cheese (or queso fresco)<SEP>Cilantro<SEP>Black Beans<SEP>Tortilla Strips (optional)<SEP><SEP>
c5xrPn51BfhO0MiWo5BL.directions: #Pork Directions<SEP>Combine all the seasoning ingredients together in a small bowl. Measure out 2 tablespoons of the mixture and save for later.<SEP>Cut the pork roast into large chunks (4-6 inches) and rub the remaining seasoning mixture (not the reserved 2 tablespoons) evenly over all sides of the pork.<SEP><SEP>Pressure cooker: add the root beer/cola soda and the 1 cup green salsa/enchilada sauce to the insert of an electric pressure cooker. Stir to combine. Add the seasoned pork. Secure the lid, set the valve to seal and cook on high pressure for 55-60 minutes. Let the pressure naturally release for 10 minutes and then quick release the remaining pressure.<SEP>Transfer the pork to a cutting board or pan and shred. Discard all but 1/2 cup of the cooking liquid in the pressure cooker. Add the pork back to the pressure cooker. Add the 2 tablespoons of reserved spices, red enchilada sauce, brown sugar, green chiles and green salsa/enchilada sauce and stir/toss to combine. <SEP>Heat through using the saute function (stir often to avoid sticking) or slow cooker function (high for 30 minutes or so). Keep warm until serving.<SEP><SEP>Slow cooker: add the root beer/cola soda and the 1 cup green salsa/enchilada sauce to the insert of a slow cooker. Stir to combine. Add the seasoned pork. <SEP>Cover and cook on low for 8-9 hours or high for 5-6 hours until tender. Transfer the pork to a cutting board or pan and shred. Discard all but 1/2 cup of the cooking liquid in the slow cooker. Add the shredded pork back to the slow cooker. Add the 2 tablespoons of reserved spices, red enchilada sauce, brown sugar, green chiles and green salsa/enchilada sauce and stir/toss to combine. <SEP><SEP>Cover and cook on high for 15-20 minutes until heated through. Keep warm until serving.<SEP><SEP>#Dressing<SEP>Add all the ingredients in to a blender.<SEP>Blend until smooth.<SEP>Serve as a dressing over salad or as a dip for veggies and chips.<SEP>
c5xrPn51BfhO0MiWo5BL.name: Cafe Rio Pork Salad Bowl (with dressing)

cBQe9RrJdihdOLHFfXdk.ingredients: Seeded bread<SEP>Neufchâtel or Ricotta cheese <SEP>Figs<SEP>Olive oil<SEP>Honey<SEP>Flaky sea salt
cBQe9RrJdihdOLHFfXdk.directions: Spread toasted seeded bread with softened Neufchâtel cheese. Top with sliced ripe figs and drizzle with olive oil and honey. Season with flaky sea salt.
cBQe9RrJdihdOLHFfXdk.name: Fig Toast

cFdgcGXAn2iZ78OXCSIl.directions: In a large bowl, cut shortening into flour, sugar (if using) and salt with a pastry blender (or two forks) until mixture resembles coarse crumbs<SEP>Combine the 1/3 C. flour and 1/2 C. water to make a slurry<SEP>Pour over crumbed shortening mixture and mix til just combined<SEP>Turn out dough onto a floured surface and form into a ball<SEP>Divide dough in half, wrap each half in plastic wrap and flatten into a small disc<SEP>Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to set. (this will make rollin git out much easier. If you don't need a double crust, you can freeze one half of the dough and use it later)<SEP>When ready to use the crust, roll out each half on a heavily floured surface. If it doesn't go well the first time, it's okay. Just crumple it back into a ball and try again, it's VERY forgiving.<SEP>To pre-bake the crust, bake at 375 for 15-20 minutes<SEP>*Use pie weights or dried beans are necessary for the crust to keep its shape. Lay parchment paper on top of the crust and pour dried beans on top.
cFdgcGXAn2iZ78OXCSIl.ingredients: 2 C. Flour<SEP>1 C. Shortening<SEP>1 tsp. Salt<SEP>1 Tbsp. Sugar (omit if making savory dish)<SEP><SEP>#Slurry:<SEP>1/3 C. Flour<SEP>1/2 C. Water
cFdgcGXAn2iZ78OXCSIl.name: Failproof Pie Crust

cKmpo0VJDnJJNdLNrIs1.ingredients: 3 lemons<SEP>1 1/2 cups sugar<SEP>1/4 pound unsalted butter, room temperature<SEP>4 extra-large eggs<SEP>1/2 cup lemon juice (3 to 4 lemons)<SEP>1/8 teaspoon kosher salt
cKmpo0VJDnJJNdLNrIs1.name: Lemon Curd
cKmpo0VJDnJJNdLNrIs1.directions: Using a carrot peeler, remove the zest of 3 lemons, being careful to avoid the white pith. Put the zest in a food processor fitted with the steel blade. Add the sugar and pulse until the zest is very finely minced into the sugar.<SEP>Cream the butter and beat in the sugar and lemon mixture. Add the eggs, 1 at a time, and then add the lemon juice and salt. Mix until combined.<SEP>Pour the mixture into a 2 quart saucepan and cook over low heat until thickened (about 10 minutes), stirring constantly. The lemon curd will thicken at about 170 degrees F, or just below simmer. Remove from the heat and cool or refrigerate.

cZaMALIyx0gwnej141rB.name: Teriyaki Sauce
cZaMALIyx0gwnej141rB.ingredients: 1⁄4 cup soy sauce<SEP>Mirin (optional)<SEP>1 cup water<SEP>1⁄2 teaspoon ground ginger<SEP>1⁄4 teaspoon garlic powder<SEP>5 tablespoons packed brown sugar<SEP>1 -2 tablespoon honey<SEP>2 tablespoons cornstarch<SEP>1⁄4 cup cold water
cZaMALIyx0gwnej141rB.directions: Mix all but cornstarch and 1/4c water in a sauce pan and begin heating.<SEP>Mix cornstarch and cold water in a cup and dissolve.<SEP>After sauce is simmering, add cornstarch and water mixture, whisking well until sauce thickens.<SEP>Heat until sauce thickens to desired thickness.<SEP>Add water to thin if needed.

dRyf1QkmkrkTXR2xNkOh.name: Pear, Apple and Cranberry Crisp
dRyf1QkmkrkTXR2xNkOh.directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.<SEP>Peel and core the pears and apples and cut them into large chunks. Place the fruit in a large bowl and toss with the cranberries, zests, juices, granulated sugar, flour, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Pour into a 9 by 12 by 2-inch baking dish.<SEP>For the topping:<SEP>Combine the flour, sugars, salt, oatmeal, and cold butter in the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with a paddle attachment. Mix on low speed for 1 to 2 minutes, or until the mixture is in large crumbles. Sprinkle evenly over the fruit, covering the fruit completely.<SEP>Place the baking dish on a parchment-lined sheet pan and bake for 50 minutes to 1 hour, until the top is brown and the fruit is bubbly. Serve warm.
dRyf1QkmkrkTXR2xNkOh.ingredients: 2 pounds ripe Bosc pears (4 pears)<SEP>2 pounds firm Macoun apples (6 apples)<SEP>3/4 cup dried cranberries<SEP>1 teaspoon grated orange zest<SEP>1 teaspoon grated lemon zest<SEP>2 tablespoons freshly squeezed orange juice<SEP>2 tablespoons freshly squeezed lemon juice<SEP>1/2 cup granulated sugar<SEP>1/4 cup all-purpose flour<SEP>1 teaspoon ground cinnamon<SEP>1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg<SEP>#For the topping:<SEP>1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour<SEP>3/4 cup granulated sugar<SEP>3/4 cup light brown sugar, lightly packed<SEP>1/2 teaspoon kosher salt<SEP>1 cup old-fashioned oatmeal<SEP>1/2 pound (2 sticks) cold unsalted butter, diced

e71N1jJ2B4QStOulvhFl.name: Taco Seasoning
e71N1jJ2B4QStOulvhFl.ingredients: 1 tablespoon chili powder<SEP>¼ teaspoon garlic powder<SEP>¼ teaspoon onion powder<SEP>¼ teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes<SEP>¼ teaspoon dried oregano<SEP>½ teaspoon paprika<SEP>1 ½ teaspoons ground cumin<SEP>1 teaspoon sea salt<SEP>1 teaspoon black pepper
e71N1jJ2B4QStOulvhFl.directions: Put all ingredients in a mason jar, shake to mix.

eMnWGUaJQexQpzeam98k.directions: #For the Chicken:<SEP>In a large bag or bowl, combine the chicken and taco seasoning along with 1 tablespoon oil. Marinate in the fridge for 20 minutes or up to 48 hours. Heat a large pan to medium-high heat. Cook chicken breasts for 5-7 minutes per side or until fully cooked. Remove from pan and rest for 10 minutes then chop into bite-size pieces.<SEP>In the same pan, add a teaspoon of oil along with sliced bell peppers and onion. Saute for 3-4 minutes or until the veggies are tender.<SEP><SEP>#For the Rice: <SEP>While the chicken is cooking, boil 2 cups water in a large pot over high heat. Once the water has boiled, add the rice and 1 teaspoon oil. Season with salt and pepper. Cover and reduce the heat to low and cook until the rice is tender and all the water is absorbed. Add in the cilantro and fluff rice with a fork.<SEP>To make guacamole and tomato salsa; While the rice and chicken are cooking, mash the avocado in a small bowl. Add half the minced cilantro (1 tablespoon), half the minced onion (1 tablespoon), and half the minced jalapeno. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and juice of 1/2 lime. Stir until the avocados are fully mashed. Set aside. In another small bowl, combine the diced tomatoes, and the remaining minced cilantro (1 tablespoon, minced onion (1 tablespoon), and half of the minced jalapeno. Please note, the recipes for the guacamole and salsa and lettuce only makes enough for 2 days so they don't go bad.<SEP><SEP>#To assemble:<SEP>Divide the rice, chicken, bell peppers, and beans into 4 bowls. Divide the romaine lettuce, a tomato salsa, a scoop of guacamole and scoop of sour-cream into the remains 2 bowls. Cover and store in the fridge for up to 4 days and the cold ingredients (salad, guac, salsa) for 2 days.
eMnWGUaJQexQpzeam98k.notes: To make your own tacos seasoning for the chicken, combine: 1 tablespoon chili powder, 1 1/2 teaspoons ground cumin, 1/2 teaspoon paprika, 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder, 1/4 teaspoon onion powder, 1/4 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes, 1/4 teaspoon dried oregano, 1 teaspoon sea salt, 1 teaspoon black pepper.<SEP><SEP>To re-heat. Heat ONLY the chicken and rice bowls for 2-3 minutes in the microwave. Top with the salad bowls when ready to eat. Prep more of the cold bowls when you run out. Enjoy!
eMnWGUaJQexQpzeam98k.name: Chicken Burrito Bowls
eMnWGUaJQexQpzeam98k.ingredients: #Chicken<SEP>4 small-medium boneless (or 1 pound) skinless chicken breasts, pounded (or thighs)<SEP>1  or 2 tablespoons homemade<SEP><SEP>#Rice<SEP>2 cups water<SEP>1 cup white basmati rice<SEP>1 teaspoon vegetable oil<SEP>1 lime<SEP>2 tablespoons freshly chopped cilantro<SEP>kosher salt to taste<SEP><SEP>#Guacamole and salsa<SEP>1 ripe Avocado<SEP>2 tablespoons cilantro minced, divided<SEP>1/2 small jalapeno minced, divided<SEP>1/8 cup onion minced, divided<SEP>1 small tomato diced<SEP>juice of 1 lime<SEP><SEP>#Add-Ins<SEP>2 Bell Peppers sliced into strips (colors of choice)<SEP>1/2 onion sliced into strips<SEP>2 cups chopped romaine lettuce<SEP>1/2 cup light sour-cream<SEP>1/2 cup black beans

ehMO1Oh9GEpmtCLxoQSH.directions: To make the dressing, whisk together the mustard and vinegar in a small bowl, along with the garlic and chile. Add the oil a little at a time, whisking all the while.<SEP><SEP>Combine the cabbage, bell pepper, and scallion and toss with the dressing. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and refrigerate until ready to serve. (It's best to let the slaw rest for an hour or so to allow the flavors to mellow; the cabbage will also soften a bit and exude some juice. You can let it sit longer, up to 24 hours, if you like. Drain the slaw before continuing.) Just before serving, toss with the parsley.
ehMO1Oh9GEpmtCLxoQSH.name: Spicy No-Mayo Coleslaw
ehMO1Oh9GEpmtCLxoQSH.ingredients: 2 tablespoons Dijon mustard, or to taste<SEP>2 tablespoons sherry vinegar, red wine vinegar, or freshly squeezed lemon juice<SEP>1 small clove garlic, minced<SEP>1 tablespoon minced fresh chile, like jalapeño, Thai, serrano, or habanero, or to taste (optional)<SEP>1/4 cup peanut oil or extra virgin olive oil<SEP>6 cups cored and shredded Napa, Savoy, green, and/or red cabbage<SEP>1 large red or yellow bell pepper, cored, seeded, and diced or shredded<SEP>1/3 cup chopped scallion, more or less<SEP>Salt and freshly ground black pepper<SEP>1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley leaves

ej5lanOUyLMq3WmsWFTP.ingredients: #COCONUT QUINOA<SEP>1 cup uncooked quinoa<SEP>1 15-oz. can full-fat coconut milk<SEP>1/2 cup water<SEP>1 tablespoon maple syrup<SEP><SEP>#ROASTED SWEET POTATOES<SEP>2 large sweet potatoes, cut into bite-sized cubes<SEP>2 tablespoons olive oil<SEP>1 tablespoon minced garlic<SEP>1/8 teaspoon salt<SEP>1/8 teaspoon ground pepper<SEP>1 teaspoon black sesame seeds<SEP><SEP>#PURPLE CABBAGE SLAW<SEP>1 cup purple cabbage, sliced<SEP>1 cup shelled edamame<SEP>1 large red pepper, sliced<SEP>1 large carrot, cut into thin sticks<SEP>1 tablespoon olive oil<SEP>1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar<SEP>1 tablespoon fresh lime juice<SEP>1 teaspoon soy sauce<SEP>1 teaspoon freshly grated ginger<SEP>1/8 teaspoon salt<SEP><SEP>#PEANUT SAUCE<SEP>2.5 tablespoons all-natural peanut butter<SEP>2.5 tablespoons water<SEP>1 teaspoon soy sauce<SEP>1 teaspoon maple syrup<SEP><SEP>#TOPPINGS<SEP>1/4 cup fresh cilantro, chopped<SEP>1/4 cup chopped peanuts<SEP>squeeze of lime juice<SEP>Black sesame seeds, to toast
ej5lanOUyLMq3WmsWFTP.name: Thai Coconut Quinoa Bowls
ej5lanOUyLMq3WmsWFTP.directions: #QUINOA<SEP>Place all ingredients in a medium size pot. Bring to a rolling boil over medium/high heat.<SEP>Once boiling, reduce heat to low, cover, and let simmer for around 20 minutes or until the liquid has absorbed and the quinoa has fully cooked.<SEP><SEP>#ROASTED SWEET POTATOES<SEP>Preheat oven to 400ºF. Then, place diced sweet potatoes on a large baking sheet and drizzle with olive oil. Toss to fully coat.<SEP>Then, season with minced garlic, salt, pepper, and black sesame seeds. Toss to combine.<SEP>Roast sweet potatoes at 400ºF for 25-30 minutes.<SEP><SEP>#CABBAGE SLAW<SEP>Place purple cabbage, edamame, carrot, and red pepper in a bowl. Set aside.<SEP>Make dressing by whisking together olive oil, apple cider vinegar, lime juice, soy sauce, maple syrup, grated ginger, and salt.<SEP>Then, toss veggies in dressing. Set aside.<SEP><SEP>#PEANUT SAUCE<SEP>To make peanut sauce, place all ingredients into a medium bowl or jar and mix together to combine.<SEP><SEP>#ASSEMBLY<SEP>Evenly distribute the coconut quinoa, sweet potatoes, and coleslaw into four bowls or meal prep containers.<SEP>Drizzle with peanut sauce if eating immediately and top with cilantro, chopped peanuts, a lime wedge, and more black sesame seeds.

euxbACw7z57DOAYP6tht.ingredients: 1 tablespoon olive oil<SEP>1 small or 1/2 large shallot, finely chopped<SEP>2 tablespoons apple juice<SEP>1 cup half-and-half<SEP>1 package (8 oz.) cream cheese, cut into 1-inch pieces<SEP>1/2 Cup grated Parmesan cheese<SEP>1 cup shredded Swiss cheese<SEP>1 teaspoon lemon juice<SEP>1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg<SEP>1/2 teaspoon pepper
euxbACw7z57DOAYP6tht.directions: Heat olive oil in fondue pot over medium heat (setting 5 or 6). Add chopped shallots and saute for 2-3 minutes. Reduce heat to low. Add apple juice and cook for a minute or two, allowing most of the juice to evaporate.<SEP>Place half-and half, cream cheese, Parmesan and Swiss cheeses, lemon juice, nutmeg and black pepper in blender and mix until smooth.<SEP>Pour ingredients from the blender into fondue pot and change the setting to medium and heat until warm.
