Reduce heat to lowest setting to keep warm for serving.<SEP>Slice French bread into 1-inch thick slices and lightly broil on both sides to toast. Cut into cubes.<SEP>Serve fondue with meatballs, French bread, vegetables.
euxbACw7z57DOAYP6tht.name: Cheese Fondue

fLX0AUJhMQ8DqptybHKc.directions: Combine cucumbers, tomatoes, scallions, olives, half of feta, and mint in a large bowl. Whisk oil and lemon juice in a small bowl; season dressing with salt and pepper. Pour dressing over salad; toss to coat. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Sprinkle remaining half of feta over and serve.
fLX0AUJhMQ8DqptybHKc.ingredients: 6 cups coarsely chopped English hothouse or Persian cucumbers (about 2 pounds total)<SEP>2 large tomatoes (about 1 pound total), coarsely chopped<SEP>1 bunch scallions, chopped<SEP>1 cup assorted pitted olives (such as Kalamata or Gaeta), halved<SEP>1 7-ounce package feta, crumbled, divided<SEP>1/2 cup coarsely chopped fresh mint<SEP>6 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil<SEP>1/4 cup fresh lemon juice<SEP>Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
fLX0AUJhMQ8DqptybHKc.name: Cucumber, Tomato & Feta Salad

fQKqMyzIPy3tVWAvGnrp.directions: Brown hamburger<SEP>Add onion and green pepper<SEP>Cook until vegetables are softened<SEP>Add remaining ingredients<SEP>Cook covered for 20 minutes<SEP>Spoon over tortilla chips and top with lettuce, cheese, sour cream, tomatoes, guacamole etc. Or on a soft taco shell.
fQKqMyzIPy3tVWAvGnrp.ingredients: 1 lb. Hamburger or 2 C. cut up chicken<SEP>1/2 Chopped green pepper<SEP>1 C. Chopped onion or 2 TBS. dried onion<SEP>1 (16 oz.) Can diced tomatoes<SEP>1 (16 oz.) Can kidney beans<SEP>1 can Pork and beans or any other bean variety<SEP>1/2 tsp. Salt<SEP>1 1/2 tsp. Chili powder<SEP>1/2 tsp. Garlic salt<SEP>1/2 C. Minute Rice<SEP>1/2 C. Water
fQKqMyzIPy3tVWAvGnrp.notes: This recipe can feed a crowd.
fQKqMyzIPy3tVWAvGnrp.name: Nacho Supreme

fSEONNX9PcCmVGRsErAD.name: Borscht
fSEONNX9PcCmVGRsErAD.ingredients: 1/4 - 1/2 head cabbage<SEP>4 cups reduced sodium chicken broth + 6 cups water<SEP>3 medium yukon potatoes peeled and sliced into bite-sized pieces<SEP>1-2 tomatoes, diced<SEP>1/2 lb meat: chicken, beef, or pork sausage (optional)<SEP>3-4 shredded carrots<SEP>3 medium beets, grated<SEP>1 onion<SEP>4-6 cloves garlic, minced<SEP>2 bay leaves<SEP>Sour cream<SEP>Fresh dill
fSEONNX9PcCmVGRsErAD.directions: Brown meat. <SEP>Shred the carrots, beets, and cabbage in a food processor.<SEP>Add the carrots, beets, onion, and garlic. Saute until tender.<SEP>Then add veggies and meat to a large pot with the rest of the ingredients.<SEP>Bring to a boil, simmer until potatoes are cooked to desired tenderness.<SEP>Add fresh dill, salt, pepper to taste. <SEP>Serve with dollop of sour cream in the middle, garnished with dill.

fjiYBFDQUuOuvOVecGNk.notes: Less meat. More kale and potatoes. Add kale at the end.
fjiYBFDQUuOuvOVecGNk.name: Zuppa Toscana (Instant Pot)
fjiYBFDQUuOuvOVecGNk.directions: Turn your pressure cooker to the sauté setting. Place sausage inside the liner and chop, stirring frequently until nearly browned throughout. <SEP>Add bacon and onion to your partially browned sausage, continue cooking until they are done. Drain excess fat.<SEP>Stir in chicken broth, potatoes, water, salt, and pepper. Replace lid, be sure that the valve is closed.<SEP>Cook on high pressure for 8 minutes then slowly release valve. <SEP>Immediately after pressure is released, add kale.<SEP>Whisk in heavy whipping cream to combine well with the other ingredients.<SEP>Top individual bowls of soup with a bit of crumbled bacon for garnish, serve and enjoy!
fjiYBFDQUuOuvOVecGNk.ingredients: 3/4 lb. spicy ground sausage<SEP>4 cups chicken broth<SEP>2 cups water<SEP>1 cup heavy cream<SEP>2 cups of Kale, chopped small<SEP>6 slices of raw bacon,  chopped<SEP>2 large potatoes, chopped<SEP>1 small onion, diced<SEP>2 cloves garlic, diced<SEP>1 small onion, chopped<SEP>salt and pepper to taste

fqrrFN3lRwlOlMDEF9JK.ingredients: 2 cups chicken, shredded<SEP>1/2 cup monterey jack cheese<SEP>1/2 cup cheddar cheese<SEP>1/2 cup Frank's RedHot Buffalo Wings Sauce<SEP>32 wonton wrappers<SEP>1 egg white<SEP>2 cups Italian breadcrumbs<SEP>Peanut or vegetable oil, for frying<SEP>Celery sticks<SEP>Frank's RedHot Buffalo Wings Sauce, for serving<SEP>Blue cheese dressing, for serving
fqrrFN3lRwlOlMDEF9JK.directions: Mix together the shredded chicken, monterey jack cheese, cheddar cheese, and hot sauce in a large bowl.<SEP>Place a wonton wrapper on a flat surface, and spoon 1 tablespoon of the buffalo chicken mixture into the center of the wonton. Lightly moisten the edge of the wonton wrapper with water, and fold 1 corner diagonally across to the other corner to create a triangle. Press the wrapper together at the seam to seal. Lightly brush the wonton with egg white, and dip the wonton into breadcrumbs on both sides to coat. Repeat with the remaining wontons.<SEP>Heat oil in a heavy-bottomed dutch oven or electric deep fryer to 350ºF. Fry wontons in batches for about 2 to 3 minutes, or until the outside is crispy and golden brown. Place wontons on a paper-towel-lined plate to drain off any excess oil, and serve warm with celery, buffalo wing sauce, and blue cheese dressing.
fqrrFN3lRwlOlMDEF9JK.name: Buffalo Blasts

fx19IlzEDR2BzjgZnV7t.notes: To toast the coconut-place coconut on lined baking sheet. Bake for 5-8 minutes at 350 degrees. Tossing a couple of times. Remove from oven when coconut is light brown.
fx19IlzEDR2BzjgZnV7t.name: Chewy Lime and Coconut Sugar Cookies
fx19IlzEDR2BzjgZnV7t.ingredients: 2 3/4 cups all-purpose flour<SEP> 1 teaspoon baking soda<SEP> 1/2 teaspoon baking powder<SEP> 1/2 teaspoon salt<SEP> 1 cup butter softened<SEP> 1 1/2 cups white sugar<SEP> 1 large egg<SEP> 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract<SEP> Zest of one large lime<SEP> 3 tbsp lime juice<SEP> ½ cup toasted coconut<SEP> 1/2 cup sugar for rolling cookies
fx19IlzEDR2BzjgZnV7t.directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line cookie sheets with parchment paper or Silpats.<SEP>In a small bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, baking powder and salt. Set aside.<SEP>Using a mixer, beat together the butter and sugar until smooth and very fluffy. This will take a couple of minutes.<SEP>Beat in the egg, vanilla extract, lime juice and lime zest. Mix until well combined.<SEP>Gradually add in the dry ingredients and toasted coconut. Mix until combined, don't over mix.<SEP>Roll rounded teaspoonfuls of cookie dough into balls. Put sugar in a small bowl and roll cookie dough balls in the sugar. Place on lined cookie sheets about 1 1/2 inches apart.<SEP>Bake 8 to 10 minutes or until lightly browned. The cookies will start to crack a little bit.<SEP>Let stand on cookie sheet two minutes. Move cookies to a cooling rack.

fy2H3Nd9IZlyEMqF4qve.name: Pizza Sauce
fy2H3Nd9IZlyEMqF4qve.ingredients: 1 6 oz can tomato paste<SEP>1 15 oz can tomato sauce<SEP>1-2 TBS oregano to taste<SEP>2 TBS Italian seasoning<SEP>½ tsp garlic powder<SEP>½ tsp onion powder<SEP>½ TBS garlic salt<SEP>¼ tsp freshly ground black pepper<SEP>1 tsp sugar
fy2H3Nd9IZlyEMqF4qve.directions: Mix tomato paste and sauce together in a medium size bowl until well combined (all the lumps of paste are incorporated into the sauce).<SEP>Add the rest of the ingredients (oregano, Italian seasoning, garlic powder, onion powder, garlic salt, pepper and sugar) and mix well.

g4tq6KzJV9wS6voOgPLB.name: Ooey Gooey Cake
g4tq6KzJV9wS6voOgPLB.notes: Serve with berries and whipped cream<SEP><SEP>Emma Daines Smith
g4tq6KzJV9wS6voOgPLB.ingredients: #Cake:<SEP>1 Box Yellow Cake Mix (18 1/4 oz)<SEP>1 Egg<SEP>16 Tbsp. Butter, melted, divided<SEP><SEP>#Filling:<SEP>1- 8 oz. Cream Cheese, softened<SEP>2 Eggs<SEP>1- 16 oz. Bag Powdered Sugar<SEP>1 tsp. Vanilla
g4tq6KzJV9wS6voOgPLB.directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.<SEP>Combine the cake mix, egg, and 8 Tbsp butter and mix well with an electric mixer. <SEP>Press the mixture into the bottom of a lightly greased 9x13 baking pan.<SEP>In a large bowl, beat the cream cheese until smooth. <SEP>Add the eggs, 8 Tbsp butter and vanilla and beat together.<SEP>Next, add the powdered sugar and mix well. <SEP>Spread over cake batter and bake for 40 to 50 minutes. Make sure not to over bake as the center should be a little gooey.

g8iMuDXbuS5qN0m4qWLb.ingredients: #Sauce<SEP>6 Tbsp soy sauce<SEP>4 Tbsp sugar<SEP>3 Tbsp rice vinegar<SEP>2 Tbsp sesame oil (roasted)<SEP>2 Tbsp water<SEP>1 Tbsp toasted white sesame seeds<SEP>¼ tsp ginger (grated)<SEP>½-1 tsp la-yu (Japanese chili oil)<SEP><SEP>#Egg Crepe<SEP>2 large eggs (beaten)<SEP>2 tsp sugar<SEP>¼ tsp kosher/sea salt (I use Diamond Crystal; Use half for table salt)<SEP>neutral-flavored oil (vegetable, canola, etc)<SEP><SEP>#Toppings<SEP>6 shrimps (+ 1 Tbsp sake)<SEP>1 Persian/Japanese cucumbers (or 1/3 English cucumber, julienned)<SEP>1 iceberg lettuce (shredded)<SEP>½ tomato (cut into wedges)<SEP>3-4 slices hams<SEP>4-6 imitation crab meat (kanikama) (or crab meat, shredded)<SEP>Kaiware radish sprouts<SEP><SEP>#Other topping options<SEP>chicken tender (steamed, shredded)<SEP>bean sprouts (blanched)<SEP>dried wakame seaweed<SEP>shredded nori seaweed (kizami nori)<SEP><SEP>#Noodles:<SEP>3 servings ramen noodles (6 oz or 170 g fresh noodles/person)<SEP><SEP>#Garnish<SEP>1 Tbsp toasted white sesame seeds<SEP>Japanese karashi hot mustard (optional)<SEP>pickled red ginger (beni shoga or kizami beni shoga) (beni shoga, optional)
g8iMuDXbuS5qN0m4qWLb.name: Hiyashi Chuka (Marie)
g8iMuDXbuS5qN0m4qWLb.directions: Combine all the noodle dressing ingredients in a medium bowl and whisk all together. You can keep it chilled in the refrigerator.<SEP>For eggs, you make thin egg crepe and cut into thin strips (Kinshi Tamago). If you want to make super-thin crepe, follow my recipe here. Whisk together the eggs, sugar, and salt. Heat the oil in the pan over medium heat. Pour the egg mixture into the pan and cook on both sides.<SEP>Cool the crepe and slice into very thin strips.<SEP>For shrimps, bring a small pot of water to a boil. Add sake and shrimp and cover with the lid. The alcohol in the sake will help remove the smell and tender the meat. Turn off the heat when the color of shrimp started to change and let it cook with remaining heat. Do not overcook otherwise shrimp will become hard. Transfer shrimps to a plate and let them cool.<SEP>Cut all the topping ingredients.<SEP>For the noodles, bring a pot of water to a boil and add the noodles, separate the noodles before dropping into water. Cook according to package directions. Drain the water and rinse the noodles to remove starch. Soak the noodles into a bowl of ice water to cool. Drain completely and divide the noodles on plates/bowls.<SEP>Place all the toppings and pour the dressing before serving. Serve with karashi hot mustard and pickled ginger on the side, if desired.

gMaIIAbt5K8DdKdxhgmx.directions: Prepare a proofing oven and preheat the convection oven to 400°F. Move oven rack in convection oven to the low position so that center of pans will be in center of oven. Grease large dinner plate and the bottoms and sides of three 9x5-inch loaf pans with shortening.<SEP>In your KitchenAid mixer bowl, using the flat paddle attachment, stir 3 1/2 cups of flour, sugar, salt, shortening, and yeast until well mixed. Add warm water. Beat on medium speed 1 minute, scraping bowl frequently.<SEP>Change to dough hook attachment and gradually stir in enough remaining flour to make the dough easy to handle.<SEP>Knead about 5 minutes or until dough is smooth and springy.<SEP>Place dough on plate, turning dough to grease all sides. Cover plate loosely with plastic wrap and let rise in proofing oven for 20 minutes or until dough has doubled in size.<SEP>Remove dough from proofing oven and divide dough into thirds.<SEP>On a lightly floured surface, flatten each dough portion with hands or rolling pin into an 18x9-inch rectangle. Roll dough up tightly, beginning at 9-inch side. Press with thumbs to seal after each tum of the roll. Once rolled, pinch each edge of dough to seal.<SEP>Fold ends under loaf. Place seam-side down in prepared loaf pan. Cover loosely with plastic wrap and let rise in proofing oven 20 minutes or until dough has doubled in size.<SEP>Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until loaves are deep golden brown and sound hollow when tapped  Remove loaves from pans to wire rack. Rub loaves with butter and cool.<SEP>Slice on a cutting board with electric knife just prior to serving.
gMaIIAbt5K8DdKdxhgmx.ingredients: 6 to 7 cups bread flour<SEP>3 tablespoons sugar<SEP>1 tablespoon salt<SEP>2 tablespoons shortening<SEP>4 1/2 teaspoons quick active dry yeast<SEP>2 1/4 cups very warm tap water (120°F)<SEP>2 tablespoons butter<SEP>1 - 2 tablespoons shortening for greasing pans
gMaIIAbt5K8DdKdxhgmx.name: Classic White Bread

gP0hiQjH7EFrzFExXfup.ingredients: 1 cup Wheat Bran<SEP>1 1/2 cups Whole Wheat Flour or Organic Whole Wheat Flour<SEP>1 tsp Baking Soda<SEP>1 tsp Baking Powder<SEP>1/4 cup Nuts chopped<SEP>1/2 cup Raisins<SEP>3/4 cup Applesauce<SEP>1 cup Milk<SEP>1/2 cup Molasses or Honey<SEP>2 Tbsp Oil<SEP>2 Eggs beaten
gP0hiQjH7EFrzFExXfup.name: Moist Molasses Bran Muffins
gP0hiQjH7EFrzFExXfup.directions: Preheat oven to 400°F. Grease a 12-cup muffin tin or line with paper baking cups.<SEP>In a large bowl, combine wheat bran, flour, baking soda and baking powder. Stir in nuts and raisins.<SEP>In a separate bowl, combine applesauce, milk, molasses, oil and eggs. Add to dry ingredients and stir just until moistened.<SEP>Spoon into prepared muffin tin and bake for 15–20 minutes.

gdtSqQxT0tTZpzSUMsQx.name: Chocolate Torte
gdtSqQxT0tTZpzSUMsQx.directions: Adjust an oven rack to the lower-middle position and heat the oven to 325°F. Line the bottom of an 8-inch springform pan with parchment paper or waxed paper and grease the sides of the pan. (Be sure to grease the sides really well!) Wrap the outside of the pan with 2 sheets of heavy-duty aluminum foil and set it in a large roasting pan, or any pan that’s larger than the springform. Bring a kettle or pot of water to boil.<SEP>In a stand mixer using the whisk attachment, beat the eggs at high speed until the volume doubles. This usually takes about 5 minutes.<SEP>Meanwhile, melt the chocolate and butter together. You can either do this in a double boiler on the stove (by placing the chocolate and butter in a large heatproof bowl, set over a pan of almost-simmering water, and stirring until melted and smooth). Or you can do this in the microwave (by heating the chocolate and butter in a microwave-safe bowl in 30-second intervals, stirring in between, until the chocolate and butter are melted and smooth). Then fold about a third of the beaten eggs into the chocolate mixture using a large rubber spatula until only a few streaks of egg are visible. Fold in half of the remaining egg foam, and then the last half of the foam, until the mixture is totally homogenous.<SEP>Scrape the batter into the prepared springform pan and smooth the surface with a rubber spatula. Place the roasting pan on the oven rack and VERY carefully pour in enough boiling water to come about halfway up the sides of the springform pan. Bake until the cake has risen slightly, the edges are just beginning to set, a thin-glazed crust (like a brownie) has formed on the surface, and an instant-read thermometer inserted halfway into the center reads 140° F, 22-25 minutes. Remove the springform pan from the water bath and set on a wire rack; cool to room temperature. Cover and refrigerate until cool. (The cake can be refrigerated for up to 4 days.)<SEP>About 30 minutes prior to serving, carefully remove the sides of the springform pan, invert the cake onto a sheet of waxed paper, peel off the parchment paper, and re-invert the cake onto a serving platter. If desired, lightly dust the cake with powdered sugar and top with berries. To slice, use a sharp, thin-bladed knife, dipping the knife into a pitcher of hot water and wiping the blade before each cut.<SEP>I like it cold, so I'll put it in the freezer/fridge before serving (Sylvia).
gdtSqQxT0tTZpzSUMsQx.ingredients: 8 large eggs, cold<SEP>1 lb. dark, semisweet or bittersweet chocolate, coarsely chopped<SEP>16 Tbsp. (2 sticks) unsalted butter, cut into 16 pieces<SEP>optional toppings: powdered sugar and/or berries

gfHrFRwc9gzsUWYWEwwy.ingredients: 1 (8-ounce) wheel brie cheese, rind trimmed<SEP>2 tablespoons brown sugar, packed<SEP>---------<SEP>1/4 cup brown sugar, packed<SEP>2 tablespoons honey<SEP>2 tablespoons maple syrup<SEP>1 tablespoon unsalted butter<SEP>1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon<SEP>Pinch of nutmeg<SEP>Zest of 1 orange<SEP>1/2 cup pecans, chopped<SEP>1/4 cup dried cranberries
gfHrFRwc9gzsUWYWEwwy.name: Cranberry Pecan Baked Brie
gfHrFRwc9gzsUWYWEwwy.directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.<SEP>Place brie on a rimmed baking sheet or a 5-inch cast iron skillet; sprinkle with brown sugar. Place into oven and bake until softened, about 12-15 minutes; let cool 5 minutes.<SEP>In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine brown sugar, honey, maple syrup, butter, cinnamon, nutmeg and orange zest. Bring to a boil; reduce heat and simmer, stirring occasionally, until foamy, about 1-2 minutes. Stir in pecans and cranberries.<SEP>Serve brie warm topped with pecan mixture; serve with crackers or baguette.

gfT0dUAjvLC45EdSGoZI.ingredients: #VEGETABLES<SEP>2 Tbsp olive, melted coconut, or avocado oil<SEP>1/2 medium red onion (sliced in wedges)<SEP>2 small sweet potatoes (halved)<SEP>1 bundle broccolini (large stems removed // chopped)<SEP>2 big handfuls kale (larger stems removed)<SEP>1/4 tsp each salt + pepper<SEP><SEP>#CHICKPEAS<SEP>1 15-ounce chickpeas (drained, rinsed + patted dry)<SEP>1 tsp cumin<SEP>3/4 tsp chili powder<SEP>3/4 tsp garlic powder<SEP>1/4 tsp each salt + pepper<SEP>1/2 tsp tsp oregano (optional)<SEP>1/4 tsp turmeric (optional)<SEP><SEP>#TAHINI SAUCE<SEP>1/4 cup tahini<SEP>1 Tbsp maple syrup<SEP>1/2 medium lemon (juiced)<SEP>2 to 4 Tbsp hot water (to thin)
gfT0dUAjvLC45EdSGoZI.directions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (204 C) and arrange sweet potatoes and onions on a bare baking sheet. Drizzle both with a bit of oil, making sure the flesh of the sweet potatoes are well coated and placed skin side down on the sheet.<SEP>Bake for 10 minutes, then remove from oven flip sweet potatoes and add broccolini. Drizzle broccolini with a bit of oil and season with a pinch each salt and pepper.<SEP>Bake for another 8-10 minutes, then remove from oven and add kale. Drizzle kale with a touch more oil and season with a pinch each salt and pepper. Bake for another 4-5 minutes then set aside.<SEP>While vegetables are roasting, heat a large skillet over medium heat and add chickpeas to a mixing bowl and toss with seasonings.<SEP>Once hot, add 1 Tbsp oil (amount as original recipe is written // use half of total amount if altering batch size) and chickpeas and sauté, stirring frequently. If they’re browning too quickly, turn down heat. If there isn’t much browning going on, increase heat. I found 10 minutes total at slightly over medium heat was perfect.<SEP>Once the chickpeas are browned and fragrant, remove from heat and set aside.<SEP>Prepare sauce by adding tahini, maple syrup and lemon juice to a mixing bowl and whisking to combine. Add hot water until a pourable sauce is formed. Set aside.<SEP>To serve: slice sweet potatoes into bite size pieces. Divide vegetables between 3 serving bowls and top with chickpeas + tahini sauce.<SEP>Best when fresh, though leftovers will keep for a few days in the fridge.
gfT0dUAjvLC45EdSGoZI.name: Buddha Bowl

gk8EydasPu3PpFjOBwNl.name: Skor Bars
gk8EydasPu3PpFjOBwNl.directions: Preheat oven to 180 C (350 F). Line cookie sheet with foil.  <SEP>Cover entirely with crackers, salted side up. <SEP>In pan, melt butter + brown sugar. No need to boil. <SEP>Poor over crackers and spread evenly.  Bake for 7 min.<SEP>Sprinkle chocolate chips on top and crack into pieces.  <SEP>Store in fridge or freezer.
gk8EydasPu3PpFjOBwNl.ingredients: Saltine crackers<SEP>1.5 pkg. chocolate chips<SEP>1 C. brown sugar<SEP>1 C. butter

gkk1O4OjN9MZmAfK158u.directions: #Marinade:<SEP>Combine all ingredients. Cover and refrigerate 1 hour or longer. Thread onto 4 long skewers, discard remaining marinade. Grill or broil chicken. Grill until juices run clear, about 5 minutes each side. Or broil placing skewers with ends hanging over pan edges or place directly<SEP>on oven rack (with a tray underneath to catch drips), wiping off most of marinade beforehand.<SEP>Cook 6 min each side or until done.<SEP><SEP>#Sauce:<SEP>Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Sauté garlic and jalapeno for 1 minute.<SEP>Season with cumin, paprika and salt. Stir in tomato sauce and cream. Simmer on low heat until sauce thickens, about 20 minutes. Add grilled chicken, and simmer for 10 minutes.<SEP><SEP>Serve with Basmati Rice or Naan (Indian Bread) and garnish with fresh cilantro.
gkk1O4OjN9MZmAfK158u.ingredients: #Marinade:<SEP>1 cup Plain Yogurt (can substitute sour cream)<SEP>1 Tbsp. Lemon Juice<SEP>2 tsp. Ground Cumin<SEP>1 tsp. Ground Cinnamon<SEP>½ tsp. Cayenne Pepper (can add up to 2 tsp. if you like spice)<SEP>2 tsp. Freshly ground Black Pepper<SEP>1 Tbsp. Fresh Ginger, minced<SEP>3 boneless, skinless Chicken Breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces<SEP><SEP>#Sauce:<SEP>2 Tbsp. Butter<SEP>2 Garlic clove, minced<SEP>1 Jalapeno pepper, seeds removed and finely chopped<SEP>4 tsp. Ground Cumin <SEP>4 tsp. Paprika<SEP>1 tsp. Salt, or to taste<SEP>2 cans (8 oz.) Tomato Sauce<SEP>2 cup Heavy Cream<SEP>½ cup Fresh Cilantro, chopped
gkk1O4OjN9MZmAfK158u.name: Melinda's Tikka Masala

h5VhksSeK3un7d1BMqQ3.directions: In a large skillet over medium heat combine chicken, 2 tablespoons butter, 2 cloves garlic, and Italian seasoning. Cook until chicken is no longer pink inside. Remove from skillet and set aside.<SEP>Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain.<SEP>Meanwhile, melt 4 tablespoons butter in the skillet. Saute onion, 2 cloves garlic, and mushrooms until onions are transparent. Stir in flour, salt and pepper; cook 2 minutes. Slowly add milk and half-and-half, stirring until smooth and creamy. Stir in Parmesan and Colby-Monterey Jack cheeses; stir until cheese is melted. Stir in chicken mixture, tomatoes and sour cream. Serve over cooked fettuccini.
h5VhksSeK3un7d1BMqQ3.name: Chicken Fettuccine Alfredo
h5VhksSeK3un7d1BMqQ3.ingredients: 6 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cut into cubes<SEP>6 tablespoons butter, divided<SEP>4 cloves garlic, minced, divided<SEP>1 tablespoon Italian seasoning<SEP>1 pound fettuccini pasta<SEP>1 onion, diced<SEP>1 (8 ounce) package sliced mushrooms<SEP>1/3 cup all-purpose flour<SEP>1 tablespoon salt<SEP>3/4 teaspoon ground white pepper<SEP>3 cups milk<SEP>1 cup half-and-half<SEP>3/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese<SEP>8 ounces shredded Colby-Monterey Jack cheese<SEP>3 roma (plum) tomatoes, diced<SEP>1/2 cup sour cream

hTcN2IUUvAkRQleRQcSQ.ingredients: 1/2 pound fresh salmon<SEP>Good olive oil<SEP>Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper<SEP>4 tablespoons unsalted butter<SEP>3/4 cup small-diced red onion (1 small onion)<SEP>1 1/2 cups small-diced celery (4 stalks)<SEP>1/2 cup small-diced red bell pepper (1 small pepper)<SEP>1/2 cup small-diced yellow bell pepper (1 small pepper)<SEP>1/4 cup minced fresh flat-leaf parsley<SEP>1 tablespoon capers, drained<SEP>1/4 teaspoon hot sauce (recommended: Tabasco)<SEP>1/2 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce<SEP>1 1/2 teaspoons crab boil seasoning (recommended: Old Bay)<SEP>3 slices stale bread, crusts removed (or panko bread crumbs)<SEP>1/2 cup good mayonnaise<SEP>2 teaspoons Dijon mustard<SEP>2 extra-large eggs, lightly beaten
hTcN2IUUvAkRQleRQcSQ.directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.<SEP>Place the salmon on a sheet pan, skin side down. Brush with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast for 15 to 20 minutes, until just cooked. Remove from the oven and cover tightly with aluminum foil. Allow to rest for 10 minutes and refrigerate until cold.<SEP>Meanwhile, place 2 tablespoons of the butter, 2 tablespoons olive oil, the onion, celery, red and yellow bell peppers, parsley, capers, hot sauce, Worcestershire sauce, crab boil seasoning, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon pepper in a large saute pan over medium-low heat and cook until the vegetables are soft, approximately 15 to 20 minutes. Cool to room temperature.<SEP>Break the bread slices in pieces and process the bread in a food processor fitted with a steel blade. You should have about 1 cup of bread crumbs. Place the bread crumbs on a sheet pan and toast in the oven for 5 minutes until lightly browned, tossing occasionally.<SEP>Flake the chilled salmon into a large bowl. Add the bread crumbs, mayonnaise, mustard, and eggs. Add the vegetable mixture and mix well. Cover and chill in the refrigerator for 30 minutes. Shape into 10 (2 1/2 to 3-ounce) cakes.<SEP>Heat the remaining 2 tablespoons butter and 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large saute pan over medium heat. In batches, add the salmon cakes and fry for 3 to 4 minutes on each side, until browned. Drain on paper towels; keep them warm in a preheated 250 degree F oven and serve hot.
hTcN2IUUvAkRQleRQcSQ.name: Salmon Cakes

i98veSi58J1PgxAkMsBl.directions: Preheat oven to 350°. Line a jelly roll pan with parchment paper and grease with cooking spray. In a medium bowl mix together flour, cocoa powder, and salt. <SEP>In a large bowl beat egg yolks until thick. Slowly add ½ cup sugar and beat until pale then beat in flour mixture. <SEP>In another large bowl beat egg whites until soft peaks form. Add remaining ¼ cup sugar a little at a time and continue to beat until stiff peaks form. Gently fold egg whites into batter in two batches.<SEP>Pour batter into prepared pan and spread into an even layer. Bake until top springs back when lightly pressed, 12 minutes. <SEP>Dust a clean kitchen towel with powdered sugar and invert warm cake onto towel. Peel off parchment paper. <SEP>Starting at the short end, use the towel to tightly roll cake into a log. Let cool completely. <SEP>Make filling: if using gelatin, place 2 tablespoons cold water in a shallow microwave-safe bowl and sprinkle gelatin in an even layer on top. Let bloom for 5 to 10 minutes, then microwave for 10 seconds until gelatin is runny—do not overheat! <SEP>In a large bowl, beat together heavy cream, powdered sugar, pure vanilla extract, and a pinch of salt, until medium peaks form. If using gelatin, strain and stream into whipped cream at this point while continuing to beat the cream. Refrigerate until ready to use. <SEP>When cake is cool, unroll and spread filling evenly over cake. Roll cake back into a log, using the towel to help create a tight roll. Place seam side down on a baking sheet and refrigerate until well chilled, 1 hour. <SEP>Make frosting: In a large bowl beat butter until smooth. Add powdered sugar and cocoa powder and beat until no lumps remain then beat in vanilla, heavy cream, and salt. <SEP>When ready to serve, trim ends and frost cake with chocolate buttercream. Dust lightly with powdered sugar and top with chocolate curls. Place cranberries and rosemary on log to create mistletoe.
i98veSi58J1PgxAkMsBl.ingredients: #FOR THE CAKE<SEP>Cooking spray<SEP>6 large eggs, separated<SEP>1/2 c. all-purpose flour<SEP>1/4 c. unsweetened cocoa powder<SEP>3/4 c. granulated sugar, divided<SEP>1/4 tsp. kosher salt<SEP>Powdered sugar, for sprinkling<SEP>#FOR THE FILLING<SEP>1 1/4 c. heavy cream<SEP>1/4 c. powdered sugar<SEP>2 tsp. gelatin (optional)<SEP>1 tsp. pure vanilla extract<SEP>Pinch kosher salt<SEP>#FOR THE FROSTING AND DECORATING<SEP>1/2 c. (1 stick) butter, softened<SEP>1 1/2 c. powdered sugar, plus more for garnish<SEP>5 tbsp. cocoa powder<SEP>1 tsp. pure vanilla extract<SEP>3 tbsp. heavy cream<SEP>Pinch kosher salt<SEP>Chocolate curls, for garnish<SEP>Cranberries, for garnish<SEP>Small rosemary sprigs, for garnish
i98veSi58J1PgxAkMsBl.name: Yule Log Cake

iO3IuZX3TPc1ULCMK51L.directions: Preheat oven to 250°F.<SEP>Arrange pretzels on a cookie sheet. Place a Rolo on the top of each pretzel.<SEP>Bake until the Rolos start to melts, about 5 minutes.<SEP>Remove from oven and top with a pecan half. Set in the refrigerator.
iO3IuZX3TPc1ULCMK51L.ingredients: 25 Rolo candies<SEP>25 small pretzels<SEP>25 pecan halves
iO3IuZX3TPc1ULCMK51L.name: Rolo Turtles

id06FsNrnQjPuEnZIJ2S.directions: In a large bowl whisk the flour with the salt. <SEP>In the bowl of your electric mixer (or with a hand mixer), beat the butter until smooth (about 1 minute). Add the sugar and beat until smooth and creamy (about 2 minutes). Beat in the vanilla extract. Gently stir in the flour mixture just until incorporated. Fold in the chopped pistachios and dried cranberries. (Make sure that the nuts and cranberries are evenly distributed throughout the dough.)<SEP>Divide the dough in half. Smooth and shape each half of the dough into an evenly shaped rectangle that is about 8 inches (20 cm) long and 2.5 inches (7.5 cm) wide. Then wrap the shaped logs in plastic wrap or parchment or wax paper, and place in the refrigerator to chill for at least three hours, or up to three days. (The logs can also be frozen for about two months. If freezing, it is best to defrost the logs in the refrigerator overnight before slicing and baking.)<SEP>Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C) with the rack in the center of the oven. Line two baking sheets with parchment paper.<SEP>Using a sharp knife, slice the logs into 1/4 - 1/3 inch (.5 cm) thick cookies. Place the cookies on the prepared baking sheet, spacing about 2 inches (5 cm) apart. Bake for about 15 - 20 minutes, or until the cookies are just beginning to brown around the edges. Remove from oven and cool on a wire rack.<SEP>Makes about 48 shortbread cookies.
id06FsNrnQjPuEnZIJ2S.name: Cranberry Pistachio Shortbread
id06FsNrnQjPuEnZIJ2S.ingredients: 2 1/3 cups (300 grams) all-purpose flour<SEP>1/2 teaspoon (2 grams) salt<SEP>1 cup (225 grams) unsalted butter, at room temperature<SEP>2/3 cup (135 grams) granulated white sugar<SEP>1 teaspoon (4 grams) pure vanilla extract<SEP>1 cup (120 grams) unsalted pistachios, coarsely chopped<SEP>1 cup (120 grams) dried cranberries, coarsely chopped (can use dried cherries)

j2IOExcYD50GgXxmriom.directions: # ginger syrup (part 1)<SEP>Peel a chunk of the ginger with the tip of a teaspoon—the papery skin scrapes right off—and grate it, using the fine side of your grater. Place the ginger, sugar, and water in a saucepan over medium heat and stir until the sugar is dissolved. Turn off the heat and allow the mixture to steep for an hour.<SEP>Strain the mixture (discard the ginger solids) and allow to cool.<SEP>You’ve now made ginger syrup (or gingerette, as the Brits call it). Stop right here if you’re looking for a short-cut to ginger ale and you don’t want to mess around with the fermentation process. Pour three or four tablespoons (more or less depending upon how gingery you like it) of your syrup over ice and add 8 ounces of seltzer water or club soda. Bottle the rest of the syrup and store it in the refrigerator.<SEP><SEP># ginger beer (part 2)<SEP>For the full ginger beer experience, place a funnel in the top of the bottle. Sprinkle the yeast in, followed by the syrup, lemon juice, and water.<SEP>Put the lid on the bottle and shake the concoction until the yeast is dissolved. Stow it on a shady shelf or in your pantry out of direct sunlight for 2-3 days, or until fizz is achieved. At this point it is ready to drink, and must be stored in the refrigerator to prevent further fermentation. Don't forget about the bottle, or the pressure will build up so much that it may explode!<SEP>As with any yeast-powered beverage, the fermentation process continues unless you prevent it from happening. Refrigerating will slow the process down but not stop it completely, that's why it’s best to treat ginger beer as a perishable beverage. Consume within 1-2 weeks.
j2IOExcYD50GgXxmriom.name: Ginger Beer
j2IOExcYD50GgXxmriom.ingredients: #ginger syrup<SEP>3/4 cup granulated sugar<SEP>1/2 cup water<SEP>2-4 tbsp grated fresh ginger<SEP><SEP># ginger beer<SEP>1/8 tsp active dry yeast or brewer's yeast<SEP>3 tbsp lemon juice, freshly squeezed<SEP>7 cups filtered water

jEN16P2gCfKKcHziIOvy.directions: In a microwave-safe bowl, microwave chocolate chips until melted; stir until smooth. Stir in 3/4 cup pistachios and half of the cranberries; spread onto a waxed paper-lined baking sheet. Drizzle with melted candy coating. Cut through layers with a knife to swirl.<SEP>Sprinkle with the remaining pistachios and cranberries. Refrigerate until firm.<SEP>Cut or break into pieces. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.
jEN16P2gCfKKcHziIOvy.name: Pistachio Cranberry Bark
jEN16P2gCfKKcHziIOvy.ingredients: 2 cups (12 ounces) semisweet chocolate chips<SEP>1 cup chopped pistachios, toasted, divided<SEP>3/4 cup dried cranberries, divided<SEP>5 ounces white candy coating, melted

jENpxGfc5arEYyLkb7TM.ingredients: 2 Cups Rice<SEP>4 Cups Water<SEP>2 Tablespoons Unsalted Butter<SEP>2 Teaspoons Chicken Bouillon<SEP>1 Clove Garlic minced<SEP>1 Handful cilantro chopped<SEP>1/2 Lime juiced<SEP>1 Can 4oz Diced Green Chiles
jENpxGfc5arEYyLkb7TM.directions: Pour everything in a rice cooker and follow product instructions, or in a pot, heat to a boil and then add the lid and turn down to low for 20-30 minutes or until tender.<SEP>Remove the lid, stir to combine everything and serve immediately.
jENpxGfc5arEYyLkb7TM.name: Cilantro Lime Rice

jNGgkOx5f4p7jMgoDJbL.name: Baked Ziti
jNGgkOx5f4p7jMgoDJbL.directions: Cook ziti pasta according to package instructions; al dente<SEP>In heavy sauce pan, cook sausage, onion, garlic about 10 minutes<SEP>Add tomatoes with juices and simmer for 10 minutes<SEP>Stir in pesto, season with salt and pepper<SEP>Preheat oven to 375. Lightly oil 9x13" pan<SEP>Combine pasta, spinach, mozzarella, and 1/3 c parmesan cheese in large bowl. Stir in hot tomato sauce mixture<SEP>Transfer mixture to baking dish and sprinkle remaining parmesan on top. Bake about 30 minutes
jNGgkOx5f4p7jMgoDJbL.ingredients: 1/2 lb hot or mild Italian sausage<SEP>1 med. chopped onion<SEP>3 cloves garlic, chopped<SEP>1 (28 oz) can diced peeled tomatoes<SEP>1/4 c. pesto <SEP>10 oz ziti or penne pasta (approx. 3 cups)<SEP>8 c. fresh spinach<SEP>6 oz mozzarella cheese, cubed<SEP>1 c. grated parmesan cheese
jNGgkOx5f4p7jMgoDJbL.notes: Add mushrooms, squash, zucchini, grape tomatoes, basil leaves

jcxIgQ5h0jAZor2fSI0M.ingredients: 1/4 c butter, softened<SEP>2/3 c brown sugar<SEP>1 egg<SEP>1 c applesauce<SEP>1/2 c all purpose flour<SEP>1/2 c wheat flour<SEP>1/2 tsp baking soda<SEP>1/2 tsp salt<SEP>1/4 tsp ground ginger<SEP>1/4 tsp ground nutmeg<SEP>1/2 tsp cinnamon<SEP>1/2 c craisins<SEP>1/2 c chopped, walnuts<SEP>#ICING<SEP>1 1/2 c confectioners' sugar<SEP>3 Tbsp margarine, melted<SEP>1 Tbsp milk<SEP>1 tsp vanilla extract
jcxIgQ5h0jAZor2fSI0M.directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking pan. In a medium bowl, mix together the butter, brown sugar and egg until smooth. Stir in applesauce.<SEP>Combine the flours, baking soda, salt and spices; stir into the applesauce mixture until well blended. Stir in Craisins.<SEP>Spread evenly into the prepared pan. Bake for 25 minutes (check at 20 minutes with a wooden pick) in the preheated oven, or until edges are golden. Cool in the pan over a wire rack.<SEP>In a small bowl, mix together the confectioners' sugar and margarine. Stir in vanilla and milk until smooth.<SEP>Spread over cooled bars, sprinkle with chopped walnuts before cutting into squares.
jcxIgQ5h0jAZor2fSI0M.name: Applesauce Bars

kDM6c6YPJksmgMr6SgPP.name: Swirl Bundt Cake
kDM6c6YPJksmgMr6SgPP.directions: Mix cake mix and pudding mix together, add eggs and mix well<SEP>add oil, sherry, and flavoring. mix well<SEP>in separate bowl, mix sugar, cinnamon, pecan pieces<SEP>sprinkle 1/3 of sugar mixture in bottom of sprayed bundt pan<SEP>pour 1/2 of the cake batter, then 1/3 of the sugar mix, then the rest of the cake batter, then the rest of the sugar mixture<SEP>bake at 350 for 45-50 minutes<SEP>dust w/ powder sugar
kDM6c6YPJksmgMr6SgPP.ingredients: 1 yellow cake mix<SEP>1 small instant vanilla pudding<SEP>4 large eggs<SEP>3/4 cup oil<SEP>3/4 cup cream sherry (not wine)<SEP>1 1/2 tsp butter flavoring<SEP>1/3 cup sugar<SEP>1 Tbps cinnamon<SEP>1/2 cup pecans

kdEslqTlcqgoeRUKu5hJ.name: Spaghetti Sauce
kdEslqTlcqgoeRUKu5hJ.ingredients: 12-14 tomatoes (fresh, garden tomatoes work best- appx. 8-10 lbs)<SEP>2 tablespoons olive oil<SEP>1 large onion chopped<SEP>8 ounces mushrooms fresh, chopped<SEP>2 teaspoons soy sauce (see notes above)<SEP>6 cloves garlic<SEP>10-12 basil leaves chopped<SEP>1 tablespoon oregano finely chopped<SEP>2 tablespoons brown sugar<SEP>1 tablespoon Kosher salt (or to taste)<SEP>1 teaspoon pepper (or to taste)
kdEslqTlcqgoeRUKu5hJ.directions: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Place tomatoes a few at a time in the water and remove after 10-15 seconds. <SEP>Immediately place tomatoes in an ice-water bath and remove skins and stems. Cut tomatoes into fourths and place in a food processor or blender. <SEP>Process tomatoes a few times, you want them to be the consistency of crushed tomatoes (don't over process). Set aside. <SEP>Heat oil in a large skillet. Add onions and saute until they become soft and transparent. <SEP>Add mushrooms and cook for about 2-3 minutes. Add soy sauce and garlic and continue to cook until mushrooms become soft. <SEP>Add tomatoes, basil, oregano, brown sugar, salt and pepper. <SEP>Bring to a simmer, stirring occasionally for at least one hour. The longer the better! Ideally 2+ hours. <SEP>Serve over cooked pasta.

kru3BPQJOgsGYH8MWNpV.notes: Use 1 can of chickpeas for the beef/lamb version, 2 cans of chickpeas for the vegan version, and omit altogether for the paleo version.
kru3BPQJOgsGYH8MWNpV.ingredients: #Sweet Potato Mash<SEP>1 1/2 lbs sweet potatoes, peeled and cut into chunks<SEP>1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil<SEP>1 teaspoon cumin<SEP>1 teaspoon garlic powder<SEP>1 teaspoon sea salt<SEP>2 tablespoons non-dariy milk (plus more if needed)<SEP><SEP>#Filling<SEP>1 lb grass-fed ground lamb or beef (omit for vegan – for the meat version, I love the quality and convenience of ButcherBox)<SEP>1 or 2 (15-oz) cans chickpeas, drained (see notes – omit for paleo)<SEP>1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil<SEP>1 yellow onion, chopped<SEP>1 red onion, chopped<SEP>2 cloves garlic, chopped<SEP>1 tablespoon grated fresh ginger root<SEP>1 teaspoon sea salt<SEP>1 teaspoon cumin<SEP>1 teaspoon cinnamon<SEP>1 teaspoon chili powder<SEP>1 teaspoon honey (optional)<SEP>1 (28-oz) can plum tomatoes, drained and chopped<SEP>1/2 cup stock (vegetable, chicken or beef)<SEP>1/2 cup currants or raisins<SEP>1/2 bunch cilantro, stems removed, chopped
kru3BPQJOgsGYH8MWNpV.name: Moroccan Shepherd's Pie
kru3BPQJOgsGYH8MWNpV.directions: #Mash<SEP>Bring a large pot of water to boil.<SEP>Boil the sweet potatoes for 15 minutes or until tender.<SEP>Drain well and add the extra virgin olive oil, cumin, garlic powder, sea salt, and non-dairy milk.<SEP>With an immersion hand blender or potato masher, blend until they reach a creamy consistency. Set aside.<SEP><SEP>#Filling<SEP>Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.<SEP>Brown the ground meat in a large skillet over medium high heat (skip to step 3 for vegan version).<SEP>Remove the meat from the skillet and set aside.<SEP>Add the extra virgin olive oil to the pan along with the onions, garlic, ginger, sea salt, and spices and cook for 8-10 minutes until the onions are softened.<SEP>Return the meat to the pan (if using) along with the honey (if using), plum tomatoes, and stock.<SEP>Bring to a boil and simmer until the sauce is thickened, about 10 minutes more.<SEP>Add chickpeas (1 can for meat version, 2 cans for vegan version, skip for paleo version), currants or raisins, and chopped cilantro. Stir and remove from heat.<SEP>Season with sea salt and pepper to taste.<SEP><SEP>#Assembly<SEP>Fill a 12 x 8-inch baking dish with the filling and spread the sweet potato mash evenly on top.<SEP>Bake for 40 minutes until the topping is beginning to brown.<SEP>Garnish with extra chopped cilantro, if desired.

l40Xuhuytt44RdueQQ8M.name: Gingerbread House
l40Xuhuytt44RdueQQ8M.notes: This is CONSTRUCTION GRADE, not good for eating. #1 got soft with the humidity of manila, but less so than the 4 other recipes I tried - worth trying again in a drier climate.
l40Xuhuytt44RdueQQ8M.directions: #Recipe 1<SEP>Mix ingredients together. Cut pieces, bake at 350 degrees until brown.<SEP>#Recipe 2<SEP>Whip cream. Add the rest of the ingredients except flour and stir for 10 minutes. Add flour and mix. Cover and refrigerate overnight.<SEP>Cut out shapes and bake at 350 until brown.<SEP>#Icing:<SEP>Beat egg whites and cream of tartar, then add powdered sugar in small amounts. Beat on high speed 4-5 minutes or until mixture thickens. Refrigerate until ready to rise.
l40Xuhuytt44RdueQQ8M.ingredients: #Recipe 1<SEP>1 c. sugar<SEP>1 c. shortening<SEP>1 c. light corn syrup<SEP>1 t. baking soda<SEP>1 t. salt<SEP>1 T. ginger<SEP>1 T. cinnamon<SEP>1 t. cloves<SEP>5 T. water<SEP>5 c. flour<SEP>#Recipe 2<SEP>1 1/2 c. heavy cream<SEP>2 1/2 c. brown sugar<SEP>1 1/4 c. molasses<SEP>1 T. powdered ginger (less or even optional)<SEP>2 T. baking soda (less?)<SEP>9 c. flour<SEP>#Icing<SEP>3 large egg whites<SEP>4 3/4 c. powdered sugar<SEP>1/2 t. cream of tartar

lIvuPtrfmD5tlzh94SPe.name: Japanese Rice (stove-top)
lIvuPtrfmD5tlzh94SPe.directions: Put rice in a large bowl. Rice absorbs water very quickly when you start washing, so don't let the rice absorb the unclear water. Gently wash the rice in a circular motion and discard the water. Repeat this process about 3-4 times.<SEP>Let the rice soak in water for 30 minutes. Transfer the rice into a sieve and drain completely, at least 15 minutes.<SEP>Combine the rice and water in a heavy-bottom pot and bring it to a boil over medium heat.<SEP>Take a quick peek to see if water is boiling (otherwise do not open the lid).<SEP>Once water is boiling, turn the heat to low and cook covered for 12 to 13 minutes, or until the water is completely absorbed (take a quick peek!). If you see there is water left, close the lid and continue cooking for a little longer.<SEP>Remove the pot (with the lid on) from the heat source and let it steam for another 10 minutes.<SEP>Fluff the rice with a rice paddle when it’s done.
lIvuPtrfmD5tlzh94SPe.ingredients: 1 cup uncooked Japanese short grain rice (1 cup = 240 ml)<SEP>1¼ cups water (1¼ cup = 300 ml)

m0EDcPxySQ5WZYhnPLfg.name: Quick Cinnamon Rolls
m0EDcPxySQ5WZYhnPLfg.directions: Prepare proofing oven and preheat the convection oven to 375°F. Line a jelly roll pan with parchment paper and spray with nonstick cooking spray. In a small bowl, combine cinnamon, 1/2 cup sugar, and brown sugar.<SEP>Set aside.<SEP>In KitchenAid bowl with fiat beater, mix 1/3 cup sugar, yeast, oil, and warm water until dissolved. Blend in eggs and salt.<SEP>Add 4 3/4 cups flour and mix well. Switch to the dough hook and add more flour until the dough is soft and smooth. Knead for 5 minutes. Cover and let rest 10 minutes.<SEP>Spray your counter with cooking spray. Roll dough into rectangle shape (18x24 inches), about 1/4-inch thick. Brush with melted butter or margarine, then sprinkle evenly with cinnamon-sugar mixture. Add walnuts and raisins, if desired.<SEP>Beginning on long side, roll rectangle tightly. Pinch edge of dough to seal. if necessary, stretch and push the roll to make sure that all the pieces will be the same diameter when cut.<SEP>Cut evenly into 24 rolls by placing dental floss under the rolled dough, then wrap floss up and over to cut the dough. Place the rolls on prepared pan, 4 across by 6 down, and let rise uncovered in proofing oven for 10 minutes.<SEP>Bake rolls in the convection oven for 10 to 15 minutes. Make sure the underside of cinnamon rolls is lightly browned.<SEP>While rolls are baking, make frosting. First, cream softened butter, vanilla, and milk. Add powdered sugar until desired thickness is reached. Beat until light and fluffy.<SEP>After taking rolls out, allow rolls to cool slightly, then frost.
m0EDcPxySQ5WZYhnPLfg.ingredients: 1/2 cup plus 1/3 cup sugar, divided<SEP>1/2 cup brown sugar<SEP>1 1/2 teaspoons cinnamon<SEP>3 tablespoons quick active dry yeast<SEP>1/2 cup oil<SEP>1 1/4 cups warm tap water, (120°F)<SEP>2 eggs, beaten<SEP>4 3/4 to 5 1/4 cups bread flour<SEP>1 1/2 teaspoons salt<SEP>1/4 cup melted butter or margarine<SEP>1/2 cup walnuts (optional)<SEP>1/2 cup raisins (optional)<SEP>1/2 cup butter, softened<SEP>2 teaspoons vanilla<SEP>2 tablespoons milk<SEP>2 to 4 cups powdered sugar

mD80u43GwasZdttpnOo6.directions: Place chicken in zip-top bags and pound with a meat mallet or rolling pin until 1/4-inch thick. Remove chicken from bag and season all over with salt and black pepper. In a shallow dish (or plastic bag), combine flour, lemon zest, paprika, and garlic powder. Mix well. Add chicken and turn to coat. Remove chicken from flour mixture and shake off excess flour.<SEP>Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken and saute 2 minutes per side, until golden brown and cooked through. Add lemon juice, wine and chicken broth and bring to a simmer. Simmer 5 minutes, until chicken is cooked through and sauce thickens. Add artichoke hearts and capers and simmer 1 minute to heat through.<SEP>Cook rice according to package directions, adding lima beans at the beginning of cooking process. Serve chicken and sauce with rice.
mD80u43GwasZdttpnOo6.ingredients: 4 (4-ounce) boneless, skinless chicken breast halves<SEP>Salt and ground black pepper<SEP>1/3 cup all-purpose flour<SEP>1/2 teaspoon finely grated lemon zest<SEP>1/2 teaspoon paprika<SEP>1/2 teaspoon garlic powder<SEP>1 tablespoon olive oil<SEP>1/4 cup fresh lemon juice<SEP>1/2 cup dry white wine<SEP>1/2 cup reduced-sodium chicken broth<SEP>1 (14-ounce) can artichoke hearts, quartered<SEP>1/4 cup drained capers<SEP>1 cup quick-cooking brown rice<SEP>1/2 cup frozen lima beans
mD80u43GwasZdttpnOo6.name: Chicken Piccata

mGdt8f7KEHzVrXHFDTmS.directions: In a large bowl, combine 2 cups flour, yeast and salt. Stir in 2 cups warm water, and beat until well blended using a stand mixer with a dough hook attachment. Using a wooden spoon, stir in as much of the remaining flour as you can.<SEP>On a lightly floured surface, knead in enough flour to make a stiff dough that is smooth and elastic. Knead for about 8 to 10 minutes total. Shape into a ball. Place dough in a greased bowl, and turn once. Cover, and let rise in a warm place until doubled.<SEP>Punch dough down, and divide in half. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Cover, and let rest for 10 minutes. Roll each half into large rectangle. Roll up, starting from a long side. Moisten edge with water and seal. Taper ends.<SEP>Grease a large baking sheet. Sprinkle with cornmeal. Place loaves, seam side down, on the prepared baking sheet. Lightly beat the egg white with 1 tablespoon of water, and brush on. Cover with a damp cloth. Let rise until nearly doubled, 35 to 40 minutes.<SEP>With a very sharp knife, make 3 or 4 diagonal cuts about 1/4 inch deep across top of each loaf. Bake in a preheated 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) oven for 20 minutes. Brush again with egg white mixture. Bake for an additional 15 to 20 minutes, or until bread tests done. If necessary, cover loosely with foil to prevent over browning. Remove from baking sheet, and cool on a wire rack.
mGdt8f7KEHzVrXHFDTmS.name: French Bread
mGdt8f7KEHzVrXHFDTmS.notes: Compare with Melinda's: 1 1/2 T. kosher salt<SEP>1 1/2 T. yeast<SEP>3 c. hot water<SEP>5 c. flour<SEP>Rise about an hour<SEP>450 degrees for 23 minutes
mGdt8f7KEHzVrXHFDTmS.ingredients: 6 cups all-purpose flour<SEP>2 ½ (.25 ounce) packages active dry yeast<SEP>1 ½ teaspoons salt<SEP>2 cups warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C)<SEP>1 tablespoon cornmeal<SEP>1 egg white  <SEP>1 tablespoon water

mTpkIk4tkFeFsfblh1Xb.directions: Preheat the oven to 375. Line a baking sheet/pan with oil and set aside.<SEP>Place a little olive oil, the garlic, scallions, and bell peppers in a skillet and cook over medium heat, stirring, for 10 minutes, or until the onions are softened but not browned. Let cool, then stir in the potato.<SEP>Beat the eggs, sour cream, cheese, and chives together in a large bowl. Stir the cooled vegetables into the bowl and season to taste with salt and pepper.<SEP>Pour the mixture into the baking sheet and smooth over the top. Bake in the preheated oven for 30-40 minutes, or until golden brown, puffed and set in the center. Remove from the oven and let cool and set. Run a spatula around the edge, then invert onto a cutting board, browned-side up, and peel off the foil. If the surface looks a little runny, place it under a medium broiler to dry out.<SEP>Let cool completely. Trim the edges if necessary, then cut into 48 squares. Serve on a platter with wooden toothpicks, or secure each square to a slice of bread, and accompany with a green salad.
mTpkIk4tkFeFsfblh1Xb.name: Spanish Tortilla
mTpkIk4tkFeFsfblh1Xb.ingredients: olive oil<SEP>1 large garlic clove, crushed<SEP>4 scallions, white and green parts finely chopped<SEP>1 green bell pepper, seeded and finely diced<SEP>1 red bell pepper, seeded and finely diced<SEP>10 oz. potato, boiled, peeled, and diced<SEP>5 large eggs<SEP>1/2 c. sour cream<SEP>6 oz. grated roncal, cheddar, or parmesan cheese<SEP>3 T. snipped fresh chives<SEP>salt<SEP>pepper

n18LqpItEmRsr9mubnLa.name: Coconut Shrimp
n18LqpItEmRsr9mubnLa.directions: In medium bowl, combine egg, 1/2 cup flour, beer and baking powder. Place 1/4 cup flour and coconut in two separate bowls.<SEP>Hold shrimp by tail, and dredge in flour, shaking off excess flour. Dip in egg/beer batter; allow excess to drip off. Roll shrimp in coconut, and place on a baking sheet lined with wax paper. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, heat oil to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) in a deep-fryer.<SEP>Fry shrimp in batches: cook, turning once, for 2 to 3 minutes, or until golden brown. Using tongs, remove shrimp to paper towels to drain. Serve warm with your favorite dipping sauce.
n18LqpItEmRsr9mubnLa.ingredients: 1 egg<SEP>½ cup all-purpose flour<SEP>⅔ cup beer<SEP>1 ½ teaspoons baking powder<SEP>¼ cup all-purpose flour<SEP>2 cups flaked coconut<SEP>24 shrimp<SEP>3 cups oil for frying

n1SAVlZDhU9frY5cVTph.ingredients: 1 bag Bowtie Pasta<SEP>1/2 bag Fresh Spinach<SEP>1/2-1 C. Craisins<SEP>1/2 C. Mandarin Oranges<SEP>1/2 C. Fresh Parsley<SEP>Green Onions, chopped<SEP>1/4 C. Sesame Seeds, toasted (or sunflower seeds)<SEP>6 oz. Honey Roasted Peanuts<SEP>2 C. Cooked Chicken, cut up<SEP><SEP>Dressing:<SEP>1/2 C. Olive Oil<SEP>2/3 C. Teriyaki Sauce<SEP>2/3. White Rice Wine Vinegar<SEP>4 Tbsp. Sugar<SEP>1/2 tsp. Salt<SEP>1/2 tsp. Pepper
n1SAVlZDhU9frY5cVTph.name: Spinach Pasta Chicken Salad
n1SAVlZDhU9frY5cVTph.directions: Mix together dressing ingredients<SEP>Cook pasta<SEP>Pour dressing over pasta, refrigerate for several hours (or overnight)<SEP>Mix remaining ingredients with pasta<SEP>Top with fresh Parmesan cheese<SEP>

nBcrksovqopdblwSC06C.ingredients: 1/2 cup (115 grams) butter, cut into pieces<SEP>2 cups (400 grams) granulated sugar<SEP>1/2 cup (120ml) milk<SEP>1/4 cup (20 grams) unsweetened cocoa powder<SEP>1/2 cup (125 grams) creamy peanut butter<SEP>1 teaspoon vanilla extract<SEP>3 cups (300 grams) quick-cooking oats
nBcrksovqopdblwSC06C.directions: Before getting started, make sure to gather all of your ingredients and measure everything out. Line two large baking sheets with parchment paper and set aside.<SEP>Place the butter, sugar, milk, and unsweetened cocoa powder in a saucepan and heat over medium heat, making sure to stir often until the butter is melted and everything is well combined. Bring the mixture to a rolling boil and allow to boil for 60 seconds (make sure to set a timer!) stirring occasionally.<SEP>Remove from the heat, and stir in the peanut butter and vanilla extract until fully combined. Stir in the oats and mix until all of the oats are coated with the mixture and everything is well combined.<SEP>Drop spoonfuls of the mixture onto the prepared baking sheets (I like to use a 2 tablespoon cookie scoop). Allow to cool for 20-30 minutes, serve, and enjoy!
nBcrksovqopdblwSC06C.name: No-bake Cookies

nQZ8IXXge5lFH5iZlzhZ.directions: Mix pudding with the sweetened condensed milk and 1/3 can water.<SEP>Leave to set while whipping cream (no sugar). <SEP>Fold in about 2/3 of whipped cream into pudding mix (reserve enough for a layer of cream on top).<SEP>Layer pudding, banana, pudding...end with pudding (I usually try to get 3 layers of bananas).<SEP>Top with remaining whipping cream. <SEP>Makes one tall pie or two thin ones.
nQZ8IXXge5lFH5iZlzhZ.name: Banana Cream Pie
nQZ8IXXge5lFH5iZlzhZ.ingredients: 1 box vanilla or banana pudding<SEP>1 can sweetened condensed milk<SEP>2 cups whipping cream<SEP>3 bananas

nmI7oXROvghLxYEo3JHQ.ingredients: 16 oz. shrimp<SEP>1 red bell pepper<SEP>2 cloves garlic<SEP>1 thumb ginger<SEP>2 scallions<SEP>1 can corn<SEP>2 T. white wine vinegar<SEP>1 t. ancho chile powder<SEP>2 t. sugar<SEP>2 t. olive oil
nmI7oXROvghLxYEo3JHQ.name: Chile Dusted Shrimp with Corn Relish
nmI7oXROvghLxYEo3JHQ.directions: Combine chile powders and 1 t. of sugar in a bowl. Season shrimp with salt and pepper and then toss into the seasonings. Set aside.<SEP>Mince the ginger and garlic, slice the scallions (keeping green and white parts separate), and dice the bell pepper. Drain the corn.<SEP>Heat a teaspoon of olive oil in a pan over medium-high heat. Add the scallion whites, bell pepper, garlic, and ginger to the pan. Saute for 3 minutes.<SEP>Add the remaining sugar, corn, and vinegar. Cook for another 3 minutes and add the scallion greens and pinch of salt. Set aside in a bowl.<SEP>Wipe the pan clean and heat another teaspoon of olive oil. Once hot, add the shrimp and saute for 3 minutes or until done, turning once.<SEP>Serve the corn relish and top with the chile dusted shrimp

noeaeX8x0clo1qXH5vOf.name: Glazed Lemon Cookies
noeaeX8x0clo1qXH5vOf.directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, salt, and lemon zest. In a large bowl, using an electric mixer, beat butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add egg, vanilla, and lemon juice and beat until combined. With mixer on low, beat in flour mixture.<SEP>Drop dough by heaping tablespoons, 1 inch apart, onto two baking sheets. Bake until edges are golden, 15 to 20 minutes, rotating sheets halfway through. Let cool 2 minutes on sheets, then transfer cookies to a wire rack to cool completely. Spread cookies with Lemon Glaze and let set, about 1 hour.
noeaeX8x0clo1qXH5vOf.ingredients: 2 cups unbleached all-purpose flour, (spooned and leveled)<SEP>1/2 teaspoon baking soda  <SEP>1/2 teaspoon kosher salt<SEP>1 tablespoon finely grated lemon zest, plus 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice <SEP>1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter, room temperature<SEP>1 cup sugar<SEP>1 large egg<SEP>1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract<SEP>Lemon Glaze

nppFFivmH5hti7ujvrql.name: Butter Chicken (Instant Pot)
nppFFivmH5hti7ujvrql.directions: Turn your Instant Pot to the saute setting. (See your manufacturer's guide for detailed instructions on how to use your instant pot.)<SEP>Add the butter and cook until the butter has melted. Add onion (and optional cauliflower), cook until translucent. Add the garlic and ginger and saute for another minute or until the garlic becomes aromatic. Do not cook too long because you don't want to burn it.<SEP>Add the tomato puree and tomato paste to the Instant Pot and stir. Add the garam masala, coriander, cumin, paprika, turmeric and salt to the Instant Pot, stir and cook for about 3 to 5 minutes. <SEP>Add the chicken thighs, water and stir everything together. There should be enough liquid in the pot to cover the chicken, so add more water if needed.<SEP>Close the lid (follow the manufacturer's guide for instructions on how to close the instant pot lid). Set the Instant Pot to the Poultry setting and set the timer to 5 minutes.<SEP>Once the Instant Pot cycle is complete, wait until the natural release cycle is complete, should take about 10 minutes. Follow the manufacturer's guide for quick release, if in a rush. Carefully unlock and remove the lid from the instant pot.<SEP>Switch the Instant Pot to the saute setting (do not put the lid on). Add the whipping cream and simmer for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. The sauce should thicken and reduce a bit. You don't want it to reduce too much. <SEP>Turn off the Instant Pot and garnish with fresh parsley. Serve warm over rice and with naan.
nppFFivmH5hti7ujvrql.ingredients: 3 tbsp butter unsalted<SEP>1 yellow onion<SEP>1 c chopped cauliflower (optional)<SEP>8 cloves garlic minced<SEP>2 tsp fresh ginger minced (or paste)<SEP>1 cup tomato puree or passata<SEP>2 tbsp tomato paste<SEP>3 tsp garam masala<SEP>1 tbsp coriander ground<SEP>1 tsp cumin ground<SEP>1 tbsp smoked paprika<SEP>1 tsp turmeric<SEP>1 tsp salt<SEP>2 lbs chicken thighs boneless and skinless, cut into pieces<SEP>1 cup water<SEP>1 cup whipping cream<SEP>2 tbsp parsley chopped

ns8APO1dLKwoBljHM3sy.directions: Preheat oven to 325°F. Butter and flour 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking pan. Sift flour, cocoa powder, baking soda and salt into medium bowl. Beat sugar, butter and oil in large bowl until well blended. Add eggs 1 at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in vanilla extract. Mix in dry ingredients alternately with buttermilk in 3 additions each. Mix in grated zucchini. Pour batter into prepared pan. Sprinkle chocolate chips and nuts over.<SEP>Bake cake until tester inserted into center comes out clean, about 50 minutes. Cool cake completely in pan.
ns8APO1dLKwoBljHM3sy.name: Chocolate Zucchini Cake
ns8APO1dLKwoBljHM3sy.ingredients: 2 1/4 cups sifted all purpose flour<SEP>1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder<SEP>1 teaspoon baking soda<SEP>1 teaspoon salt<SEP>1 3/4 cups sugar<SEP>1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter, room temperature<SEP>1/2 cup vegetable oil<SEP>2 large eggs<SEP>1 teaspoon vanilla extract<SEP>1/2 cup buttermilk<SEP>2 cups grated unpeeled zucchini (about 2 1/2 medium)<SEP>1 6-ounce package (about 1 cup) semisweet chocolate chips<SEP>3/4 cup chopped walnuts

nv9A1kqx9aBN2bZRDmFI.name: Oatmeal Chocolate Chip Bean Cookies
nv9A1kqx9aBN2bZRDmFI.ingredients: 1 1/2 cups old-fashioned oats<SEP>2 cups all-purpose flour<SEP>1/2 teaspoon baking powder<SEP>1/2 teaspoon baking soda<SEP>1/4 teaspoon salt<SEP>3/4 cup great Northern white beans, drained and rinsed<SEP>1/4 cup applesauce<SEP>1 tablespoon water<SEP>2 large eggs<SEP>1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract<SEP>1/4 teaspoon butter extract<SEP>3 tablespoons butter<SEP>1 cup firmly packed light brown sugar<SEP>1 3/4 cups milk chocolate chips, divided
nv9A1kqx9aBN2bZRDmFI.directions: Preheat convection oven to 375°F. Line two baking sheets with parchment paper. These cookies do not expand much, so they can be placed close together.<SEP>In blender, process oats until finely ground but not powdery. Pour the oats into a separate bowl, and combine with flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.<SEP>Drain and rinse the beans in a sieve. Allow all the water to drain off the beans. <SEP>In the blender, puree the beans, applesauce, water, eggs, vanilla, and butter extract.<SEP>In your KitchenAid mixer, cream butter and brown sugar with the paddle attachment until light and fluffy. <SEP>Add the pureed mixture (scrape out your blender thoroughly), and beat well.<SEP>With mixer on low speed, mix in the oat and flour mixture. Gradually stir in 1 1/4 cups milk chocolate chips.<SEP>Using the small spring-loaded cookie scoop, drop dough by spoonfuls on prepared cookie sheets. Using a wet hand, press the dough to the thickness of the chocolate chips.<SEP>Bake for 8 to 10 minutes, or until lightly firm to the touch. ff you wait until they are golden brown, they may over-bake.<SEP>Cool slightly on pan before putting on cooling rack.<SEP>While the cookies are baking, gradually melt the remaining 1/2 cup milk chocolate chips in the microwave in 30 second intervals in a freezer Ziploc bag. The chocolate chips should NOT become warmer than the warmth of your hand (a total of 1 minute should do it). Massage the chips with your hands between the 30-second intervals.<SEP>Snip a SMALL (toothpick size) comer off the Ziploc and pipe the melted chocolate in a zigzag pattern on the tops of the cooled cookies. <SEP>Place the decorated cookies in the dispensary refrigerator until set, about 15 minutes.

oDCYlxYuTnc9QZhuwmQ3.ingredients: 4 fish fillets<SEP>2 tablespoons olive oil<SEP>1 1/2 tablespoons grated orange zest<SEP>1/4 cup fresh orange juice<SEP>salt and pepper to taste crushed red pepper flakes to taste<SEP><SEP>#Salsa:<SEP>1 mango - peeled, seeded and diced<SEP>1 small red onion, finely chopped<SEP>1 avocado - peeled, pitted and diced<SEP>3 roma tomatoes - peeled, seeded and chopped<SEP>1 lime, zested and juiced<SEP>1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and finely chopped<SEP>1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger root<SEP>1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro<SEP>1 teaspoon kosher salt
oDCYlxYuTnc9QZhuwmQ3.directions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C.)<SEP>In a shallow baking dish, combine the olive oil, orange zest, orange juice, salt, pepper and chili flakes. Rinse the fish fillets and pat them dry. Place them into the baking dish and turn to coat with the seasonings.<SEP>Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven, until fish can be flaked with a fork.<SEP>While the fish cooks, combine the mango, onion, avocado, tomatoes, lime zest and juice, jalapeno, ginger, cilantro and 1 teaspoon kosher salt in a glass bowl. Stir to blend and set aside at room temperature until fish has finished cooking. Place fillets on a platter and spoon the salsa over them to serve.
oDCYlxYuTnc9QZhuwmQ3.name: Mango-licious Fish

oMYQI1QPoGSjWCwCtAZ0.name: Pumpkin Pie Cake
oMYQI1QPoGSjWCwCtAZ0.ingredients: 1 (29 ounce) can pumpkin puree<SEP>1 (12 fluid ounce) can evaporated milk<SEP>3 eggs  <SEP>1 cup white sugar  <SEP>½ teaspoon salt<SEP>4 teaspoons pumpkin pie spice<SEP>1 (18.25 ounce) package yellow cake mix<SEP>¾ cup butter  <SEP>1 cup chopped walnuts
oMYQI1QPoGSjWCwCtAZ0.directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease one 9 x 13 inch pan (preferably metal).<SEP>In a large bowl, combine pumpkin, evaporated milk, eggs, sugar, salt, and pumpkin pie spice. Mix well. Pour batter into the prepared pan.<SEP>Sprinkle the dry cake mix evenly over the pumpkin mixture. Melt the butter or margarine, and drizzle it over the cake mix. Sprinkle walnuts over the top.<SEP>Bake for 55 to 60 minutes, or until done.

oTNyY55Vs8V6fxth7vuH.name: Pie Crust
oTNyY55Vs8V6fxth7vuH.ingredients: 4 1/2 cups flour<SEP>2 cups shortening<SEP>1 tsp. salt<SEP>1 tsp. baking powder<SEP>1 egg<SEP>1/4 cup lemon juice
oTNyY55Vs8V6fxth7vuH.directions: In a large bowl, add flour, baking powder, and salt. Stir with a fork<SEP>Add shortening, mix into flour by rubbing mixture between hands<SEP>In 2 cup measuring cup, mix 1/4 cup lemon juice and 1 egg, add water until all ingredients add up to 1 cup. Add to dry mixture and mix.<SEP>For cream pies, roll out, place in pie tin, and bake at 375 for 10 minutes. Then turn oven to 350 and bake until golden brown.<SEP>For double crust fruit pies, prepare pie and bake at 375 for 10 minutes, turn oven down to 350 and bake until done.

oUia0RfzsIOtGFeOZGW5.ingredients: 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil<SEP>1 medium onion, sliced<SEP>2 bell peppers (any color), cored and sliced<SEP>2 jalapeño peppers, cored and sliced<SEP>2 cups corn kernels (fresh or frozen and defrosted)<SEP>1 teaspoon chili powder<SEP>1 teaspoon ground cumin<SEP>A pinch of salt<SEP>2 cups salsa<SEP>1 (15-ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed<SEP>2 cups shredded cheese (I like a blend of Monterey jack and cheddar)<SEP>4 medium sweet potatoes, spiralized<SEP>Diced tomatoes, avocado and fresh cilantro for serving
oUia0RfzsIOtGFeOZGW5.directions: Preheat the oven to 350°F, then lightly grease an 8×10″ casserole dish.<SEP>In a large skillet, warm the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook for about 3 minutes, until translucent. Next add the bell peppers, malunggay, jalapeño, corn, chili powder, cumin, and salt then stir and continue to cook for another 5-7 minutes. Remove from heat, stir in the salsa and beans, then set aside.<SEP>Layer half of the spiralized sweet potatoes in the bottom of the baking dish then cover with half of the vegetable mixture and top with 1 cup of the cheese. Finish with the remaining sweet potatoes, vegetables and cheese, then cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes.<SEP>Remove the foil, set the oven to broil and cook for about 5 more minutes, just until the cheese is lightly browned. Allow to cool for 5-10 minutes, then garnish with diced tomatoes, avocado and cilantro before serving.
oUia0RfzsIOtGFeOZGW5.name: Mexican Sweet Potato Casserole

oYEKM1o5hL2ZSTHFcy9I.ingredients: 1 cup chopped walnuts<SEP>1 cup milk chocolate chips<SEP>1 cup butter<SEP>2 tablespoons water<SEP>1 cup sugar
oYEKM1o5hL2ZSTHFcy9I.directions: Put half of the nuts in the bottom of a buttered 9x13-inch metal cake pan.<SEP>Measure chocolate chips and set aside. (These will be used on top of the toffee.)<SEP>In a 4-quart saucepan, combine butter, water, and sugar. Boil and immediately wash down sides of pan.<SEP>Cook on medium-high heat, stirring occasionally with a flat candy paddle, until candy smokes and becomes the color of a brown paper grocery bag. This takes between 10 and 20 minutes.<SEP>Pour syrup over the nuts. Do not scrape the inside of the pan.<SEP>Sprinkle chocolate chips over the top of hot toffee. When chips are melted, spread chocolate evenly over toffee.<SEP>Cover chocolate-toffee mixture with the other half of chopped nuts. Place in refrigerator to set chocolate.
oYEKM1o5hL2ZSTHFcy9I.name: English Toffee

oiQUMWqzLEX9KusCzDuL.directions: Whisk together the cream, milk, sugar, salt, and vanilla. <SEP>Pour the mixture into your ice cream maker and freeze according to the manufacturer's directions. <SEP>While the ice cream is churning, chop each cookie into 4 pieces.<SEP>Scatter 1 cup of cookie pieces in the bottom of a freezer safe container. <SEP>When the ice cream has finished churning, scoop half the ice cream over the cookies in the container, sprinkle the ice cream with 1 cup of cookie pieces. Spread the ice cream across the container and top with the remaining cup of cookie pieces. <SEP>Freeze until firm. Enjoy!
oiQUMWqzLEX9KusCzDuL.name: Cookies and Cream Ice Cream
oiQUMWqzLEX9KusCzDuL.ingredients: 1 3/4 cups heavy cream<SEP>1 1/4 cups milk<SEP>3/4 cups sugar<SEP>1/8 tsp kosher salt<SEP>1 tbsp vanilla extract<SEP>20 chocolate sandwich cookies, quartered, about 3 cups

p86etCn0BN4nGSnvc1cM.name: Gallo Pinto (Nicaragua Beans & Rice)
p86etCn0BN4nGSnvc1cM.ingredients: [For the beans]<SEP>1 (16-ounce) bag dried small red or black beans<SEP>Salt<SEP>7 garlic cloves, peeled<SEP><SEP>[For the rice]<SEP>1/4 cup vegetable oil, divided<SEP>1 medium yellow onion, finely chopped (about 1 cup), divided<SEP>1 1/2 cups long-grain white rice<SEP>3 cups water or low-sodium chicken broth<SEP>1/2 green bell pepper, cored and seeded
p86etCn0BN4nGSnvc1cM.directions: [For the beans]<SEP>Spread beans out in a rimmed baking sheet. Pick out any debris and broken beans. Transfer beans to colander and rinse under cold running water. Place rinsed beans in a large pot and cover with cold water; water should cover beans about 3 inches. Let soak for 30 minutes.<SEP>Bring to boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium and simmer beans for 30 minutes. Turn off heat, cover beans, and let rest 1 hour. Bring beans back up to boil over high heat. Add 2 teaspoons salt and garlic, reduce heat to medium, and simmer until beans are tender, 30 to 60 minutes.<SEP>If storing the beans, cool completely, transfer beans and some of the cooking liquid to quart-sized zipper-lock bags. When ready to use, thaw out in refrigerator and heat on stovetop in saucepan or microwave.<SEP><SEP>[For the rice]<SEP>Heat 2 tablespoons oil in large heavy-bottomed saucepan over medium heat until shimmering. Add 2/3 of onion and cook, stirring, until softened and translucent, about 5 minutes.<SEP>Add rice and cook, stirring, until grains are shiny and evenly coated with oil, 2 to 3 minutes. Add water or broth and 1 1/2 teaspoons salt, increase heat to high, and bring to a boil. Place bell pepper on top of rice.<SEP>Boil rice without stirring until most of the liquid has evaporated and you can see small bubbles bursting on the surface of the rice. Immediately reduce the heat to the lowest setting, cover, and cook (do not stir, do not remove lid) for 15 minutes. Remove and discard bell pepper. Fluff rice with chopsticks or fork, then let cool and refrigerate for 1 day.<SEP>For the gallopinto: Heat remaining 2 tablespoons oil in large saucepan over medium-high heat until shimmering. Add remaining onion and cook, stirring, until softened and translucent, about 5 minutes.<SEP>Add rice and 2 cups beans to skillet and cook, stirring, until rice is evenly coated. Continue to cook, stirring, to allow flavors to meld and mixture to become slightly crisp, about 10 minutes. Cover and cook over low heat an additional 10 minutes. (See note.)

pPGKLEUeEdxKfghnolCm.name: Apple Pie
pPGKLEUeEdxKfghnolCm.ingredients: #filling <SEP>2 tablespoons all-purpose flour<SEP>3/4 cup packed brown sugar<SEP>1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg (optional)<SEP>1/2 teaspoon cinnamon<SEP>1/8 teaspoon salt<SEP><SEP>#crust<SEP>3/4 teaspoon salt<SEP>2 1/2 cups all-purpose or pastry flour<SEP>3/4 cup (5.2 oz.) shortening<SEP>8 to 10 tablespoons ice cold water<SEP>6 cups prepared baking apples (about 2 Ibs. of apples, or 6 large apples, peeled, cored, and sliced)<SEP>2 to 3 tablespoons milk<SEP>Raw sugar
pPGKLEUeEdxKfghnolCm.directions: #filling<SEP>In a large mixing bowl, combine 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour, brown sugar, nutmeg, cinnamon, and 1/8 teaspoon salt.<SEP>Peel, core, and thinly slice apples. Add apples to brown sugar mixture and toss to coat. Set aside.<SEP><SEP>#crust<SEP>Combine 2 1/2 cups all-purpose or pastry flour and 3/4 teaspoon salt in a mixing bowl.<SEP>Gently cut in the shortening with a pastry blender until pea-sized.<SEP>Measure the full quantity of water into a bowl or measuring cup. You will not use more than 10 tablespoons. Sprinkle 6 tablespoons of cold water over flour mixture, tossing mixture lightly with a fork or rubber scraper. Add remaining water 1 tablespoon at a time, tossing with a fork, and press to the side of the bowl until dough is moistened.<SEP>Divide dough in half and gently pat into two lightly flattened balls. (Don't overwork your dough at this point. You should just gently gather the dough into two slightly flattened pieces, not two tightly compressed dough balls.)<SEP>Preheat oven to 425°F.<SEP>Prepare the bottom first. Place one ball of dough in the center of a lightly floured surface of plastic wrap or the counter top (use all-purpose flour). Using your hands, pat the dough into a 1/4 inch thick disc, keeping it round and the edges even. Cover the disc with another layer of plastic wrap if desired. Roll from center to edges to form a 14-inch circle. Fold the rolled dough into quarters. Unfold it over a 9-inch pie plate. Ease pastry into the pie plate.<SEP>Carefully pour the prepared apple pie filling into the center of the pie plate. Avoid getting filling on the edges of the pie crust, or it may become difficult to seal.<SEP>Decide how you would like to top your pie-a solid sheet of dough with slits or cutouts (double crust) or strips of dough woven over and under each other (lattice top).<SEP>For a double-crust pie, place the second ball of dough in the center of a lightly floured surface of plastic wrap or your counter top. Using your hands, pat the dough into a 1/4 inch thick disc, keeping it round and the edges even. Cover the disc with another layer of plastic wrap if desired. Roll from center to edges to form a 14-inch circle. Fold the rolled dough into quarters. Make cuts along the folds to allow steam to escape. Unfold it over the filling. Using kitchen shears, trim pastry 1 inch beyond the rim. Fold top edge under the trimmed bottom edge and flute edge (create a decorative edge) to seal.<SEP>For a lattice-top pie, place the second ball of dough in the center of a lightly floured surface of plastic wrap. Roll dough from center to edges to form a 12-inch circle. Using a pizza cutter or decorative pastry wheel, cut pastry in 112-inch strips. Starting at the center of the pie, weave dough strips over filling to make a lattice. Press ends of strips into the rim of the bottom crust. Fold bottom crust over strips and flute the edge to seal.<SEP>Brush crust with milk and sprinkle with sugar. <SEP>Fold a 12-inch square of aluminum foil into quarters. Cut out the center section, making a 7 1/2-inch circle. Unfold the foil and place the square section over the pie. You may also use a long strip of foil 5 inches wide to wrap around the pie. When placing the foil on the pie, place the shiny side out to reflect the heat away from the crust. Loosely mold the foil over the edges to protect them from burning.<SEP>Bake for 35 minutes. Remove foil and bake for 15 to 20 minutes more, until the crust is golden brown and the filling is bubbly.

pPOHTCjGPRMYRTVKAja3.directions: Combine the ingredients for Seasonings and mix well until the sugar is mostly dissolved (or you can microwave for seconds). Rinse the salmon and pat dry. Season the salmon with kosher salt and black pepper on both sides.<SEP>Sprinkle 1/2 Tbsp. of all-purpose flour on one side of salmon and spread evenly. Flip over and sprinkle the rest of flour on the other side. Gently remove the excess flour.<SEP>In a frying pan, add the vegetable oil and melt the butter over medium heat. Don’t burn the butter. If the frying pan gets too hot, reduce heat or remove from the heat temporally.<SEP>Add the salmon fillets, skin side on the bottom (this will be top when you serve). Cook the salmon for 3 minutes, or until the bottom side is nicely browned, and then flip.<SEP>Add sake and cover with lid. Steam the salmon for 3 minutes, or until it's cooked through. Remove the salmon to a plate.<SEP>Add the seasonings to the pan and increase the heat little bit. When the sauce starts to boil, add salmon back in the pan and spoon the sauce over the salmon.<SEP>When the sauce thickens, turn off the heat. Plate the salmon on a plate and serve immediately.
pPOHTCjGPRMYRTVKAja3.ingredients: 2 fillets salmon with skin (2 fillets = ½ to ¾ lb = 340 g) (1/2 to 3/4" thickness, skin will hold the flesh together while cooking)<SEP>1/4 tsp kosher/sea salt (I use Diamond Crystal; Use half for table salt)<SEP>freshly ground black pepper<SEP>1 Tbsp all-purpose flour (plain flour) (See Notes why using flour)<SEP>½ Tbsp neutral-flavored oil (vegetable, canola, etc)<SEP>1 Tbsp unsalted butter<SEP>1 Tbsp sake (or Chinese rice wine or dry sherry)<SEP><SEP>#Seasonings<SEP>1 Tbsp sake (or Chinese rice wine or dry sherry)<SEP>1 Tbsp mirin (or 1 Tbsp. sake + 1 tsp. sugar)<SEP>1 Tbsp sugar<SEP>2 Tbsp soy sauce
pPOHTCjGPRMYRTVKAja3.name: Teriyaki Salmon

pULh7UI0qXVDJMfyb85d.ingredients: 2 3/4 -3 cups of flour<SEP>1 tsp baking soda<SEP>1 tsp salt<SEP>1 cup of butter<SEP>3/4 cup sugar<SEP>3/4 cup brown sugar<SEP>2 eggs<SEP>1 tsp vanilla<SEP>1 1/2 cup of chocolate chips - Guittard Chocolate<SEP>1 cup chopped walnuts (optional)
pULh7UI0qXVDJMfyb85d.name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
pULh7UI0qXVDJMfyb85d.notes: Watch the cookies as they cook. You want to pull them out while they still look a little gooey on top but the bottom with start turning brown
pULh7UI0qXVDJMfyb85d.directions: Preheat oven to 375ºF.<SEP>In a small bowl combine flour, baking soda and salt; set aside.<SEP>In a large bowl cream butter, sugar and brown sugar until light. Beat in eggs and vanilla until smooth. <SEP>Gradually add flour mixture until combined. <SEP>Stir in chips and walnuts.<SEP>Drop by well-rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake 8-10 minutes or until golden brown.<SEP><SEP>Cookie bars: Prepare dough as directed. Spread evenly into greased 10x15x1-inch pan. Bake at 375ºF for 20-25 minutes. Cool before cutting into 48 two-inch bars.

pVEDjP9oM1KXVZh5wCAI.directions: #Crust:<SEP>Using 2 pastry blenders, blend the flours, sugar, shortening, butter and salt. Whisk the egg, vinegar and water in a 2-cup measure and pour over the dry ingredients incorporating all the liquid without overworking the dough. Toss the additional flour over the ball of dough and chill if possible. Divide the dough into 2 disks. Roll out 1 piece of dough to make a bottom crust. Place into a pie dish. Put dish in refrigerator to chill.<SEP>Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.<SEP>#Filling:<SEP>Mix the rhubarb, strawberries, sugar, tapioca, flour, zest and juice of lemon, dash of cinnamon, and vanilla. Mix well in a large bowl and pour out into chilled crust. Dot the top of the filling with the butter. Brush edges of pie crust with egg white wash. Roll out the other piece of dough and place over filling. Crimp to seal edges. Brush with egg white wash and garnish with large granule sugar. Collar with foil and bake at 425 degrees F for 15 minutes. Decrease temperature to 375 degrees F and bake for an additional 45 to 50 minutes, or until the filling starts bubbling. Higher altitude will take 450 degrees F and 400 degrees F respectively. Also, you can use a pie bird for extra decor. Let cool before serving.
pVEDjP9oM1KXVZh5wCAI.notes: Next time, try America's Test Kitchen recipe & compare
pVEDjP9oM1KXVZh5wCAI.name: Strawberry Rhubarb Pie
pVEDjP9oM1KXVZh5wCAI.ingredients: #Crust:<SEP>2 cups all-purpose flour, plus additional flour as needed, up to 1/4 cup<SEP>1/2 cup cake flour (recommended: Soft As Silk)<SEP>3 teaspoons sifted powdered sugar<SEP>1/2 cup butter-flavored shortening (recommended: Crisco)<SEP>1/4 cup salted butter<SEP>Pinch salt<SEP>1 egg<SEP>2 teaspoons vinegar<SEP>1/4 cup ice cold water<SEP>#Filling:<SEP>2 1/2 cups chopped red rhubarb, fresh<SEP>2 1/2 cups de-stemmed, washed and cut strawberries (in larger pieces)<SEP>1 1/2 cups sugar (1 1/4 cups for high altitude)<SEP>2 tablespoons minute tapioca<SEP>1 tablespoon all-purpose flour<SEP>1/2 teaspoon lemon zest<SEP>1/2 teaspoon lemon juice<SEP>1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon<SEP>1 teaspoon vanilla extract<SEP>3 tablespoons butter, cubed small<SEP>1 egg white beaten with 1 teaspoon water<SEP>Large granule sugar

pdcoLXVbYD6lHcs5HruA.ingredients: 1 C. Brown Sugar<SEP>2/3 C. Peanut Butter<SEP>1/2 C. Karo Syrup or Honey<SEP>1/2 C. Melted Butter<SEP>2 tsp. Vanilla<SEP>3 C. Quick Oats<SEP>1/2 C. Coconut<SEP>1/2 C. Sunflower Seeds<SEP>1/2 C. Craisins (orange flavored)<SEP>1/3 C. Wheat Germ or 9 grain<SEP>1 C. Mini Chocolate Chips
pdcoLXVbYD6lHcs5HruA.directions: Mix first 5 ingredients then add remaining ingredients<SEP>Press into a 9x13 cake pan
pdcoLXVbYD6lHcs5HruA.name: Homemade Granola Bars

pgT0JPFFlMRL0NRlIJrM.directions: Put sesame seeds in a frying pan and toast them on low heat. When 2-3 sesame seeds start popping, remove from the heat.<SEP>Grind the toasted sesame seeds with a mortar and pestle until smooth.<SEP>Combine all the ingredients in a bowl and whisk everything together.
