Drizzle on top of a simple salad of ice burg lettuce topped with tomatoes, boiled eggs, wakame, and corn. You can keep the dressing in the refrigerator for up to a week.
pgT0JPFFlMRL0NRlIJrM.ingredients: 3 Tbsp toasted white sesame seeds<SEP>2 Tbsp Japanese mayonnaise<SEP>2 Tbsp rice vinegar<SEP>1½ Tbsp soy sauce<SEP>1 tsp sugar<SEP>½ tsp mirin<SEP>½ tsp sesame oil (roasted)
pgT0JPFFlMRL0NRlIJrM.name: Goma Dressing

plH6npYdAN7R9ZHNeOjx.name: Cheeseburger Cups
plH6npYdAN7R9ZHNeOjx.directions: Preheat oven to 350° and grease a muffin tin with cooking spray. Flatten burger bun halves to 1/4 inch thick with a rolling pin and place one half cut-side up in each prepared muffin cup.<SEP><SEP>In a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat oil. Add onion and cook, stirring, until soft, about 5 minutes. Add ground beef and cook, breaking up meat with a wooden spoon, until no longer pink, about 6 minutes. Drain fat.<SEP>Return beef mixture to skillet and season with garlic powder, salt, and pepper. <SEP><SEP>Divide ground beef mixture among burger bun cups and top each with a cheddar cheese square. Bake until cheese is melty and buns are golden, about 10 minutes.<SEP><SEP>Drizzle cups with ketchup and mustard, top with a pickle, and sprinkle with sesame seeds.
plH6npYdAN7R9ZHNeOjx.ingredients: Cooking spray<SEP>6 burger buns, split<SEP>1 tbsp. vegetable oil<SEP>1 medium onion, chopped (I used onion soup mix instead)<SEP>1 tsp mustard<SEP>1 tsp Worcestershire sauce<SEP>1 lb. ground beef<SEP>1/2 tsp. garlic powder<SEP>Kosher salt<SEP>Freshly ground black pepper<SEP>3 slices cheddar, quartered (blue cheese is also delicious)<SEP>Ketchup, for serving<SEP>Yellow mustard, for serving<SEP>12 pickle chips<SEP>Tomato, lettuce, red onion, for toppings<SEP>Sesame seeds, for garnish

pzaqU4Fc57qu9blP5QRE.directions: #Tacos<SEP>Season fish with taco seasoning<SEP>Pan fry fish<SEP>Heat up tortillas, either in the oven or in a skillet<SEP>Top with cabbage, green onions, avocados, and cotija<SEP><SEP>#Sauce<SEP>Finely chop the chipotle pepper, cilantro, and the garlic clove.<SEP>Place all of the ingredients in a mixing bowl including the lime juice. When you add the oregano crumble it with your fingers to break it into smaller pieces.<SEP>Stir briskly with a fork.<SEP>Refrigerate the sauce 2 hours before serving.<SEP>Stir before serving.
pzaqU4Fc57qu9blP5QRE.ingredients: #Tacos<SEP>White fish<SEP>Taco Seasoning<SEP>Tortillas<SEP>Cabbage<SEP>Green onions<SEP>Avocados<SEP>Cotija cheese (optional)<SEP><SEP>#Cream Sauce<SEP>1 cup sour cream or crema<SEP>1 (or 2) chipotle peppers in adobo<SEP>1 clove garlic<SEP>1 tbsp Mexican oregano<SEP>Juice of 3 small Mexican limes<SEP>1 tsp sea salt<SEP>Cilantro
pzaqU4Fc57qu9blP5QRE.name: Fish Tacos and Chipotle Cream Sauce

qWQWWLSw7LfPobUKBtOX.ingredients: 8 oz. cream cheese<SEP>3 eggs<SEP>2 1/2 c. sugar<SEP>2 1/2 c. flour<SEP>1/4 c. pecans<SEP>3 tbsp. butter<SEP>2 1/2 tsp. cinnamon<SEP>1/2 tsp. salt<SEP>2 tsp. baking powder<SEP>1/4 tsp. baking soda<SEP>1 1/4 c. solid-packed pumpkin<SEP>1/3 c. vegetable oil<SEP>1/2 tsp. vanilla extract
qWQWWLSw7LfPobUKBtOX.directions: Heat oven to 375 degrees F. Lightly coat two 12-cup standard muffin tins with oil and set aside.<SEP>Mix the cream cheese, 1 egg, and 3 tablespoons sugar in a small bowl and set aside. Toss 5 tablespoons sugar, 1/2 cup flour, pecans, butter, and 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon together in a medium bowl and set aside. <SEP>Combine the remaining sugar, flour, salt, baking powder, baking soda, and remaining cinnamon in a large bowl. Lightly beat the remaining eggs, pumpkin, oil, and vanilla together in a medium bowl. <SEP>Make a well in the center of the flour mixture, pour the pumpkin mixture into the well, and mix with a fork just until moistened. Evenly divide half of the batter among the muffin cups. <SEP>Place two teaspoonfuls of cream cheese filling in the center of each cup and fill with the remaining batter. <SEP>Sprinkle some of the pecan mixture over the top of each muffin and bake until golden and a tester, inserted into the muffin center, comes out clean -- 20 to 25 minutes. Cool on wire racks.
qWQWWLSw7LfPobUKBtOX.name: Pumpkin and Cream Cheese Muffins

qYEdjdBnZX7bk973AAe6.ingredients: 1 lb broccoli, cut into bite-size pieces, stems peeled and thinly sliced<SEP>1/2 onion, minced or grated<SEP>1 carrot, shredded<SEP>2 cloves garlic<SEP>1 cup chicken or vegetable stock<SEP>1 tsp mustard powder<SEP>Salt and pepper to taste<SEP>__<SEP>1 cup chicken or vegetable stock<SEP>4 oz (about 1 cup) shredded cheddar cheese<SEP>2 tablespoons unsalted butter<SEP>1/2 cup heavy cream or half-and-half
qYEdjdBnZX7bk973AAe6.directions: Prep Directions: Combine all the prep ingredients in a 1-gallon resealable freezer bag. Squeeze out the air, label, and place in a round container to freeze into shape.<SEP>Serving Day Directions: Add the stock and the contents of the package to the instant pot. Cook on high for 5 minutes. Let the pressure release naturally for 5 minutes<SEP>Manually release any remaining pressure, gradually stir in the cheddar cheese, butter, and heavy cream until the cheese is melted<SEP>Using an immersion blender, puree the soup.
qYEdjdBnZX7bk973AAe6.name: Broccoli Cheddar Soup (Instant Pot)

qhL8KkLOCo6ce7PYJDm9.directions: Wash soybeans<SEP>Put soybeans on a baking sheet, and put in the oven<SEP>Bake at 300 F for 10 minutes (do not preheat)<SEP>Beans should be slightly browned with cracked skin<SEP>Turn off, then let rest for 2 minutes in the oven.<SEP>Let beans cool, then put soybeans in a blender, add sugar<SEP>Grind in a blender until you get a very fine powder
qhL8KkLOCo6ce7PYJDm9.name: Kinako (Roasted Soy Bean Powder)

qiRwhIefqrRMY3eoDCZL.directions: Cover 2 pounds halved small waxy potatoes with cold salted water, bring to a boil, and cook until tender; drain and transfer to a large bowl. Meanwhile, heat 1/4 cup olive oil in a medium skillet over medium-high heat. Add 1/2 chopped onion; season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring often, until soft, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and mix in 1/4 cup apple cider vinegar. Add to potatoes along with 4 sliced scallions, 2 tablespoons chopped fresh dill, and 1 teaspoon toasted caraway seeds and toss, crushing potatoes slightly; season with salt and pepper.
qiRwhIefqrRMY3eoDCZL.ingredients: 2 pounds halved small waxy potatoes<SEP>1/4 cup olive oil<SEP>1/2 chopped onion<SEP>1/4 cup apple cider vinegar<SEP>4 sliced scallions<SEP>2 tablespoons chopped fresh dill<SEP>1 teaspoon toasted caraway seeds and toss<SEP>Salt<SEP>Pepper
qiRwhIefqrRMY3eoDCZL.name: German Potato Salad with Dill

qxsjzoVsdbxKI0qWAtCy.ingredients: 2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast halves<SEP>2 teaspoons salt<SEP>½ cup cooking oil<SEP>1 ½ cups chopped onion<SEP>1 tablespoon minced garlic<SEP>1 ½ teaspoons minced fresh ginger root<SEP>1 tablespoon curry powder<SEP>1 teaspoon ground cumin<SEP>1 teaspoon ground turmeric<SEP>1 teaspoon ground coriander<SEP>1 teaspoon cayenne pepper<SEP>1 tablespoon water<SEP>1 (15 ounce) can crushed tomatoes<SEP>1 cup plain yogurt<SEP>1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro<SEP>1 teaspoon salt<SEP>½ cup water<SEP>1 teaspoon garam masala<SEP>1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro<SEP>1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice
qxsjzoVsdbxKI0qWAtCy.directions: Sprinkle the chicken breasts with 2 teaspoons salt.<SEP>Heat the oil in a large skillet over high heat; partially cook the chicken in the hot oil in batches until completely browned. Transfer the browned chicken breasts to a plate and set aside.<SEP>Reduce the heat under the skillet to medium-high; add the onion, garlic, and ginger to the oil remaining in the skillet and cook and stir until the onion turns translucent, about 8 minutes. Stir the curry powder, cumin, turmeric, coriander, cayenne, and 1 tablespoon of water into the onion mixture; allow to heat together for about 1 minute while stirring. Mix the tomatoes, yogurt, 1 tablespoon chopped cilantro, and 1 teaspoon salt into the mixture. Return the chicken breast to the skillet along with any juices on the plate. Pour 1/2 cup water into the mixture; bring to a boil, turning the chicken to coat with the sauce. Sprinkle the garam masala and 1 tablespoon cilantro over the chicken.<SEP>Cover the skillet and simmer until the chicken breasts are no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 20 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Sprinkle with lemon juice to serve.
qxsjzoVsdbxKI0qWAtCy.name: Murgh Kari (Indian Chicken Curry)

qz5A3UkWFZdySOhzUPRl.name: Yogurt/Cucumber salad
qz5A3UkWFZdySOhzUPRl.ingredients: 1 large cucumber or 2 small ones<SEP>salt<SEP>2-3 cloves garlic, optional<SEP>2 cups yogurt<SEP>Pepper, white is preferred<SEP>1 tsp dried, crushed mint or 1 tablespoon finely chopped fresh mint or to taste
qz5A3UkWFZdySOhzUPRl.directions: Dice cucumber. If seeds are large, take them out and dice rest of cucumber. Sprinkle with salt. <SEP>Add remaining ingredients, add salt and pepper to taste.

r2fQSfcL0gVPZfePsZSz.ingredients: 1 cup real Mayonnaise<SEP>1 cup finely chopped dill pickles<SEP>1 Tbsp dill (fresh or frozen), OR 1 Tbsp finely chopped fresh parsley<SEP>1 tsp lemon juice<SEP>1 tsp sugar<SEP>1/4 tsp freshly ground black pepper<SEP>2 Tbsp finely chopped onion is good too, but optional (I usually skip it)
r2fQSfcL0gVPZfePsZSz.name: Tartar Sauce
r2fQSfcL0gVPZfePsZSz.directions: Combine everything and give it a good stir.

raz2q8hhAHqqKPkNKYO0.directions: First layer: refried beans with a little taco seasoning mixed in<SEP>Second layer: Avocado, sour cream, mayo, taco seasoning and/or tajin mixture<SEP>Third layer: Ground beef cooked with taco seasoning<SEP>Fourth layer: Lettuce<SEP>Fifth layer: Tomato<SEP>Sixth layer: Cheese<SEP>Seventh layer: Black olives<SEP>Eighth layer: Green onion
raz2q8hhAHqqKPkNKYO0.name: Mom's Taco Salad
raz2q8hhAHqqKPkNKYO0.ingredients: Refried beans<SEP>Avocado<SEP>Sour cream<SEP>Mayo (optional)<SEP>Ground beef<SEP>Lettuce<SEP>Tomatoes<SEP>Cheese<SEP>Green onions<SEP>Black olives<SEP>Taco seasoning<SEP>Tajin (optional)<SEP>Tortilla chips

rcO18hIf6V3wqq30KguM.directions: Slice cucumber, ham<SEP>Cook and shred eggs<SEP>Mix with cooked and cooled harusame noodles<SEP>Sprinkle generously with chuka aji, mix<SEP>Use ponzu for dressing<SEP>Top with sesame seeds
rcO18hIf6V3wqq30KguM.ingredients: Cucumber<SEP>Bean Sprouts<SEP>Ham<SEP>Egg<SEP>Harusame (clear noodles)<SEP>Chuka aji no moto<SEP>Ponzu
rcO18hIf6V3wqq30KguM.name: Chinese Summer Noodle Salad

rdKoa2ZaF9LMncvsSz8D.ingredients: 2 t. freshly ground Kampot or black pepper<SEP>1/2 t. salt<SEP>1/2 t. sugar<SEP>2 t. freshly squeezed lime juice
rdKoa2ZaF9LMncvsSz8D.directions: Mix the ingredients in a small shallow dish and use as desired.
rdKoa2ZaF9LMncvsSz8D.name: Tuk Meric (Cambodian Black Pepper Sauce)

rg2qkPtyouHDu4MXVbaf.notes: Not enough veggies. 2x the onion, 4x the spinach, and 3x the mushrooms for layering along with the cheese/sauce.
rg2qkPtyouHDu4MXVbaf.ingredients: 20 lasagna noodles<SEP>2 tablespoons olive oil<SEP>1 cup chopped fresh mushrooms<SEP>1 cup chopped onion<SEP>1 tablespoon minced garlic<SEP>2 cups fresh spinach<SEP>3 cups ricotta cheese<SEP>2/3 cup grated Romano cheese<SEP>1 teaspoon salt<SEP>1 teaspoon dried oregano<SEP>1 teaspoon dried basil leaves<SEP>1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper<SEP>1 egg<SEP>3 cups shredded mozzarella cheese<SEP>3 cups tomato pasta sauce<SEP>1 cup grated Parmesan cheese
rg2qkPtyouHDu4MXVbaf.directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).<SEP>Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add lasagna noodles and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain.<SEP>In a skillet over medium-high heat, cook mushrooms, onions, and garlic in olive oil until onions are tender. Drain excess liquid and cool. Boil spinach for 5 minutes. Drain, then squeeze out excess liquid. Chop spinach.<SEP>Combine ricotta cheese, Romano cheese, spinach, salt, oregano, basil, pepper, and egg in a bowl. Add cooled mushroom mixture. Beat with an electric mixer on low speed for 1 minute. <SEP>Lay 5 lasagna noodles in bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish. <SEP>Spread one third of the cheese/spinach mixture over noodles. <SEP>Sprinkle 1 cup mozzarella cheese and 1/3 cup Parmesan cheese on top. <SEP>Spread 1 cup pasta sauce over cheese. Repeat layering 2 times. End with noodles and a light layer of sauce topped with cheese.<SEP>Cover dish with aluminum foil and bake in a preheated oven for 1 hour. Cool 15 minutes before serving.
rg2qkPtyouHDu4MXVbaf.name: Spinach Mushroom Lasagna

rl3lTe5NRQmHBR3KxW8j.directions: Chop vegetables and cook chicken ahead of time<SEP>Add all ingredients to large bowl and stir<SEP>Pour into dutch oven<SEP>Cover and cook at 350, stirring often, for at least 1 hour or until vegetables are soft<SEP>Garnish with coconut flakes, fresh green onions, and limes<SEP>OPTIONAL: Serve over rice
rl3lTe5NRQmHBR3KxW8j.ingredients: 8 oz. chicken breast (cooked)<SEP>salt and pepper<SEP>1 Tablespoon coconut oil<SEP>2 zucchinis (chopped)<SEP>1 red bell pepper (chopped)<SEP>1 bunch green onions (chopped)<SEP>1 yellow onion (chopped)<SEP>2 cloves garlic (minced)<SEP>2 tablespoons red or green curry paste<SEP>1 16oz can full fat coconut milk
rl3lTe5NRQmHBR3KxW8j.name: Coconut Chicken Thai Curry (Dutch Oven)

rr7gYEkcTAbz91YVCpIp.name: Banana Bran Nut Muffins
rr7gYEkcTAbz91YVCpIp.ingredients: 1-1/4 cups Wheat Bran<SEP>1-1/4 cups Whole Wheat Flour or Organic Whole Wheat Flour<SEP>1 tsp Baking Powder<SEP>1-1/2 tsp Baking Soda<SEP>1/4 tsp Sea Salt<SEP>3 Tbsp Brown Sugar packed<SEP>3/4 cup Chopped Walnuts<SEP>2 Tbsp Vegetable Oil<SEP>1-1/4 cups Yogurt (plain lowfat)<SEP>1 Banana large-sized, over-ripe
rr7gYEkcTAbz91YVCpIp.directions: Preheat oven to 400°F. Insert paper liners in muffin tins, set aside.<SEP>In a large bowl, combine the bran, whole wheat flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, brown sugar, and walnuts and stir until well mixed.<SEP>Measure the oil and yogurt into the blender (or processor) and add the banana, broken up. Blend at medium speed until uniform, then pour over the dry ingredients. Stir gently until all is wet.<SEP>Spoon the batter into the foil liners and bake for about 20 minutes.

s1ndxmjH8N2Wcr06R95D.name: Rainbow Spring Rolls
s1ndxmjH8N2Wcr06R95D.ingredients: 7-8 rice spring roll papers<SEP>1 medium beet (skin removed and finely grated)<SEP>1/2 yellow and red pepper (seeded // thinly sliced)<SEP>1 cup carrots (thinly sliced)<SEP>1 ripe mango (cubed*)<SEP>1 large bunch mint leaves<SEP>1 large bunch cilantro (cut from stems)<SEP>8 ounces extra-firm tofu or cooked vermicelli noodles (optional // or use 1 cup cooked quinoa in place of 8 ounces tofu or rice noodles)<SEP><SEP>#Ginger Peanut Sauce<SEP>1/2 cup salted natural peanut or almond butter<SEP>1 1/2 Tbsp soy sauce (tamari for gluten-free eaters)<SEP>2-3 Tbsp brown sugar or maple syrup (add to taste)<SEP>1/2 medium lime, juiced<SEP>1/2 tsp chili garlic sauce<SEP>1/2 tsp fresh grated ginger (optional)<SEP>Hot water (to thin)
s1ndxmjH8N2Wcr06R95D.directions: Prep veggies and set aside for easy assembly. For the beet, I used this mandolin. You can find all of our Simple Kitchen Essentials here.<SEP>Bring 3 cups water to a boil in a saucepan or kettle and set aside to cool slightly for cooking rice papers.<SEP>Prepare peanut sauce by adding all ingredients except water to a mixing bowl and whisking. Add hot water 1 Tbsp at a time and whisk until desired consistency is achieved (should be pourable but thick). Set aside.<SEP>Add hot water to a large shallow dish (I used a skillet) and submerge a rice paper to soften for about 10-20 seconds. If you let it go too long or if your water is too hot, they will get too fragile to work with.<SEP>Once soft, transfer to a clean, slightly damp surface (I prefer a wooden cutting board), and gently smooth out into a circle.<SEP>Add carrots, peppers, mango, beets, and a healthy handful each cilantro and mint (and any other desired fillings). Fold bottom over the fillings, then gently roll over once and fold in the side to seal, then roll until completely sealed. Place on a serving plate and top with a room temperature damp towel to keep fresh.<SEP>Repeat process until all toppings are used - about 7 or 8 (amount as original recipe is written // adjust if altering batch size). Serve with dipping sauce and sriracha, if desired.<SEP>Store leftovers covered in the fridge for up to a couple days, though best when fresh.

s7dp1o2lEO60wuv0EDdS.name: Cottage Fries (Seven Brothers copycat)
s7dp1o2lEO60wuv0EDdS.directions: Slice potatoes into 1/4" rounds. Heat oil in a pan<SEP>Fry for a couple minutes until golden<SEP>Take them out and let cool for a minute or two<SEP>Then fry again until they look toasty brown<SEP>Sprinkle generously with seasonings

s9VZMa0aPpL7luLJYjIL.ingredients: ¾ cup Shiratamako or Mochiko<SEP>¾ cup water<SEP>¼ cup sugar<SEP>½ cup potato starch/cornstarch<SEP>Ice cream of your choice
s9VZMa0aPpL7luLJYjIL.name: Mochi Ice Cream
s9VZMa0aPpL7luLJYjIL.directions: Using the cookie scoop, scoop out ice cream into aluminum/silicone cupcake liners. The ice cream will melt quickly so I recommend freezing them immediately for a few hours or until ice cream balls are completely frozen solid.<SEP>Once the ice cream balls are frozen solid and ready, you can start making mochi. Combine shiratamako and sugar in a medium microwaveable bowl and whisk all together.<SEP>Add water and mix well until combined.<SEP>Cover the bowl with some plastic wrap (do not cover too tight). Put the bowl in the microwave and heat it on high heat (1000w) for 1 minute. Take it out and stir with a wet rubber spatula. Cover again and cook for 1 minute. Stir again, cover, and cook for 30 seconds to finish cooking. The color of mochi should change from white to almost translucent.<SEP>Cover a work surface with parchment paper and dust it generously with potato starch. Then transfer the cooked mochi on top.<SEP>To prevent from sticking, sprinkle more potato starch on top of the mochi. Once it has cooled down a bit, you can spread the mochi into a thin layer with your hands or with a rolling pin. Make sure to apply potato starch on your hands and the rolling pin. <SEP>Transfer the parchment paper onto a large baking sheet. Refrigerate for 15 minutes until the mochi is set.<SEP>Take out the mochi from the refrigerator and cut out circles with the cookie cutter.<SEP>Dust off the excess potato starch with a pastry brush. If you find some sticky part, cover the area with potato starch first then dust off. Place a plastic wrap on a plate and then mochi wrapper on top, then lay another layer of plastic wrapper down. Repeat for all wrappers. With leftover mochi dough, roll into a ball and then flatten into a thin layer again and cut out into more circle wrappers.<SEP>Now we’re ready to form mochi ice cream balls. On the work surface, place one sheet of plastic wrap with a mochi layer on top. Take out one ice cream ball from the freezer and put it on top of the mochi wrapper. Pinch the four corners of the mochi layer together to wrap the ice cream ball.<SEP>Quickly cover with plastic wrap and twist to close. Place each mochi ice cream into a cupcake pan to keep the shape. You will need to work on one mochi ice cream at a time in order to keep the ice cream frozen all times. Put mochi ice cream back into the freezer for a few hours. When you’re ready to serve, keep them outside for a few minutes until mochi softens.

sGdd6GXC1zPWMgCjRMFC.name: Vegan Lentil Soup
sGdd6GXC1zPWMgCjRMFC.directions: Warm the olive oil in a large Dutch oven or pot over medium heat. One-fourth cup olive oil may seem like a lot, but it adds a lovely richness and heartiness to this nutritious soup.<SEP>Once the oil is shimmering, add the chopped onion and carrot and cook, stirring often, until the onion has softened and is turning translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic, cumin, curry powder and thyme. Cook until fragrant while stirring constantly, about 30 seconds. Pour in the drained diced tomatoes and cook for a few more minutes, stirring often, in order to enhance their flavor.<SEP>Pour in the lentils, broth and the water. Add 1 teaspoon salt and a pinch of red pepper flakes. Season generously with freshly ground black pepper. Raise heat and bring the mixture to a boil, then partially cover the pot and reduce heat to maintain a gentle simmer. Cook for 30 minutes, or until the lentils are tender but still hold their shape.<SEP>Transfer 2 cups of the soup to a blender. Protect your hand from steam with a tea towel placed over the lid and purée the soup until smooth. Pour the puréed soup back into the pot and add the chopped greens. Cook for 5 more minutes, or until the greens have softened to your liking.<SEP>Remove the pot from heat and stir in the juice of half of a lemon. Taste and season with more salt, pepper and/or lemon juice until the flavors really sing. Serve immediately.
sGdd6GXC1zPWMgCjRMFC.ingredients: 1/4 c. extra virgin olive oil<SEP>1 medium yellow or white onion, chopped<SEP>2 carrots, peeled and chopped<SEP>4 garlic cloves, pressed or minced<SEP>2 t. ground cumin<SEP>1 t. curry powder<SEP>1/2 t. dried thyme<SEP>1 28-oz. can of diced tomato, drained<SEP>1 c. brown or green lentils, picked over and rinsed<SEP>4 c. vegetable broth<SEP>2 c. water<SEP>1 t. salt, more to taste<SEP>pinch red pepper flakes<SEP>freshly ground black pepper<SEP>1 c. chopped fresh collard greens or kale , tough ribs removed<SEP>juice of 1/2 to 1 medium lemon, to taste<SEP>

sSB6dl8y2CqvS88Ryi9S.name: Oat Milk
sSB6dl8y2CqvS88Ryi9S.directions: Add oats, water, salt, and any additional add-ins (optional) to a high-speed blender. Top with lid and cover with a towel to ensure it doesn't splash. Blend for about 30 seconds - 1 minute or until the mixture seems well combined. It doesn't have to be 100% pulverized. In fact, over-blending can make the oat milk slimy in texture.<SEP>Scoop out a small sample with a spoon to test flavor/sweetness. If it's not sweet enough, add more dates.<SEP>Pour the mixture over a large mixing bowl or pitcher covered with cheesecloth. Double strain if you want.<SEP>Transfer to a sealed container and refrigerate. Will keep in the refrigerator up to 5 days (sometimes more). Shake well and enjoy cold. DO NOT HEAT or it will thicken and become gelatinous in texture. It's delicious as is or added to granola, smoothies, or baked goods!
sSB6dl8y2CqvS88Ryi9S.ingredients: 1 cup rolled oats (gluten-free if GF // or sub steel-cut oats*)<SEP>4 cups water (use less water for thicker, creamier milk!)<SEP>1 pinch salt<SEP>1 whole date, pitted (optional // for sweetness // or 1 Tbsp (15 ml) maple syrup)<SEP>1/2 tsp vanilla extract (optional)

soC1vmfSDtN6e0BtA902.notes: Top with more cheese if desired
soC1vmfSDtN6e0BtA902.name: Penne with Sausage, Red Potatoes & Green Beans
soC1vmfSDtN6e0BtA902.ingredients: 8 oz. Uncooked Penne Pasta<SEP>4 Small Red Potatoes, quartered<SEP>8 oz. Spicy Italian Sausage<SEP>1/4 C. Minced Yellow Onion<SEP>2 Small Garlic Cloves, minced<SEP>1 C. Chicken Broth<SEP>1 Tbsp. Olive Oil<SEP>1 Tbsp. Butter<SEP>1 lb. Fresh Green Beans, cut in half (or french style canned)<SEP>1 Tbsp. Fresh Parsley, chopped<SEP>Salt & Pepper<SEP>1/2 C. Romano, Asiago or Parmesan Cheese
soC1vmfSDtN6e0BtA902.directions: Cook the pasta according to package, drain<SEP>Steam the potatoes or cook them in boiling salted water until tender<SEP>At the same time, steam the beans until tender (if using fresh) 6-12 minutes<SEP>Meanwhile, brown the sausage, add the onion and garlic, cook and stir until the onion is soft and sausage is completely cooked<SEP>Pour in the broth and simmer for 3 minutes<SEP>Stir in the oil and butter until the butter melts<SEP>Add green beans, potatoes and pasta<SEP>Mix well with a spoon, add salt and pepper and parsley to taste<SEP>Decrease heat to low and sprinkle 1/2 C. cheese over the mixture<SEP>Cover the pan and cook a few more minutes until the cheese is melted

suYLDwUtVBrpfj4tJWsK.directions: Mix dressing ingredients together. Marinate cooked pasta in dressing for at least 2 hours or overnight. <SEP>Combine the rest of salad ingredients in a large salad bowl, add pasta & dressing and toss.<SEP>Serve with Parmesan cheese
suYLDwUtVBrpfj4tJWsK.ingredients: 16 oz. Bowtie Pasta, cooked al dente<SEP>1/2-1 Bags Fresh Spinach<SEP>1/2-1 C. Craisins<SEP>1-2 C. Mandarin Oranges<SEP>1/2 C. Parsley, chopped<SEP>1 Bunch Green Onions, chopped<SEP>1/4 C. Sesame Seeds or sunflower seeds, toasted - 350 for 10-14 min<SEP>6 oz. Honey Roasted Peanuts<SEP>2 C. Cooked Chicken, cubed<SEP><SEP>#Dressing:<SEP>1 C. Vegetable Oil<SEP>2/3 C. Bottled Teriyaki Sauce<SEP>2/3 C. White Wine Vinegar<SEP>6 Tbsp. Sugar<SEP>1/2 tsp. Salt<SEP>1/2 tsp. Pepper
suYLDwUtVBrpfj4tJWsK.name: Spinach Bowtie Pasta Salad
suYLDwUtVBrpfj4tJWsK.notes: Serve cold or room temperature.<SEP><SEP>*optional ingredient: sliced water chesnuts<SEP>Can do it without chicken for a lighter option.

t3W6d5u6raZyAZPfYmqM.ingredients: 8 ounces pad thai noodles<SEP>2 eggs<SEP>1 batch of this awesome pad thai sauce<SEP>3 cooked chicken breasts, sliced<SEP>1 cup bean sprouts<SEP>1 cup cilantro<SEP>3 green onion, sliced<SEP>1/2 cup chopped peanuts<SEP><SEP>#Sauce:<SEP>3 tablespoons soy sauce<SEP>1 tablespoon sriracha (more or less depending on how spicy you like it)<SEP>2 tablespoons lime juice<SEP>2 tablespoons canola oil<SEP>2 tablespoons brown sugar<SEP>
t3W6d5u6raZyAZPfYmqM.directions: Prepare noodles according to package instructions.<SEP>Meanwhile, scramble eggs for about 2 minutes and set aside.<SEP>In a large skillet, combine noodles, chicken, and sauce.<SEP>Top with bean sprouts, cilantro, green onion, and peanuts.<SEP><SEP>#Sauce:<SEP>Whisk together ingredients. Serve several tablespoons over pad thai.  Can also use zucchini noodles.
t3W6d5u6raZyAZPfYmqM.name: Melinda's Pad Thai

tAfqHowIMD6WYQrNe3FG.name: Tofu
tAfqHowIMD6WYQrNe3FG.directions: Place 3 cups of dried soybeans in a medium mixing bowl. Cover with water by about 2 inches. Let soak overnight. In the morning, drain the beans, and get ready to make soy milk.<SEP>Place drained, soaked soybeans into a blender with 8 cups of water. Blend until creamy and frothy.<SEP>Pour the liquid into a large pot, and place over medium heat on the stove. Cook, stirring often and skimming and discarding any froth or foam that forms, until steam, begins to rise from the surface of the liquid but the liquid does not boil.<SEP>Take care not to burn your milk here and be sure to constantly scrape the bottom of the pot with your wooden spoon<SEP>Once the soy milk starts to get seriously foamy (like beer) and rise up the sides of the pot, move it off of the heat immediately and do not let it boil over. Set your fine mesh strainer over a mixing bowl. Line the strainer with cheesecloth, and leave plenty of it hanging off of the edges.<SEP>Pour the cooked soy milk into the cheesecloth-lined strainer. Allow this to cool for at least an hour or two or until cool enough to handle.<SEP>Once your soy milk is cool, gather up the sides of the cheesecloth in your hands, forming a sack. Press out the remaining soy milk from the solids. Once all of the milk has been squeezed from the sack, you should have about 8 cups of soy milk. Transfer the soy milk back into the pot, and discard or save the solids, called okara, to use in cooking.<SEP>Heat the soy milk on low heat to reach 160-175°F (70-80°C) degrees. <SEP>Meanwhile, prepare the coagulant by mixing the nigari with 1/2 cup luke-warm water.<SEP>Mix the water and coagulant mixture into the hot soy milk. Gently stir the milk 2 or 3 times but do not over mix. Cover the pot.<SEP>Allow the mixture to sit undisturbed and covered for 20-30 minutes.<SEP>While the mixture sits, small white curds will separate from amber colored liquid.<SEP>Once the process is complete, transfer the curds into a molding container lined with cheesecloth or a similar fabric. Fold the fabric over the curds and place a weight on top to begin pressing out the liquid. Allow the mixture to be pressed by the weight for 20-30 minutes or until it holds together. Remove the block of tofu from the mold.<SEP>If you don't plan to consume the tofu the same day that you make it, store it in a container filled with cold water in the refrigerator. Change this soaking water daily until you consume your tofu.
tAfqHowIMD6WYQrNe3FG.ingredients: 3 c dried soybeans <SEP>8 c water<SEP>1-3 tsp nigari<SEP>1/2 c warm water
tAfqHowIMD6WYQrNe3FG.notes: If you are using store-bought soy milk, skip to step 8.<SEP>Okara is nutritious--has protein and fiber. Add it to smoothies, oatmeal, cookies, cakes, brownies, potato/tuna salad, pancakes, croquettes, etc.

tS2NtG9C3PsxZihzk1SO.name: Peanut Chicken Zoodles
tS2NtG9C3PsxZihzk1SO.ingredients: 2 Tablespoons sesame oil <SEP>2 teaspoons minced or chopped garlic<SEP>1 cup shredded carrots<SEP>1 cup thinly sliced cabbage (I use red)<SEP>1 large bell pepper, thinly sliced (I use red)<SEP>3 large zucchini, spiralized into noodles<SEP>2 large chicken breasts, cooked & shredded (about 2-3 cups)<SEP>Toppings: 1 Tablespoon sesame seeds, handful of cilantro, 1/2 cup peanuts, chopped green onion<SEP><SEP>#Sauce<SEP>1/2 cup creamy peanut butter<SEP>1/3 cup honey<SEP>1/3 cup soy sauce (I use reduced sodium)<SEP>2 Tablespoons sesame oil*<SEP>2 Tablespoons rice vinegar*<SEP>2 teaspoons fresh ginger, minced<SEP>1–2 teaspoons Sriracha or any hot chili sauce
tS2NtG9C3PsxZihzk1SO.directions: Heat 2 Tablespoons of sesame oil and the garlic in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the carrots, cabbage, and pepper slices. Cook for about 5 minutes until the vegetables are a little tender. (I usually begin the peanut sauce, step 2, during this time.) Once tender, add the zucchini noodles and shredded chicken to the skillet. Cook and stir for about 3 minutes until the zucchini is a little softer and chicken is warm. Turn off the stove and remove from heat. Set aside.<SEP>Combine all of the peanut sauce ingredients in a small saucepan over low heat. Whisk constantly until the peanut butter has melted and everything is combined. <SEP>Once the sauce is heated through, pour over chicken/vegetables. Toss everything around until combined. Top with sesame seeds, cilantro, peanuts, and green onion. Serve immediately.

tXhkRHv0rGvPfaaop4cC.name: Thai Quinoa Salad
tXhkRHv0rGvPfaaop4cC.directions: 1. To cook quinoa: In a medium saucepan, bring 1 ½ cups of water to a boil. Add in quinoa and bring mixture to a boil. Cover, reduce heat to low and let simmer for 15 minutes or until quinoa has absorbed all of the water. Remove from heat and fluff quinoa with fork; place in large bowl and set aside to cool for about 10 minutes. You should have a little over 2 cups of quinoa.<SEP><SEP>2. To make dressing: Add peanut butter and honey or agave to a medium microwave safe bowl; heat in microwave for 20 seconds. Add in ginger, soy sauce, vinegar, and both sesame and olive oil and stir until mixture is smooth and creamy. If you want a thinner dressing, simply stir in a teaspoon or two of water or olive oil.<SEP><SEP>3. Add as much or as little dressing as you’d like to the quinoa. I always start out with a little bit of dressing and usually add more to suit my taste preferences. Alternatively you can save the dressing for later and add when you are ready to eat; however the flavors of the dressing usually soak into the salad so I love adding it to the quinoa first.<SEP><SEP>4. Next fold in red pepper, onion, cabbage, carrots, and cilantro into the quinoa. Garnish with cashews and green onions. Serve chilled or at room temperature with lime wedges, if desired.
tXhkRHv0rGvPfaaop4cC.ingredients: ¾ cup uncooked quinoa<SEP>2 cups shredded red cabbage, depending on how much crunch you like<SEP>1 red bell pepper, diced<SEP>1/4 cup diced red onion<SEP>1 cup shredded carrots<SEP>½ cup chopped cilantro<SEP>¼ cup diced green onions<SEP>½ cup cashew halves or peanuts (honey-roasted is good)<SEP>Optional: 1 cup edamame or chickpeas<SEP>Fresh lime, for a bit of tang<SEP><SEP>Dressing:<SEP>¼ cup all natural peanut butter<SEP>2 teaspoons freshly grated ginger<SEP>3 tablespoon gluten-free soy sauce or coconut aminos<SEP>1 tablespoon honey (use agave or pure maple syrup if vegan)<SEP>1 tablespoon rice vinegar or red wine vinegar<SEP>1 teaspoon sesame oil<SEP>1 teaspoon olive oil or more sesame oil<SEP>Water to thin, if necessary

tddYi5Zf7DWBBVzdtv7Q.ingredients: ½ kabocha (squash/pumpkin) (Small kabocha, roughly 1 lb / 450 g )<SEP>1 inch ginger (optional)<SEP>1 ¾ cups dashi stock (mix granules with water)<SEP>1 Tbsp sugar<SEP>2 Tbsp mirin<SEP>2 tsp soy sauce<SEP>pinch kosher/sea salt (use half for table salt)
tddYi5Zf7DWBBVzdtv7Q.name: Simmered Kabocha Squash
tddYi5Zf7DWBBVzdtv7Q.directions: In a small pot, boil 1 ¾ cups water. <SEP>Remove the seeds and pith from the kabocha. Microwave for 2 minutes.<SEP>Cut the kabocha into wedges, then equal 2” (5 cm) pieces.  Remember, kabocha skin is edible and nutritious.<SEP>Place the kabocha pieces, skin side down, in a pot that fit in a single layer. Change the pot if kabocha doesn’t fit.<SEP>Add dashi, sake and sugar. Tip: Swirl the pot to mix the seasonings so you won't break the kabocha.<SEP>Cook on medium high heat and bring it to a boil.<SEP>Add soy sauce and salt, and swirl the pot again to mix the seasonings. If the liquid does not cover 3/4 of kabocha, you can add a little bit of water. Bring to a boil again.<SEP>Once boiling turn down to medium low heat to maintain simmering. Cook for 20-30 minutes.<SEP>Remove from the heat and let kabocha sit covered until cool, about 30 minutes. This helps kabocha absorbs more flavor as it cools. You can serve at room temperature or reheat before serving.<SEP>[Optional garnish] Cut the ginger into rectangular piece (so each strips will be the same length). Cut into thin slabs and then thin julienne strips.<SEP>Soak in cold water for 1 minute and drain well. Set aside. Serve with simmered kabocha.

tiCgZam172wZwM6KhayL.directions: #CHICKEN<SEP>Season chicken generously with salt and pepper.<SEP>Heat oil in a large saute pan over medium-high heat. Add chicken and saute for about 4-6 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the chicken is browned and nearly cooked through.<SEP>Pour in the orange chicken sauce, and stir to combine. Let the sauce come to a boil, then boil for an additional minute or two until thickened. Remove from heat and serve immediately over quinoa or rice. Garnish with green onions, sesame seeds and additional orange zest.<SEP><SEP>#SAUCE<SEP>Whisk all ingredients together until combined. If you would like the sauce to be even sweeter, add an extra 2-4 tablespoons of honey.<SEP><SEP>Serve over rice.
tiCgZam172wZwM6KhayL.ingredients: #CHICKEN<SEP>2 lb. boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces<SEP>salt and pepper<SEP>2 Tbsp. olive oil<SEP>orange chicken sauce (ingredients below)<SEP>toppings: thinly-sliced green onions, toasted sesame seeds, orange zest<SEP><SEP>#SAUCE<SEP>3 cloves garlic, minced<SEP>1/2 cup orange juice<SEP>1/2 cup honey<SEP>1/3 cup soy sauce<SEP>1/4 cup rice wine vinegar<SEP>3 Tbsp. cornstarch<SEP>1/2 tsp. ground ginger<SEP>1/2 tsp. white pepper<SEP>zest of one orange<SEP>pinch of crushed red pepper flakes
tiCgZam172wZwM6KhayL.name: Orange Chicken

tnAnPVMEiLyJdIT1OE0G.name: Gyoza
tnAnPVMEiLyJdIT1OE0G.ingredients: 1 pkg gyoza wrappers (52 sheets)<SEP>1 Tbsp neutral-flavored oil (vegetable, canola, etc)<SEP>¼ cup water <SEP>1 tsp sesame oil (roasted) <SEP><SEP>#Filling<SEP>¾ lb ground pork<SEP>2-3 leaves cabbage<SEP>2 green onion/scallion (or flat Chinese chives)<SEP>2 shiitake mushrooms<SEP>1 clove minced garlic<SEP>1 inch ginger (fresh, grated)<SEP>chuka aji no moto<SEP><SEP>#Seasonings<SEP>1 tsp mirin<SEP>1 tsp sesame oil (roasted)<SEP>1 tsp soy sauce<SEP>¼ tsp kosher/sea salt (use half for table salt)<SEP>freshly ground black pepper<SEP><SEP>#Dipping Sauce<SEP>1 Tbsp rice vinegar<SEP>1 Tbsp soy sauce<SEP>⅛ tsp la-yu (Japanese chili oil) (optional)
tnAnPVMEiLyJdIT1OE0G.directions: Gather all the ingredients. Tip: After you open the gyoza wrappers, make sure to cover them under a damp towel or plastic wrap so they won't dry out.<SEP>Optional step: As cabbage leaves are thick and hard, we use different ways to make the cabbage leaves wilted. You can blanch or microwave them for a minute or two. You can also sprinkle salt to dehydrate the cabbage and squeeze the water out. Or you can skip the entire process altogether.<SEP>Remove the core of the cabbage leaves and cut into very small pieces.<SEP>Cut green onions and shiitake mushrooms into small pieces.<SEP>Combine the ground meat, cabbage, green onion, and shiitake mushrooms in a large bowl.<SEP>Add minced garlic and grated ginger to the bowl.<SEP>Add the seasonings (1 tsp sesame oil, 1 tsp soy sauce, ¼ tsp kosher salt, 1 tsp sake, and freshly ground black pepper).<SEP>Mix well and knead the mixture with hand until it becomes pale in color and sticky.<SEP>Take a wrapper and place it in the palm of your non-dominant hand. Use a teaspoon to take a small amount of filling and put it in the center of the wrapper. Dip one finger in a bowl of water and draw a circle around the outer ¼” of the wrapper with your wet finger until it’s wet all around.<SEP>Fold the wrapper in half over the filling.<SEP>Using your left thumb and index finger, start making a pleat about once every ¼ inch on the top part of the wrapper.<SEP>gyoza step by step-36<SEP>Once you make each pleat, press it down with your right thumb and make pleats toward the left side.<SEP>Continue all the way till there is no more top wrapper to pleat.<SEP>Press the pleats and shape the gyoza.<SEP><SEP>#To cook<SEP>Heat the oil in a large non-stick frying pan over medium heat. When the pan is hot, place the gyoza in a single layer, flat side down in a circular shape (or place them in two columns).<SEP>Cook until the bottom of the gyoza turns golden brown, about 3 minutes.<SEP>Add ¼ cup of water to the pan. Immediately cover with a lid and steam the gyoza for about 3 minutes or until most of the water evaporates.<SEP>Remove the lid to evaporate any remaining water. Add 1 tsp sesame oil around the frying pan.<SEP>Cook uncovered until the gyoza is nice and crisp on the bottom. <SEP>Transfer to a plate and serve with dipping sauce. For the dipping sauce, combine the sauce ingredients in a small plate and mix all together.

tq84SP9fXjY8S67g3pOu.name: Soy Milk
tq84SP9fXjY8S67g3pOu.ingredients: ½ cup yellow soybeans (80 g)<SEP>4 cups water (1 l)<SEP>½ teaspoon vanilla extract or a piece of vanilla bean (optional)<SEP>4 dates (optional)
tq84SP9fXjY8S67g3pOu.directions: Soak the soybeans in water overnight (ideally 12 hours or longer)<SEP>Drain the soybeans and remove the outer skins. Removing the outer skins is optional, but your milk will have a better texture if you do<SEP>Blend the soybeans with 3 cups of water (750 ml) until well blended and almost smooth<SEP>Strain the blended mixture using a nut milk bag, a cheesecloth, a napkin or a fine mesh strainer<SEP>Pour the mixture into a pot or a saucepan and add 1 cup of water (250 ml). Bring to a boil, stir and skim foam<SEP>Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, for about 20 minutes<SEP>Let cool the soy milk. You can add other ingredients such as vanilla extract or dates. Blend the mixture if necessary<SEP>Keep leftovers in a sealed container in the fridge for about 3-5 days
tq84SP9fXjY8S67g3pOu.notes: Only makes 2 cups. Double or triple recipe for more!

u2TBhULvlK4GITeqGjce.name: Chicken Fajita & Quinoa Soup
u2TBhULvlK4GITeqGjce.ingredients: 1 1/2 lb. boneless skinless chicken breasts<SEP>1 cup uncooked quinoa, rinsed<SEP>3 bell peppers, chopped<SEP>1 medium onion, chopped<SEP>3 cloves garlic, minced<SEP>4 cups low-sodium chicken broth<SEP>Juice of 1 lime<SEP>1 (15 oz) can diced tomatoes<SEP>1 (4.5 oz) can green chiles<SEP>1 (15 oz) can black beans, drained and rinsed<SEP>1 cup frozen corn<SEP>1 1/2 Tbsp chili powder<SEP>1 Tbsp cumin<SEP>2 tsp. paprika<SEP><SEP>2 tsp. salt<SEP>Toppings (optional): Cilantro, avocado, shredded cheese
u2TBhULvlK4GITeqGjce.directions: In a 6-quart slow cooker, add chicken and the rest of ingredients, cover and place on high for 3 to 4 hours or low 6 to 8 hours.<SEP>Remove chicken and shred with two forks then add back into the slow cooker. <SEP>Season with additional salt and seasonings if needed.<SEP>Spoon soup into bowls and top with favorite toppings, enjoy!

uCVYkjie9xuwIdKuN7lf.ingredients: #Filling<SEP>1 1/4 pounds sweet potatoes (2 small-to-medium)<SEP>1 can (15 ounces) black beans, rinsed and drained, or 1 1/2 cups cooked black beans<SEP>4 ounces (1 cup) grated Monterey Jack cheese<SEP>2 ounces (1/2 cup) crumbled feta cheese<SEP>2 small cans (4 ounces each) diced green chiles<SEP>1 medium jalapeño, seeded and minced<SEP>2 cloves garlic, pressed or minced<SEP>2 tablespoons lime juice<SEP>1/2 teaspoon ground cumin<SEP>1/2 teaspoon chili powder<SEP>1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper (optional)<SEP>1/4 teaspoon salt, more to taste<SEP>Freshly ground black pepper<SEP><SEP>2 cups (16 ounces) mild salsa verde, either homemade or store-bought<SEP>10 corn tortillas<SEP>4 ounces (1 cup) grated Monterey Jack cheese<SEP>2 tablespoons sour cream<SEP>1 tablespoon water<SEP>1/4 cup chopped red onion<SEP>1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro
uCVYkjie9xuwIdKuN7lf.name: Sweet Potato & Black Bean Enchiladas
uCVYkjie9xuwIdKuN7lf.directions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit and line a large baking sheet with parchment paper for easy cleanup. Slice the sweet potatoes in half lengthwise and coat the flat sides lightly with olive oil. Place the sweet potatoes flat-side down on the baking sheet. Bake them until they are tender and cooked through, about 30 to 35 minutes.<SEP>Meanwhile, pour enough salsa verde into a 9 by 13-inch baking dish to lightly cover the bottom (about ½ cup). In a medium mixing bowl, combine all of the remaining filling ingredients.<SEP>Once the sweet potatoes are cooked through and cool enough to handle, scoop out the insides with a spoon. Discard the potato skins, and mash up the sweet potato a bit.<SEP>Stir the mashed sweet potato into the bowl of filling, and season to taste with additional salt (I added ¼ teaspoon) and pepper.<SEP>Warm up your tortillas, one by one in a skillet, or all at once in a microwave so they don’t break when you bend them. Wrap them in a tea towel so they stay warm.<SEP>Working with one tortilla at a time, spread about ½ cup filling down the center each tortilla, then wrap both sides over the filling and place it in your baking dish. Repeat for all of the tortillas.<SEP>Top with the remaining salsa verde and cheese. Bake for 25 to 35 minutes, until sauce is bubbling and the cheese is lightly golden.<SEP>Let the enchiladas cool for about 5 minutes. Whisk the sour cream and water together to make a drizzly sour cream sauce. Drizzle it back and forth over the enchiladas, then top them with cilantro and red onion. Serve.

uSBau1SBxhWPC4vdnfDO.name: Hijiki Salad
uSBau1SBxhWPC4vdnfDO.notes: Store in an airtight container and keep in the refrigerator for up to 3-4 days. You can also freeze it for up to a month.
uSBau1SBxhWPC4vdnfDO.ingredients: ½ cup dried hijiki seaweed (1 oz, 28 g; 10 x more after rehydrated)<SEP>4 cups water (for soaking)<SEP>2 aburaage (deep-fried tofu pouch)<SEP>3 oz konnyaku (konjac) (⅓ konnyaku, 84 g; optional)<SEP>3 oz carrot (½-1 carrot, 85 g)<SEP>¼ lotus root (renkon) (1.3 oz, 37 g; pre-boiled; optional)<SEP>1 Tbsp neutral-flavored oil (vegetable, canola, etc)<SEP>⅓ cup shelled edamame (2 oz, 60 g; cooked; optional)<SEP>2 cups dashi (click to learn more about this soup stock)<SEP><SEP>#Seasonings<SEP>4 Tbsp mirin<SEP>2 Tbsp sugar (Reduce the amount in half if you like; Hijiki Salad is typically on the sweet side for preserving purpose. Especially when packing it in a bento box, it tastes better as we eat it at room temperature)<SEP>4 Tbsp soy sauce
uSBau1SBxhWPC4vdnfDO.directions: Gather all the ingredients.<SEP>Soak dried hijiki in 4 cups of water for 30 minutes.<SEP>Drain to a large fine sieve and wash under the running water.<SEP>Boil water in a small saucepan and pour it over the aburaage. This will remove the excess oil coated on the aburaage. Cut in half lengthwise and slice thinly.<SEP>Add water and konnyaku in a small pot and boil for 3 minutes to remove the smell. It also makes konnyaku absorb flavors more and improves the texture.<SEP>Cut the carrots into julienne pieces.<SEP>Cut the lotus root into thin pieces.<SEP>Heat oil in a medium pot over medium heat. Add carrot and lotus root and cook until they are coated with oil.<SEP>Add the hijiki, then konnyaku and aburaage. Mix all together.<SEP>Add the dashi and let it boil.<SEP>Add all the seasonings and mix well. Cook covered on medium-low heat.<SEP>After 30 minutes, add the edamame.<SEP>Cook uncovered to reduce the sauce until you see the bottom of the pan.

ugOBefJ6ZHQufyv3dOdZ.name: Butter Chicken (Murgh/Chicken Makhani)
ugOBefJ6ZHQufyv3dOdZ.ingredients: Tomato ketchup ( optional ) - 1 tablespoon.<SEP>Coriander leaves - 1 springs.<SEP>Oil - 4 tablespoons.<SEP>Crushed kasuri methi - 1 tea spoon.<SEP>Green chillies - 2 numbers.<SEP>Coriander powder - 1 tablespoon.<SEP>Fresh cream - 1/2 cup.<SEP>Cashewnuts - 8 numbers.<SEP>Red chilli powder - 1 tea spoon.<SEP>Sugar - 1/2 tea spoon.<SEP>Cumin seeds - 1/2 tea spoon.<SEP>Tomatoes (chopped) - 150 grams.<SEP>Butter - 100 grams.<SEP>Salt - to taste.<SEP>Red chilli powder - 1-1/2 tea spoon.<SEP>Ginger garlic paste - 2 teaspoons.<SEP>Onion(chopped) - 1 number.<SEP>Raw chicken slices - 500 grams.<SEP>Color water (optional) - 1 tablespoon.<SEP>Garam masala - 1 tea spoon.
ugOBefJ6ZHQufyv3dOdZ.directions: Cut the chicken into thin slices and apply 1 teaspoon ginger garlic paste,salt, 1/2 teaspoon chilli powder, a pinch of coriander powder mix it.<SEP>Now shallow fry in the hot oil then transfer onto a plate and keep it aside.<SEP>In this oil add cumin seeds,onions, ginger garlic paste mix it.<SEP>Now add water, coriander powder, cashew nuts, red chilli powder, kasurimethi powder, green chillies, tomatoes mix it and cook covered with a lid.<SEP>Now everything is mashed up, put it in a blender and blend it.<SEP>In the same pan add butter, chicken use out water, tomato puree, salt, colorwater, sugar and boil it.<SEP>Now add tomato ketchup, cream, chicken, garam masala mix it and boil.

uoPe6pKxtR0IVxXA4sU6.directions: Pour all ingredients into a bottle, fit with a spray top. Gently swirl the bottle to mix the ingredients together.
uoPe6pKxtR0IVxXA4sU6.name: All-Purpose Cleaner
uoPe6pKxtR0IVxXA4sU6.ingredients: 1/2 cup distilled white vinegar<SEP>2 cups water<SEP>20 drops essential oils

v0r3BWUdceySBuDSZtkK.directions: Combine all ingredients, stirring to dissolve sugar completely. <SEP>Fill ice cream maker no more than two-thirds full; freeze according to manufacturer's directions (refrigerate any remaining mixture until ready to freeze).
v0r3BWUdceySBuDSZtkK.ingredients: 2 cups heavy whipping cream<SEP>2 cups half-and-half<SEP>1 cup sugar<SEP>2 teaspoons vanilla extract
v0r3BWUdceySBuDSZtkK.name: Vanilla Ice Cream

v4dMLUnkZpH37mGGwK3K.ingredients: 1 white cake mix, with eggs and oil necessary to<SEP>prepare cake according to package directions<SEP>1 teaspoon raspberry extract<SEP>1 package (8 oz.) cream cheese<SEP>1/3 cup frozen raspberries<SEP>1 package (24 oz.) vanilla almond bark<SEP>1/4 cup graham crackers, coarsely crushed<SEP>Red decorative cake sprinkles
v4dMLUnkZpH37mGGwK3K.directions: Prepare the cake according to directions on the package, adding the raspberry extract to the batter. Bake according to the directions and cool quickly by breaking into large pieces and placing on cooling rack.<SEP>While the cake is baking, place the graham crackers inside a Ziploc bag and use a rolling pin to crush. Set aside.<SEP>When cake has cooled, coarsely break the cake into a large mixing bowl. Cut the softened cream cheese into 1/4-inch cubes. Mix cream cheese with raspberries and add to crumbled cake. Mix lightly by hand.<SEP>Scoop mixture with small cookie scoop onto wax paper-lined jelly roll pan. Roll dough into nice, round balls.<SEP>Put almond bark in a small, but deep microwave-safe bowl. Microwave for 1 minute. Stir. Cook in 10 second intervals until melted and smooth. CAUTION: You do not want to over-heat the almond bark. Melt it slowly and stir often.<SEP>Drop each cake bite into melted bark and scoop out, using a fork, allowing excess bark to drip off each ball into bowl. Place dipped balls on wax paper. Immediately sprinkle with crushed graham cracker crumbs and/or sprinkles.<SEP>Allow the cake bites to set up in the refrigerator.
v4dMLUnkZpH37mGGwK3K.name: Raspberry Cheesecake Bites

vEEP8bO46Lt7fvRjVxWj.directions: #Crepes:<SEP>Blend banana in a food processor until totally smooth. Add melted butter, blend again. Add remaining ingredients and blend until they are combined. Transfer batter, which will look pretty thin, to a bowl (even easier later if it has a spout), cover with plastic wrap and chill for at least an hour, preferably overnight, and up to two days. When you remove the batter, it will seem surprisingly thick. Stir it to redistribute the ingredients before using it.<SEP>Heat a medium skillet or crepe pan over medium-high heat. Once heated, brush pan thinly with melted butter. Pour 1/4 cup batter into skillet, swirling it until it evenly coats the bottom and cook, undisturbed, until the bottom is golden and the top is set, about 2 to 3 minutes. Flip* the crepe and cook it for 30 seconds on the other side, before transferring it to a plate to cool. Repeat with remaining batter. You can stack your crepes and they should not stick together. Let crepes cool completely.<SEP>#Filling: <SEP>Whip cream cheese until fluffy, then beat in yogurt, 1/2 cup at a time. When fully combined, add sugar and vanilla then beat until rich and fluffy, just another minute.<SEP>#Assemble: <SEP>Lay first crepe on a cake plate or serving platter. Spread with 1/4 cup of the yogurt-cream cheese filling. Repeat with all but the last remaining crepe, which should be stacked but have no filling on top, as it is the lid.<SEP>#Butterscotch sauce:<SEP>Combine the cream, brown sugar and butter in the bottom of a medium, heavy saucepan over medium-high heat. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and let it simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally in the beginning and more frequently as it reduces and thickens. You’ll know it’s done when it becomes thick and smells toasty. Stir in the vanilla and salt, then walnuts. Immediately pour over stack of filled crepes, nudging the butterscotch to the edges with your spoon — if it goes over the edge, so be it.<SEP>Serve immediately, or keep in fridge until ready to serve. Crepe cake keeps for up to 3 days, possibly longer, but good luck with that.
vEEP8bO46Lt7fvRjVxWj.ingredients: #Banana crepes<SEP>4 tablespoons butter, melted and cooled slightly, plus extra for greasing pan<SEP>1 large (will weigh 6 ounces/170 grams be about 6 inches long when unpeeled) speckly ripe banana (should yield a scant 1/2 cup peeled, pureed)<SEP>1 cup (235 ml) milk<SEP>3/4 cup (95 grams) all-purpose flour<SEP>4 large eggs<SEP>2 tablespoons (25 grams) light brown sugar<SEP>1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract<SEP>1/4 teaspoon table salt<SEP>1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon<SEP>1/4 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg<SEP>Pinch of ground cloves<SEP>#Cream cheese yogurt filling<SEP>8 ounces (225 grams) cream cheese, well-softened<SEP>1 1/2 cups (345 grams) plain Greek-style yogurt<SEP>1/3 cup (65 grams) granulated sugar<SEP>1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract<SEP>#Walnut butterscotch topping<SEP>1/2 cup (120 ml) heavy whipping cream<SEP>1/4 cup (50 grams) packed dark brown sugar<SEP>1 tablespoon (15 grams) unsalted butter, at room temperature<SEP>1/2 cup (about 50 grams) chopped walnuts, toasted<SEP>1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract<SEP>1/4 teaspoon flaky sea salt, or to taste
vEEP8bO46Lt7fvRjVxWj.name: Banana Crepe Cake

vdaasCN7FTGSduoi0sfE.directions: #Applesauce:<SEP>Our favorite was a mix of stovetop and Instant Pot. Peel, core, and slice the apples and cook until soft (30 minutes on stovetop, 7 minutes in Instant Pot). Combine and process in jars. Serve with cinnamon. (If in DC, see notes)<SEP><SEP>#Apple chips:<SEP>Peel, slice thick (1/4-1/2 inch). Dehydrate 24 hours on highest temp, then store in airtight containers with silica gel packets.
vdaasCN7FTGSduoi0sfE.ingredients: #The results of The Great Applesauce Experiment of 2019:<SEP><SEP>#Applesauce:<SEP>Get a mix of apples, predominantly golden delicious. 1 bushel = about 15 quart-sized jars.<SEP>#Apple chips: <SEP>Get a mix of apples, predominantly golden/red delicious. <SEP>Silica gel packets
vdaasCN7FTGSduoi0sfE.notes: Richard's Fruit Market - $12/bushel for #2 apples, $10/bushel for medium-sized apples. Call ahead to check availability and/or reserve. In 2019, #2 golden delicious were available from the end of September through October.<SEP><SEP>If doing it at Melinda's house: Sterilize jars the night before. Start as early as possible. Quarter apples, then cook in wide, thick-bottomed pots on medium heat. (Tall pots take longer, thin bottoms burn faster.) Get saucer ready. Fill jars, then process later.<SEP>If doing it at Marie's house: Borrow Jenn's peeler/corer. Chop roughly and cook in thick-bottomed pots on medium heat. Fill jars, then process later.
vdaasCN7FTGSduoi0sfE.name: Applesauce & Apple Chips (Marie)

vqBSf3EeCJvxwjdsBQ9z.name: Koshari
vqBSf3EeCJvxwjdsBQ9z.directions: #Red Sauce<SEP>Combine tomato juice and salt in large pot. In large skillet sauté grated onion in oil). Add minced garlic and stir occasionally until onion is almost brown. Add to tomato juice. Bring to a boil, simmer for 30 minutes.<SEP><SEP>#Hot Sauce<SEP>Combine all ingredients in pot. Bring to a boil and keep it boiling until oil floats on the surface (about 1 hour).<SEP><SEP>#Daqqa<SEP>Combine all ingredients in small bowl, mixing well.<SEP><SEP>#Onions<SEP>Put sliced onions into big bowl, add water, then put your hands into the onions and separate them into individual half rings. Drain water off. Coat lightly in flour. Add onions to heated oil. Stir occasionally. It takes 20-30 minutes for the onions to brown—but they do. Keep the oil hot.<SEP><SEP>#Pasta, rice, lentils<SEP>Cook according to package directions. Rinse.<SEP>Lentils (brown): Rinse 1 cup brown lentils. Put in pot with 2 and 1⁄2 cups water. Bring to a boil. Simmer until tender (20-30 minutes). Drain water.<SEP>Rice & Vermicelli: Put rice in strainer, rinse rice under running water until water runs clear. Heat oil in a medium pan on high heat. Add vermicelli and stir until vermicelli is browned. Add the rinsed rice to the pan and continue to cook on high stirring constantly until the rice is well coated about 1-2 minutes. Add 2 3/4 cups water and bring to a boil. Add salt and stir once. Cover, reduce heat as low as possible. Cook for 20 minutes. Let set for 10 minutes.<SEP>To Serve:Combine the macaroni, spaghetti, rice & vermicelli, and lentils. Add 2-4 tablespoons of the oil the onions were browned in (optional). Serve in bowls. People add their own Red Sauce, Daqqa, Hot Sauce, and onions.
vqBSf3EeCJvxwjdsBQ9z.ingredients: #Red Sauce<SEP>4 cups tomato juice<SEP>1 onion, grated oil<SEP>8 cloves minced garlic <SEP>2 teaspoons salt<SEP><SEP>#Hot Sauce<SEP>2 cups tomato juice<SEP>2 cloves garlic, minced <SEP>3 tablespoons hot chili (or 1 tablespoon red pepper flakes)<SEP>1 1/2 tablespoons cumin 1 teaspoon salt<SEP>1 teaspoon oil<SEP>1 1/2 tablespoons vinegar<SEP><SEP>#Daqqa (vinegar sauce)<SEP>3-4 cloves garlic, minced <SEP>1 tablespoon salt<SEP>1 tablespoon cumin<SEP>3 lemons, juiced<SEP>3/4 cup vinegar<SEP><SEP>#Fried Onion<SEP>2-3 large onions, skinned and cut in half, thinly sliced<SEP>2 Tbsp flour<SEP>Lots of oil<SEP><SEP>#filling<SEP>2 cups elbow macaroni<SEP>1 cup spaghetti (broken into 2-3 inch pieces)<SEP>1 cup brown lentils<SEP>1 cup vermicelli<SEP>1 cup rice<SEP>2 tablespoons vegetable oil

vsONRXnrr9oR9NQwTEux.ingredients: 1/2 cup all-purpose flour<SEP>1/2 cup yellow cornmeal<SEP>2 tablespoons plus 2 teaspoons sugar<SEP>1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder<SEP>1/2 teaspoons salt<SEP>1 tablespoon plus 1 1/2 teaspoons vegetable oil<SEP>1/4 cup mayonnaise<SEP>1/2 egg (2 tbsp)<SEP>1 1/2 teaspoons finely chopped onion<SEP>1/2 cup cream style corn
vsONRXnrr9oR9NQwTEux.name: Cornmeal Muffins
vsONRXnrr9oR9NQwTEux.directions: Preheat oven to 400°F. (If you are using dark muffin pans, reduce oven temperature by 25°F.) Prepare a small 6-cup muffin tin by greasing the cups well.<SEP>In a large mixing bowl, combine flour, cornmeal, sugar, baking powder, and salt.<SEP>Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients and add oil, mayonnaise, egg, creamed corn, and onion. Stir just until mixed.<SEP>Spoon into prepared muffin tin. Bake for 20 minutes, then remove from oven and allow to cool for a few minutes. <SEP>Remove from pan and serve warm or cool completely on a wire cooling rack.

vzh3zMARUp09n2Opp5cF.ingredients: #CAKE:<SEP>18 1/4 oz white or yellow cake mix<SEP>2 c melted butter pecan ice cream (measure melted not frozen)<SEP>3 large eggs<SEP>#FILLING:<SEP>8 oz neufchatal cream cheese, softened (light cream cheese)<SEP>1/2 c powdered sugar<SEP>1 tsp vanilla extract<SEP>#BANANA FOSTER FILLING:<SEP>1/2 c packed light brown sugar<SEP>3 Tbsp butter (no substitutions)<SEP>1 1/2 c finely chopped firm right bananas (about 2 large)<SEP>1/4 c pecans, chopped<SEP>1/2 tsp rum extract<SEP>1/4 tsp ground cinnamon<SEP>#CARAMEL FROSTING:<SEP>1 c butter, room temp.<SEP>3 1/2 c powdered sugar<SEP>1/3 c packed brown sugar<SEP>1 1/2 tsp water<SEP>1 tsp vanilla extract<SEP>OPTIONAL:<SEP>1 c heavy whipping cream<SEP>2 Tbsp granulated sugar<SEP>pecans, chopped
vzh3zMARUp09n2Opp5cF.name: Bananas Foster Cake
vzh3zMARUp09n2Opp5cF.notes: I'm not sure the cake is better than the regular cake mix recipe.<SEP>The caramel frosting could use a bit more brown sugar or caramel flavor.
vzh3zMARUp09n2Opp5cF.directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Spray to round cake pans with nonstick spray. Set aside.<SEP>#For Cake:<SEP>In a mixing bowl, combine cake mix, melted ice cream and eggs on medium speed for 3 minutes. Pour into prepared pans. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Do NOT over bake! Remove and allow to cool completely. Trim and level cakes as necessary.<SEP>#For Filling:<SEP>In a separate mixing bowl, beat cream cheese, powdered sugar and vanilla until smooth and creamy. Spread over top of bottom cake layer. (I prefer a thin layer but use as much as you like.) Now prepare frosting before the Banana Foster filling. You may wish to also prepare whipped cream topping and place in fridge until needed.<SEP>#Caramel Frosting:<SEP>In a mixing bowl, cream margarine (or butter) using a mixer. Slowly add in powdered sugar a little at a time until smooth and creamy. In a small separate bowl, microwave brown sugar and water 30-60 seconds, stirring once, just until the sugar is dissolved and mixture is bubbling. (You don't want it gritty!) Let stand for a few minutes to cool. Pour into margarine mixture and beat on high speed. Beat in vanilla until all ingredients are well incorporated and smooth. Set aside.<SEP>#Whipped Topping: (if desired) <SEP>Preferably in a chilled mixing bowl with chilled beaters, beat whipping cream and sugar until stiff peaks form. Refrigerate until needed.<SEP>#Banana Foster Filling:<SEP>Melt butter in skillet over med-high heat. Stir in brown sugar. Add remaining ingredients and continue to stir until caramelized and sugar is well dissolved. Cool slightly. Pour half the mixture over cream cheese on bottom cake layer. Place top cake layer onto the banana filling on bottom layer and press lightly to set.<SEP>Frost with caramel frosting in two layers. (The crumb layer and the presentation layer.) Carefully pour remaining banana mixture on top of cake. Pipe whipped cream around top edge. If desired, press chopped pecans to sides of cake. Serve immediately.

w26y5E4pDMVHfUXKB7Su.ingredients: 1 cup raw almonds (soaked overnight in cool water // or 1-2 hours in very hot water)<SEP>5 cups filtered water (less to thicken, more to thin)<SEP>1 pinch sea salt<SEP>2 whole dates (optional // pitted // or other sweetener of choice // omit for unsweetened)<SEP>1 tsp vanilla extract (optional // or sub 1 vanilla bean, scraped per 1 tsp extract // omit for plain)<SEP>2 Tbsp cocoa powder (optional // for "chocolate milk")<SEP>1/2 cup berries (optional // for "berry milk")
w26y5E4pDMVHfUXKB7Su.name: Almond Milk
w26y5E4pDMVHfUXKB7Su.directions: Add your soaked almonds, water, salt, and any additional add-ins (optional) to a high-speed blender and blend until creamy and smooth. Keep it running for at least 1-2 minutes so you get the most out of your almonds.<SEP>Strain using a nut milk bag or cheesecloth. Then squeeze until all of the liquid is extracted. Discard pulp, or save for adding to baked goods.<SEP>Transfer milk to a jar or covered bottle and refrigerate. Will keep for up to 4-5 days, though best when fresh. Shake well before drinking, as it tends to separate.

wIL0ECvdD4wFQ1v6JI3w.name: Orzo Salad
wIL0ECvdD4wFQ1v6JI3w.directions: Pour the broth into a heavy large saucepan. Cover the pan and bring the broth to a boil over high heat. Stir in the orzo. Cover partially and cook until the orzo is tender but still firm to the bite, stirring frequently, about 7 minutes. Drain the orzo through a strainer. Transfer the orzo to a large wide bowl and toss until the orzo cools slightly. Set aside to cool completely.<SEP>Toss the orzo with the beans, tomatoes, onion, basil, mint, and enough vinaigrette to coat. Season the salad, to taste, with salt and pepper, and serve at room temperature.<SEP>#Red Wine Vinaigrette:<SEP>Mix the vinegar, lemon juice, honey, salt, and pepper in a blender. With the machine running, gradually blend in the oil. Season the vinaigrette, to taste, with more salt and pepper, if desired.
wIL0ECvdD4wFQ1v6JI3w.ingredients: 4 cups chicken broth<SEP>1 1/2 cups orzo<SEP>1 (15-ounce) can garbanzo beans, drained and rinsed<SEP>1 1/2 cups red and yellow teardrop tomatoes or grape tomatoes, halved<SEP>3/4 cup finely chopped red onion<SEP>1/2 cup chopped fresh basil leaves<SEP>1/4 cup chopped fresh mint leaves<SEP>About 3/4 cup Red Wine Vinaigrette, recipe follows<SEP>Salt and freshly ground black pepper<SEP><SEP>#Red Wine Vinaigrette:<SEP>1/2 cup red wine vinegar<SEP>1/4 cup fresh lemon juice<SEP>2 teaspoons honey<SEP>2 teaspoons salt<SEP>3/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper<SEP>1 cup extra-virgin olive oil

wMpEORynWh65WcYdyMpV.name: Pollo Saltado
wMpEORynWh65WcYdyMpV.directions: Have the sliced chicken breast ready, sprinkled with salt and pepper, and some chopped garlic<SEP>Put the pan over the highest heat. It should start to smoke. At this point add the oil.<SEP>Ideally, when you add the chicken, the pan should get on fire and give the meat a delicious smokey flavor. But BE EXTREMELY CAREFUL with this, and only do it if you're an expert in the kitchen. Otherwise, just make sure it's hot but not to the point of flames when you add the chicken (don't let the pan and oil smoke if you want to avoid this).<SEP>Add garlic and onions as the pan continues to smoke while the chicken gets golden.<SEP>Add vinegar and soy sauce to the pan.<SEP>Add tomatoes and cilantro, chili pepper, salt and pepper.<SEP>Serve the saltado with all its juices, white rice and French fries. This may sound like too much food, but you will understand the importance of these side dishes when you eat them together and see how they absorb the juices of the chicken stir-fry and make the perfect ensemble.
wMpEORynWh65WcYdyMpV.ingredients: 1 lb. chicken breast, skinned, boned, and cut in thin slices<SEP>2 garlic cloves, minced<SEP>3 tablespoons vegetable oil<SEP>1 red onion, cut in thick slices<SEP>2 tomatoes cut in thick slices<SEP>1 seeded aji amarillo chili pepper cut in thin slices (substitute with 1 tablespoon aji amarillo paste, or with any chili pepper)<SEP>3 tablespoons soy sauce<SEP>3 tablespoons red wine vinegar<SEP>Salt and pepper<SEP>1/2 cup fresh cilantro, chopped<SEP>2 cups french fries<SEP>White rice as a side dish

wRAgxXAChTQr0p3dddFS.name: Raspberry Pretzel Cheesecake
wRAgxXAChTQr0p3dddFS.directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.<SEP>Combine the crushed pretzels, sugar and melted butter in a bowl or large ziplock bag. Pour mixture into 9x13” pan and press to form a crust. Bake for 12 minutes, then let cool completely.<SEP>Meanwhile, beat the cream cheese, lemon juice and ½ cup sugar until smooth and fluffy. Fold in cool whip and spread mixture over cooled pretzel crust, making sure to go to the edges to seal.<SEP>Bring 2 cups water to a boil and stir in raspberry jello mix until dissolved. Remove from heat and stir in frozen raspberries. Pour mixture over the cream cheese layer and refrigerate until jello is set, about 2 to 4 hours.
wRAgxXAChTQr0p3dddFS.ingredients: #Crust<SEP>2 1/2 cups salted pretzels, lightly crushed<SEP>3 tbsp sugar<SEP>½ cup butter, melted<SEP><SEP>#Filling<SEP>8 oz cream cheese, softened<SEP>½ cup sugar<SEP>1 tbsp lemon juice<SEP>8 oz cool whip, thawed<SEP><SEP>#Topping<SEP>6 oz package raspberry jello<SEP>2 cups water<SEP>4 cups frozen raspberries

wZ87c5sn3K6uQwNWS7CK.name: Dilly Dip
wZ87c5sn3K6uQwNWS7CK.directions: Mix all together and refrigerate overnight.  Serve with relish tray veggies.
wZ87c5sn3K6uQwNWS7CK.ingredients: 1 cup sour cream<SEP>1 cup mayonnaise<SEP>1 Tbsp. Minced onion<SEP>1 Tbsp. Parsley<SEP>1 Tbsp.  Dill weed<SEP>½ tsp.  Accent (monosodium glutamate)

wekuGaWVXlumBIWdQw04.name: Banana Oat Pancakes
wekuGaWVXlumBIWdQw04.ingredients: 2 medium ripe bananas (best when they have lots of brown spots)<SEP>2 eggs<SEP>1/2 cup unsweetened almond milk<SEP>1 teaspoon vanilla extract<SEP>1 ½ cups old fashioned rolled oats, gluten free if desired<SEP>2 teaspoons baking powder<SEP>½ teaspoon ground cinnamon<SEP>¼ teaspoon salt<SEP>Olive oil, for cooking
wekuGaWVXlumBIWdQw04.directions: Add all of the ingredients to a blender and blend on high until completely smooth, about 30 seconds to 1 minute. Let the batter sit in your blender while you heat your pan up.<SEP>Lightly coat a griddle with coconut oil, vegan butter or olive oil and place over medium heat. Once pan is hot, add 1/3 cup of the batter to the griddle for each pancake and cook for 2-4 minutes until pancakes slightly puff up and you see a few bubbles along the edges.<SEP>Flip cakes and cook until golden brown on underside. If you find that pancakes are browning too quickly then you need to lower the heat. I normally start on medium heat, then decrease to medium low later so that my pancakes don't burn. If at any point your griddle starts smoking, it means your pan is too hot.<SEP>Wipe skillet clean and repeat with more oil and remaining batter.

whvf6JAoQuSzG5kNFl1Y.name: Pesto
whvf6JAoQuSzG5kNFl1Y.directions: Pulse basil and pine nuts in a food processor: Place the basil leaves and pine nuts into the bowl of a food processor and pulse a several times.<SEP>Add the garlic and cheese: Add the garlic and Parmesan or Romano cheese and pulse several times more. Scrape down the sides of the food processor with a rubber spatula.<SEP>Stream in the olive oil: While the food processor is running, slowly add the olive oil in a steady small stream. Adding the olive oil slowly, while the processor is running, will help it emulsify and help keep the olive oil from separating. Occasionally stop to scrape down the sides of the food processor.<SEP>Stir in salt and freshly ground black pepper, add more to taste.<SEP>Toss with pasta for a quick sauce, dollop over baked potatoes, or spread onto crackers or toasted slices of bread.
whvf6JAoQuSzG5kNFl1Y.ingredients: 2 cups fresh basil leaves, packed (can sub half the basil leaves with baby spinach)<SEP>1/2 cup freshly grated Romano or Parmesan-Reggiano cheese (about 2 ounces)<SEP>1/2 cup extra virgin olive oil<SEP>1/3 cup pine nuts (can sub chopped walnuts)<SEP>3 garlic cloves, minced (about 3 teaspoons)<SEP>1/4 teaspoon salt, more to taste<SEP>1/8 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, more to taste

wiu7NEovVFpvt2DbxjOO.name: Pupusas
wiu7NEovVFpvt2DbxjOO.directions: Make the curtido: In a large bowl, combine the cabbage, onion, and carrots. Pour the boiling water over the vegetables and toss. Let sit for 10 minutes, then drain.<SEP>In a liquid measuring cup or small bowl, combine the vinegar, oregano, and salt. Pour over the slaw and toss to coat. Once thoroughly mixed, transfer the curtido any any leftover liquid in the bowl to an airtight jar or container.<SEP>Chill for at least 20 minutes in the refrigerator, or chill overnight for best results.<SEP>Make the chicharrón: Heat the vegetable oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add the pork shoulder and salt. Cook for 15 minutes without disturbing. If the pork is browning too quickly, reduce the heat to medium. Turn the pork over and let cook on the other side for 10 minutes more, or until crispy and golden brown.<SEP>Transfer the pork to a food processor and add the tomato, green bell pepper, and onion. Pulse until a thick paste forms. The mixture should not be watery. Set aside.<SEP>Make the pupusa dough: In a large bowl, whisk together the masa harina and salt, then add the water. Use your hands to mix until the dough comes together with a clay-like texture.<SEP>Fill a small bowl with water and a bit of oil and set near your work station. You’ll wet your fingers with the mixture as you work to keep the dough from sticking to your hands.<SEP>Take a golf ball-sized portion of dough and roll into a ball, then flatten into an even round.<SEP>Fill the dough round with ½ tablespoon chicharrón paste, 1 teaspoon refried beans, and 1 teaspoon mozzarella cheese. Fold the dough over the filling until it’s completely sealed. Then, pat out the ball between your hands until flat. If the pupusa cracks, patch it with a bit of dough and a little oil. Repeat with the remaining ingredients.<SEP>Heat a large pan or griddle over medium heat. Brush with vegetable oil, then place 2-3 pupusas on the pan and cook for 2-4 minutes, or until the bottoms are golden brown. Flip and cook on the other side for 2-4 minutes more, until golden brown and warmed through. Repeat with the remaining pupusas.<SEP>Serve the pupusas with curtido and salsa roja.
wiu7NEovVFpvt2DbxjOO.ingredients: #curtido<SEP>½ head green cabbage, cored and shredded<SEP>1 small white onion, sliced<SEP>2 medium carrots, grated<SEP>4 cups boiling water<SEP>1 cup distilled white vinegar<SEP>1 tablespoon dried oregano<SEP>2 teaspoons kosher salt<SEP><SEP>#CHICHARRÓN<SEP>1 teaspoon vegetable oil<SEP>1 lb boneless pork shoulder, cut into 1-inch (2-cm) cubes<SEP>1 teaspoon salt<SEP>1 medium tomato, diced<SEP>½ green bell pepper, diced<SEP>1 small white onion, diced<SEP><SEP>#Dough<SEP>4 cups masa harina<SEP>2 teaspoons salt<SEP>3 cups cold water<SEP><SEP>#filling<SEP>1 cup grated mozzarella cheese<SEP>1 cup refried beans, cooked<SEP>1 tablespoon vegetable oil, for frying

xBgNeI1PM5x4YRAQvTdJ.ingredients: 6 strips (uncooked) bacon cut into small pieces<SEP>3 Tablespoons butter unsalted or salted will work<SEP>1 medium yellow onion chopped (about 1.5 cup/200g)<SEP>3 large garlic cloves minced<SEP>⅓ cup all-purpose flour 42g<SEP>2 ½ lbs gold potatoes peeled and diced into pieces no larger than 1” (this was about 6 Large potatoes for me/1.15kg)<SEP>4 cups chicken broth 945ml<SEP>2 cups milk 475ml<SEP>2/3 cup heavy cream 155ml<SEP>1 ½ teaspoon* salt<SEP>1 teaspoon ground pepper<SEP>1/4 - 1/2 teaspoon ancho chili powder<SEP>2/3 cup sour cream 160g<SEP>Shredded cheddar cheese, chives, and additional sour cream and bacon for topping optional
xBgNeI1PM5x4YRAQvTdJ.directions: Place bacon pieces in a large Dutch Oven or soup pot over medium heat and cook until bacon is crisp and browned.<SEP>Remove bacon pieces and set aside, leaving the fat in the pot. (If you have a helper, they can start chopping onion and peeling/cutting potatoes).<SEP>Add butter and chopped onion and cook over medium heat until onions are tender (3-5 minutes).<SEP>Add garlic and cook until fragrant (about 30 seconds).<SEP>Sprinkle the flour over the ingredients in the pot and stir until smooth (use whisk if needed).<SEP>Add diced potatoes to the pot along with chicken broth, milk, heavy cream, salt, pepper, and ancho chili powder. Stir well.<SEP>Bring to a boil and cook until potatoes are tender when pierced with a fork (about 10 minutes).<SEP>Reduce heat to simmer and remove approximately half of the soup to a blender (be careful, it will be hot!) and puree until smooth (half is about 5 cups of soup, but just eyeballing the amount will be fine. Alternatively you can use an immersion blender.).<SEP>Return the pureed soup to the pot and add sour cream and reserved bacon pieces, stir well.<SEP>Allow soup to simmer for 15 minutes before serving.<SEP>Top with additional sour cream, bacon, cheddar cheese, or chives. Enjoy!
xBgNeI1PM5x4YRAQvTdJ.name: Potato Soup

xQ7M7HqwrZaJtBoEtXr5.name: Pineapple Frozen Yogurt
xQ7M7HqwrZaJtBoEtXr5.ingredients: 1 can pineapple chunks<SEP>2 T. pineapple juice<SEP>5 T. sugar<SEP>500 g. plain yogurt<SEP>1-2 egg whites, whipped into a meringue (optional)

xTISKcisHwG6IK62OQfN.notes: Refrigerate up to 2 days or freeze up to 3 months. Thaw at room temperature to serve.
xTISKcisHwG6IK62OQfN.directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line 8x8x2inch baking pan with foil, allowing foil to extend over edges of pan. Coat foil with nonstick cooking spray, set aside.<SEP>In bowl stir together oats, flour, and 3/4 cup sugar. Using pastry blender, cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs (use fingers, if necessary, to break up mixture). Remove 1-1/2 cups oat mixture; set aside.<SEP>Press remaining oat mixture evenly into bottom of pan. Bake 20 minutes.<SEP>Meanwhile, for filling, in a medium saucepan combine rhubarb, 1/3 cup sugar, water, and 1/2 teaspoon ginger. Cook and stir over medium heat for 8 to 10 minutes until filling is thickened and bubbly. Stir in chopped strawberries. Remove 1/2 cup filling; cover and set aside. Carefully spoon remaining filling over hot baked crust. Sprinkle with reserved oat mixture, pressing lightly into rhubarb filling.<SEP>Bake for 30 to 35 minutes more or until top is golden and filling is bubbly. Cool in pan on wire rack. Lift from pan using foil. Carefully pull foil away from sides. Cut in bars. Top each with a spoonful of filling. Drizzle with Ginger Icing just before serving. Makes 16 bars.
xTISKcisHwG6IK62OQfN.ingredients: 1 ½ cups quick-cooking rolled oats<SEP>1 cup all-purpose flour<SEP>¾ cup granulated sugar  <SEP>¾ cup butter  <SEP>1 ½ cups chopped fresh or frozen rhubarb, thawed<SEP>⅓ cup granulated sugar<SEP>¼ cup water<SEP>½ teaspoon ground ginger<SEP>2 cups chopped fresh strawberries<SEP>Ginger Icing
xTISKcisHwG6IK62OQfN.name: Strawberry Rhubarb Bars

xZY6ASGidssof83mlBBm.name: Lemon Blueberry Bread (Dutch Oven)
xZY6ASGidssof83mlBBm.directions: Line a 9"x 5" loaf pan with parchment paper (or lightly grease with butter).<SEP>In a medium bowl, whisk the flour, baking powder and salt, and set aside.<SEP>In the bowl of an electric mixer, blend together the melted butter, sugar, eggs, vanilla, lemon zest and lemon juice.  Mix until well combined.<SEP>While slowly mixing, add flour mixture and milk in two batches (some flour, then some milk, then the rest of the flour and the rest of the milk).  Stop mixing as soon as it's just combined.<SEP>Rinse off the blueberries (if using fresh) so they have just a bit of moisture on them, then, in a small bowl toss the blueberries and 1 T. flour.  This flour coating will help prevent the blueberries from sinking to the bottom of your loaf while baking.<SEP>Add the flour coated berries to the batter and gently but quickly stir, by hand, to combine, then pour batter into the baking pan<SEP>Prepare glaze by simply whisking together the melted butter, powdered sugar, lemon juice and vanilla.<SEP>Set up four small rocks in the dutch oven for your pan to rest on. The pan should not be touching the dutch oven. <SEP>Bake for about 60 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center of the loaf comes out clean. <SEP>After the cake had cooled flip it over onto a tray and pour the glaze over the top. (if you make the glaze before hand you can put it in the jar and put it next to the coals to warm it back up before pouring it)
xZY6ASGidssof83mlBBm.ingredients: 1 and 1/2 cups all-purpose flour<SEP>1 teaspoon baking powder<SEP>1 teaspoon salt<SEP>1/3 cup unsalted butter, melted<SEP>1 cup sugar<SEP>2 eggs<SEP>1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract<SEP>2 teaspoons fresh grated lemon zest<SEP>2 Tablespoons fresh lemon juice<SEP>1/2 cup milk<SEP>1 cup blueberries<SEP>1 Tablespoons all-purpose flour<SEP>Glaze (optional)<SEP><SEP>#Lemon glaze<SEP>2 Tablespons butter, melted<SEP>1/2 cup powdered sugar<SEP>2 Tablespoons fresh lemon juice<SEP>1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract

xf4XrmSb0Dv6nKe3eJCD.notes: Double or triple this recipe. Keep in fridge in a mason jar.
xf4XrmSb0Dv6nKe3eJCD.name: Buttermilk Syrup
xf4XrmSb0Dv6nKe3eJCD.directions: Boil first 3 ingredients for 5 minutes in large enough pot<SEP>Add baking soda, cook for 2 more minutes<SEP>Watch closely or it will boil over<SEP>Add Vanilla
xf4XrmSb0Dv6nKe3eJCD.ingredients: 1 1/2 C. Sugar<SEP>3/4 C. Buttermilk<SEP>1/4 C. Butter<SEP>1/2 tsp. Baking Soda<SEP>2 tsp. Vanilla

xpr8oDD70avxJKj6GRyP.directions: #Chicken<SEP>Combine Chicken and Marinade ingredients and set aside for at least 1 hour, up to 24 hours. (Note 4)<SEP>Heat 1/2 tbsp oil in a fry pan over medium heat (or heat the BBQ). Remove chicken from marinade, shaking off large bits of lemongrass (small bits should fall off during cooking).<SEP>Place chicken in the pan and cook each side until dark golden brown and chicken is just cooked through - about 6 to 8 minutes in total.<SEP>Remove from pan, shaking off any remaining bits of visible lemongrass and set aside to rest for 5 minutes. Then slice into thin pieces.<SEP><SEP>#Nuoc Cham sauce<SEP>Combine the Nuoc Cham ingredients and mix well to dissolve the sugar. Adjust to your taste (spiciness, lime, sweetness) and set aside for at least 20 minutes.<SEP><SEP>#Assemble<SEP>Soak the vermicelli noodles in hot water for 3 minutes (or according to packet instructions), then drain and rinse under cold water to stop the noodles from sticking together.<SEP><SEP>Individual servings: Place noodles in bowl. Top with vegetables and herbs, and sliced chicken pieces. Drizzle with a few tablespoons of Nuoc Cham Sauce (be generous, ~ 4 tbsp per serving) and serve with lime wedges.<SEP><SEP>DIY (my preferred way): Place chicken, vegetables, herbs, noodles and sauce in separate bowls / piled on platters. Then let everyone make their own bowls.
xpr8oDD70avxJKj6GRyP.name: Vietnamese Noodle Bowl
